Freshly prepped food, skillfully, prepared, and a artsy but chill environment, created a lovely evening and a delightful experience for our group. Especially nice was our all burnt haired, beautiful and sweet waitress, who took the best care of us, and ensure that everything was perfect.:-)

What a great brunch spot! We had a reservation for 10, which is when they open. We arrived a few mins early And were seated right away. I ordered the fuyu persimmon yogurt bowl and vegetable soup. Both were so good. The yogurt bowl had dates, pistachios, and a delicious syrup. Totally unique and new! I also had a latte which was ordinary compared to the creativity of the other dishes, but nothing to complain about. The service was great too. We were constantly checked on, even when it was a full house. My friend ordered the porridge which had a full baked apple in it-- super interesting! I took a bite and it was great.

The chicken breast salad used to be great but it came out greasy with wilted lettuce. So this is love on a plate and what it feels like to be nurtured through a dining experience. Noted. Every note of the evening from arrival to very tipsy departure (note: when traveling with friends that drink as a hobby, have water...often). The food was pitch perfect incredible from how it was presented to the taste and texture and feel of the meal. The service was impeccable and timed with proper interjection to recommend....you guessed it more wine. Absolutely a must for dates or dinners where your ex is paying.

Great lunch spot on 10th Avenue in Chelsea. There is ample seating both indoors and outdoors, so in the summers highly recommend outside. Servers were young but super attentive and friendly. Got a few hipster / Brooklyn vibes, but overall was a great experience. Lots of great items on the menu. I ended getting just a cheeseburger (you know when you're having one of those days...) Really good burger, no question. Everything else others were ordering looked equally delicious so I feel comfortable recommending to anyone.
Fantastic brunch in Chelsea. I know Cookshop has been around for many many years but this was the first time I had a meal here. Good service, fantastic brunch menu, and convenient location!

Service was a bit slow at the beginning. Food was good. The salad was a nice portion. Good central location with great outdoor seating.

My only comment is that the service was a little bit sporadic and slow but maybe our server just had too many tables? They were definitely busy for lunch on a Monday. This was a great place to meet friends for lunch. I'm not sure I would try it for dinner but overall I had a great experience.

It's  a cute spot  to gather with groups of ppl. A bit too noisy for the  first date couples in my perspective. The food is decent. We ordered butter biscuits as appetizer. scrambles and Huevos Rancheros as main dishes. The Bloody Mary tastes stronger than usual. The latte is good tho!

I'm late to this popular brunch but I'm definitely happy I decided to join in! Definitely make a reservation as it's as packed as ever. The Baked French Toast was phenomenal and the Eggs scrambled with mushrooms and creme fraiche were creamy and delicious. I had a coffee (wasn't on the menu but $4 with free refills) and they brought me a side of warmed oat milk. Such a pretty restaurant, lively atmosphere, fantastic food. I'm returning to try the beignets!!!

Nice seasonable food, I typically consider myself a carnivore but this is one of those places where I ordered a ton of veg and loved it. The ambiance was nice, but the service and experience itself wasn't quite as cozy as I wanted it to be. I'd go back if in the area.

Amazing spot a block from the High Line. Waiter was such a professional and recommended the huevos which are the only item that permanently stays on the menu as they rotate seasonal items year round. Delicious tequila bloodies!
Nice and cozy restaurant with great service and reasonably priced food for NY's standards.
One day visiting NYC, my bestie and I ended up at Cookshop for lunch. Beautiful restaurant, with small but great menu. Our server Jarvis was so awesome!!!
Was there for Saturday brunch.  Good service. Good margarita. I liked the baked egg dish which came with a small salad. I did not like my stale coffee though.

An old favorite, Cookshop is always packed. It has been going strong in Chelsea for well over 20 years. Once cutting edge, it is now just good solid food. You will always have an enjoyable, even if not particularly creative, meal. Their other restaurants - Shuka, Vic's -- are more creative. All very good. Expect a wait if you are going for Sunday brunch.

amazing brunch place!! the egg sandwich was really good and the potatoes were cooked really well. my friend got the poached egg and the serving size was the biggest but it looked very tasty!! cookie plate had such a nice variety :)

Great restaurant! The food was good and the service was awesome. I had a delicious salad from here. The server was so kind and patient as I met up with a friend I haven't seen in eight years. The place is very cute too. I would totally go back!

Awesome brunch spot! They have creative cocktails and a great savory or sweet options. They also have a great selection of dessert wines/cheeses which was a great way to close up the afternoon. Very quick and welcoming service!

Overall, I had a really good experience here. The oysters were fresh and my waiter was so attentive. The egg sandwich flavor was really good but the sandwich was very flat. There was very little arugula was on the sandwich leaving me with just caramelized onion jam and a fried egg. I think the sandwich would've been better served on toast because there aren't many elements to it for it to be on a hamburger bun. If you're a vegetarian or pescatarian I do not recommend as I'm sure the ham makes this sandwich a sandwich.

Surprised I had never heard of this restaurant! Came here last night and started with the burata which was incredible. Then had the pork chop and chicken and both were amazing. Don't sleep on the chicken, very good. Would definitely come back

Wine, beer, good food and excellent service made an ordinary afternoon into one to remember. Four friends enjoyed delicious sandwiches and The Market Salad.

Oh this is my first time to this restaurant, we started with radishes and heirloom tomatoes. Overall, the waiter was fantastic and the food Was extremely fresh and the presentation was perfect. Upping my stars to a 5!

Excellent menu for lunch brunch or dinner. Great service, good cocktails, and lovely decor. I have never had a bad experience here, which is more than I can say for most NYC restaurants. I've recommended Cookshop to many friends and everyone has always had the same reaction. It's nice to know there is a place that's always reliable and in the neighborhood!
The food, service and drinks are always quality. It's a farm to table type of place, and I've never had a bad meal here. Staff is also very knowledgeable about the food and wine, and attentive.

Came here during the day for lunch on the patio and was impressed! Their cucumber cooler drink was strong and delicious. Great drink on a warm summer day. To eat I had the smoked brisket sandwich and this sandwich was massive! Huge! I had to take some of the brisket out first to eat. It also came with fries so I think for NYC standards this is a good deal and big enough item to share if needed. Others in my party had the fish sandwich and poached artic salad. We were all impressed with our meals and the service was great. Nice outdoor patio as well. Would definitely recommend and be back!

Service is great! Food is good. Their seafood is really fresh and the drinks are good. Their cold tomato soup is excellent. They have lots of indoor and outdoor seating.

This is one of those cozy places that you can never go wrong with. I went here on a date with my boyfriend and we were both blown away with how fresh and tasty the food was. Additionally their service was really good and the waitress offered great recommendations as it was our first time. I would definitely go back with friends or family.

A bright and sunny brunch atmosphere! The egg sandwich was delicious with the flavor highlighting the onions, though the portion size was a bit small. The huevos rancheros were unfortunately mediocre. Overall, the place is a nice brunch spot right in Chelsea, though the food is nothing exceptionally different from your standard American brunch fare.
Roasted chicken breast salad was exquisite (just the right amount of food) and the lemon, lime & bitters beverage was both beautiful & tasty.

Ohhhhh my gahhh the French toast is the best I have ever had!! The baked eggs come close as second place. The food is so tasty the service is great, I can't remember our waiters name (he had a shaved head and from Jersey city) he was so nice and wonderful service!

The food was just amazing and the service was 10/10. The best thing about the restaurant is the cocktail. I've tried every cocktail they have to offer and they are all amazing! The trout was cooked just the right amount and the broccoli on top makes it much better. Asparagus and Rust took on an aspect of aged potatoes that was very well prepared and served.

Had a rainy brunch experience here and it was great! Although sitting in the booth seats nearly a foot away from strangers has never been my favorite, the French toast I ordered was delicious and whatever I stole from my boyfriend was delicious as well. Looking forward to another trip!

Had a to-go order. For a $25 chicken, we shouldn't have to use our hands to eat because the restaurant can only afford cheap utensils. Where does all the money go for all the overpriced meals you charge?????

Our first sit down meal in NYC.  The waitress was horrible and didn't even complete our drink order before walking away.  There were many people clearing our table but only saw her again for the check.  The cheeseplate was the tiniest I've ever seen and it was served with large slices of bread. Main course of cauliflower pasta and calzone were just okay.

We moved into the area last month. Every time we walked by it is full. Speaking with a close friend he said it's his favorite place for brunch. So we came to try it out and we were not disappointed. The food is great, so much that we came back twice in one week! They have a variety of options. Victoria is amazing and so is the rest of the staff. Attentive and friendly. It definitely will be a go to place for us.

French toast and frittata was next level. The service is fantastic their waitstaff is top tier. Would recommend to any and all humans!

Good and drinks with a little party on the side? I'm in! Bring someone you're thinking about dating here and consider ordering the double fried potatoes. The beet salad really had it going on. The mi amor drink is made with gin and a splash of love. The blankets keep you nice and toasty while you get to enjoy some great food and conversation. Our waiter Ollie is the GOAT and set us up with a magnificent spread and magical vibes. Thank you Ollie and thank you cookshop

The service was amazing. Love the beignets and the egg breakfast sandwich. The bread was so light and fluffy.

I have been coming here for many years and must write a review because it is consistently a great brunch and lunch spot.  Friends were in town and we had an amazing brunch on Sat 10/22.  HUGE thanks to Christopher who was our server outside (FYI provide blanket in case you are cold).  Brunch was great - you have to try the buttermilk biscuit, heuvos rancheros with a Marianna Blood Mary.  Thanks to Andrew for help with the reservation.  Great spot!

Came here in a Saturday afternoon for brunch with my friends. We were early so we had drinks at the small but cute bar. I had the watermelon a sugar- perfect summer drink. We were seated promptly. The restaurant is very cute- bright and open layout with outdoor seating- we chose to stay in. Our waiter Alfredo was hilarious and took great care of me and my five friends. Service was pretty quick but I found the menu to be kind of limited. I hope they'll add more options. 4 of the ladies had the chicken salad and loved it. Another friend had the burger- I assume it was good- her plate was empty. I had the egg sandwich which was just ok- I wouldn't order it again. Overall I enjoyed the atmosphere and service- also the drinks were great. I'll definitely stop in again.
Fantastic place!  The food was super fresh and seasoned in very creative ways!  Would love to get some of their recipes.  Great staff, well ventilated environment.

Such a cute spot for dinner or brunch! I ate here on New Years Eve (got take out because they were booked). The food was so so so good and fresh. It was so delicious that my friend and I came back here for brunch the next day, for outdoor dining! This place took all of the necessary covid precautions and we felt extremely safe. The food and drinks were once again very impressive and delicious. I will definitely come back here whenever I'm in the city. Super friendly wait staff and just an awesome vibe in general.

O my gosh this place was a hit! Let's start by saying the cappuccino was on point. Beignets were heavenly. The best dish though was the huevos rancheros. Seriously I am a Texas girl and this was the best I have ever had them. The layers were deep and the pickle onion on top made the dish!! Last I had a spicy Bloody Mary, the marianna I believe. It was a kicker just to warn you if you like heat in Make a reservation and ask for a table away from the walk ways as it's tight and your chair will be bumped. I cannot wait to return and try other drinks and dishes.

I used to love this place but I won't be going back after a series of bad experiences. The food has gotten to be subpar in terms of taste for very small portion sizes (and thus incredibly overpriced). The servers were friendly but relatively absent and slow. And the ambience has gotten really chaotic - far too many tables crammed in. Definitely not worth it which is sad because it used to be great.

Cookshop really has its outdoor eating and COVID safety measures down pat. I felt safe and comfortable eating here. Unfortunately, vegan options are limited to sides, soup, and a grain/vegetable salad (no real mains are vegan). The vibe and location makes this a really fun place to dine out--read: heat lamps!
Must try brunch! I loved the Huevos Rancheros - def my favorite and so flavorful. Try to make a reservation but I came an hour after they opened and there was no wait!

The food is good and I love the location, but unfortunately we received pretty bad service. It could have just been an off day so I'd be interested in going back and trying since I did enjoy the food.

One of the best restaurants in NYC. I've been 10+ times and every single time am amazed by the menu options, the food, the cocktails and the excellent service.

Had brunch yesterday with my boyfriend and I very disappointed in quality of get food and service.We been waiting for out scrambled eggs for 40 min and when they arrived, they have dark color,not like usually.I have same dish couple times and food wasn't taste good.It was waste of money and time.Very bad server too,she didn't try to give us some compliment like dessert to make our experience not that bad.

A pleasant brunch. The Sunday brunch included beignets and a burger with a hot black tea. Everything delicious. The staff was friendly and professional. The ambiance great, people watching a true experience. Highly recommended.

I would love to dine here again. There brunch menu is very specific I would say to their atmosphere and ambiance was perfect for the occasion. Even though they list they're ingredient to all their entrees it still seems wowing when you see the servers pass with the extraordinary dishes. The menu is much more of the $$ side but I think its worth every penny.

We came here for brunch with no reservation and were able to get seated immediately (after a quick temp check). The staff was wonderful throughout our whole meal; attentive, kind, and quick.  The food was equally incredible.  We started with the cinnamon bun and it was perfect. Not too sweet, but just soft and moist enough. Next we had the Huevos Ranchero and the Scramble and both were delicious. Both were elevated versions of classics and both I would highly recommend. The portion sizes were great, we both left feeling very full.  Overall would highly, highly recommend Cookshop for brunch

service was nice but unfortunately the food was very salty (we got 4 dishes). Pity because if it wasn't as salty it could've been quite good. ambiance was cozy, especially outside with the blankets and the heating.

Had a great experience taking my mom to lunch at Cookshop. Made reservations for 2:30 outside on a Friday which is a peak time since the place was buzzing with folks. We got the corner table which I wanted so that started us off on the right foot. Our waiter was great and so was the food. We ordered the shishito peppers to start and wished we'd gotten 2 orders! Then I got the smoked brisket sandwich and my mom ordered the burger, and we shared. I liked my brisket the best. Didn't lack in flavor and the coarse mustard was the perfect addition. It was a beautiful day in Chelsea and I'm glad we came. Will definitely come back!

Came for brunch on a nice morning and the waiter told us he would rather be anywhere else and then proceeded to prove it by nearly ignoring us for the duration. It was not easy to get anything out of the distracted staff and I had to ask twice for flatware and cream. There were plenty of staff as they had lots of time to chat with each other and treated our table as annoying interruptions. I get it, service is a hard job but if you don't wanna do it, then find something else. It's forgivable at a basic restaurant but at a place charging these prices? They should be willing and able to do the basics of waiting tables.

I love this place - it's the perfect Pre-High Line or Pre-Whitney brunch. I was sad to see that they took the mushroom scramble off the menu though! I ordered the asparagus version which was great, but I had my heart set on the mushrooms

Adorable and delicious brunch spot! The indoors has lovely plants lining the perimeter. Food is excellent, I'd recommend the huevos rancheros. They do bottomless coffee in cute colorful mugs and the alcoholic drinks are top notch too.

Came here for late brunch at 3:30. We were thinking of coming in the morning as a walk in, but was glad we didn't. The only time available after 3:30 and even when we arrived it was packed. Had waited for at least another 10 minutes to get seated. The outdoor seating was nice spaced out if you are concerned about being too close to other groups of people. I was disappointed that they didn't have a full brunch menu and wanted to try the egg sandwich when browsing pictures, so i opted to get the huevos rancheros. It was good, but wished it had more balance against the tomatoes. I didn't feel like it even had any and mostly consisted of beans compared to what I expected. Overall, it was still decent, but not necessarily worth the price.

Drinks here are great! The Harvest Moon is a great fall cocktail with vodka and pumpkin infused notes. Presentation is beautiful from the Fall Fashion to their mezcal grapefruit cocktail. Would most definitely order the mezcal cocktail again! The food is also really good. We enjoyed the shrimp appetizer, it reminded me of seafood ceviche. Good starter to share. For the main, my friend orders the baked chicken which I liked better than my order. I ordered the swordfish which came on a bed of greens and grapefruit. For me, I didn't really enjoy the fish. It was cooked well done and a smidge dry. The combo of greens and grapefruit was just not good for me. Order the fries!! Perfectly crispy and well seasoned! They also give you a paper bag to keep your mask in while you eat. I liked the thoughtfulness of that and wish more places did that.

My date and I truly enjoyed brunch here. I ordered the burger and he ordered the french toast. Needless to say, we talked about it for several days later.
Cookshop is consistently wonderful...great food, service and ambience.  The menu is diverse and we find new items popping up all the time.  We've eaten there many, many times and always love it .

It is expensive but a good place to go with friends. The weather was amazing, so my friends and I decided to sit outside for brunch. The waitress (with short hair) was so friendly and also well-informed about the vegan options. Potato Hash was tasty and its portion is enough. I really recommend it! I also tried Green Juice and Citrus Salad that were okay but not perfect and their portion was very small when we think about their price. My non-vegan boyfriend said that Scramble and Coffee with oat milk were very delicious. It's also good that they have plant-based milk options. We only asked for oat milk but I don't know the other options. The portion of French Fries was also big. My other friends tried Pomelita, Burger, and French Toast and they also liked them.

Food was incredible and ambience was truly lovely. Had the oysters, grain salad bowl, trout, pork Choi and ramp pizza. Amazing!!!! Want to go back for breakfast.

Had brunch reservations on Sunday morning and it was delightful. It wasn't crowded when we walked in at 10am but it filled up quickly. The service great and food was delicious. The menu itself is small but has good sweet and savory options.

Chic and reliable neighborhood institution. Large outdoor dining area and professional wait staff.

Once the best restaurant in Chelsea, the Cookshop has become quite uneven. Last night was a particular drag, although the place wasn't very busy for the holiday weekend. One of the 2 hostesses was surly from the beginning. After she sat us at a table beside a large family with a screaming child,  we asked to be relocated to one of the many empty tables. She gracelessly plunked us down at a window table in the direct sunlight. When we apologetically asked for yet another table, she moved us without a word and slapped our menus down in front of us. I'd even said I was sorry for the inconvenience.  The very sweet, eager waiter then brought me the wrong meal, but I was so discombobulated, I agreed to keep it. I'm a regular customer, but I've given the Cookshop too many chances lately.

This is a good place to have a casual good food in NYC , lunch is great , Ames García was our server , he was great !! My office is across the street so I have been hear many times, this time I came on Sunday with my family and I have the disgrace to be attack by Julia Abramovich (kind of pretending Summelier) rude as I never see one , and I have to say I m chef from Barcelona michelin starred in NYC , I never mentioned that to the servers, she basically insulted my wife because we did not pick her wine suggestion, it's a shame she needs to be fired , she can drain the wine sales and customer experience

We had dinner at Cookshop for the first time.  The food, service and patio were all outstanding.  Sebastian made wonderful suggestions and our fish dinners (we tried all three options) were superb.  The vegetable sides and salad were fresh and done with a light touch.  We were outside on the patio on a cold evening - they provided blankets and there were heaters so we did fine.  I can't recommend this restaurant more highly.

Great brunch spot! We came here on a sunny Saturday in the Fall and they had cute blankets to keep the clients warm draped over every chair. The staff were efficient and quick which was impressive given all the tables inside.  We ordered cocktails which were beautiful - they have a spin on the classic Bloody Mary that is tequila based and has an extra kick of spice! For mains we ordered the egg sandwich with a side of garden salad and the huevos rancheros. Highly recommend for a cute, energetic brunch spot and delicious cocktails!

Came in last weekend with my boyfriend for brunch. We made reservations for 10:30. It wasn't too crowded when we got there, but it definitely filled up and there was a wait by the time we left! They have a pretty good menu with options for just about everyone. The coffee was pretty pricey but was unlimited so can't complain too much. We both ordered the broccoli scramble and a side of cheese grits. The scramble was delicious! So creamy and perfectly cooked. It also came with a biscuit. I have high standards for biscuits and have been on the search for a good one in NYC. This one was decent. I didn't like the jam they had very much. The biscuit had a good taste but wasn't very flaky. The cheese grits were awesome! I don't think I've ever had any like that before. Very flavorful but not too cheesy. A good place to bring parents for brunch.

Last night out with friends before Lent, so 3/4 of us had the burger. It was cooked to perfection, service was very nice, attentive, and friendly. My friend has several allergies, so our server made sure to check with staff about cross contamination and did everything she could to make sure the meal was enjoyable for her. I'm looking forward to returning to try their vegetarian grain bowl and spend plenty of time there in the Spring.

Second time here. Comfortable outdoor seating. Their pizza was great. The waiter was attentive. I am definitely going back.

We stopped by Cookshop for a quick lunch after visiting one of the galleries in Chelsea. First off, the outdoor tables were either well spaced or in a partial, well ventilated enclosure. And the staff, of course, was wearing masks. We felt safe. (I still wouldn't go inside, though, and it would be nice to have sanitizer at the tables.) The food was excellent and delivered promptly. We had a citrus & fennel salad (blood oranges, fennel, pistachio, etc.) and a vegetables & grains dish which, despite the uninspired name, was delicious (kale, cabbage, sweet potato, braised broccoli, roasted cauliflower). Accompany the whole thing with a glass of Sancerre or a beer and you are set!

The French toast with ice cream/yogurt cream and scrambled eggs with asparagus are great.

Classic tastes with great outdoor seating and atmosphere. Both my friend and I got the scramble with goat cheese and broccoli and they were willing to substitute the goat cheese with cheddar. Great service and very accommodating.
No comment

Loved this brunch spot on the corner in Chelsea. I ordered a mimosa, which wasn't strong really (I didn't mind as drinking wasn't my focus at this particular brunch). I just ordered a few starters as my meal, since there weren't really any dairy-free options. I ordered the whole wheat sourdough toast and the parsnip soup (no longer on the menu). The apple compote for spreading on the bread was delicious, and the bread was in thick slices so I was satisfied. The soup was creamier than I thought, but it tasted good and I loved the parsnip. The flavors in each of the dishes were clearly well thought out, and I appreciate the expertise and art that went into planning and cooking these dishes. Service was super nice; they even provided little cookie bags for you to store your mask in! Prices aren't bad either, and I'd love to come back to this trendy spot, maybe for dinner next time!

Cookshop is a great spot for brunch! It's pretty far west but the area is cute and you can go to the high line and Chelsea market afterward. We went during COVID and the outdoor seating was great. They have a 90 minute limit for a two person reservation which is a little annoying because the next table wasn't even there yet, but I sort of get it because they want to clean the table, etc. The bloody marianna was really good, and the chicken salad was better than I expected. It was mostly chopped vegetables and not a lot of lettuce but I liked that. My friend ordered the huevos rancheros and really liked it.
No comment

I had this restaurant on my list for so long. I went for a weekday lunch with a friend And was underwhelmed.Honestly the food is nothing to write home about. The restaurant itself was pretty large and was adhering to Covid restrictions. So I guess that's a plus.
No comment

Surprisingly pretty empty for a Sunday morning. The waiter brought us a blueberry muffin for our anniversary which was really nice! Huevos Rancheros was extremely flavorful and enough for two people. Grains and greens bowl was 7/10 - wish it had a bit more grains. Definitely a place we'd come back to!

This was a perfect little restaurant off the Highline trail! The Apple croissant French toast was sooooo good! Hands down one of the best I've had. The deviled eggs were delicious & i liked that each egg on the plate had a different topping. Would DEFINITELY come here again!

Got a reservation well in advance because I had heard great things and read good reviews. The hostesses were great and the atmosphere was nice if not a little dim for Saturday brunch. I really enjoyed the beignets but other than that the food was a little bland. We had the bluefish starter, Bloody Mary, the egg sandwich, and the baked eggs. What drops it to a 2 star is that we asked the waiter for coffee refills 3 times and just got slight nods, then when we asked the 4th time (after not having any coffee for about 25 minutes) he said they were brewing more. Just wasn't what I had hoped for for a brunch experience.

I found myself talking about what I wanted to order the next time I came before we were even done with our meal! This experience was amazing. This is an NYC institution; the ambiance, dish variety, fresh ingredients and creativity through and through. Visit on a night where Chef Matt Aita is running the kitchen and beg to have Jack as your server! These two made our experience exceptional and unforgettable. Can't wait to plan our next visit.

We went there for dinner on a Thursday. Getting reservation was easy and we were seated right away. We were starving, ordered three appetizers, shaved asparagus, shrimp ceviche, burrata, entrees were the grilled sword fish and the burger, with charred string beans and grilled asparagus. Burrata was pretty good. Shaved asparagus and shrimp ceviche are ok, both seemed a bit too much lemon. Then the main course, the burger is very dry, even though we ordered medium rare it has no juice at all. The sword fish is ok, quite small piece. The pickled veggies that goes with the sword fish are tasty. Both side dishes are disappointing, way too much lemon. Especially the asparagus. Overall I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone, especially considering the price here.

Disgusting food! We ordered pork chops and fish tacos bought dishes tasted horrible definitely not fresh! Management is rude! My friend complained to the manager and manager got very nasty and added racist comments. It's obviously not the way to treat customers!!!!! I strongly recommend never go to this place!

Chicken was tender but surprisingly the vegetables were the star of the show. Not sure what they did but it was roasted and tender. Forgot what drink I got but that was rlly good as well. A very decent brunch place for if you are in the area! I wouldn't go out my way to come here but I  would go again if I lived closer to it.

Not much to say, mediocre meal at high prices. The twice-cooked smashed potatoes were the highlight, delicious. The brisket sandwich and chicken salad were mediocre, and not what we expected. The service was very slow, but our waiter was excellent. Won't be back.

Had a fun lively dinner here with a party of 6. It was a bit too loud - we sat in the outdoor section, partitioned off from others by sheets of plexi. Luckily I sat in the middle so I could hear everyone but people on the ends could only hear those beside them (and across - but not even that that well). We shared a couple of bottles of wine, cocktails (love their tequila cocktails), their foccacia bread with cheese dip (generous portions), seafood ceviche (great), radishes (great) burrata/toast, a fish entree (great), roast chicken (great), and 2 desserts (the rhubarb one was great as was the chocolate). I'd go back but hopefully with a different seating arrangement so it's not so loud and hard to hear others. Friendly service and super fun night.

Never again. First, they refused to turn off / or turn away the heaters that were directed to our faces - saying it is a shared space and they don't care if we are not comfortable then although I specifically asked if the food was spicy, they said no spice in it, and it was the spiciest food I've ever eaten in my life.   I am really surprised all the stars this place got - should be friends and family... You are in NY and there are millions of good restaurants and Cookshop is not one of them!!!

Came here for lunch and they took Safety precaution seriously. We must wear a mask with we are interacting with the staff which I really liked. I really like the bread soup with a lot of onions. I made an mistake of ordering too much since we also got cookshop burger and scramble. The burger is medium rare as ordered and soft rich beef flavor.

Consistently great, not overly complicated food. I prefer the dinner menu to the brunch menu and particularly like the chicken entree, but have tried a number of the apps and sides as well as some of the salads that aren't currently on the menu. Great service and amazing outdoor setup too.

Super cute place and food was very tempting however I didn't find the taste to be great. (Beignets were my favorite), everything else (poached eggs, deviled eggs, and heuvos rancheros, I wouldn't order it again. We had fun though. It is a place to stop by when you are near high line.

I finally got to try Cookshop for brunch after what felt like being forever on my Yelp Bookmarks. Needless to say, I wasn't disappointed. The one tip I have is definitely make reservations unless you want to wait forever to  and if you do then you do you lol. It's easy to make reservations on Resy but make sure to do so at least a couple days in advance. I managed to get a reservation at noon for Sunday a couple days beforehand. This place is super cute and homely inside, loved that and the open kitchen as well. For drinks I ordered the Old Fashioned while my friend opted for the Bloody Mary. Both drinks were nice and strong. As we both have a sweet tooth, for entrees I got the "Dutch Baby" and my friend got the Almond Pancakes.  I can't speak for the pancakes (though they looked really good) but the "Dutch Baby" was very good. I kind of just wish it was more fluffy but I think it's just how it's cooked...I don't know anything about cooking. Overall, Cookshop is a solid place for brunch.

An absolutely highly recommended brunch place. The Benny I had  was amazing and wife had the breakfast sandwich, must come again!

The meal was really good here, I had the grilled tuna with winter beans. All perfectly seasoned. But the service was really bizarre. Recently had dinner here and was reminded that Cookshop still is one of the best spots in this neighborhood. They've been steady busy during the outdoor dining scene, and even as it started raining during the evening, they were quick to seat everyone beneath large umbrellas that kept the weather ignorable. The waiter suggested the sea scallops, and they were perfect; everything was fresh and enjoyable. The staff are also incredibly friendly and accommodating, despite how busy it can get.

Cookshop has to be one of my favorite brunch spots in the city. They always are able to accommodate people easily even on a busy Sunday morning. They have a great staff and very well organized operation. The food is very delicious, you can almost choose what type of brunch you would want to have. You have healthy options of greens and juices as well as healthy serving options of eggs. Definitely a must on your list if you are adventurous for brunches.

Came here last weekend when I was visiting a couple friends in NYC. My girlfriend made reso's a week before hand for a table of 5 and we were guaranteed a table yet we still had to wait 25 mins for our table. The waiting area was extremely busy and it was situated next to the bar. The restaurant itself looked super nice and I loved their design and aesthetic. The food on the other hand, pretty standard overpriced brunch place. Nothing amazing stood out. I ordered the Egg + Sausage Sandwich with their hash (mainly for their hash) which actually came out to be a burger. The hash I thought tasted similar to the ones you can get at any Eggsmart but just more wet. I wasn't impressed. My boyfriend ordered the Huevos Rancheros - which I had looked up on yelp to see that it was highly recommended. It was alright as well, tasted like tortilla chips with salsa and you decided to throw in an egg and called it 'brunch'. The rest of my friends ordered the Poached Eggs, Simple Oven Baked Eggs, and Falafel. A side of Hash for the entire table. I wasn't really blown away with anything and their were they. Their Caesars looked very dressed up though. I would say, save your money and time and go to any other brunch place in NYC - there are tons to choose from.

One of the more popular brunch options at this restaurant and I can see why. The flavor from the black beans worked perfectly with the pickled jalapenos and lime creme fraiche. I would definitely recommend this restaurant and this dish if you're ever in Chelsea!

Great lunch spot in Chelsea if you're looking for a nice, sit-down meal.  Came here with a friend last week.  Loved the variety on the menu, and the crowd was interestingly diverse.  We had the burrata to start, which was delicious.  I then had the arctic char as my main, which was a nice, light dish, and perfect for anyone trying to stick to their New Years resolutions.  The ginger lemonade was delish as well.  My only criticism was that service was a bit slow.  Otherwise, will likely come back here.

Love a place that allows dogs in the outside seating area! We came for lunch and enjoyed the deviled eggs, the pate, the burrata, fish tacos and the oysters (all solidly good, especially the tacos). I also appreciated our server for bringing my pup a bowl of water and a treat. :)

Excellent food - everything we got was absolutely spectacular. The chicken, the Brussels sprouts (perfectly crisped), the spinach salad, the cocktails....not one complaint

This place is so good. If you love healthy food with a bit of indulgence this is the place. We skipped the bread basket but it's one of the best ones I've seen yet with a great selection.  Wild salmon is on the menu. Rarely can I find wild salmon. It's usually farmed so I never get to order it. My 5 yr old daughter said her salmon tasted so soft and swore she was eating sushi even though it was cooked well. The dessert menu is amaazing. The blueberry cheesecake sundae was a dream. One of our favorite restaurants. And brunch is a must!!!

This cute shop is always bustling.  The only time I could grab a weekend brunch reservation was 10am, right when they open!  Our group started off with beignets and the chef's pastry sampler.  What a good idea!  They were all amazing, especially the beignets and scone.  We had a variety of cocktails, which are admittedly pricey but are very strong.  I'd rather have a good well-made drink over cheap sugary drinks that give you a hang over.  All the entrees looked gorgeously appetizing - the ones we ordered as well as those just passing by!  This will be our new go-to brunch place :)
Incredible bloody mary's and an awesome burger, something for everybody, as good of a place there is in Chelsea to be honest.  Super professional operation, the servers are top notch.

Had lunch here with some coworkers on a Monday afternoon and the service was pretty meh. Our waiter was not attentive whatsoever. It was difficult to get his attention and given they it was the middle of the work day we were hoping for pretty swift service. 3/5 of us ordered the fish tacos which were pretty underwhelming. I ordered the huevos rancheros which were amazing! A filling portion and absolutely delicious. We also ended up sharing desserts. We ordered the cookie sundae and the strawberry cheesecake parfait both were really delicious. I'd be tempted to go back just for the huevos and just hope that the service would be better.

Came here on a Friday for a late breakfast and we were seated right away. I ordered the breakfast board which came with two soft boiled eggs, bread, salad and apple and almond butters. The salad was a little bitter. The bread was super healthy tasting and the eggs cooked perfectly. And the apple butter was a fan of everyone at the table. Service was quick and efficient!

Great food and wonderful service!  Dog friendly too.  We sat outside. Great cool evening. I would definitely recommend.

Love this place! Great addition to the neighborhood. Lively vibe inside and great healthy food. Love their salads, chicken and burgers. Great cocktails and wine.

Haven't been here since covid. Everything was great. Foccacini. Fries. Pork chops with collard greens with macerated cherries. Pot de creme.

I was randomly yelping popular brunch places and came across this one that was relatively close to where we were at the time. Made a reservation immediately and thank goodness they had a spot open! We were seated within 5min of our arrival. Since we had never been here, we asked our waitress for her recommendations and she recommended the huevos rancheros and the 100% grass fed beef burger. Huevos rancheros was super filling and flavor packed, definitely on the heavier side of a dish so be prepared to not wanna walk after your meal (in a good way though). The burger was also good but nothing super special, fries were fine as well. A good, trendy brunch place for sure that will leave your belly satisfied!

Good brunch! Restaurant atmosphere is open and bright. Does get quite loud. Servers and hostess were super warm and friendly. Food was good not great. Just pretty simple, nothing wrong with simple.

Came for Sunday brunch and loved the food and the atmosphere. We got the huevos and rancheros and sausage and egg sandwich. The service was very good--I casually had mentioned my friend and I were going to split the meal between us--and they took the initiative to cut the sandwich and bring it out on two plates, with the huevos rancheros in the middle. Delicious. Long wait but it's worth it, this place is busy for a reason.

This is one of my all time favorite restaurants in NYC. The service is always amazing, cocktails flawlessly designed and crafted, and the food is unbeatable! They created an incredible outdoor area in light of the indoor dining shutdown, and it is warm, welcoming and so comfortable! They temp check at the door as well. My friend and I brought our pups, and our server was quick to bring over water and treats, winning over the hearts of the dogs!! I'd highly recommend this restaurant to anyone, thank you so much Cookshop for continually being an amazing dining experience!!! Please, other Yelpers/viewers, help save restaurants and go to or order from Cookshop!!!

I've been itching to go here for so long ...finally made it and fell in love. Great ambience, a little too loud perhaps but otherwise a home run. We had a number of different dishes and apps but all in, all out I couldn't have been happier. Next time I'm in the area, I'll happily dial this up again and it's on my short-list of go-tos now in the city. Love it.

My first time here and I loved it! The service was good, the lady waitress was nice. I suggest getting the strawberry iced tea. It was so refreshing! I also got the fish tacos (I asked for them grilled not fried). They were good but a bit spicy for my taste. My favorite thing by far was the burrata with pesto garlic sauce. I'll definitely be coming back for that! Also the beef carpaccio was extra tasty. The chocolate cake with ice cream was perfect! I definitely would come back but for brunch next time! The inside of the restaurant is a bit too loud but other than that, I enjoyed It.
Mostly very good.  Good service.   Good food.   Good outdoor set up for the colder weather.   Good location.   Look for the Lantern House and what do you notice about it that is unique?

Now this Is a great place! We went there for brunch and I was the happiest to find something vegetarian, something gluten free and something in chicken - basically a lil something for everyone! We all loved our food, especially mine that falafel.. it was Amaaazinng!! The service was great, happy cheerful people to welcome you to the restaurant and even though we went for Sunday brunch, place was swamped!! Tip- please reserve a table before you go on weekends! Definitely going back for more !!

Good food, good vibes. Lunch + drinks here on a sunny day is hard to beat. For entrees, they serve a solid burger and huevos rancheros. Starters tried the burrata- on the small side but very creamy, though the olive oil wasn't as strong as I'd prefer. Friendly service, but be prepared to wait a bit if you're walking in.

I didn't plan to come here for brunch but when every other place on my list had a 2 hour wait, I just happened to find this little gem on yelp! I'm so glad I ended up here because it's delicious. The huevos rancheros are to die for. I ended up ordering the egg and sausage breakfast sandwich on a brioche bun because the description sounded amazing, who can say no to jalapeño sauce?! My boyfriend ordered the huevos rancheros and I am for sure getting that next time! I had a classic Bloody Mary as well and it was made well, just needed some more vodka because I could taste the Bloody Mary mix a lot. Overall, I loved this place and I will definitely be coming back.

My first time to Cookshop.  Excellent service. We had no problem exchanging one of our cheese to a different one once we saw that it's blue cheese which none of us eat. The mussels were very fresh and done just right. Great tasting toast we were given. Asked for more bread, got the focaccia.  Yum.  I got the Bordetto for entree.  A little on the spicy side but that's just personal preference. The sirloin steak my cousin had looked good. Porkchop was very tender and flavorful too. The crispy potato was sooo crispy. Wow.  And that's from someone who doesn't normally eat potato. (I didn't eat any of the finger potatoes in the Bordetto. Again, I just don't really eat potatoes,  that's all me).  So you can imagine how good the crispy potatoes were. We finished our meal with brownie. So good! Love it.

Since the brunch here was so spectacular we returned for dinner.  Second time around was underwhelming.  The rose, salad and dessert were excellent but our entrees were disappointing.   I ordered the soft shell crab and he the mushroom ricotta ravioli.  The flavors were there but there should've been 2 crabs instead of 1 and 3 large raviolis instead of 2.  We were both a bit hungry still after our entrees but decided to move on to dessert instead of sharing a 3rd entree.  Cookshop has been demoted after this recent experience.

Been here for brunch, lunch, and dinner. Each and every time the food has been outstanding and service has been excellent. They have the best huevos rancheros in the city, and some of the best veggie dishes ever. It's worth the wait; def make reservations.

My husband and I eat here at least 3 times a week. They change their menu daily, so you don't get sick of anything. Probably the best find for dinner or brunch. Food is farm to table so it's a major plus! This is the gem of the neighborhood, but be prepared for a long wait for a table, especially for brunch! You really can't go wrong with anything you order, and the staff are all exceptionally friendly and welcoming. David the manager is great and so is Hailey. Always assisting if there is ever any issue with a positive attitude and a big smile. I really hope they NEVER close!

Loved the awesome vegetarian friendly options. I had come here for dinner and got the eggplant dip to start with. The naan and dip were good but I had to ask for hot sauce as I needed something spicy. The eggplant lasagna was my favorite entree. My friend got the baked squash and liked it as well. We were offered complimentary bread and butter as well as sparkling water. The service was great and we did not feel rushed at all. I definitely want to try their brunch next time.

Ordered the huevos rancheros and the cheddar and spinach egg scramble on a biscuit. Especially enjoyed the scramble on a biscuit - it was a little salty, but overall delicious and hearty. The huevos was a little Smokey, like a chili, but still good and paired well with the egg scramble. Nonstop black coffee was also delicious! Wouldn't rush back here, but glad we came.

Came here for brunch right after opening (a little after 10 am on Sunday) and got a table for 2 easily. There were definitely still a lot of people already seated too though, so come early if you don't have a reservation! The staff was friendly and efficient. We sat outside on the covered patio and it was very pleasant! I ordered the kale scramble and my boyfriend got the sausage breakfast sandwich. Mine came with a fluffy biscuit and a side salad. Went here on Wednesday night. The tables were distanced, contactless menus, drinks on point, and the food was great. They did a wonderful job setting up a dining area and didn't miss a beat. Bravo!

Cookshop is a solid choice providing great food for the neighborhood. Located in Chelsea near the Highline, Cookshop offers high quality American food at modest (for the area) prices. I tried the deviled eggs and a few other things & all were good. The people who work there are so friendly & kind. They seated me quickly & made helpful suggestions. I really like the fact they have both indoor and outdoor dining areas. And there was no wait when I went there a few weeks ago. I passed by Cookshop again today to check out their breakfast menu. The pancakes with berries looked delicious. Definitely worth a try!

This was the best fresh farm to table food I've had in a long time.. from the fresh beet juice to the heirloom tomato salad with fresh feta! Yummy!

Wow. What a meal. What service. Cookshop really is amazing. I highly recommend the grilled swordfish sandwich. The food has a French vibe, delicious light but very flavorful. We had a very good experience tonight. We walked in at around 9pm and waited at the bar for a table. It only took about 20 minutes. We say at the bar and immediately we're greeted by the bartender who was absolutely amazing. He had great drink recommendations and in fact came up with his own concoctions. After we ordered some drinks we got to our table and order lots of good stuff. We had the deviled eggs, buratta, chicken liver pate, Brussel sprouts, persimmon salad, roasted chicken and roasted sunchokes. Everything we had was pretty solid but the stand outs were the buratta, chicken liver pate and the roasted chicken. The service was good and friendly but got a little slow but the end of the night. All things considered we had a great time, it's a really fun environment with a great vibe. We will come back again for sure!

Apparently this is the go-to brunch place. We went on a Saturday at around 2 and was told that there was 25-30 mins wait. We put down our numbers for a text when our table was ready and walked around the neighborhood.  The wait time wasn't too bad, though it was way past brunch time.  When we got the text and went into the restaurant, we got seated right away. Our server came and offered complimentary still/sparking water, gave us time for the menu, took our order, etc. Though the staff were all very nice, and our server was definitely attentive. They made sure to always topped off our coffee, brought us plates and knife for us to share the deviled eggs, then reset the entire table for our brunch food.  The space was very airy and nice, it had a very good atmosphere to it. The price was reasonably and we really liked our brunch food. Though I thought the deviled eggs were a bit on the salty side.

A class act - always! I've always told friends "this is my favorite restaurant in NYC" and last night Cookshop again proved why. On a busy Saturday night, they welcomed my husband and I with our stroller and 4 month old with open arms. It was our first night out as a family for dinner and the hostess was beyond accommodating, seating us at a spacious 4-top to make room for the stroller to be table side. After enjoying the Brussels, deviled eggs and pork croquettes we followed that with meat loaf and the cornmeal dusted skate. After those courses with wine and cocktails they staff lovingly sent over 2 glasses of champagne as congratulations for making our first night out with baby! I can't express how that simple gesture truly was the icing on top of an already incredible experience. Thank you so the Cookshop staff at 6pm on 12/21, you are all rock stars!

We had been trying to go to the Yayoi Kusama exhibit in Chelsea, but by the time we got there (weekend midmorning) the line was almost wrapped around the full block so we decided against it and to eat instead. Nothing really struck our fancy in the area, but Cookshop came up as a well rated breakfast and brunch place so we decided to check it out. I think when we got there they had just opened, but even so it was still super busy. We got the last 4 seat table that was available, and sat down and ordered. Among the four of us, we got the baked eggs with toast, the Huevos Rancheros, the quiche/frittata, and the eggs and bacon basic breakfast with a couple of coffees. The decor of Cookshop is very grand, very all-American breakfast kind of place with flowers and wood paneling on the walls, and with pets/dogs allowed inside the store (we had a French at the table next to us!). The food was just alright, not the best brunch I've had but it was definitely quality food. For the price point in Chelsea, it was a fair amount of food. I was less than impressed by my Huevos Rancheros, but the baked eggs were pretty good (could've been spicier, given how it looked it wasn't spicy at all!). Overall, solid brunch place (not super conducive to conversation unfortunately because it's pretty loud), but the alcoholic brunch drinks looked good! Wouldn't be opposed to coming back here again.
The best poached eggs I have ever had! The 'cilbir' poached eggs were so good and so full of flavor. Eggs with a Mediterranean twist for the win.

I visited for brunch with two girlfriends and really enjoyed it! We started with coffee and cocktails which were on point (Overholt spiked apple cider, a spicy Bloody Mary, and a Cookshop champ.) Everyone was pleased with their drink selections, but I liked the cider the best, which was good b/c that is the one I got. I had the broccoli and caramelized onion frittata which came with a biscuit and a side of greens. The biscuit was huge and was served with apple butter (nomnomnom.) The frittata was warm, cheesy, and well-portioned. After inhaling the entire thing, I was definitely full but not too full. The other ladies had the kale and egg salad and baked eggs which came with bacon and walnut raisin toast. We were able to sub for another of the wonderful biscuits. Service was prompt and friendly.  If I lived in the area I would be coming back here soon.

Upon arrival, the restaurant had a very lively atmosphere. The hostess and waitress were really down to earth and really gave us a great laugh throughout our meal. The food was pretty unique. We got the tempura fried squid, fish tacos, and spicy lamb - which were all delicious. I got the root of all evil drink which definitely highlighted the taste in each of my meals. Definitely a repeat when I return.

My 3rd time here. Never disappoints. The service is always good, the staff courteous. The food is always well-made, exactly as ordered and the ambiance is always vibrant, filled with people and laughter. We ordered the huevous rancheros and the goat cheese, spinach scrambled which I requested to be well done. Everything was on point and the homemade biscuit and homemade jam was delish. Just melt in your mouth types. The wait is always 30-45 mins. But its worth it. If this spot had an option for reservations, it would have received a 5-star from me. Definitely recommend it.

I've been here numerous times for brunch and dinner and everything is always delicious. When the weather is nice they have outdoor seating and it's a great place to people watch and also within walking distance to the High Line. The food and drinks are fabulous and they change the menus seasonally and the service is always great. I would definitely recommend coming here.

They only allow 30% of the seat to be reserved so you can walk in. I couldn't make the reservation but Place was huge and we were seated right away when we came for Sunday brunch 10:45am. Food and service were all great.

Got here just in time for lunch but was in the mood for breakfast and the menu totally totally took care of us. The service here is incredible. They are truly accommodating and sweet people.  The menu is meticulously designed and great attention to detail. Although simple still incredibly unique. I got the breakfast bowl which was super filling . My friend got the frittata and we shared the deviled eggs. The bread is worth it as well, sourced from Amy's Bakery.

After years and years of just never getting here it finally happened! And it was awesome. The chicken liver mousse was a dream. Buttery and velvety. Mmm. That I could slather on just about anything. My duck was so delicious. Well cooked and seasoned. This place just makes real food. Honest, hit you at your soul food. The servers are so great, friendly and accommodating. Loved the donuts to end the meal. Can't wait to come back!

Came here before going to Sleep No More. Perfect location and a short stroll on the High Line to get there. Love all the fun shop around this area as well such as Story. Cookshop is what I'd consider a Chelsea brunch monument... Excellent creative food that makes both young and old happy. Only downside is so many hotels have now shared this so much that it can often flood with tourists, which makes it hard for us locals to get a table (sounds like a good problem to me as they're doing many things right)! I brought a friend here from out of town and she loved it (I've been many times where I've sat at the bar, inside table, as well as dined outside). If you haven't been to Cookshop, I highly suggest it but recommend you get there early with your entire party to ensure you're able to snag a table (you can put your name in w/the hostess & enjoy their fabulous craft cocktails at the bar while you wait - it's worth it). The Margarita Refresher is fantastic (refreshing like its fitting name), the deviled eggs are so tasty for a light bite, and then that Dutch baby on the skillet is truly next level goodness!! Hope to be back soon for more.

We sat outside after walking the Highline and enjoyed the atmosphere.  The cocktails were outstanding.  My party also really liked the Starter selection of Stuffed Whole Wheat Pita Bread, but that was probably the high point of the meal.  Service was pretty slow, and when our pork shoulder, lamb burger and ribeye finally arrived, we were underwhelmed.  The lamb burger was "a little rare".  The pork shoulder was "kind of fatty" and "not a lot of meat".  The ribeye was "good".  Overall, I expected better food, but the atmosphere and location worked for us.

Definitely worth the visit and I'll be back for not-so-sloppy seconds.

It's a famous brunch place. We made a reservation at 1:45 but could not sit down until 2:15. The service was slow and not satisfying. The food was very salty... I ordered the eggs with spinach and biscuit. It was okay but nothing special about it... I don't know why this place is so popular. I saw many people order Bloody Mary. I didn't. Maybe it was the Bloody Mary that made this place famous.

A little on the pricey side for brunch. $14 just for one cocktail. The food was delicious, I particularly enjoyed the dutch apple pancake which was more like a breakfast version of apple brown betty or an apple crisp without the excess sugar. There was a bit of a wait but I would return if I was in the highline area.
No comment

Came in for brunch on Sunday. To start off, we got a Dutch apple and mint pancake for the table. I love as extremely disappointed with it because it was much smaller than it looks in pictures; you can probably finish the entire thing in 6 bites. The pancake was not as thick as expected and it was almost soggy since it was soaking in the apple sauce. It came with syrup which wasn't really needed for the dish as the apple had its own syrup. Next I got the fried egg sandwich while my sister got the sautéed spinach and cheddar scramble. The fried egg sandwich came with a jalapeño cabbage slaw which I got on the side and was happy with my decision since it had a very strong acidic flavor. I loved the house made sausage, it was seasoned to perfection and went well with the egg. The hash brown was to die for, also seasoned very well . Overall I'd say this was. 9/10 meal. I had some of the sautéed spinach and cheddar scramble which I liked very much. The highlight of both meals was the buttermilk biscuit. It was a big portion and tasted delicious. Perfectly doughy but had the perfect crumble. The cheddar scramble was also delicious. So as a tip I would go with their baked options for an appetizer just based off the biscuit. We had a really great waiter who gave us complimentary beignets for dessert. The beignets weren't the best ever but they weren't bad either.

I really wanted to like this restaurant but out of four Of us, there was not one person that enjoyed any part of their meal. We ordered the chicken wings, which were largely left untouched, a couple of different salads they were not very good, the pork chop, which was dry, the Scsllopss, which inexplicably came on more greens and was, at best so so, and the swordfish, which was not even half eaten.

My sister and I stumbled across this place during a trip to the city this year. Nine months later I'm still talking about the experience, the food and the service's I haven't been able to make it back, but I will when I move to Manhattan next year!!! It's in my top five list for the city! Highly recommended.

I had a lovely experience at Cookshop. The staff was incredible, so great. I went with my mom around 7:15 on a weekday night and we were seated immediately without a reservation. What a thrill! I cannot say this is a normal experience and maybe was because everyone was out watching manhattanhenge (which does not thrill me by the way). The food was great, but if I could do it again I would have made a real effort to split everything with my fellow diner. I got cabbage as an appetizer, which was too spicy for my mom but I thought was delightful. For an entree I got ricotta lasagna which was really good but a bit heavy. I only made it through half the skillet before I tapped out :(. I was however impressed by how much of the menu was vegetarian friendly. For dessert I got rhubarb crumble which also was too big for me. It was incredible though! I have one final note about cookshop: there were a bizarre number of pregnant women at this restaurant. Do with that information what you will...

OMGOSH, cheese grits, cheese biscuit, cheesy scrambled eggs, feta cheese in the frittata and super waiter, Josh. Best brunch of the month at Cookshop.  It's a little too neat and tidy but oh so good.  The best part, they take reservations. RIGHT ON !!

The flavors pull together the right amount of spice and the beans are cooked to an appropriate texture.  If you want to try trendy this is a good choice, but speak up is the type of service to prepare for when you dine.  Also the hostess is not much in welcoming you and other guests noted, not sure if pretentious is part of the allure for some patrons.

Packed brunch spot by the high line, with ample seating both indoors and outdoors. The food was pricey and didn't live up to the hype for me, though there certainly wasn't anything bad about it! Try their fall apple margarita -delicious

Came for breakfast on an week day. The place was moderately empty. I was seated immediately and ordered within 10min or so of being seated. The food is read to sound like a lot of food but you're actually being fed small to non-existent portions for the price,unless you get pancakes (but who can really eat more than 2) you'll leave dissatisfied. I had the option that sounded like the most will come out of the dollars they want since I was very hungry. Who bothers to serve grits but gives only close to a tbls amount? Overall I think this is one time and done spot if ya are very close by and not hungry.

Tough place to get in for brunch but very worth it.  Great bloody mary's and cocktails.  Some good people watching in Chelsea and the occasional model or celeb too.  Plenty of savory and sweet menu items too.  They rotate out fresh pastries which I highly recommend.  We've had the caramel and bacon pecan rolls a few times and those are the best in our life.  One of the best things you can put in your mouth.  The huevos is awesome here too.  A good mix of traditional and modern cuisine.  Perfect for brunch or groups.   It gets busy fast though.

One of the best meals I've had in NYC. Atmosphere was intimate, service was knowledgeable and attentive, and the food was exquisite. The broccoli pizza is not to be missed, along with the fish sandwich and basically every vegetable side. We'll definitely be back!
The lamb burger is super delicious- probably the best burger I've had in a while. It took an hour to get food for three people- way too long- but I'd go back for the burger.

So good. Simple food, but very high quality and well done. They don't overdo anything. I actually think that brunch is the best meal to have here. Service is always good too.
Great staff! Everyone was so happy and very helpful with questions or suggestions. Food was good too with decently big portion sizes.

Sophisticated takes on new American cuisine. The dishes we tried at lunch (beignets, tuna melt, mushroom soup) all had several layers of flavor beyond what you'd expect. Great, thoughtful service by Niki. Altogether a wonderful dining experience. P.S. There's an entrance to the High Line conveniently located across the street for a post-meal stroll.

Cookshop was delicious! I went there on Thursday for Lunch and had a great time! I got the poached eggs cilbir since I was really interested in how the components would taste with each other. The dish had poached eggs, sweet potato hummus, pressed yogurt, chili oil, and a side of countryside sourdough. I was soo glad I got this dish because it was perfect. I wish I could eat this everyday. I also got to try the gluten free almond pancake and that was really good. The pomegranate had a nice crunch and balanced out the sweetness with the pancake. Also try the green juice. Our server was very attentive and knowledgeable and the interior was modern and had a good amount of seating. You should definitely check this place out

Very good service and a great menu. Breakfast was delicious and dinner is fantastic also. This is a definite hot spot in Chelsea - very busy and exciting. A must visit if you're in this part of the city.

Fantastic Monday lunch. Swordfish was wonderfully moist. Service was friendly and efficient, with no attitude about the fact that my friend was late and we also were in a hurry. All went off perfectly. Apple margarita was also delicious.

We ordered the fish tacos and a BLT. What we got was AMAZING! Each component to the meal tasted fresh/or from scratch. Even the bread before the meal must've been made that day. The staff was friendly, and the environment was welcoming and relaxed. This is a place we will be returning to and recommending to all friends & family that travel this way.

Went in without reservations for Sunday Brunch and sat down at the bar with no wait! Plus in my book already! We started off with the delicious hot biscuit and marmalade and it was so good, we ordered a second one. Just thinking about it again is making my mouth water! I lived in the South so I've eaten a lot of quality biscuits in my day! My bestie and I decided we wanted to try multiple things so we got the Fried Egg Sandwich (we got it scrambled style) and the 'Dutch Baby' Skillet-Baked Pancake. What can I say! The brioche bun on that sandwich was so soft and pillow-like that I hated that I decided to share it. I mean you really can screwup an egg sandwich so it was pretty good. Now on to that Dutch Baby! I think it saw Jesus when I ate that bite cause it just melted in my house. It came in its little skillet nice and hot with that walnut compote was just magical. We didn't drink (recovering from previous evenings shenanigans) but a lot of Blood Orange Mojitos were being served and they looked very tasty. Service was great and they were very attentive! It's definitely a must-try for Brunch!
No comment

Cookshop has been consistently good for a long time and stay yummy; very impressive  My favorite time to eat here is lunch; alone or with friends/clients.  It's always a good time.  Food is never disappointing  Recent favorites are - Cookshop Breakfast Bowl and Cascun Farm Chicken Breast Salad, and Grilled Cheese Sandwich.   Service is always good, though noise is my least favorite part of this space.  I don't enjoying eating at the bar area and no dinner.  Reservation is strongly recommended.
This place has great staff and atmosphere but the breakfast was not good. Maybe it was just the huevos rancheros.

Just stopped in for an excellent lunch. Good food and attentive and efficient service. The cold tomato soup was outstanding, the deviled eggs very good, and the fish tacos were not typical but quite tasty. Recommended.

Came for Saturday brunch. 4 stars vs 3.5 solely off of service. Sat at bar because wait time at noon was almost 45 mins. Food was honestly ok. My buger was very good. However the order of french toast wasn't bad but the way they make it it comes a little on the soggy side. My fiance tried their new lobster rolls that just were placed on the menu days ago, and she didn't like it. Wasn't really fresh tasting, seems like they need a little trial and error with the recipe. However with no questions asked bartenber scooped it up took off bill and replaced with a very good chicken salad. We will definitely return just hoping that hospitality at tables are the same as bar. Btw we were amused when we gave our phone number to be seated, we were notified that table was ready, we replied that we were at bar. Someone responded with "great enjoy" followed by a smiley face :)

Food good.  Service good.  Outside seating the norm ...side walk tables and chairs ...but nice with the sun out.
I had a great brunch there today along with a very decent Bloody Mary, worth visiting on a lazy Sunday afternoon.

I came with my sister, where she started with a side salad, I got the frittata, and she got the burger. The side salad was $12 and was legitimately a bowl of lettuce, a little ridiculous. Perfect late lunch post the craziness at Chelsea Market. Shared the burrata, the deviled eggs and the grilled Savoy cabbage. All three were delicious with the grilled cabbage being our favorite.

This is a brunch review, I'll be back for dinner and/or lunch.  When five people sit down for a meal and everyone's delighted you know the place is a keeper.  When we came in we noticed that everyone was drinking bloody marys.  Our interest we piqued and we saw that they actually have five different versions.  We ordered the bacon bloody mary s and someone ordered the pickled bloody mary.  In both cases they were the best we've had! The bacon Bloody Mary is definitely one to try. Winner's were the chicken liver mousse as well as the beignet with ricotta.  For a main courses there was the best egg sandwich I've ever had and my daughter said virtually the same thing about her huevos ranchero.  My wife who's very health concious had the breakfast bowl and was delighted.  A must try for brunch;  be sure to get a reservation, because walk-in's were told the wait was about an hour.

Returned to Cookshop on a Saturday evening. We had a reservation and were seated immediately. This is a big, loud venue with a lot of "electricity" in the air. It's not a place for quiet conversation but it is a place to enjoy creative cuisine by an exceptional chef. Our server was attentive throughout the meal. Our appetizers were the Squash Blossom Picatta with anchovy, lemon, pecorino cheese, capers, and garlic and the Sungold tomatoes with tri-star strawberries and purple basil. The Squash Blosson Picatta didn't look anything like the description but was wonderful. The Sungold tomatoes was an attempt at creativity that missed. Somehow, Tomatoes and strawberries just didn't work. It was pleasant but in the past I had a cold Sungold Tomato soup that was far better and I wished it was on the menu the night I dined here. Our entrees were the Pan roasted hallibut with marinated cucumbers, tarragon vinaigrette, and herb salad and the Montauk Porgy with black olive tapanade, cumin, lemon, and fava bean salad,  Both were excellent. Dessert was the Rhubarb pie with almond cream, oat crumb and buttermilk ice cream and the Basil Sorbet. The Rhubarb pie was great.  For me, Chef JoJo forever will own the best Basil Sorbet, and this sorbet, while creamy, seemed too sweet. It was good however. I skipped coffee since on previous visits the coffee was mediocre. The one thing I have to say. We dined on a night when the outside temperature was over 90. Several of the staff were wearing strong cologne that was really unpleasant and overwhelming when they approached the tables. It would be appreciative if the staff could wear more subtle cologne while waiting the tables. Apart from this, another great dining experience at Cookshop. And it was nice to have the owner bid us "farewell" after our meal.
Favorite brunch place with the girls! I had an amazing squash omelette that was amazing and to die for!! I have to make it back to this place soon!!!

Huevossssssssss....get you some! Huevos Rancheros that is! I had this plate at Cookshop and I must say it was excellent. I know what you're thinking, "Huevos Racheros...no biggie.", well you're wrong, wrong, wrong...yeap I said it...what are you gonna do about it?!?!? This plate is different from the typical Huevos Rancheros - think Huevos Rancheros Casserole because the egg, beans, salsa is mixed together in a perfect melody of delishness. The restaurant itself is large, faces 10th Avenue so it gets great sunlight, and has outdoor seating for all you sundwellers and people watches. The waiters are cute but of course as a straight women - none were very interested in my cakes. Speaking of cakes, that's the one negative about my experience - they were out of pancakes which didn't make my roomie happy...sad day.  Other than that - good weekend brunch spot.

This place is a joke. I know someone that worked there for a week. The working conditions for the employees are downright disrespectful. They work hard all day and are not allowed breaks. My friend couldn't take it and after one week she quit, it's been over a month and they still haven't got paid. They can expect a call to the department of labor and the better business bureau. Someone needs to know about the horrible things the store managers do to their employees.

This place was fantastic. Service was amazing. Our server (Karen? Kendra? It started with a K) was so thoughtful, kind and attentive. She knew the menu inside and out and made really good recommendations. The other staff was also incredibly attentive and welcoming. Wow. The place was also gorgeous, the playlist was great, but not so loud that we had to scream to hear each other or that it was intrusive. The food was also really good. I'll definitely be back. Thank you!
No comment
No comment
One of the top brunch places on my list! Been there couple times and the breakfast bowl is surely what I always order. Giving you a great way to start your day with a health but yet interesting dish.

My second trip to the restaurant was lovely. I love how the menu Changes. I had vegetarian meal: hummus appetizer, pizza and some corn. It was all delicious. The service is always impressive. Definitely returning again. The atmosphere is great for groups and couples.

Met a friend from out of town for dinner here. Food was good, albeit overpriced - i guess it's Manhattan afterall. The service was excellent. Only taking one star off for the ambiance: think a mixture of American Psycho style yuppies, middle age men on dates with women young enough to be their daughters & older waspish types. Not my cup of tea...
Very nice place with delicious food and excellent service. This is my second time here and I will certainly come again to taste something else

After years of passing in my own neighborhood, I finally took the plunge with a friend (and excellent cook!) visiting from out of town. Decent prices considering service/location. VERY busy - but food was excellent and service quite good despite the business. Portions seem large. Just remember to make a reservation.

Hands down the best breakfast I have had this year. Cookshop has great attention to detail, flavor and balance in everything we tried. The service was great and there was a friendly and efficient vibe to the place. I tried the egg and sausage sandwich on brioche that came with potatoes and some dressed greens. I'd walk from Brooklyn to get another plate of those potatoes again. What a great find. Eat here. You will not be disappointed. Biscuits and grits are worth ordering for sure.

Adorable decor and wonderful brunch food. The wait would have been much longer had we not made a reservation, so be sure to do that. The drinks were great tasting, but rather strong, so be aware of that when ordering one! Definitely a great place to try and a solid brunch location.
