The food and waitstaff are both good here. They were very patient as we had the kid with us for dinner and they do have high chairs (which is a huge plus). Tried the pizza which was decent and there is a nice selection of beers.

So delicious. Love the hipster farm to table atmosphere. It's the perfect brunch spot. The food is delicious and creative. I got the citrus salad and the buttermilk biscuit which were really interesting. The espresso was so good. I'm not normally a coffee drinker but I actually savored each sip. Expensive but perfect for that special Sunday outing;)
Great experience with friends. The snacks were a great appetizer and the drinks were great. A bit expensive, but nonetheless the entrees were amazing. Great experience.
No comment

I have been here several times and left impressed every time. This time however was a miss for me. I ordered the Grilled Carolina shrimp salad w/ fingerling potatoes, capers, olives and dijon vinaigrette. First of all shrimp and potatoes are just not a good match. I should have known and I guess the chef should have known. But the crime was the shrimps themselves. Having that unmistakable acetoney flavor that seafood take on when past its prime. The salad was overdressed and the greens severely melted. The dressing was too salty, add the capers and the olives - to the point of inedible. I had really high hopes this place was capable of making an outstanding salad. My mainstay. It's so easy guys. You just need fresh ingredients, minimal experience, then toss. My husband ordered the crispy fish sandwich which was superb. The wine was great as usual and the former governor of New Mexico, Bill Richardson was dining on the next table over, which naturally led to reminiscing about those happy days. Lunch is very busy here and it seemed the staff was a bit overwhelmed. It was hard to get their attention. Don't you want to sell more wine? Or was it Bill?

A quaint little place right next to the High Line and in a block's proximity to both Chelsea Piers and Chelsea Market.  Their outdoor seating is fun if the weather is nice; lots of owners bring out their furry friend dogs to their meals.  Went for brunch with my friend and we weren't disappointed
No comment

The menu had so many great options it was hard to choose, I cannot wait to go back. Everything we ordered had amazing flavor and was such a unique recipe. Our waiter was great too, he came by and chatted several times and made some great recommendations for both food and wine.
No comment
No comment

One of the best brunch places I have been to in New York. Good ambience and great outdoor seating by the highline, perfect for a date spot. As a heads up, we got there at 3:15PM and it was still a 20 minute wait for indoor seating, 30 minutes for outside. You have to get the huevos rancheros, it is much more appetizing than the pictures suggest here. Their menu is dated so the drink and food menu is always changing. They also have great bartenders if you sit at the bar that are happy to educate you on the different drinks they have and even make you some of their off-the-menu favorites.
No comment
No comment

I visited this restaurant for brunch for the second time, this past weekend and was equally as impressed both visits. What I love about this place is that the ambience is very inviting, and the food selection for brunch is just as impressive. Last time I came, I ordered the Huevos Rancheros and thought it was delicious and very filling. This time, I went for a sweet choice and got the Cornmeal Pancakes with lemon and Pomegranate seeds, and enjoyed every bite. I also find that the prices are pretty reasonable for the portion of the meals and for the overall exceptional experience! If you come for brunch on the weekend, I recommend getting there right when it opens, so that you will get a table right away. When we left around 11:30 am, there was a long line waiting for a table. This has become one of my favorite brunch places in the city; I will definitely be making another visit very soon!

Cute spot for brunch! Pretty big space, but there was still a wait. I ordered the fritata and it was delicious. It was crisp on the outside and softer on the inside. They didn't skimp on the veggies. Service was great. Would definitely be back.

Ehhh. It's all hype. Sorry to break it to my fellow yelpers. I live a block away and would always pass by when I would come home looking for parking. I decided to take my best friend here for a birthday breakfast. Not a fan of the potatoes. There was an odd seasoning going on. The only thing I enjoyed was the iced coffee that's why I'm giving 2 stars. Other than that I could have gone to Chelsea Square for a way better breakfast. I wanted to love this place but how does one mess up breakfast? It's the easiest. The ambience is nice but when your food isn't tasty...what's the point :( NEXT!

Very happening spot, perfect for any meal! Menu is constantly being updated with seasonal twists. Would highly recommend starting with the burrata, perfect portion to share between two or have all to yourself! Besides their delicious food and great atmosphere Cookshop has an incredible beverage selection and the sommelier is extremely informed on their wines. Stop in for a bite or a drink then enjoy a walk along the Highline or through Chelsea Market. You won't be sorry!

One of best brunch spots in city. Just steps off the high line park. Very popular on weekend brunch, but they also have lots of outdoor seats, quite nice for summer. Waitress are always patient and nice to introduce the menu. Food come quite fast, looks good , and also tasteful

Why in the world is this place so popular?? It's mediocre at best and that's being generous! Although the staff tried best to be very nice, I must say, however the busser splashed sauces all over my friend while cleaning up another table, he was being careless and that was just as we sat down. Your busers need to be more careful! I used to work as a busser when I was young and can't imagine splashing someone's leftovers on another customer.... now for the rest: we ordered the pork and cod for dinner. The pork was certainly lacking flavor and nothing to write home about. The cod was just the same, though flavorful with sauce, however it wasn't anything so scrumptious that I was head over heels. Then we ordered the zepoles, as we were told by the waiter (super handsome and the only highlight was this eye candy) .. oh right the zeps- MEH, I've had better for 1 buck in name-any-Queens-pizzareria here.... why did I pay so much for this meal!? Drank the hot toddy with some ridiculous name, guys, it's not that serious..sigh, two stars. Wish it weren't so, I was hoping for better.

The Cookshop is a great place to get brunch! Breakfast can be a bit pricey, but the quality and service is so worth it! Everything are fresh and cook to order. This is one of my go-to spot whenever I am in New York! And it's only a few blocks away from Chelsea Market.
No comment

We had wonderful brunch at Cookshop in Chelsea!  The Bloody Mary was okay, but not a highlight.  We started with the Beignets, which were very good.  Not your Cafe du Monde style, but more of a hushpuppy.  Great texture and the grape sauce was a nice addition.  The "Cookshop Eggs" were fantastic.  Perfectly cooked sunny-side-up eggs with a tomato relish.  My wife had the Huevos Rancheros, was probably the best I have had.  Service was spot on.  We arrived at 10:30 on Sunday and was seated within 20 minutes.  Table service was also solid.
3 1/2 stars. Good wine after 4 tastings. Very chewy Wagyu beef. For $75 I expected much more. Very good onion rings. Good service.
No comment

This is consistently the best food in New York. They never balk at special requests or replacing one food for another or allergies or gluten-free none of this is a problem for them. Are you even once asked if they had sangria and it's not on the menu but the bartender said I can make it for you not a problem. I have been with many friends and nobody has ever complained about any of the food it is always delicious.
Long wait on weekends. Nice presentation and food tastes decent but really overpriced. Frittata was $17 and was it particularly special. Breakfast bowl also not worth it. Disappointed.

Far and away the best huevos rancheros in NYC. Great brunch spot; solid dinner too. Highly recommended.

This was a lovely brunch experience. The place was nicely decorated and bright. We did have to wait a bit (30 minutes ish) for a table but a drink at the bar made the time go quickly. We ordered the goat cheese scone and the beignets. Both were good but not amazing and beignets would probably have been better as a dessert rather than an app. For the main course, we got the huevos rancheros. It was a generous portion and very flavorful and delicious. My friend ordered the grits and enjoyed those as well.

Excellent service from the greeters to the server & management. Phenomenal ever changing menu. Came here over the Christmas holiday with the family and it was perfection. Definitely make a reservation! And get the lentil/kale salad. Yummmm.

I came here for Sunday brunch based on a Yelp search and the Yelpers had it right. The food, the service and the ambiance were all top quality. As a solo diner I had plenty of opportunity to watch the pace and flow, and to notice many of the dishes being served. This restaurant is noteworthy on all counts. You can't go wrong.
Burger is sooo good!! Small menu, love ambiance and music selection! They charged fur club soda refill, over priced
My friend recommended we eat there after visiting the Beltway. The servers were friendly and helpful. The food was amazing. Definitely a place to add to the list.

Well worth the wait. Came here for brunch and had the most amazing lemon ricotta pancakes. Very unique, more eggy then bready which I liked. I also tried the Huevos Rancheros which was tasty and filling. For drinks, I tried the Popeye Mary vodka which consisted of cold press spinach, fresh ginger, tumeric, and pepper and just tasted like a really nasty health juice. The tumeric definitely did not make for a good combo.

Good food and great service! They often have a line but it moves pretty fast. Plenty of waiting space. The place is really hustling and bustling, nice ambience. Huveros rancheros highly recommended!

I was hungry. I ordered fish. The fish was good. Can't remember what wife ordered. She liked her food too. Wife picked restaurant. She made a good choice. Husband happy. Service was very good. Can't remember name of waitress. Saw Oliver Platt. Oliver Platt sat at table next to us. He liked food too.

We've been to Cookshop several times for lunch and dinner and its always good.   In fact my only complaint would be that its super-popular so often tough to get a reservation.  Great menu with plenty of variety and a reasonably priced wine list as well.  Lots of outdoor seating and its light and bright inside as well.  A great venue for a casual lunch or dinner.

They try to rush you from the moment you sit down, even though their service is slow.  My dish came out 10 minutes after my friend's even though I ordered before she did.  They never gave us pepper for the salad, anything for the eggs, or anything for the plain biscuit.  10 minutes after my food came out they were trying to clear our table, even though I had 75% of my food left.  They had 3 different people ask me twice each if they could take my plates.  We compromised on boxing up the rest of mine, but when I got home I realized there was only half of a biscuit with a bite taken out of it in the box.  From what I was able to eat I can say the food was good, but the service was just terrible.  I get it, brunch is busy and you want to turn tables fast to make more money, but come on, don't treat people like trash.  It's a bummer because we live next door and were hoping to make it a regular spot.

Very nasty service. This place was hyped up to me for a wile so I decided to get be it a try.We arrived at 4:05, were we were informed that they stop lunch at 4 and dinner isn't until 5. They said we can sit at a table to get drinks, very rude like hello I came here for food. So my question is why in 2017 does it not say this anywhere on their website or menus it's very rude to trick people to coming then trying force drinks on them with no food. Nasty thing to!

I kinda stumbled upon this restaurant and I wasn't sure what to expect- WOW- it was amazing!!! First of all it's simple and beautiful inside- airy with tons of beautiful flowers. The menu is so creative with options like small plates, butchers list , appetizers and main dishes.  I had oysters, fresh and awesome! Then had grilled octopus with an amazing warm potato salad. The burrata was the best I've ever had and the morels with cheese grits were to die for! For dessert I had the carrot cake sundae- I have no words- it was incredible.  The drinks were great and my server Nate was soooo nice and funny!! What a great place- I definitely recommend it!

This review is only for their disappointing service. Even if the restaurant is half empty, even if you're starving and only one person is missing in your party, the hostess wouldn't seat you unless you are friends with her. While hungry me waited for about ten minutes for my lunch buddy to arrive, I saw at least two people get their tables where half of their party was already seated. Also saw her give table to at least two other parties where only half the people were present. Finally we chose to eat somewhere else.

I went to cookshop and had an incredible time. My servers name was Carly. She knew so much about the menu, and encouraged me to try so many different things I wouldn't have initially looked at. The food was absolutely delicious! Will definitely be coming back!

Such a nice place! I found it on yelp and I'm so happy I did. Their menu changes often through out the day so make note of that. Every dish that came out was amazing and so were their cocktails. Most importantly, service was impeccable. I'd definitely recommend this place.

Fun spot! Buzzing at dinner time. Too loud for a serious conversation but perfect for casual dining.  Creative blends of food like pork croquets, scallop ceviche or the Chimichurri potato crisps.  For us, the Pizza was a better value at $19 than the pork chop at $29.  All the food tastes farm fresh. Solid service but may have to flag em down when it's busy. Sparkling water carafe is free (seems strange saying it but was nice). Brunch wins over Dinner.

The restaurant is so beautiful and cozy, but what brought this experience to the next level was our INCREDIBLE waiter, Kingston. So well versed in the menu and wines. He was throughly thoughtful and kind. Amazing restaurant with one of a kind ambience

Good atmosphere and food. Took awhile for the food to come out, but it was Saturday and busy. Good brunch options. The music is a bit loud so it's hard to have a conversation. Located right at the bottom of the High Line, so good place to stop in the area.

It's a nice brunch spot if you live close by definitely it's not a place where worth a visit if you live further. Accept reservation for 2. But won't return again given there are too many better brunch places.

this restaurant is an all around catch! The atmosphere, the food, cocktails, and service are all around aces. Our table of 6 had a mixture of brunch, lunch, specialty cocktails, and dessert. everyone was so pleased & happy. our server emma was perfection, very knowledgeable with great customized suggestions. the manager Joshua made us feel very comfortable & loved. there is a reason this place is always so busy... it's the best!
Location is great, ambience is nice, service is good. Food presentation is impressive. Food is decent. Definitely a worthwhile experience if you will be in the area.
Excellent spot for some good American fare. Interesting items on the menu which gets changed from time to timer. Great place for an evening with friends out on the town!

Yummy food, good service. The fried brussel sprouts are great.
Great food, but the prices were high in comparison to what we got. We ordered the beef brisket and it was excellent.

(2 1/2 stars) Went here for Sunday brunch with friends last weekend. The decor was nice, especially for Autumn, service was ok. Food was ok, my friends ordered the "baked french toasts", they said they wished there was more on their plates than just "3 slices of toast" for $14. My "huevos rancheros" was "eh" ..is that usually served with BOILED eggs?? l've never gotten boiled eggs with that dish & l've ordered huevos rancheros before at other places, they're usually scrambled or sunny side up. The appetizers.. We weren't crazy about the "almond toasts" but we enjoyed the "beignets", those were tasty. My friends actually commented that we should have just ordered those. I agree.

Just came here for lunch for the first time. Had a WONDERFUL experience!!! The food is sooo fresh and tasty and mostly everything on the menu is healthy (there are other options too though that are on the less healthy side but regardless sound yummy). I will definitely be coming back here for the food. Our waitress was very kind and helpful. Love love love! Highly recommend the burrata, the wagyu beef carpaccio, and the chocolate cake! Oh and the strawberry iced tea was so good.

Went here for brunch with a friend visiting from out of town - there was a long wait for 1pm!  I ordered the Blood Orange Brunch cocktail ($13) and it was waaay too alcoholic! Especially to start my day off after a night of drinking haha ... my friend ordered the Brooklyn Russian ($13) and that was more of what I should have ordered - an alcoholic coffee drink.  Anyways, I ordered the Friend Egg Sandwich ($13) and that was so good!  The potato hash was spicy - it had some spicy oil all over but it was delicious.  The sandwich itself was a bit oily, maybe from the fried egg topped over an Italian sausage patty, but it was great hangover food.  My friend ordered the Huevos Rancheros, and it looked really good, but all it really was was beans with three baked eggs on top for $17 - a little too expensive for what it was.  A good brunch spot to try, but I'm sure there are a bunch of others in the area that won't have you waiting forever.
I would sell my soul to Satan for a vat of these grits. A+ nicest servers ever. This food is so good and a relatively cheap brunch deal. Cheap in price not in quality.

Not a huge brunch person but this has been on my list for a while (when friends come into town, brunching is a must). There were a few things I was looking at but decided on the baked eggs, my friend had the egg sandwich. Wishing I was there for the egg breakfast pizza! We sat outside, people watched, there was a wait (about 20 min) but its saturday brunch in ny... Orange juice and coffee... $10 total, so just be aware of ny pricing there. Manager/owner was walking around, chatting with us (nice touch). My eggs were perfect, so was the pancetta, and the raisin toast (great hangover cure). My friend wasnt feeling so hot so I dug into her siracha sweet potatoes as the side for her egg sandwich.. Very good and unique. $13 for my eggs, felt that was fair. Good service, a spot you could take the bf, or his parents, or your parents, or your bff.

Cookshop is a chic restaurant in Chelsea that always has a line. If you are thinking of coming here, you should definitely reserve a table. I came here on a Tuesday night and it was packed! The hostess and servers were kind and knowledgable about the menu. The food was also delicious. I recommend ordering the beef tar tar. It was my first time having it and it was amazing. Don't forget to squeeze lime into it. I ordered the chicken with potatoes. The chicken was noisy and not over cooked. Though it may have been a slight too salty for my taste, it was still delicious. Pro tip: Ask to be seated closer to the kitchen if you're cold or further away if you tend to get hot. They have a pizza oven and it gets quite warm if you're seated by it.

Without of doubt the best Huevos Rancheros I have ever had!!  The Bloody Mary was top notch too.  Service was great.  I will definitely recommend to friends and return the next time I find myself in New York.

Had brunch with couple of my friends at Cookshop. The food and location of this place is definitely worth mentioning.  This is located at the Meatpacking District where most of the hipsters hangout.  Their food is fresh and uses local grown produce. Plus the restaurant has a cool modern vibe to it.
Food was delicious and service was exceptional! The cinnamon bun and crumb cake were amazing!

Food is forgettable.  The host will seat you early but server does not give you your change back.

Try to enjoy the strawberry chicken salad with walnuts but the chicken was over cooked and spinach began to welt... not a happy camper but the champagne was the best part for sunday brunch.....

Came here for brunch with a friend. The apple cinnamon pastry was great and coffee was okay nothing special. The service is incredible. It's a bit pricey for what you are getting in my opinion but a nice little spot in Chelsea to meet up with a friend.

I doubt the cold, overcooked egg atop my grain bowl was fresh the farm, but if it was then what a shame about the preparation.  Our group of 4 was generally unimpressed with the food, especially against the backdrop of mediocre service, a substantial wait, serious pricing and small portions.  Don't believe the hype.

Came here with my mother for her birthday. Great dessert!! Best pasta I've ever had hands down. Waiters were very respectful and on top of things. Service was delightful. I'm definitely coming back here again.

I've always loved cookshop. No matter when we go, no matter what time of day or day of the week, we are greeted with a warm smile, great service and fab food. They're nice to little children and the servers always go out of their way to make sure you're happy with your meal without being overbearing. My favorite breakfast is the porridge with rhubarb and almond milk, my favorite dinner, their BURGER of course :)

came in at the exact opening hour and got the seat at the bar - bartender guy was awesome, our drinks are good, i got turkey for entree and scallop for appetizer, food was beyond good, i and my tummy left satisfied!!
The steak was good but other dishes were ok. Not sure why the hype. Service was great.
Food is decent. But the whole restaurant smelled like the kitchen sink. It was pretty unpleasant
My son took my friend and I for Mother's Day. They loved it, but I thought it was just ok foodwise. Location and atmosphere are lovely.
Food is good but pricey due to the location. The portion is on the small side. The healthful eating is all the rage now too bad my friend is not a big fan. He was still hungry afterward.

We were dropped off here for a late lunch at the recommendation from our cab driver. I'm so glad we took her advice. It was an great spot. So many wins!... the wait staff was excellent, the food was great and well presented, and it was just the right atmosphere to enjoy a Sunday afternoon. Latte was perfect after my meal. Everything came out fairly quick even though it appeared that all tables were occupied.

Delicious brunch spot with a cozy ambience.  Ordered the quevos rancheros with a side of their turkey sausage. Both were satisfying to the palate. If you're contemplating on which side you should get, I would recommend the wild hive grits.
No comment

For a Sunday night at 8pm, this place was hopping with no empty tables that we noticed.  We were in NYC from Toronto where we are spoiled with an amazing inventory of restaurants.  Cook Shop did not disappoint these two self-appointed foodies. Cocktails were well made and yummy, Wagyu Beef was perfectly done.. good wine pairing from our delightful and super attentive waitress.  Staff worked together like a well oiled machine with people slipping in and out of our table with food, refilling glasses, clearing plates, etc, allowing our server to focus on just that... serving.  In NYC you can get amazing food everywhere but what truly stands out is a well managed service environment and friendly staff who don't look like they would rather be elsewhere.  Cook Shop succeeds here.

I've been here twice - once for dinner and once for brunch. Had great experiences both times! This is definitely a must try. It's a little pricey but absolutely worth it. Bloody Mary's are very tasty. The food at brunch was absolutely amazing! French toast, fried egg sandwich and the spinach omelette are definitely recommended! I absolutely loved the omelette - not your typical omelette...just so delicious! Reservations are recommended as they are quite busy!

We're regulars  here (at least twice a week). Its a great place. Every night feels like Saturday night. Great music. Cool, eclectic crowd - hasn't yet been taken over by the wanna-be's in the meatpacking district. We like to sit at the bar. I pretty much always have the chicken - sounds boring until you have it.. locally sourced, juicy, and beautifully crooked. Occasionally a bit too much salt. Everything else on the menu  is also good here. The staff always take care of us - they know we're regulars and treat us well - even the slightest issue is taken care of immediately. Wish I could find more places like this!!

Had a couple of drinks here at the bar.  This is a nice spot with good cocktails.  They are a bit pricy - $45 for two drinks.  The Deviled eggs and radiates are ok.  The burrata was tasty.  Might try it for dinner next time.

No comment

Terrific find in the heart of Chelsea; Kyle B. was very knowledgeable, friendly, polite and entertaining all at the same time. Delicious bloody Mary menu and food selection. We really had a great time; thank you Kyle B.

We had an early dinner reservation for a party of 6, after a gorgeous afternoon architectural boat tour, and our glorious day just continued with the great food and service at Cookshop!  We were seated at a booth by the windows with a great view of the outdoors and ordered appetizers to share. Our waitress Nikki was amazing at describing the various dishes, but also readily volunteered her favorites to guide our decisions. We asked for the fried okra and cauliflower fritters, and she suggested the peppers. All 3 were excellent!  For entrees we had the spit roasted chicken (2), sea scallops (2), mixed grill and pork chop.  Everything was delicious. The berries served with the pork chop and the marinated vegetables with the chicken made each of those entrees so special. The sea scallops were devoured so quickly that I can't share any details!  The desserts were great too. Nikki was attentive and efficient throughout!  We hope to go back for brunch!

The BLT Bloody Mary is really amazing, this place is always full, so arrive early at the weekends if you don't wanna wait in line. Around 10:30 am. The cappuccino is also really good, not so easy to find in typical american restaurants. I love the service too.

Food is amazing! But not as good as that e staff! Always knowledgeable, welcoming and friendly. Can't not pop in when I'm in Chelsea. Schifty five stars

Aside from having an excellent dinner I really wanted to say something about the service.  I need to say ahead of time I have never met our server Kinston before and have no connection to him but he made us feel some comfortable and at home, it was really the highlight of the meal. He was knowledgeable, sincere and engaging, but not intrusive. A great experience all around.

I didn't know there were so many different ways to cook eggs with just the right amount of spice! Food was amazing, worth the wait. Walked to Chelsea Market while waiting for our table. Would love to try other things on their menu!

Wonderful food. Bistro-like atmosphere, can be noisy when it's busy. Service has always been attentive but occasionally slow (not in a bad way! -- just clearly busy).

I went for brunch and loved it. Excellent variety of Bloody Mary's. I recommend the bacon one. Huervos rancheros was excellent. Biscuit and grits were also tasty! Beware there could be an hr wait if you don't have a reservation.
No comment

The waiter was nice, it was crowded but food came fast. Everyone else seemed to love their food and it all tasted good, but the brunch bowl I got tasted like plastic. I'd order something else next time but I'll probably come back
No comment

Came here for huevos rancheros but missed their brunch serving time because we got on the wrong train. So instead of brunch, we had beef sandwich, chicken breast salad and an interesting deviled egg sampler. The food was good but didn't wow me. Mocktails were refreshing. It is definitely a great lunch spot to chichat with your friends or coworkers in my opinion. Despite of not getting my brunch craving fixed, I had a great dining experience here.

Lovely environment, welcoming staff. Drinks are creative and fresh. Amazing cauliflower soup. Must try. Killer fries and breakfast. This place is super hip and there will for sure be a wait on weekends.
Veggie lasagna was delicious! Friend had chicken and loved it (and he is fancy ).  Top notch service.  Overall great experience! Atmosphere is also great!

Absolutely delicious lunch! I had "the bowl" and we split the appetizer, Burratto(sp?) which was delicious. Nice ambience, lovely waiter, good atmosphere, perfect spot for lunch. Great place to meet up with old friends!
Good spot, good eats. Drinks were lackluster and it all seemed overpriced. Good bar scene, maybe a little touristy?
Their watermelon cocktail is , as is their service. Interior and food color schemes are on point
No comment
No comment
Expensive and a bit posh but the food is delicious e the waiters are very handsome and friendly, try the kale salad or the fish tacos, yuminess!!

Super long wait always but a big bar in case you see a seat and can sneak right in. I've come here for brunch. Amazing cocktails and fresh ingredients in their food. I recommend the frittata, filled with squash, kale and garlic topped with goat cheese and small salad. So good! I would definitely come back!
Deviled eggs. Who knew they could be such a star.  Excellent service and food all around.
No comment

Amazing food, great environment and extremely kind and helpful staff. Also great vegan and veggie options. I called the manager David the next day I went in because I wanted to buy a bottle of the wine I had, and he went above and beyond to send me a picture of the bottle and where I could try to find it. Will definitely be back!!
No comment

Oh, I just love this place. Found this gem on Yelp and after reading several reviews. Why no one told me about Cookshop??? I really liked the food, beer and experience here. The best Grill food you could find, ever. We love his vibe and appreciate that he has gotten to know us over the years. Everything was so delicious. I do agree that the service is good here, the staff is very personable. Laid back, delicious food, friendly service, my perfect type of place. Would definitely revisit this place for brunch again.

Found this place walking around on highline. Got there about 930 just before the brunch crowd filled the place up. Creative breakfast choices, great Bloody Mary's, and amazing beignets. Our server Stephanie could not have been nicer. Will definitely go back.

Hmmm expected this place to be one of the best brunch spots in nyc.... it did not live up to my expectations. We got there around noon and got seated fairly quick for 4 people. When we left around 2pm it was jam packed with people waiting to be seated. Us girls shared the Brioche French Toast which was different.. a little heavy and reminds me of bread pudding. The Huevos Rancheros was nothing that special either, also had the deviled eggs. In my opinion there are better brunch spots but at least this place takes reservations.
No comment
No comment

I have been to the cook shop about 3 times. It is a great brunch/ lunch place but it does get a little pricey and the portions are okay. But nonetheless it is an amazing place to eat at. They have a decent selection of foods. There is a wait on the weekends for sure so expect to wait!
Great fresh food!! We loved the fish tacos, falafel and spinach was simple but good!!

It has a decent bar and people in general are friendly. We had to wait for about 30 minutes which is fine because you can actually get a drink in the bar and then wait outside for them which is kind of nice. My date and I we're taking it easy on a Sunday morning drinking mimosas, just enjoying the nice weather outside while we were already seated at the table. Then the waiter started getting weird and pushy about wanting us to order. After the second time he asked if we were ready to order and we told him that we were just taking it easy, he called the manager and the manager asked us if we could order because they were full capacity (!!!). So, food is ok, bar is ok, but they clearly don't give a damn about treating their customers appropriately. Will never go back.
No comment
No comment
Food is delicious but very crowded inside. It was so loud I couldn't hear the person across me
No comment
No comment

Lives up to the hype! Had a bit of a wait even with a reservation but there's a nice little outdoor coffee spot you can wait at with your party. The breakfast bowl was SO GOOD! And tasted pretty healthy (if that makes sense). My boyfriend had the egg sandwich and said it was just okay but I think it's best to order something less traditional at a "trendy" place like this. The huevos rancheros also looked amazing! Definitely would love to try it next time.

Amazing menu, amazing food. Everything I've had here is delicious. Some of the friendliest wait staff in NYC, highly accommodating and always kind. Whenever I'm in the area and looking for a good meal, this is the first place I think of. Try to make a reservation because it's very popular and wait times are longer without one. If you want brunch, arrive right when they open and they usually seat you right away. Highly recommend to anyone.

It's good so don't let my stars fool you. 3+ for food and 4+ for atmosphere. It's a bustling , fun and casual place with all the glory of a killer NY restaurant. Food is decent, I got the flank steak and the quality was low. Buddy got mix grill and was happy. Waitress was not as fun as the restaurant around her, need improvement  on energy. It's a winner and I would come back, eat outside if it's nice as well. They stuck us in a dark corner which bummed  me out on a 75 degree night with a reservation I came to early. Doughnuts were 5 star for desert! Overall 3.5 for me.
Excellent brunch. French toast and brunch bowl were delicious. Location next to the highline is perfect. Great Farmers cocktails. Will definitely be back to try more of the menu!!
I have only been to Cookshop once for Brunch and the infamous Bloody Mary!  Both were delicious! A popular brunch spot in this area.
Killer spot!!! Great flavors and superb plating.  Well worth the $$$.  Busy, upbeat and well designed, you'll enjoy the meal and the great service.  Go eat and enjoy, you'll be so happy you did.

The concierge recommended this place which was just a few blocks from our hotel. It was delicious!!! We got there around 10 on a Saturday right before the crowd - score! We shared the cinnamon bun which was yummy. I got the broccli scramble with a biscuit which was delicious. My dining partner got the 2 eggs breakfast which she liked a lot. This place was a bit trendy and not exactly cheap but good food and the service was great. Recommend it.
Excellent service. I had the eggs and potato hash - an awesome breakfast. Extremely friendly staff, light and airy decor. The only issue was a high noise level.

Oh my, so many selections.  Went here for brunch last Saturday and it was so yummy.  I had the poached eggs on grilled asparagus with hollandaise and everything was on point.  we also had the dutch baby, which could have been bigger, but the fruit on top was the star!  My daughter had the breakfast sandwich on brioche which was a great portion and spicy!  Coffee was delicious, had a wonderful capp!  Service was great, and sitting outside made it all the more perfect!
No comment
I love Love Love this place, great food, great service and I go all the time!!!  Great place for a nice quiet dinner!
No comment
Love this place!!!! Very healthy options for food, great salads! One of my favorites is chicken liver pate. They also have outside sitting! Highly recommended:)
Extremely good food. Brunch was delicious. The service was somewhat slow because it was very busy on a Sunday morning. The outside seating is nice-shaded with umbrellas. Highly recommend.

The Cookshop is good for brunch. Has the traditional brunch menu items. The service is great and their outdoor seating is dog friendly. The food is not outstanding in any way, though. The huevos rancheros is very rich and heavy. The egg sandwich was mediocre and lacked flavour.

Love, love, love Cookshop! Easily my favorite in Chelsea, consistently excellent food and great service. Best to make a reservation in advance though because it's super busy especially at popular times

Nice romantic restaurant. I loved the mixed grill and their vanilla cheesecake along with pisacho ice cream. Food was absolutely delicious. They had a wine sommiler who was warm and approachable. I appreciated the free wine tasting before getting the glass of wine. I would come here again!

I'm sorry to see this long time standard degrade so rapidly. On our last visit we found it to be too noisy with too many staff members standing around chatting with each other and paying no attention to customers. The food was poorly prepared and presented but one seemed to care if the customer are enjoins the meal or happy with the service. Real shame.
No comment

Seasonal menu with delicious dishes. Amazing service by David who took us on a culinary journey versus being just an uninterested order taker. Loved the burrata to start, excellent steak dish and indulged in doughnuts for dessert. Curated wine list by a Sonoma based somm with his own label, which was excellent in red & white varietals. Will recommend to all friends living in or visiting NY.
No comment
No comment
Very nice place. Seated immediately and wait staff was really friendly. Hamburger was great and so was Bloody Mary was strong and perfectly spicy. Would recommend.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Incredible food, great service, and good prices. Definitely my new favorite brunch spot, can't wait to go back.
No comment

Atypical American brunch place that definitely stands out for good reason. If you want to challenge your taste buds, I recommend their Dutch pie. I really enjoyed their scotch eggs and the blueberry pancakes. Beignets are overrated in my opinion.

You pay for the ambiance and house made cocktails when you visit the Cookshop. The drinks are unique and delicious and the ambience is so beautiful. When I was there I felt like I was in a sophiscated version of a rainforest restaurant. Lots of green! The wait was almost an hour long and we were starving so we decided to park it at the bar. The bartenders were friendly and super patient so I enjoyed their company. What I wasn't a huge fan of was the food. It was okay. We started with the french toast which was very soggy on the bottom and I ordered the lobster roll as my main course. The only thing that was good about that dish was the chips.. Oh.. They were fantastic. The lobster tasted like eggs and the bartender said that it was maybe the bread and I picked up just a piece of the lobster on its own and I still tasted egg. I later ordered a chicken cesear salad which the kitchen graciously made for me because it wasn't on the brunch menu. The chicken was so tender and juicy and just LIFE! I love it!! All in all the staff was friendly, drinks were awesome and the salad was great but I wasn't a fan of the other food I ordered. I would love to see if my mind would change if I dined for dinner.
Incredibly busy so am glad I booked - food was great, had the pancakes which were delicious.
Now we had our lunch and it was superb! Nice waiter, Quick and I had The trout and it was very good! Then The fact we sit outdoor at 3:30pm does Of course play a little part...Highly recommended!
The price to value here is very good. absolutely delicious! Every dish we had was so fresh and bursting with flavor. It is not often that every bite your group takes ends in a moan!
Great food--get the lamb burger. Owner and staff are super friendly. Some creative spins on American dining with interesting and unexpected flavors.
No comment
No comment

My husband and I went to Cookshop 2 Saturdays ago. We were super excited to enjoy our last brunch out on a patio.  The place was super packed around 2pm, but we were seated outside immediately.  The food was okay, but the service was not so great.  A table was seated 5 mins after us and they were approached by our waiter before us.  In fact, we had to have one of the bussers track down our waiter so we could put in an order.  15 mins after we were seated, we were given water...drinks took another 10-15 mins, but food came out fast.  Perhaps the service would have been better inside..who knows. I would not go here again.

In general a positive experience. They made a mistake with my order with one of the ingredients (mixing up romaine with escarole in the caesar salad) and I had to ask the waiter multiple times before he said the chef realized there was indeed a mix up. To remedy this they gave us a second salad with the correct ingredients on the house so appreciated this. All their dishes seem quite tasty and it's a laid back - yet felt "trendy" and well groomed- environment.  Especially since there seem to be few eateries in this area, I would go back when checking out Chelsea.
Great food, great location and great service!  Cheryl was our server and she was friendly and helpful and just a ray of sunshine!

Exactly what brunch in the city should be. Delicious variety of food, real customer service, and fun atmosphere. All the raving over the signature items is correct.  Have the chocolate beignets to share, huevos rancheros, and a mojito or bloody mary. The breakfast sandwich and other options were fabulous!  Looking forward to going back.. plus the high line is nearby to walk it all off!
No comment
No comment
Love to go in the afternoon between meals - the bar is quiet and you can order the deviled eggs and a glass of wine - great for a quick meet up or a cocktail apres/before the High Line.
No comment
No comment
service is absolutely amazing and the food is delicious! Cookshop checks off all of the boxes for the perfect sunday brunch location, vibes and atmosphere
Grossly over rated, mediocre food with very basic uninspiring decor. I would definitely not recommend this restaurant giving there are so many better places around.
No comment

By far our favorite brunch place in the city. Since moving to the suburbs we miss going here on a regular basis. Their menu is seasonal and nothing on it disappoints, ever. Love the creativity. Service is always top notch as well. We always walk the high line afterwards.

Me and my friends came over for the first time last week for some appetizers and drinks, and it was a great experience. You should try the oysters deviled eggs and the apple spiced margarita. The environment is cool and our server, Kolt, was on top of his game giving us a great service. Definitely coming back.

It was crazy crowded so you would think this speaks to how good the food is. The food wasn't bad, it was just OKAY. The biscuits, broccoli cheddar scramble - not bad, just good, not amazing or superb. The Dutch baby pancake undelivered. The drinks cost almost as much as an entree. You don't expect to pay almost $100 (with tip) for brunch for two for just good, not great food.
Very nice brunch place if you live in West Chelsea. I love their bloody mary.
No comment
No comment

My friend and I came here for lunch on Christmas Eve--the service was fine, but the entire restaurant smelled like sweat for some reason. I ordered the bloody mary as recommended, but there was nothing unique about it. The poached eggs were okay, but definitely not filling enough and a little overpriced.

Deviled eggs sampler was fantastic.  My family and I love eating here because all of the food is phenomenal and the service is excellent.  There were a few flies flitting around the last time, which was annoying.

If you have a group of people with diverse tastes in food, this is a good place to go for a meal. I went with a couple of vegetarians, a friend on a diet and me (a hardcore carnivore). The food was very good, I had their Bloody Mary and their burger and they were both amazing. My friends' food looked great too. A little bit pricey for what you get, but I had a nice experience.
My friend and I went there after Soulcycle. Everything we ordered was good. Menu is pretty unique and offers many healthy stuff. Recommend making a reservation!

The Cookshop has a nice laid back setting nice enough for client dinners or just casual dining. The menu isn't complicated and it's diverse enough for any palette. The food and wine were good and the service was on point. My only critique was the lighting in the dining room, it was too dark and difficult for me to cut the fat from the meat on my tasty lamb chops.
Service is friendly and prompt. They are completely amazing. Their lunch menu has a awesome selection of starters, three choices of sandwiches and salads, and a few grill and stove top items.

Large outdoor seating area, great cocktails on the brunch menu (Gentleman Collins was delicious & strong), and attentive servers. I ordered the broccoli & cheddar scramble with biscuits, which was pretty much what you'd expect, but $16 was a little steep for the portion size & quality. The table next to us ordered the gingerbread pancakes and huevos rancheros, which seemed like the better move. We came around 11am on a Saturday morning, and there was no wait at all for a table for 2. We walked by again around 2pm and there was a swarm of people waiting outside, so try to arrive before noon to avoid crazy wait times

This was a great surprise. After walking from the theater district we wanted a breakfast place Yelp showed this as four star. It deserves better. Very clean!  Nice atmosphere and the best pancakes ever.

Very slow service. We had reservations. Others that arrived after us had orders taken and food served before us. Sausage on breakfast sandwich was raw. Egg on baked eggs was completely raw. We were charged for an extra coffee we did not order.

This place was packed for brunch on Sunday even near opening time at 10:30am and our wait time was ~40 minutes. I'd definitely recommend a reservation if possible. We ordered the Huevos Rancheros and Fried Egg Sandwich and split the two between two people. The Huevos Rancheros was good, but I wouldn't want to finish the whole thing by myself. There's a lot of beans, and the flavors aren't too interesting. The fried egg sandwich was almost like a burger but with sausage instead of hamburger meat. My favorite part of the dish was actually the potato hash on the side.

To start with the service was great, best waiter ever, really nice and funny! The food was really nice too. There were 4 of us at a packed Saturday brunch (with a reservation), we were seated as soon as we were all there which honestly was slightly late. Everyone really enjoyed their meals. We had a really fun time!!!

Had vegetarian lasagna for the first time (butternut squash) and it was delicious!!!! I would definitely return and recommend... place is packed but still a dinning room calm atmosphere. Apparently the menu changes daily so I look forward to trying a few new dishes.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Enjoyed the outdoor seating and fish tacos. The oyster appetizer was great! Great service and attentiveness! My friend had the lamb burger and thoroughly enjoyed the quality! Certainly will revisit when going to the highline!
No comment

Cookshop is a beautiful restaurant packed with beautiful people. If only the food had delivered. My salad had too much dressing and was oily while my fish was under seasoned and the potatoes that came with it were practically raw. The bread of the house was dense and not especially delicious, it was also served cold. The sauce that came with my fish wasn't particularly savory and it was watery. So strange to have such disjointed food in a venue that screams success and is so packed. I was really disappointed because I don't think the farm to table concept really works here and at these prices, I am in no rush to return.
No comment
Very nice brunch place! Really good food I got the huevos rancheros! It was amazingggg so good I will come here Kaur for that! Really cute restaurant! :)

Brunch was awesome. Service was amazing and that's hard to say in NYC. Audrey was our waitress and really went above and beyond. From start to finish, drinks and food were delicious and I will definitely be back!

The perfect brunch spot while strolling the Beltline!  Possibly the best biscuit & jam we've ever had....and we're from the South where biscuits are serious business!  Our server Jordan was stellar as well.
No comment

I've eaten here many times and will certainly be back. The restaurant has its pros and cons. The food is consistently good with extra points for the entrees. But the service is consistently mediocre. The space is a bit crowded and tends to be pretty warm especially as you get closer to the large pizza oven.

We were seated very quickly. Service was fantastic. Had French Toast - the grapefruit pieces were perfect with the dish. And fresh OJ :-) also had Huevos Rancheros very nicely done. - first time having with beans all mixed in. Had two Bloody Mary's. The BLT & Mescal. Both were delicious.

Great little Brunch spot. Service was great and food was good quality. We had a pot of English Breakfast tea and my husband had coffee (refilled constantly). We ordered the jaleopeno loaf bread to start with. This was delicious and warm with a slight sweet taste. We then ordered scrambled egg on English muffin. Very tasty and big portion with salad. To finish (just because we can't leave without pancakes) we ordered blueberry pancakes. Get your butts to this brunch spot!
Consistently delicious food and friendly, professional service. Lunch and dinner are equally good. Great people watching.  I've been a fan since they opened.
No comment
Probably one of the best brunches I've had in my life. We had the pancakes, both with pear (small) and the apple, mascarpone - amazing!
Omg I just had one of the best breakfasts ever at this place! The fried egg sandwich was incredible, the service was quick and attentive and the wait wasn't long. Highly recommend!!

I live close by. The brunches look popping but I've only been for dinner and for a drink. The food is pretty good. The menu isn't too large of a selection but apparently it's the place to be because it's always pretty crowded! The service is good. Overall a good experience.
No comment
No comment

Came in on a weekday, but called ahead to ask if they had brunch (twice). Was told yes and to be fair hey had SOME brunch items but not all. Wish the people who I spoke to over the phone told me that it was only partial brunch as I was really looking forward to their full brunch menu, which is why I called ahead to ask. I had the breakfast bowl, my mom had the frittata, it was all average. Not bad but nothing that great. For me it wasn't worth going out of my way for (from Williamsburg). Maybe other menu items here are good, but I'm a BIG breakfast person and wasn't impressed.

Other WORST service ever. 20 min for coffee. We ordered 3 oj's and received 2. My sister ordered hot sauce for the eggs. By the time they brought it the eggs would have been cold. She ate them without. The bill was wrong. I could go on, but you get the idea.

Went for dinner two nights ago with family in from out of town.  Location easily accommodated everyone but it was a healthy walk from the subway.  We had reservations at 5:45 and were sat promptly despite one person missing from our party.  The bread was great!  My cousin and I had the flight of deviled eggs.  Yummy!  My aunt had the smoked slice duck to start.  I made my meal out of two starters: the pumpkin gnocchi and the octopus.  My cousin had the seafood stew entree and my aunt had the crab cake starter with a side of romanesco potatoes.  My aunt said both her dishes were a little spicier than she would have liked but still good.  Dessert was also great with the apple tart and the carrot cake Sunday.  We also really enjoyed our cocktails.  My aunt's mocktail had a lot of ginger and they happily strained it for her.  Overall, I would definitely return.  Would love to try brunch.

To start off, I decided to check out this place since it's one of the popular brunch places that are dog-friendly. The server was very welcoming not only for me but also my little fellow. The server got my doggie a dog treat which was very thoughtful. My fido enjoyed watching me having brunch and people passing on the street. I would recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a good brunch with their loving family (including their dogs)!

The 5 star rating is not a "best restaurant in the world" rating but Cookshop is a fantastic place to eat. We stopped in while gallery hopping and had a delicious lunch. The Bloody Mary was solid and the two dishes we had - Kale salad with chicken and the roasted pork sandwich (special of the day) - were both tasty. Service was very good and the tables and chairs are comfortable. I would recommend Cookshop to my friends.
No comment

There was not one bad bite or sip during my lovely dinner experience at Cookshop. Exquisitely prepared fish and the loveliest tartare to start. The wine list is extensive.  The space is also quite beautiful with its large windows and wooden tables and chairs. Grab a bite at the bar or sit down for dinner in the main area. You really can't go wrong here.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I agree with the comments that this place is overrated.  What i will say is that the food came out fast given how busy it was.  The hostess and the waitstaff give off a very "fake-happy" vibe.  It was off-putting, especially when I called to confirm my reservation.  Also, my boyfriend caught one of the hostesses for several minutes straight picking her nose - nasty.  The bus boys would also cough on the patrons as they are walking by.  Gross.  The gingerbread pancakes were pedestrian at best.  What they lacked in flavor, they made up for presentation.  The potato hash was decent - it really needed salt and seasoning.  Save your money and skip.  There were better places on the route there. We would not go back.

If I could give this place 100 stars, I would! The food literally gave my goosebumps and when I say literally, I literally mean literally!!! The staff was so friendly and the atmosphere was nice and spacious. They even let us sample a side of grits since we were unsure about how they would taste! Wish I lived in New York to become a regular here, love love this place!
No comment

This restaurant was delicious from the service to the food! For drinks try the Shop Champ, it has champagne with grape juice and lime or their cappuccino if your looking for coffee. To eat we had the Huevos rancheros which had an amazing taste, gingerbread pancakes, and the 3 huevos with bacon. We also ordered a side of potatoes that we weren't crazy about but still good. The service was beyond excellent!

Had brunch here. It was pretty packed but we found a seat at the bar quickly. The mahi mahi tostadas were a bit fishy and the burrata crostini was a little soggy but the breakfast bowl was very delicious! I would come back again for sure :)
No comment
No comment

So I am the BIGGEST fan of huevos rancheros. I get this dish at pretty much every brunch spot I go to, and hands down, this place had the best of this dish that I have EVER tasted. The spicy sauce was excellent and the presentation was beautiful. The empanadas were off the hook delicious as well. Also,our waiter was super patient and really good at his job. Highly recommend this spot for brunch lovers and those who love cute/modern decor. There is a little bit of a wait time and no reservation opportunity so come prepared to wait at least 45 minutes on the weekend!
No comment
No comment

One morning we were heading to the Empire Dining,  but it was not open yet. We asked a man who past us by on the sidewalk, if he could recomend a place to eat. He recomended that we went a little bit further down the street to Cookshop.  A queue met us, and after the visit we understood why. The food and the waiters was amazing. A big THANK YOU to the guy who recomended this restaurant for us.
No comment
Amazing seafood stew! Great server, she gave us vanilla bean cheesecake for a congratulations gift for our trip! Bloody Mary's we're so good, recommend doing tequila instead of vodka

The BEST Bloody Mary's I've ever had.  food was delicious!!   a bit of a long wait but, go walk the high line for a half and build up an appetite.  i will definitely plan on making this place a landmark for me.
I went here for brunch and the food is fantastic. I had the spinach eggs and the bacon. I loved my pickled Bloody Mary. It's a Bloody Mary with actual pickle juice in it. I would definitely go back.
Clean, bustling, timely service. Never felt rushed. Fairly priced. Have to have the whole party to sit down which is not my favorite practice.

Was there for a late breakfast at 11:00am. Place was empty. Coffee was served cold. Twice! Waitress was completely disinterested . Food took forever to get to table and had clearly been left waiting for her to pick up. Will not be returning.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Great restaurant.  It is worth the wait. 30 minute wait at lunchtime on Friday but I came prepared. The food was excellent, fresh, hot. They had a limited selection which is a positive in my opinion. The only thing that really bothered me was how fast the service was. I waited for more than 30 minutes to get a table but then my entire meal was finished including the check being swept away at the end in approximately 30 minutes.  I can appreciate a busy lunch time but I also feel there is a point where you should be able to relax and enjoy your meal when you're paying $44 per person.  This was unappreciated service.

I found Cookshop the first time I visited the High Line in 2010. Now I try to eat here every time I'm in New York. The food is always fresh, the staff friendly, professional and efficient. This visit confirmed my initial infatuation. It was a cold Sunday and the place was very crowded. Even though I was a solo diner I received very attentive service. I had read that their huevos rancheros were not to be missed and am here to say that the laudatory reviews are 100% justified. It's a sophisticated take on a rustic dish that had just the right amount of heat. I've had maybe three memorable Bloody Mary drinks in my life. Their's is one of them.
Fantastic. Service, food, atmosphere and wine recommendations from Richard were wonderful - thank you Ann Marie!

Sunday brunch was awesome on a warm December Sunday. Greeted by a group of smiling welcoming hosts who walked us to our table as soon as we walked in. We were then greeted by our busy waitress who handled her section by attending to all of us without ignoring any of us- big up to Amory for being a great to us. She helped by letting us know winning dishes which appeared to be all of them, but helped us with making decision. Ginger lemonade was freshly made and very good, pulled pork croquettes with a lemon aioli dressing to start as appetizer followed by huevos rancheros and a fried egg sandwich. Food was delicious and recommend this spot if you want to eat food, feel good, and be in a pleasant environment filled with awesome people.

Really disappointed by a return visit here for dinner after many years of having forgotten about it. Maybe I forgot how incredibly slow & utterly careless the service was here before, or maybe they are just resting on their laurels from their heyday when they were new, back in the early days of the Chelsea art scene? It's still fairly popular, evidently, but my friends & I all found the service really lackluster, to the point where our server's really low energy & bad attitude brought us all down . It took 45 minutes just to get a drink. The food arrived in a more timely manner but was just okay, not great. I was delighted to see squash blossoms on the menu, but they were greasy & salty & the fish dishes were somewhat mediocre, both over $30, too, which...in this neighborhood, there are far better options at this price point. So much for a neighborhood pioneer. On to more spirited newcomers!

Met up with some friends here for brunch, but I guess we showed up during a 30 min transitional period where they don't serve breakfast or lunch, so we had to wait? It was weird. Maybe because it was a weekday. The food was good, once we eventually got served!

Great location right next to the highline, so you can take a short walk while you wait for your table. I came on a Sunday for brunch and only had to wait 20 minutes! Several bloody mary's to choose from, and the BLT one I had was very good! Beignets were good and more doughnut-y than ones I've had in the past. I got the scramble and biscuit--it didn't come with hot sauce, but it was perfect as is! Our waitress did give us a house-made habenero hot sauce when I asked for it, which was spicy and amazing! The bf got the french toast, which was baked and kind of had a bread pudding consistency. So delicious.

The food was great but the 3 star review is based on the slow and unpleasant waiter. It took 20 mins to get a cup coffee, the mimosas came quicker! Yes they were busy for Sunday brunch but tables seated after us had their coffee long before our table. The bust boys were friendlier and more helpful then our waiter.

I like the atmosphere of this place. Good coffee. However, I think it's a little expensive for the quality. I ordered the falafel, which was extremely crunchy and dry. I think I could make better falafel at home, even if I took a box of dry falafel mix and baked it at 450° for 3-7 hours. Despite chomping on burnt crumbs I may give Cookshop a second chance.

Got here at 12:30 for our reservation for 2 and the place was beyond packed, but luckily we only had to wait a couple of minutes for our table. The waitress was very nice 4 stars and the raspberry margarita was delectable 5 stars... The food was also very good- burrata was 5 stars, breakfast bowl needed a little salt or hot sauce or something but was still pretty good 4 stars, and the pancakes were average 3 stars. Overall, this place was really good but considering how they never have reservations for brunch available and how they were sooo packed I did expect more. I would definitely return but only under someone else's suggestion... There are other places to try!

Cozy spot with delicious food! Want to go back from Brunch, as we did dinner. The layout of the restaurant was lovely, as I am huge on atmosphere. Started with the Raw Autumn Salad, dinner was the Striped Bass, and finished with amazing donuts with raspberry sauce and graham cracker ice cream. Awesome casual date spot. I will definitely go back! Thanks Cookshop for living up to the hype.

I went here with a buddy a few months ago and the food was decidedly mediocre, which was surprising because the place has fantastic reviews. There are so many other fantastic spots to try that I doubt I'll be back here in the near future, but would be amendable to it if the situation arose.
No comment

Great for breakfast! We had the goat cheese scramble and also their waffles. Definitely would recommend both. The place fills up quickly so try to get there when it opens at time. Worth the wait if you come later!
No comment

Excellent breakfast.  Our group was super excited for the various pumpkin or raspberry pancakes, but they were only offering jalapeño pancakes.  I bit the bullet and ordered it and it did not disappoint.  They were amazing...not spicy and just the perfect amount of savory with sweet.  Everyone was so pleased with the meal and our server was super sweet.  We'll definitely be back!

What a great brunch!  I love the beignets and the huevos rancheros.  What a satisfying well prepared meal.  Great friendly hostess and waitstaff.  I would recommend a reservation if you do not want a long wait.  This place is popular and well worth it.

I came here on Sunday for brunch with my mother. Even though I made a reservation, I had to wait 10 minutes to be seated and ended up getting a great corner booth away from the front, which was crowded. Our waiter was very nice and enjoyed the complimentary sparkling water. I ordered the margarita on the cocktail list, which tasted as great as it looked! I also ordered the Cookshop Breakfast Bowl and would 100% order this again because it was so fresh and all the ingredients worked. My mother and I split the biscuit because it looked so good and we were right! I would definitely recommend this brunch for anyone looking for a trendy spot close to the High Line.

This greenmarket to table oriented restaurant is a gem.  Everything was fantastic!  We ordered the Pulled Pork Empanadas, Wagyu Steak Skewers, Sweet n Sour Duck Wings, Deviled Egg Tasting, and my personal favorite, the Crispy Brussels Sprouts.  The house-made focaccia is fabulous and so was the Cran-Orange Margarita.  The Brussels Sprouts Pizza caught my eye, but after all the small plates, I didn't order a dinner plate myself.  The Roasted Cod and Lamb Burger were hits at the table

Great service, yummy food and fantastic cocktails & ambiance!

Huevos racheros were really good and the peach french toast I had was amazing (very sweet imo but in generally very flavorful and well done). They specialized in bloody marys so this is a great spot for those. Also even if you stop by for brunch and the wait is 30-45 minutes, you can also just hang out at the highline until they call you (txt you that your table is ready).

Gave 5 stars the first time I came here a couple of months ago. So I was looking forward to coming back with a couple of friends. Kind of disappointing this time. The food was OK but kind of average, nothing stood out to make it worth coming back.

Walked in on a Saturday night without a reservation and were able to be seated inside right away, although the place was packed and there seemed to be a lot of people waiting on a patio table. The menu is seasonal and everything looked amazing, so we decided to do tapas style and share. We tried the scallop ceviche, deviled eggs, some sugarpea dish, the burrata, and the pasta. Every thing we got starting with the wine (I had the Savingaun blanc and she had the Rose) was fabulous and so flavorful! Go try this restaurant!

Went there today for brunch with some friends, it was packed!!! good think I RSVP. Food was OK, had pancakes with bacon, The bacon wasn't wroth the $8 or $17 for the pancakes, had better. Would I come here again.......Most likely not.
The menu changes and hence somewhat unpredictable. So if you love something go back for it quickly. I enjoy the outside seating.

This place gets slammed on the weekend. Making reservations was easy, even when I had to call back a second time to add another person to our party the hostess was extremley accommodating. The original Bloody Mary was a little too spicy for my taste, but the food was delish. I would highly reccomend the breakfast bowl, the portion was a great size, satisfying without being too heavy. The service is phenominal, our waitress was on point.
Amazing brunch, we had our friend's baby with us and they politely helped us get settled in a corner with the stroller. Excellent service & drinks
Brunch!  The go to spot in Chelsea.

Got the fried egg sandwich because that was the only item that seemed to be popping up in all the Yelp pictures. Please note, I do not like sausage--so much so that I usually pick it out of pastas and the like. However this sandwich was SO good. The sausage is not dense and overly seasoned. The bun is incredibly light and fluffy. Such a great combination.

The food was very good, but beware the place is packed for brunch. Pricey drinks, although delicious, but it is in a nice spot in Chelsea so it's not shocking.

Not only is the food here great (my favorite dishes are the chicken salad and crispy potatoes for lunch and almond waffles and bacon for breakfast), but the staff is so nice! My wallet fell from the table and I couldn't find it. Not only did four staff members immediately help me look for it (thankfully it was at the host stand) but I also had a missed voicemail from the hostess telling me they had my wallet. Such a nice restaurant and staff!!

We had a great time at this restaurant. We went for lunch, and it was very busy but in a really good way. Our waiter Kingston was unbelievable. Attentive, happy, pleasant, and hard-working. He made it so much fun to have lunch there. The wine selection was very good. great, The food was good. I had the fish tacos, and it was average. But my partner had a hamburger and said it was great. Would definitely go there for lunch if in the meatpacking area.

Great restaurant with a fun buzz and friendly atmosphere. It's good for brunch or dinner. It has a revolving menu so you're always going to find something new. Go on a casual date or with friends. It won't disappoint. After, head to the Chelsea market for more fun.

Excellent food and really friendly service. I had the eggs benedict and my friend had the cookshop breakfast. Everything was delicious, quick and the restaurant is lovely. Would definitely go here again!

column3: Town of Hempstead, Long Island, NY
column6: I'm here for the Sunday brunch, crowded as usual. Thank god I made reservation. I've been looking forward to trying this place but I'm not impressed. Everything is mediocre. I ordered the burger, some goat cheese ball ( I forgot the name of it). Too oily for me, but I guess that's just American style brunch lol.

Great environment. The food was good but it was the service that was top notch. I tried the wagyu beef steak. It's not kobe/wagyu beef you will find in japan. Sorry to disappoint any meatlovers who might have gotten excited. Might be their version of it? I was surprised because the price was significantly cheaper but understood when I tasted it. But everything else was really good. And again, REALLY good service with attentive staff. That usually makes or breaks a place. And they definitely make it.

He had brought a Fleurie as a suggested substitute, and we agreed. A nice wine, but a surprise on the bill. It was a slightly higher price, which he never mentioned. Not right, but I'll still go back.

Arrived just in time for Saturday breakfast. My brother was in town from out of state so we always venture off to something new. Cookshop did not disappoint. Our service was great and good was excellent!

Loved having brunch here!  Their cocktails are amazing!

I want to go back to NY just to eat here again.  I am smitten with this place.  Great atmosphere!  I was there with 2 ladies I work with, but this place definitely seemed like a romantic spot. Ha ha.  The dim lighting, the design, etc.  Anyway, I was MIND-BLOWN with the food here.  It's been days since I was here and I am still craving seconds.  I currently am not eating carbs/sugar so I went with the Mixed Grill.  You get a small portion of steak, pork belly, and a tiny lamb chop.  The flavor of the meat was INSANE. The piece of squash that came with that was charred also was to die for.  The sauce it is all topped with was delicious.  I think it was honestly the best meal I've ever had.  A+

Thought I would give Cookshop another try after having gone years ago.  Still not too happy with our dining experience.  The restaurant had a strange wet towel smell that stymied my appetite.  Our appetizers came out on time, but we had to wait around 40 min for the entrees to arrive.  This is not good when you have a baby dining with you.  Management apologized and said the kitchen was having some problems.  They did give us a complimentary glass of wine, but the wait was really brutal.  Two stars is mainly for the friendly waitstaff.

Easily my favorite brunch spot in the city! I love it year round but it's a great summer spot for the outdoor seating. There are usually changes to the menu every time we visit. Recently I had the Braised Kale and Poached Egg. It was unexpectedly soupy but DELICIOUS! You can't go wrong with the huevos rancheros. I've liked some of their sweet brunch dishes in the past too, but they're no longer on the menu. If you're looking for a brunch spot, make a reservation at Cookshop quick! (It's always packed so expect a long wait without reservations.)

Amazing brunch as always. Kinston is the best waiter!! Attentive and couldn't have been nicer.

Cookshop is our go-to place for brunch especially after a long walk along the Highline. They serve amazing bloody marys and the food is farm fresh. If the weather is good, the best seats are outside and I recommend you call ahead if you plan to show up with a large group of riends.

Authentic fresh market cuisine. They have a great brunch on weekends but my favorite is their weekday lunch. Their chicken salad is great. You can tell all the vegetables and ingredients are organic and fresh. Simple flavors that let the ingredients speak for themselves. Definitely recommend it. I've returned many times.

Loved everything about this place; location, décor, friendly staff, and the food most of all. Everything we ordered was very fresh and seemingly on the healthy side(even the Bloody Mary with kale). Portions were big and the prices good.  There was a bit of a wait, but it was worth every bite.

Great place for brunch. Outstanding, not to mention very large, Bloody Marys. Food was wonderful. My daughter had delicious Huevos Rancheros but it was the short ribs with poached egg that won my heart. The two don't sound like they should go together but they did--they absolutely did. Make reservations if possible because it's very crowded. We didn't but were lucky enough to find two seats at the bar while we waited for our table.
must go if you are in the area great service and awesome food get regular it is already spicy

This is, in my opinion, the best brunch place in New York. It's hard to snag a weekend reservation: do it six weeks in advance if you want a prime time (anytime between 11-2). The Bloody Marys are superb (get one with ramps in the spring). The pastry board (with assorted scones, beignets, etc.)  could be a meal in itself. The coffee is smooth and rich (my guess is La Colombe). Cookshop's renditions of the classics (frittata, huevos rancheros, scramble, and French toast) are all done to perfection, with seasonal ingredients. The room is also really spacious with well-spaced tables. No need to scream to be heard. No risk of having to listen to your neighbors' annoying conversations. I will go back again and again.

Delicious flavors and quality ingredients. Came here with a long time local to the area. Place is dim but has a swanky appeal during dinner time. The deviled eggs is a must order for an appetizer. Each egg had a different topping like anchovy or onion, all were tasty.  I had the pork selection for my entree which was essentially pork served three ways: sausage, pork belly, and a pork chop. It came with thin sliced potato and some great greens tossed in some kind of light dressing.

Overrated, underwhelming brunch. You'll wait a long time for slow service and average food. While the items that we ordered sounded like they would be delicious (huevos rancheros, shakshuka, chicken liver mousse, sweet potato bread), they were mediocre in execution. The huevos rancheros and shakshuka were bland compared to renditions I've had elsewhere, and the crackers that came with the chicken liver mousse had seasoning that overpowered the rest of the dish. The pickles served with the mousse were also unappetizing. As for the sweet potato bread, I could've made better at home. Some brunch places like Le Barricou or Balthazar are actually worth the wait, but Cookshop is not one of them. There is superior food elsewhere.

This place is amazing!! I went for brunch and had to wait about an hour for a table of 3. It was totally worth the wait. I ordered the huevos rancheros and it was one of the best huevos rancheros I've ever had. A must try!!

This was 3 stars at best.  Yesterday, my husband and I went for breakfast.  We ordered the Cookshop breakfast which had 2 fried eggs, a buttermilk biscuit, sausage and bacon.  The food was good but not outstanding.  I think what tainted my experience was the service which was incredibly slow and there were not many people there.  Our waiter was inattentive and I felt like I was invisible.  I can't tell you how many times I tried to flag someone down to get more jam for my biscuit only to be ignored.  The icing on the cake was when we paid in cash and the waiter gave us 20 singles as part of our change.  Felt like the wait staff really did not care.  Will not be returning.

This is another time when I wish Yelp had half stars because Cookshop is more of a 4 1/2 than 4 stars. Went for brunch on a Monday and it was still pretty packed but we got a table with no wait. Started with some nice strong coffee. Next we shared the poached eggs with cauliflower, harissa and hand pulled croutons- a must in my opinion. We also got the cornmeal griddle cakes, biscuit, bacon and grits! The cornmeal cakes were interesting but if I went back I would stick with the poached eggs. I also really enjoyed the sides, particularly the bacon- but it's hard to go wrong with bacon.
Came here for brunch! The food was amazing! Many of the ingredients are from locals! Make a reservation way in advance.
Service and food are great the cocktails are also delicious . Try the kale salad I can't say anything else than yummy !

Ate here for lunch a few times and always impressed with the quality and service. One of the better choices when coming off a nice log walk on the High Line, in an area where restaurant choices are somewhat limited.

Took a friend here for her birthday.  The devil eggs and the fried oysters were good.  These came out pretty quick unfortunately our main course took a long time.   It was disappointing cause the chicken was not cooked fully when you get to the thigh. It's odd that the breast portion was good.  We didn't speak to the waitress cause we don't want to wait another 20mins for the redo or even 2sec for the microwave redo.   This place is ok..

Bookshop is great for breakfast. I love the Oven backed egg. It is just perfectly cooked. And the Dutch baby pancake is also very nice. The food is quite expensive though.

Walked in before they we're open, but they warmly invited us to sit at the bar. Chatted with us while they finished opening, then served us politely and with great customer service. Would highly recommend.
