Over priced but worth the Bloody Mary and the ambiance ... If you can sit outside defiinetly do and go for the seasonal and specials
Perfect place for brunch in the neighborhood. Had to wait for the table but it was worth.

Wow, this place is packed for a reason. The huevos rancheros were amazing and really different!! I love sauce and the entire entre was smothered in delicious, spicy sauce with melted cheese from being placed in an oven. Amazing service too - they messed up my order  but immediately fixed it, provided it for free and gave us a drink on the house. Definitely going to come back for more!

Super casual place with absolutely AMAZING FOOD. I went there to meet my friends that told me before how great this place is. We were a group of 6 and we ordered bunch of plates to share, so I had the chance to try out half if not more of the menu and OMG...  from the first bite to the last every single dish was just incredible, and let me tell you with the amount of food we had on the table that almost never happens. Just a few of my favorites to count: the chicken wings - soo tender and flavorful, the meat just falls apart from the bone just by a touch of your fork; caesar salad - they make it with Lacinato Kale and most delicious caesar dressing ever;  whole trout - I was extremely skeptical about it I've had quite a few fishy experiences with trout but this one was to die for; roasted chicken - so tender and juicy; fried skate - do not get fooled by the fried part because the fish would melt in you mouth like butter; pork chop - had a nice preparation with rhubarb and strawberries very tasty. And we finished with some donuts and orange ice cream .... Everything is so fresh and tasty,  farm to table, even the garnishes of each dish we terrific and you can tell the chef pours his love in to the food because you can feel it with each bite you take. The whole experience was magnified by their staff. The waitress was attentive and very knowledgeable about the menu and Richard  the manager or/and the somm took such a good care of us with a brilliant wine recommendation and just most welcoming and friendly attitude. The atmosphere of this place is radiating good vibes and you walk out a happy clam planning on your next visit. I am totally going back!

Cookshop is a very hyped up restaurant that everyone seems to know about, but I was a bit disappointed with my experience. The staff said that our wait would be about 45 minutes but it ended up being an hour and a half. However, they gave us tasty cheddar cornbread and a muffin as an apology, which was nice. My friend and I split the huevos rancheros and the pancakes. The huevos rancheros was good for the first few bites, but then I discovered how watery it was at the bottom. Either they didn't drain the beans well or something, but it made everything really soggy. The raspberry pancakes with lemon curd was absolutely amazing on the other hand. This place definitely has its pros and cons, but I haven't decided if I will give it another try yet.

I went here twice in one week it was THAT good. The waiters I had were absolutely amazing and so friendly and attentive. The food is some of the best I've ever eaten. I got the salmon one night and the poached eggs the other day that I went for brunch. Everything was cooked to perfection. I love the ambiance in this place too. 10/10 would recommend to all!!!

The service is superb here. Food is always prepared with the season's best produce. A fun sit at the bar, breezy Sunday drinks type of place. The bartenders are super creative so just ask if you dont see it on the cocktail list.

We went for lunch and though crowded & loud, it was comfortable akin to being part of a large family. From the hostess to our server, Carrie, they were warm & kind. The food was spot on and good. The fries & potato chips-homemade fresh & not salty. My friend had the fish sandwich which she loved. My burger had to go back twice-to no ones fault as things happen (once undercooked & then a piece of gristle) but what I had was delicious. I also enjoyed the delicious rhubarb pie! It was an overall wonderful experience! Carrie was gracious, kind, funny, full of heart even while she was training a new server. Sit in her section if you can! I will definitely go back & highly recommend it! Enjoy!

Had brunch today with the family and it was great. My fried egg sandwich with sausage was fabulous.  Wife's eggs were great too. Lucky to get a table outside on a nice warm day. Make sure to make reservations, it helped.  Would definitely go back if I'm in the area.

Slightly pricy especially the cocktails but you pay for what you get: quality and exceptional food and drink. The deviled eggs are amazing and if you have a party of two, get two orders so that you don't have to share.

Saturday nite crowded but service was good. Will try brunch next time. Dinner, meh. Appetizers are very good. 5 of us ordered: Chicken super moist, seafood looked salty, Caesar salad: way too salty, fish meh, pork chops fatty.

One of my favorite restaurants in New York- a gem by the Highline. The quality of the dining experience here has been great at all times of the day. Their food is delicious, and I appreciate their collection of non-alcoholic drink options, though I also like their cocktails. Last night, I had their cassoulet, which was nicely done- the lamb shoulder and pork belly were perfect- surprisingly, many other restaurants in New York can't seem to get their pork belly right.

Came on a Saturday around 10:30/11 with five friends. Split the French toast to share, which was fantastically delicious, and I ordered the frittata, which had a great pistachio sauce on top of it. One of my friends ordered the poached eggs, which I would definitely love to try next time! Overall, waitress was great, ambience was perfect, and the booth seats look awesome.
Excellent local restaurant that has become wildly popular. Good luck getting in. A bit loud, but the food is always yummy.
No comment

No comment
Great food bit it took a very long time. Waitress was great, it was just the food that took forever.
No comment

We had our post marathon brunch here with my cousin on our way out of town.  I didn't realize when I made the reservation (which might be necessary because it was fairly crowded given that it was a Monday) that we ate here about five years ago.  The breakfast was really good, the staff was very friendly, and I would definitely feel comfortable going back or recommending it to a friend.
No comment
No comment
Awesome brunch experience. Great choice of bloody mary's, wish they served them in pitchers!
No comment

No comment

Classic and good all around. We started with the burrata which was tasty especially with the olive oil soaked bread! I then decided on the roasted spinach and cheddar scramble. I was pleasantly surprised by how much I enjoyed it as I am usually more of a sweet dish brunch person. (Although I did get the raisin toast instead of the buttermilk biscuit to satisfy that craving.) Would recommend to friends and even to people who aren't my friends! Truly delish.
No comment
No comment

Can't believe Cookshop doesn't have 5 stars. First and foremost, food is A+. My wife and I were looking for a Hobbit second breakfast, coffee, and a glass of bubbly at 945am when we stumbled upon Cookshop. Deviled eggs and the scone were just enough for us, but next time I'd try more. I always judge a breakfast/brunch by it's coffee and Cookshop won't disappoint. The biggest appeal of this place was the staff. Wow. We were the first guests to walk in and they weren't even open but they let us hop out of the cold and hang at the bar. From start to finish they treated us like family and I would come back just to say hello and thank you for a cup of coffee. Thanks to the great folks here for the conversation, welcoming attitudes, and adding another great part to our anniversary weekend!!!
Long line outside, nice ambience, great food!! Corn pancakes and huevos ranchetos reeeeally good!

We're able to make reservations on Open Table and, when we arrived, they sat us right away. The place was packed for brunch, even at 3pm. We had two infants with us and they accommodated our needs without batting an eye. Our waitress was SUPER friendly, knowledgable, and very baby savvy. She was never more than a couple minutes away the entire time. The food was good as well! I had the gingerbread pancakes; yum! My hubby had the broccoli and cheese scramble with caramelized onions; mmmm mmmm! And my friends had the poached egg dish and huevos rancheros. I tried them all and they were good; even the biscuit that came with my husbands scramble! A rarity to find a tasty biscuit in NY that doesn't chip your tooth; I was impressed!
No comment
Great location and great vegetarian chow. Nice environment, music and service.  Highly recommended. Wife had a chicken stew and slammed a bunch of wine. I had the veg plate. As good as it gets.
We had an amazing late supper there. Excellent service, great fresh menu... Delicious stop near the high line!!
Although reservation was easy, great atmosphere, with good service, food was generally way too salty. If you do not like over seasoned food, i would avoid.
No comment
I thought the food was hit or miss. Enjoyed our appetizer (chicken liver pate on toast), but thought our lamb and halibut entrees were mediocre. Fun, casual, lively atmosphere though.
This was an ok restaurant. I appreciate that they use all local ingredients, but I wasn't overly impressed. To me this was a basic restaurant with a high price tag.

Brunched here. Ordered the $12 bread basket but I couldn't finish more than one breakfast pastry b/c the individual pastries were pretty big.  The basket included a huge muffin (didn't get a chance to try), delish cinnamon roll, soft scone, and a thick slice of banana bread.  There wasn't really much on the brunch menu that I wanted to try so I was pleasantly surprised when I heard the specials of the day which included a duck confit with escarole and potatoes. Sadly this dish was just seasoned with too much pepper so I ate a little bit but didn't really enjoy it all that much.  The OJ here was pretty good and the coffee was not bad either. The best part: there's al fresco seating and the crowd tends to be young and trendy.

I have no complaints about Cookshop, but I don't quite understand why it gets such rave reviews. To me the food on the menu always sounds fantastic but then it turns out to be somewhat bland. I'm not the healthiest eater in the world, so maybe I am just missing all of the butter and other unhealthy ingredients that other restaurants probably use. The atmosphere is rustic and welcoming, and spacious compared to most restaurants in Manhattan. The service is also good, but not spectacular.
No comment
All around mediocre food/service/everything. Very forgetful.
Delish! The broccoli and egg scramble was to die for!
Ok lunch spot, but pricey. Kale & Chicken breast salad was pretty good.

Stopped for a quick bite and the service was bad, the waitress forgot parts of our order and then charged us for it. The burrata was tasteless and the toast burnt (dark!!!) I had to send it back. Overall I didn't liked the experience. But the lamb burger was quite good.

Meh. Came here for brunch this weekend because of all the amazing reviews but must say I was a bit disappointed. The place is nice, the service is good but I really wasn't impressed with the food. We had the French Toast and Huevos Rancheros. The FT wasn't terrible but tasted more like bread pudding rather than the actual thing, I didn't even finish half of it. The eggs in the Huevos Rancheros were way overcooked but other than that it tasted ok I guess. Cocktails were good. Location is great. Don't think I will be coming back though... There are tons of better brunch places in the city.
Total joke.  Striped bass was so small I ate the whole dish in 2 bites.  Don't go. Way overrated and menu does not have a lot of choices.  This place is all about taking your money.
It was good. Not as great as I was told but good never the less.  Waited about 30 minutes, which isn't bad for Sunday brunch.  Service was great!

The egg sandwich at brunch is the best egg sandwich I literally have ever had. I ordered with no sausage and they actually reduced the price of the sandwich, this is really worth noting as it is exceptional customer service. Will 100% go back and recommend to friends. Would highly recommend a reservation!
No comment

Went for lunch - it was definitely tasty but everything was just a bit too over greasy and rich. The brioche buns were pretty soaked with oil from the hot dog and the steak sandwich. Personally I would have preferred a bit of a fresher take. I would try again for brunch but probably wouldn't go back for lunch.

Food is really good. Ordered the breakfast bowl and it was delish. Made a reservation during brunch time and didn't have to wait at all when we got there. The place was pretty packed and trying to get in and out of our seats was a pain. And the noise level was a little too much for my liking. We sat next to a table of about 6 and after they had a couple of rounds of cocktails, it got a little too much. But the food did make up for it.

Great breakfast and lunch! Love the grits platter and burger! Perfect neighborhood casual restaurant.
Bro, you gotta come here and interface with the Sr. Manager of Bartenders, Jill. she makes great drinks, serves up tremendous food recommendations, and is guaranteed to power your story. Cheers!!
No comment
No comment

Fantastic food and a great atmosphere. I waited an hour for a table but it was SO worth it. We were also seated next to Anne Burell from the Food Network and I feel like this made the food taste better. I would suggest the frittata, hamburger, and breakfast sandwich. The sandwich is delicious with a buttermilk biscuit, scrambled eggs and applewood smoked bacon with a side of greens. The ice tea here is really good too and the people watching makes it a very entertaining place to be. Just expect a wait and you won't be disappointed.

My new favorite restaurant! A few weeks ago I tried Cookshop for the first time to celebrate my birthday. Kira was our server and service was spot on. She was knowledgeable about the menu and her timing was impeccable. The wine selection was varied and sophisticated. As for dishes,  we enjoyed, the citrus salad, mushroom salad, cauliflower Romesco, butternut squash lasagna and mushroom entree. The cauliflower was probably my favorite but everything was divine. My friend also had the oysters and raved about them. I came to Cookshop looking most forward to trying their desserts but after all of the appetizers and main dish I simply could not eat anything else. I cannot wait for my next visit.

Amazing . Went for brunch twice already. There is something about fresh ingredients that I can't get over. Once you go to a place where they use farm fresh ingredients, it's hard to go to others. Truly amazing food, very tasty , yummy comforting food.

Waited for hour on a Saturday morning expecting something amazing. It wasn't. Nothing special eggs with no flavor and burnt toast. Best part of my meal was the biscuit which tasted like it was brought in.
Great food & service. Loved how they asked me exactly how I wanted my eggs cooked. Subtly makes the difference. Open, bright and airy atmosphere, I highly recommend this establishment.

Food was good but great environment and food presentation. Polite staff and never felt rushed in my consumption. Perfect spot for a good brunch or lunch amongst friends.

Came here for dinner with other people. the staff was awesome, the atmosphere hip but the food was really lackluster. We had the cracklings (fried pork skin) which is $8, very greasy and difficult to break apart and, honestly, not very tasty. We also had the stracciatella cheese for $14, but what cheese on bread isn't? the balsamic was a bit overpowering. Nothing new here. The chicken liver mousse was fine. I had the cassoulet for dinner which included one kick ass sausage, which I promptly ate, but the beef belly and beans were too much, so I took it home, and honestly it was better the next day, heated up in the microwave than when served in the restaurant. Maybe that's the mark of a great meal? Just seemed fine in all, but I won't be craving anything from here and needing to go back any time soon.
Service was amazing we got seated a half hr after our reservation. And we're accommodated by 5 plates of appetizers and free dessert! The seasonal mussels in sauce is delish.

This was a very cute place. Good food, decently priced for the city and was big portions. The drinks were great. They have a good green juice along with awesome Bloody Mary! Coffee was decent, not very strong but ok. Recommend trying it out. No wait but it was a weekday morning.
No comment
Wayyyy over priced. On the menu things look good but it's honestly just a hot mess. They are trying too hard and should just focus on getting the normal menu items down.
Incredible food, ambience and service. Loved the crispy fish tacos, the deviled egg sampler and the Pig Slap ale. Our waiter was amazing. Right near Highline - nice to walk after a lovely lunch.
Fabulous food at proper amount (hmm. Maybe not the roasted chicken ) very dedicated environment too. Perfect for a romantic night - start at high line, then dinner, then the park....
Came for brunch- very busy.  We had several pastries, all were very fresh and delicious. Hamburger was great
Great choice for Chelsea brunch. Fresh quality food, interesting flavors based on classics. Saturday at 10, 2 of us got seated immediately at the bar, while the quoted wait was 20.

I randomly walked in just to grab some drinks late Sunday afternoon. I have to say that I forgot how good their cocktails were. They were made with fresh fruits which made it THAT much better. We ordered a few bites at bar and I was reminded that I have to make Cookshop a more frequent stop.

My husband and I love a good plate of huevos rancheros and since Cook Shop is supposed to have some of the best and very good brunch, we were super excited. We ordered beignets, jalapeño cornmeal pancakes, huevos rancheros, and fries. It was all extremely average and it was a let down after reading all the yelp reviews. It was by no means a bad meal, but was really just okay. The fries were very disappointing though and had the texture of soggy fast food fries. If you live near by, I think it's an okay brunch spot, but don't go out of your way for it.

I took my parents here for dinner a few weeks ago.  My favorite part about this place is that they try to encorporate the season into their menu and decor.  Overall, a safe choice but I found the prices to be a bit steep for the type of restaurant is is.   I ordered the arctic char, which was delcious but literally could have been eaten in 3 quick bites.
This restaurant is very nice right cross of Highline. The food is delicious and the staff is very friendly. My experience is wonderful! I highly recommended this place to my friends and everyone.
No comment

Cookshop has a beautiful atmosphere and I love that it's on open table. It was very simple to make a reservation, and despite running about 30 mins late I called and they accommodated kindly and we were seated right away. Our waiter Michael was so great! He was very attentive and knowledgable about the menu. I had the pan roasted attic char and it was incredible. My parents had the grilled plate (a special) and my mom had the grilled amberjack. The food was delicious and service was wonderful - everyone we encountered on the staff was so friendly. Thanks for a great meal!
Everything is great. The staff is very accommodating. But the chilled cucumber soup is the besttttt !
No comment
No comment

We showed up at around a quarter past six on a Wednesday eve without a reservation and were seated immediately at an outside table as requested. Service was prompt and everything was quite good. Oysters were very fresh, breads tasty, the charred eggplant with naan appetizer scrumptious, and my Stone Oven Pizza entree was the most uniquely spicy pizza I've ever had - delicious. Given other reviewers' tales of long waits we probably lucked out on the timing (there was a line when we left) but it was a perfect impromptu summer evening meal. Given the location, decor, and service, I thought the price was quite reasonable (not cheap, but look where it is).

My kids have food allergies. Not the annoying kind. The ambulance to the hospital kind. When we dine out with the kids, there are OK restaurants who are really good with the allergies; there are great restaurants that are OK with the allergies; and there are very few great restaurants that are great with the allergies. We had brunch at Cookshop last week and they are in a whole other class. We had an exceptional meal prepared and served by a team so attentive to our dietary limitations it literally made our day. They transcended great customer service and treated our kids with genuine kindness. Both the regular menu and allergen free adaptations were absolutely delicious. We'll be back...soon.
No comment
Not a huge fan of this place. Their lunch dishes are all mediocre. Hopefully their brunch is better.
No comment

Very busy for lunch, but they treated me like a queen on my birthday. Sent over a fresh, hot cherry crumble with a big scoop of vanilla ice cream and a candle in it. So sweet! The food and service is impeccable during a busy lunch hour, and definitely don't skimp and try one of their mocktails. So refreshing on a hot summer day when you want something more grand than an Arnold Palmer. I recommend the one with blueberry and ginger soda. So great!
Nice brunch spot tucked away in the west side. Great atmosphere, beautiful location, delicious food.
No comment

Even though it was crowded on a Sunday at lunchtime, we got a table quickly. Service was friendly and knowledgable, the food was terrific and the coffee was delish. I had huevos rancheros - yummy - and my friend had baked eggs, which she also enjoyed. And they let us sit and catch up for quite a while - we live in different countries and don't see each other that often, so it was a treat to be able to relax and not feel rushed out onto the street. Highly recommended.
Solid four star spot. The food is great the only reason it wasn't a 5 is that the eggs were a bit over cooked. Great bloody Mary's!

I have been here multiple times for dinner and brunch and always find the food to be tasty. The atmosphere is enjoyable and not too loud, but can be a bit cramped when its busy. Staff is courteous and helpful and I enjoy the seasonal menu options.

I live in the building above Cookshop, and have been going here for years. A friend and I went this morning for brunch, and once again we were reminded that Cookshop never disappoints. Brunch was delicious, our server was fantastic, and everyone who works in there is so friendly, its a pleasure to be there on a Sunday morning. Yes, its a bit pricey, but the food is always impeccable, and the service is quick. Get there as close to 10 as you can because it fills up very quickly!
No comment
The liver mouse is superb!  The deviled eggs tasting was delicious and my artic char salad was so clean and the flavors incredibly fresh & pure.

We were traveling to NYC for weekend and selected this restaurant for brunch. We were not disappointed. There was quite a line when we arrived so we sat at the bar where you could also be served a meal. My husband ordered a Bloody Mary and really enjoyed the flavor/spice.  For brunch he ordered the Huervos Rancheros and I ordered the egg sandwich with homemade Italian sausage and a jalapeño slaw. Both meals were outstanding and our bartender/server Jhorhey was excellent.   Definitely a great brunch destination.

While I've been in the process of relocating to this area this restaurant has been my go to. Every meal I've had from brunch to lunch to dinner and drinks has been wonderful. The FOH staff and severs are all professional and knowledgeable about each dish and are happy to assist in an appropriate wine pairing. Well worth the wait for a table outside for brunch. A must if you're in the area. Mike my server this evening has been particularly wonderful.

This place is not vegan friendly. There's an entree listed on the yelp menu that looks like it could be easily made vegan, but they've stopped offering it. When I went the option was either a cheeseless pizza, a side salad, or a vegetable soup minus the cheese. I got the soup which was quite tasteless. Giving it three stars because my family liked it but if you're vegan I'd avoid this place.

My first  & last time here; the positive is that the service was friendly & quick and the drinks were pretty good. But I am very sad to report that my huevos rancheros were totally bland. Very surprising since they were so highly rated by other yelpers.

I went for brunch and the food was fantastic, the service was friendly and attentive, and although the restaurant was very crowded, the seating was comfortable and the normal noise level you'd expect for a busy brunch restaurant. The only reason I am not giving this restaurant 5 stars is because the portions were so small we had to order two more plates after we each had a full meal. To be clear, I am a thin female and my friend is barely 90lbs soaking wet. We were still HUNGRY after the meal. I don't remember what I ordered but I remember going, "this doesn't come with some kind of carb with it? That's odd". So I ordered a full order of some delicious bread in addition to my meal. Also, the bloody mary's were absolutely delicious.

Loved this place. I wandered in on a Saturday afternoon while exploring the highline. I asked for a table for 2 and was seated right away. I ordered an iced coffee which was wonderful and not bitter at all. My mother ordered a strawberry iced tea which was also very good. We ordered the heirloom tomato salad to start which was incredible. For the main I had the shakshuka (delightful) and she had the poached eggs. We were both very happy customers.
Fabulous dinner here last night night. The "Mixed Grill" dish to die for: pork chop, hangar steak, and Merguez sausage ....great ambiance.

I was so excited to try this place but serious disappointment. We had a reservation for brunch and they still make us wait 40 minutes for a table. My food (broccoli cheddar scramble) was super salty and my husband's huevos rancheros was just ok. The worst part was that all the utensils and glasses had a weird smell so we were a little nervous but thought maybe it was just their dishwasher and my husband and I both felt sick afterwards. We both have really bad colds now and feel really nauseous. Gross.

Love this place. Gem of Chelsea. All the boys who work there look perfect and handsome. They are also very polite. Best service. The food is exquisite. Brunches are the best. BLT bloody marries are the best in town. Always crowded be sure to order / come in advance.

It doesn't look like Cookshop needs another review, but my experience here was truly memorable. Something needs to be said when a group of 6 people is pleased with their experience. We sat comfortably. One of us ordered the gazpacho, but it was more than anticipated so we ended up sharing it. I drank the rioja and ate the mezze- my favorite plate in my my 5 day stay in NY. Can't wait to come again.
Friendly and attentive staff. Great food! Amazing jalepeno corn bread! I will be back when visit Nyc again.

Ok to trendy, pricy and nicely decorated place.  Now let's hit the food which was a HUGE disapointment.  Chef is heavy handed with the salt.  the only edible dish was a tempura laden soft shell crab.  $18 for one is unreal.  Everything else but dessert was really non eventful and even not worth eating.  Don't spend your $ here...it's not worth it at all.
No comment

Always love Cookshop brunch (amazing huevos) and decided to give dinner a go this past week and have to say we were a little disappointed. Instead of the usual well seasoned food, everything was very heavily salted and the brussel sprout appetizer, holy garlic. I'm glad we were all sharing or else I'd be embarrassed to speak. Cocktails were tasty, but nothing you couldn't find anywhere else in Chelsea. Dessert was the only saving grace. Loved the eggnog ice cream, and the zeppole alone get a star-def worth the calories. Maybe it was an off night, but I think we'll stick to knowing this as the brunch spot.

Cook shop does not mess around. Everything flavorful. Oysters clean and tasty. The bread basket comes with savory delicious pieces. The kumquat margarita (13 bucks) great. The buckwheat pasta and spinach and more very good. My couillette hearty, hot and heavy for $26. After a couple outstanding brunches here years ago I worried the inspiration would be on the low end but the food persists as flavorful and creative. Service is professional and attentive. The decor is welcoming with a higher end farm to table vibe. Is this the monied, hipster influenced, hedonistic Manhattan seeking seasonal food, local commitment and unpretentious arrangements? No doubt. Totally unreal and very tasty.

Brunch.  Started with Beignets (meh) and I had a classic Bloody Mary (super spicy and I like spicy).  I ordered the Fried Egg Sandwich (good, would have been better if the eggs weren't overcooked...), my son had Sautéed Spinach & Cheddar Scramble (he loved, I never tasted), my wife had the Frittata (really yummy).  My poor daughter...she ordered the Oven Baked Sunnyside-up Eggs...twice!  The first time, way over cooked.  The second time, barely warm.  She gave up and ordered the Frittata.  They were very apologetic and comp'ed her dish.  Followed the meal with a nice jaunt on the High Line.
No comment
So good! Ask to sit at the bar and skip the line
No comment
One of my favorite brunches in nyc

The Huevos Ranch was excellent. The Cookshop Eggs were very, very good. The Mimosas were just okay. The Irish Coffee was pretty good. The service once seated was more than adequate and quite friendly. Overall very good but not sure if it was worth the half hour wait.
No comment

Baked eggs fairyland! They're just so good. Jalapeño cornbread? Yes please. Everyone at our table was delighted with their food. Only removing one star as the Bloody Mary was like rocket fuel (really wish there was more tomato juice). Overall a winner for brunch if in the neighbourhood.

My friend and I arrived at 10am on Sunday without a reservation and were seated immediately. I don't think that has ever happened to me within the 12 years that I've lived in NYC. We both ordered the exact same thing - Huevos Rancheros. Now, I hail from the Southwest, so I am a HUGE fan of Mexican and TexMex. This dish did not disappoint. We both left feeling satisfied. I will return for another brunch dish - their crepes sound delicious!

Yesterday a colleague of mine showed me this place right here on yelp, and since I've recently been looking for a nice traditional American spot to try out, I decided that this place was a prime candidate. I got here right after work yesterday with that same colleague, promptly sat down and started looking through the slightly overpriced menu. I went for some deviled eggs, the ravioli retrangoli and drinks. The ravioli was scrumptious, it had sweet potato, ricotta, brown butter and was doused in sage herbs which gave it a terrific smell. The deviled eggs were so so. Atmosphere was very generic, nothing really caught my attention however the place was spotless, so props to them for that. I think I'll be making a return visit here, it was a very chilled and relaxing spot overall.

An overall enjoyable brunch experience, however it didn't start that way.  The hostess wanted to seat us in a dark back corner and refused at first to allow another seat despite many others being available.  The food was well prepared and the menu was creative.  Our server was excellent.
Came here for brunch on a Saturday. Food was good, lots of cocktail options, and is in a great location. Service was a bit slow due to the large crowd but we were seated quickly with a reservation
Came here on Friday afternoon with my friend. Ordered the soft shell crab burger, and it was good! The house made tartar sauce and chopped pickles and onions made the burger. Definitely worth a go!

The best brunch I've had since I've been in New York.  We arrived at about 1:30pm and there were a ton of people there.  We didn't have a reservation, so there was a 45 minute wait, which flew by due to out bloody marys. I am a huge bloody mary fan and these were done well, spicy, with horse radish and the right amount of vodka.  Once we were seated we had a hard time choosing our meals beause everything sounded so good. Our server was friendly, honest, and answered all our questions.  We settled on the Cook Shop Scramble with smoked trout and the Chilaquiles.  Both dishes were amazing, and we ate everything! I would definitley recoomend this place for brunch.

The summer squash and squid salad was great.  So were the delicious nuts which accompanied it.  Drinks were good and service were fine no complaints.  The minute steak was over cooked (well done) and salty.  When the waiter asked how everything was I replied honestly.  They offered something instead and I ordered the duck which came out extremely rare and close to raw.  My dinner companion ate most of it.  He had the  lamb burger.  I had a bite.  It was too salty for me but again my dinner companion ate everything.  They knew I was unhappy with the meal so they provided complimentary sorbet and didn't charge me for the entree.  I gave the waiter a big tip because he was so nice.  They get three stars only for effort in trying to make the customer happy.
No comment

As far as brunch spots go, it wasn't bad.  My friends and I were overlooked more than once while we waited to be seated at brunch, which was frustrating. The hostess sent over free beignets, which put us in a great mood.  The drinks are a bit overpriced, but taste pretty great.

wow. this place is so good. comfortable tables, nice staff. deviled eggs super smooth. lots of mixed veggies with the scallops and the ginger drink was great. the only negative were the people next to us were a bit loud. good thing they only arrived after we were half way or more done. overall, I would go back in a second. the food was great.
No comment

Great brunch. Ramp frittata generous portion.   All four had taste and cooed.  Get corn bread to compliment.   Heuvos rancheros just right spiciness    French toast wonderfully sweet but more of a desert than meal.  Interestingly the pancakes which our party passed on were going back to kitchen unfinished and the stack might need to be resized.  Drink selection from cucumber soda to ginger cumquat lemonade were unique fun and tasty.  My daughter thought cucumber soda would match well with gin
Came here few days ago for dinner. Our waitress is very nice and attentive. The food was good .... But we waited forever for our main entrée.
Wow!  Check out the new Cook Shop II on 24th. The dumplings, noodles, bok choy service wine and all are off to a delicious start!  Must enjoy!!

I been to cookshop a few times - the food is consistently tasty and the vibe is great. What entitles cookshop to 5 stars is the service and I'm particularly impressed with Caitlin, the maitre'd. I arrived without a reservation (booked chop shop) and was graciously seated immediately. The staff was quite busy and I waited a smidge too long for a waiter to take our order. Somehow, Caitlin was keeping an eye on everyone and attended to us at the perfect time; turning a potentially negative experience into a positive one. I eat out 3 nights  a week and how she manages such a large popular venue truly stands out!  I'll be back soon.

This place is excellent.  Working near hear and are there four times in the last. Purple of weeks.  Berkshire pork chop is excellent.  Ravioli's are large.  The Vermont Cider is the best I have ever had. Highly recommended.

With the healthy kale nested breakfast choices on the menu I had the Huevos to order something big, the Rancheros. Framed by a hot bake dish and neighboring black coffee I forked my way through a medley of textural flavors and fueled my downtown power walk.

I have officially found my favorite brunch spot in nyc! I absolutely love everything about this place! My friend and I didn't have reservations, but despite the long line, it was only a 20 min wait. For brunch, I would highly recommend the grapefruit brulee, the honey braised beets, blueberry cornmeal griddle cakes, and roasted broccoli rabe and provolone scramble. I can't stop thinking about our epic, mouthwatering meal and can't wait to go back!

I'm not breakfast and brunch person so it's hard for me to rate. However Cook Shop have brunch menu that's absolutely delicious. I got the poached egg with mushrooms. It tasted like fresh farm food. Loved it!
No comment

I had a wonderful lunch with my friends yesterday.  I didn't get a chance to ask the waiter's name but his friendly and professional service is worth mentioning.  His recommendation on main dishes and desserts were right on.  I LOVED the chicken salad.  It's not an ordinary salad.  Juicy and perfectly seasoned rotisserie chicken on top of fresh greens with beets, walnuts and golden raisins tasted amazing!  Lemon meringue was one of the best.  Overall, it was  a pleasant experience and can't wait to go back!
Some of my favorite places in Manhattan!! Food and ambience are both great, my always go-to when friends come visit me in town
No comment
No comment

Freshest, most delicious meal I have had in Manhattan. Wild caught salmon, skin cooked crisp with preciseness, on a bed of thinly sliced watermelon, drip of yogurt, rockmelon (cantelope), and I am not too sure what else because of the rate that it disappeared. Also tried some of my friend's fish, which had an amazing eggplant puree.
The food was great. We had ordered Huvevos Ranchos and the raisin french toast both of them were really good. Would definitely go back again.
The food here is excellent and the service is fantastic.  Had a birthday party and the staff was very accommodating.  I would definitely go back again.

We were a party of 4, went there just before Christmas for lunch. We were seated promptly despite a line and the service was very good. I had the mushroom broth with poached eggs for starter - wow, it was so simple yet packed with flavor. It has been 2 months and I still remember the dish! Definitely a place worth going back.
No comment

Good service & cocktails.  Subpar grubs.  Lacking flavor across the board - we tried a little bit of everything - not one dish was good.

Keeping this short and sweet: super cute place with outdoor seating, incredibly friendly staff ( although they checked up on us way too often), great concise menu, high quality ingredients, and nice spin on old classic dishes. Prices were reasonable too. But why only 4 stars? I don't know for me the place has to have something very unique and special about it and while this place was an all around great restaurant it was missing a wow factor. I would recommend getting the trout fish entree or the mixed grill entree. The vegetable aioli starter and blackberry pavlova meringue dessert were good choices too.
No comment
Amazing brunch and fantastic service. Save room for dessert - some of the best in the city! I come here whenever I am in town for a fresh juice cocktail and an all around delicious meal.

Overrated and expensive. My drink was half full and $14. Food was mediocre. Hostess was rude and we were sat 20 min after our reservation time. Waitress was nice and the place itself was lovely. Overall just not impressed. Lots of other better places out there.

Rarely do I find a place where everything I order is delicious.  From the beet salad with spiced pumpkin seeds, to the deviled eggs, crisped potatoes, to perfectly cooked and seasoned fish and chicken entrees.  It was such a delight to stumble upon this place for dinner.  We didn't have a reservation, but they offered to seat us at tables in the bar area which worked out just fine.  The person taking care of us did a great job of answering questions and helped us to come up with some options for our kids (which worked out great).   Couldn't have been a better ending to our day in NYC!

Cookshop is a great place for brunch. We had to wait about an hour because we didn't make reservations, but the brunch cocktails were on point. As where the entrees. A tad overpriced, but delicious nonetheless. Try the BLT Mary for an out of the box cocktail.
No comment

As we were driving home, my husband wanted to stop and get brunch. I looked on yelp and it pointed me here. Parking is pretty ok around the area and we were greeted warmly but with a 40 minute wait. We decided to wait it out as the place was packed (always a good sign) and we liked how chic the ambience felt. The hostess said we would get a text when the table was ready so we went for a walk (highline is right across the street). From the crowd, the yelp reviews and how popular the place was, I was anticipating a lot. I liked the eggs and my husband liked his plate. I agree that the chef likes his salt but the service was nice, attentive and overall a nice experience but VERY BUSY. I think I would def. come back and have dinner here or a drink.

Customer service is solid. This place is always busy, but I've been lucky a few times and been able to walk in and sit down almost immediately. Perfect for a couple or family who wants a nice brunch then stroll the highline.
No comment

Well, my party of five for an anniversary was a bust.  We arrived at 6:25 for a 6:30 reservation.  We were sat immediately.  I called around 3 to have a bottle of champagne waiting for us on the table when we arrived.  It was not.  The beginning of bad bad service, for over three hours.  The waiter tried to save things several times but he could not save Appetizers that took over a half an hour to get delivered, dinner 45 minutes later, with only three of the five dishes arriving, waiting 5 minutes for the fourth, and more than 10 for the fifth.  In fairness, the food was all great, with the three appetizers being incredible.  The waiter knew that he dropped the ball on the entrees so he got long blond haired manager to help out (David?).  He did what he could but by the time the firth entree was brought out most of the rest were cold.  The Steak was sent back and then came out too tough and overdone.  He was actually wonderful, offering to take the steak off and giving us desserts, so in that sense tried to redeem the evening. It was too little too late.  I love this place and have had several wonderful meals here but Monday night they really failed us.  When your bill is 300+, and a restaurant of this calibur, the things that went wrong should have not.  Very disappointed in what should have been a positive memorable dinner.
No comment

Very solid brunch spot! Based on previous yelp reviews, I ordered the huevos rancheros and was not disappointed! My friends all got either the brisket hash or the poached eggs and their portions were a lot smaller than mine (or mine was bigger than theirs) so I was really stuffed afterwards! I had the BLT bloody mary as well, which was spicier than most bloody mary's, but I like them that way. The place was full on a Sunday morning so I would definitely recommend making a reservation if you can.

Best food I've had in NYC! I don't get out much, but I still think this food is objectively delicious. Shared gingerbread pancakes and huevos rancheros - ideal combo. Stuck with the Mexican theme and topped it off with a spiced apple margarita :) 50 minute wait on a Saturday around 11 a.m. but well worth it as the highline is across the street and they text when the table is ready.
No comment

Cookshop is amazing!! You definitely have to order "right" though. The first couple of times I went I thought it was average because I was definitely ordering wrong. Go for the waiters' recommendations, the roast chicken, wine and mushroom app were on point!!"
No comment
Such an amazing brunch!  We had the blt bloody Mary's and they were perfect!  The French toast and the poached eggs with hummus were unbelievable. One of the best brunches we've had!
No comment

We called to make a reservation on a Saturday morning and were told that we can come in and wait for a while to be seated. When we got there the ladies at the front desk were so ridiculous and questioned us when we said that our friends were parking! Would never go there again!

Staff was friendly, food was a little dry but all in all was good. Mimosas were very yummy and food came out fast. Our waiter was nice. We waited about and hour and a half to be seated on a busy Sunday but were able to walk around and they texted us when it was ready so that was very convenient! Ambiance was also nice.
Talk about a great experience...amazing food, incredible humans with amazing service. If you come, ask for Bandit Monday at the bar... he will take care of you!

Chelsea restaurant with good food and beautiful people. I enjoyed my trout and tried my friend's chicken dish (quite a large portion there). The berry pot pie was also yummy. Good scene and overall a good experience.

The brunch here is awesome, and we were able to get a seat without reservations, although there was a 30 minute wait. It was definitely worth the wait. We shared a cinnamon roll (rich, fluffy, syrupy and gone in seconds) and I had an omelette for my entree, with broccoli rabe and a biscuit. The biscuit I loved, the eggs and vegetables not so much. But then again, I am really picky and I like my eggs cooked more. We were seated in a booth near the front of the restaurant, which left something to be desired because I would rather have been seated in the main room, away from all of the people waiting in line. I noticed that some of the lunch items looked to-die-for, particularly the fries. I would come back again, especially because it is walking distance from the highline.

This place was average.  It gets a lot of hype and I definitely didn't see why.  We came for brunch around 12 on a Sunday, so we expectedly waited 1 hour.  Once seated, the waiter took our order.  The kitchen messed up our order so we watched while the table next to us got their meals even though they arrived after us.  Then the waiter came out with what we thought was our food....nope! Completely messed up the order so again sent it back.  It was another 1.5 hours until we got our food.  He did bring us a round of free drinks to hold us over.  Once the food arrived, I noticed my omelet was sitting in a puddle of oil.  The food was okay, not terrible, but not amazing as we expected.

Had a late lunch here  on MLK (Monday). The place was packed. Ordered the ginger margarita which was good but had a little too many seeds and pulp for my liking (hard to drink). We split the figs appetizer which was delicious and then both got the chicken with salad. Really great. I hadn't been here in quite some time so I was glad that it was as delicous as I remembered.

I want to love Cookshop but the constant wait and overcrowding is making it very hard. However if you are patient enough to stick it out the food will absolutely make up for it. Whether dinner or brunch, never had a dish that I didn't enjoy. But that being said, is it worth the wait? Not really.
This place is always a solid choice with revolving seasonal menu.  I've never had a bad meal here.  My goto is always the brick oven pizza no matter the season!
No comment

Happy to report that Jesse from Cookshop reached out to me in order to follow up on my experience at the restaurant.  He offered his apologies and asked for the chance to make it right.  Very professional and much appreciated.

Attended Cookshop around 2 pm on a Saturday for brunch. The wait was approximately 35 minutes so we ended up walking around until they texted us notifying us that our table was ready. I ordered the watermelon mojito as my cocktail and I must say not only was it delicious, it was also hella strong! For our entree, both my friend and I ordered the huevos rancheros with a side of bacon and a biscuit (sides were to split.) The huevos rancheros was DELICIOUS! Probably the best I've ever had. I was definitely part of the clean plate club with this dish. The biscuit was also top notch...the jelly? AH-MAZING! The bacon...was....not good at all. It was overcooked, burnt and extra, extra, extra CRISPY. I love me some bacon and I wasn't even able to eat it. No bueno. Aside from the bacon, the seating is crazy close. I get it, they want to fit as many people in this bad boy as possible. You kind of feel like you're on top of each other. The service was great! Our bill came up to $80...so it was a little pricey for brunch. I'm definitely going to return! The next time I'll request a booth and better bacon.
Last weekend we had  breakfast, lunch and brunch in a three day span. All three servers were well versed in the menu and attentive. The food quality is high, and the food prep is imaginative.
Great brunch. Delicious bloody marys
Huevos rancheros, French toast, and Bloody Marys are great. The wait is extremely long for brunch if you don't have a reservation. My favorite NYC brunch spot.

I had drinks at the bar two weeks ago late in the afternoon with some small bites. The bartender was great the drinks were top notch along with the little bites. I returned that Saturday night to what ended up being an amazing dinner from start to finish with great service from our waiter, wines that showed the care and passion in choosing what should be on the list ( sommelier is also a wine maker I was told) and the food  I can't write what I felt about the food in words it wouldn't do it justice but I'll try! Fresh,cooked to perfection and flavors that you need to experience the food blew us away and then they had the nerve to bring over these mini donuts that pushed us over the edge. There was an amazing green salad on the table, a fresh burrata that melted in your mouth, main course - chicken dish you haven't tasted a chicken like this  so moist and a flavor profile any chicken dish before this  doesn't count anymore, a lamb burger that was f@&ken outstanding and a Steak that was better please don't repeat this better than most Steak houses. We sat outside because the place was jam packed for good reason and we had a wonderful late dinner. We had fun enjoying everything! I even ordered an espresso at the end of the meal that can ruin everything at most restaurants but it was perfect and closed the deal that this is one of my favorite restaurants in NYC that I would recommend to everyone who loves food , good wine ,nice friendly service and the price was less then I expected but don't tell the owners that - Amazing dinner great waiter that gave perfect recommendations !!!!

A very convivial place with excellent food; the mushroom broth was a winter delight, and the lamb meatloaf very tasty and cooked with just the right amount of spices; a lovely 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon made a delicious pairing; the staff were attentive and very friendly; the only let-down: a little bit too much noise to enjoy a proper conversation.

I had a great time at Cookshop. I had a delicious vegetarian dish, Mezze, that was like a deconstructed Mediterranean salad. Really, really good. Wine list and cocktails were also unique and interesting.
Great service, really good food. Had tons of all dishes and loved all of them.  Outside patio is beautiful.  A must do in NYC!
No comment

No comment
No comment
The brussel sprout pizza was delicious as was the raw vegetable salad! Service was way too slow though.

Right by High Line.  Good thing we had a reservation for bruch - this place was hopping.  Beautiful interior.  Beignets better than the originals in NOLA.  Nice bloody marys w a generous pour.  Delicious entres.  Solid sevice.  On the expenssive side but seemed worth it.

I could go on and on, but instead I'll just say this was the absolute *best* meal I have ever had in NYC. It's a bit loud inside, and the view outside isn't the best...but it's calmer & quieter outside. Moreover, you are right across the street from the entrance to the High Line. Go here for the best, freshest seasonal dishes in the city and service to match. Worth every cent!
Came here on a date- such great food and wine. Definitely a new go to.

Delicious brunch, and friendly service! I recommend making a reservation, which we did for opening time 10:30 and got right in, but by the time we left the place was PACKED with people waiting! Probably not worth a lengthy wait given that there's other good food in the neighborhood, but I'd wait 20 minutes for it and I like that they take reservations for brunch. Delicious. I loved the beet salad. Next time I'm trying the burger, it looked incredible.
Great brunch spot with a light airy ambiance. The brunch dishes are great - had the kale bowl and huevo rancheros are always amazing. Can get busy on weekends for brunch.

Very busy brunch spot that is perfect for a lazy Sunday morning. Food and drinks are decent. I tried the huevos rancheros after reading reviews on yelp, and it definitely did not disappoint. If you sit outside on a hot sunny day, be careful where they seat you --- the umbrellas don't do a good job covering the entire patio area, and if you're unlucky enough to have to sit in the sun you'll be roasted by the end of your brunch!
No comment

I had brunch here and I was expecting so much more from the recommendations and reputation.  I had the huevos rancheros and my gf had the scrambled eggs with smoked trout.  Neither of us finished our meals.  Never coming back.
ONe of the best dinners I have had in ages.  The staff was so nice and accomodating.  I love that everything is fresh from the farm, so healthy.  Definetly will be goign back.

Great portion size. The turkey sandwich was massive. The chicken, kale salad was ok. Didn't think the uncooked carrots went well with it. We didn't have dessert but we heard the two guys next to us talking about how yummy their white chocolate sorbet was. Good selection of cocktails. Service was good but the food took a while to get to us. A fun crowd.

I have been coming here for awhile since I live in the neighborhood.  Recently one afternoon I witnessed a gentleman who I believe had a managerial role be rude to a young woman who was applying for a position in the restaurant.  This was a complete turnoff.  Plenty of other restaurants in the area with equally good food but better manners.  No reason for that kind of attitude.
No comment

No comment
No comment

This place is so overrated...it's actually a shame how many people get suckered into the hype.  Two stars being given for average food and somehow no wait time for a table on a Friday evening.  We ordered an appetizer which never came because our server completely forgot to put in the order.  With close to no apology, we finished our entrees as quickly as we could and went next door to the lovely Fillmore Room for desserts and drinks.

Don't know why the Yelpers were so off on this one.  The menu looks great, but the execution is school-cafeteria worthy at best.  Overcooked meat literally swimming in oily water.  Completely uninspired.
No comment
Best brunch spot in Chelsea - no question.  Not tacky like most of the place on 8th ave.  Great food, solid bloody marys.  Be prepared to wait a while during peak hours, as it gets very crowded.

We have eaten here on a previous trip to NYC and enjoyed the food and service (4 stars). On this trip, we tried to go twice. Once on Thursday at 10:45 and once on Monday at 9am. On Thursday, they were between breakfast and lunch service and were only serving drinks. On Monday (Columbus Day) they were not open for breakfast and were not going to be opening until 10:30 for brunch. Sigh. We ended up at Chelsea market both days. You might make sure they are open and serving when you want to go.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Unpretentious,  flavors that u cannot recreate in your own kitchen while it feels like you're dining with family, wine in the righteous true tradition of the sport, fresh and airy comfort.  Expensive though.

came for brunch when visiting friends for the weekend. Food was great, hefty portions. I didnt mind the slower service since we spent the whole meal catching up and could tell they were wanting us to leave after we paid our tab. My bloody mary was a meal in itself. This place is on all the lists to go to in chelsea for a reason :)
This place was good, nothing amazing but all the food was good. I had the steak, and crab. I think one of the best things was the mustard chicken wings. Id come here again.

Came here for a girls night and loved it. Food was excellent and mirrored the fresh new American style food I've had in LA. Cocktails are also awesome, and the popcorn Sundae dessert tastes like caramel corn...I'll definitely be back!
No comment
No comment

We were looking for a spot to have a nice breakfast, and on my search Cookshop popped up. I called and they said that the wait would be anywhere from 15 min to an hour. We decided to take the ride and see what happens. Luck was definitely on our side this beautiful (and extremely hot) sunday. We got there before 10:30 and found parking right in front of the place. The day was off to a good start already. We walked in and were seated immediately. Not long after, the place started to pack in!! My girl had the huevos rancheros and i have to say they were pretty yummie. i'm not a huge fan of beans for brkfst but they were good. I had the cookshop scramble. The caramelized onions and bacon paired perfectly with the beautiful fluffy eggs and the biscuit. I had the cherry ginger limeade which i loved. Very bright and refreshing. Mine was so good that i don't remember what my girl got. lol. A little pricey, but it's NYC. Definitely would not mind coming back to Cookshop! ENJOY!

I went there for my friend's BD dinners! All the food that we ordered was great!! It's busy restaurant but people works there are very attentive. Great service and great food! Thank you so much! I'll def going back!
Amazing all around!!! The atmosphere, food was so flavorful and delicious, plus outstanding customer service. My new favorite place to go!!! Can't wait to go back!!!

This place was good but not great. The tomato soup was great and the peach sorbet was excellent. The salad was lacking in freshness and flavor. The service was good, very nice folks. I would go back if i lived nearby but would not travel from another neighborhood for it.

Went there today with a couple of friends. They had a bad selection of menu mainly comprising of eggs. I ordered quiche which was kind of under-cooked. My friend ordered poached egg that he didnt even like..i wont return for sure. Also i could see something moving in my water glass, though the waitress changed it after i complained. Overpriced and not worth it.
Exceptional meal, outstanding service and star treatment after a little twitter mention. Small plates were delicious, main course was prompt well planned and executed incredibly. We will be back.

Disappointed after the reviews.  We came here on a Wednesday night with a late reservation for after a Wine Tasting event.  We had to leave the event a little early to make our reservation and then we were not seated for over half an hour.  Translate, someone does not know how to do reservations, or they put someone else in as a favor.  Then then squeezed 6 at a table for 4.  They tried to ameliorate us with a glass of Proseco, and when the table next to us left they expanded us to what we should have been set up with in the first place, but its a case of too little too late.  The food was extremely average.  Most things were very salty and the Cassoulet was anything but - just things dropped on a bed of beans and poorly prepared at that.  Maybe brunch is better, but we will avoid it in the future for dinner.

i live on the upper west and have heard a lot about "cookshop".....a lot of good things (needless to say) and the place doesn't disappoint......it is quite spectacular.......not to mention the servers were also fantastic.....i had the pleasure of cheryl serving us and she is jus the best.....sooo passionate about her work and sooo helpful in making our experience more enjoyable.....not to mention, there is also, carrie, steph, marie and ryan who also deserve recognition......they, like cheryl, are quite nice and a nice representation of the cookshop brand......thanks cheryl for making this such a great experience......much appreciated....

Love this restaurant! They earn 5 stars for being extremely considerate of unusual food allergies. They don't just tell you want you want to hear. If they aren't sure, they'll tell you but for the most part they do know exactly what ingredients are in everything. This is one of the few places I can eat, have great choices and know I won't get sick!

Got in easily without reservations for an early Sunday night meal. Server was very pleasant but a little inattentive. We shared vegetable empanadas and flatbread. Both were delicious! Ambience was festive but not too loud for conversation.
No comment

I cannot remember if I reviewed this before or not so I will keep this short and say that the food, service and atmosphere are perfection! Wish I had tried dessert but was too full. You won't be disappointed by Cookshop.
No comment
No comment
Lovely brunch menu! Enjoyed a delicious omelette with squash and kale. Great (attentive) service. A very neighborhood feel.
Eh it's okay. Not really worth the wait for the food but the Bloody Mary is great.  It's near a fun area so it might be worth it to put your name down and walk around.

Went for brunch and the food was great. I highly recommend the smoked bluefish plate (though they really should give more of the toast and fixings.) The three stars are mostly for the rest of the experience. For a place that gets a lot of business, they just seemed unprepared. Our coffee came out after the food. Our waiter was hard to find. There was no pepper in the grinder--or the one at the table next to us. The bathroom was untidy. And it wasn't even peak brunch time. I expected more.
Great food! Even better service!!! They were so nice and helpful when trying to accommodate my baby's needs. Made the dining experience so wonderful!  Thanks guys!!!!!
No comment
No comment
No comment
Excellent brunch! Good bloody Mary's as well as huevo rancheros. Would absolutely come back.

Wow - walking by and caught our eye .  Food was wonderful.  Salad greens didn't need dressing - crispy calamari was fantastic and not standard rings -  my wife had mezza plate which was delicious and I nailed the "nicoise" tuna. Perfect piece of fish.

Cookshop is great! It keeps getting better and better. They aren't afraid to change the menu with the seasons, and quality is great. It's best for dinner, but lunch service is good too. The desserts are amazing, and Richard is an amazing Sommelier. I always feel welcomed and have a great time even though it's a busy place. Make your reservations days in advance.

I never write reviews for places but I have to say this place was AMAZING! I came two days in a row and ordered the same thing...the breakfast bowl. I asked for no cheese and sub egg whites. Flavor was amazing and I can't rave any more. Definitely a new go to for in the city.

Great foods actually. I like their foods. Especially the egg sandwiches were very good. I'm very much satisfied with their hospitality also. I can still feel the taste of their food. Hope, I'll go there again.
Bloody Marys are back on track and tasty again! They're still not quite as banging as they were before, but still some of the better ones in the city that I've tried. This place redeemed itself. :)
Excellent service, impeccable wine pairing, delicious food. Felt cared for start to finish, despite the popularity.

What is there to say about Cookshop that hasn't already been said. The food is divine. The service is impeccable. The cocktails are out of this world. I hate that they change the menu because old favorites disappear but I love that they change the menu because I get to fall in love with new delicacies. The only thing that kills me is how packed it can get but hey, it's not good, ITS GREAT!!!

Delicious food and friendly service. Sometimes feels a bit pricey but all in all really like the casual environment if you're meeting up with friends and family. Would recommend making a reservation in advance as this place can have a bit of a wait...
Came here for breakfast on a Saturday. Had to wait 30 minutes but it was worth it. Service with a smile and pretty good food.
No comment

Steady Monday lunch crowd. Slower at the bar where I always tend to sit solo. Service was fast and friendly but maybe don't sit by the service bar. Us fellow service industry people hear everything :) mezze salad was perfect size and tons of different flavors. Bread that comes w  on point.
The Huevos Rancheros is on point here, amongst other things! There could be a long wait, but seating is open at the bar!

My favorite brunch spot in the city! Very trendy and loud however not loud to the point where you can't hold a convo...great staff. The drinks are delicious and they have the BEST huevos rancheros ever!!!! One of the more creative brunch menus..their pastry selections are def a must have. Love it!
Great brunch food! While you are waiting, you can get a great cup of coffee at the Intelligentsia truck across the street.
No comment

The receipt came with a handwritten tip amount  below the total price, "tips $10.xx" for lunch cost $50+tax. That means they charged us 20% tip on top of food and tax. The server didn't even return the exact change, keeping the coins for themselves (are they so poor that they have to steal the change?). We only had three people and to charge the tips arbitrarily is rude. Tips should be given voluntarily based on satisfaction with food and service.

Always the most courteous. The menu never disappoints. We live in the neighborhood and Cookshop was the very first restaurant we took our twins to eat at. The staff is amazing, especially if you have children. Always accommodating with an ever changing menu. We met Carey the manager this evening and her staff clearly follow her lead. If you're on the highline or just passing through Chelsea this is a must eat spot. Lucky for us we live nearby.

Pretty solid dining experience, but nothing really stood out in any regard.  The best part of the experience was our waiter, I would come back to try their brunch, but wouldn't necessarily come back for dinner.

We are staying at the Highline Hotel across the street, and so we jumped over to Cookshop for lunch. We had deviled eggs, chicken liver pate, the grass-fed hamburger, and the lamb pita. Everything was great. The service was excellent too. The first day of the year where it felt warm enough to eat al fresco, and we had a great view of the highline!
Tip was added fraudulently to my bill - will never go again and wouldn't recommend going.
No comment
Nice spot to have brunch. Me and my gf spent our Valentine's day here love the luv bunz....

So great! Staff amazing! Grreat space! Great food! Been there about five times and never a bad experience. Get there at 10:30 Sarurday or Sunday otherwise u will wait a very long time!!! They use locally sourced food. Authentic farm to table!!

Could only get a 3pm reservation for brunch here.  Got to sit outside on a beautiful day.  Good thing the weather was great and the people with their dogs were cute, because the food left something to be desired.  I got the huevos rancheros, but the eggs were watery-ish.  I had a bite of my friend's sausage and egg sandwich and wish that I had gotten that instead.   I'd go back for that.  Or dinner.
Really good farm to table restaurant in Chelsea with very welcoming staff. High sense of selection of products. From staters to dessert, every single dish is always a good surprise.

There are very few restaurants that have impressed me recently, and this is one of them.  I think their pork chop is divine and the other dishes just as good.  I find the servings to be too big to enjoy both an appetizer and a meal, but I can always take some food home, so why complain.  If you can't get a reservation, try showing up to get a spot at the bar.  They have pretty good cocktails too.
No comment

I'm sort of surprised, because everyone's reviews are excellent.  Maybe we went on an off night?  The sommelier was strangely rude (she brought a bottle of wine in place of the one we ordered, allowed us to try it, and when we said we didn't care for it, she walked away), and the service was really slow.  The bread was great, the starters were good, but my main, the scallops were not so great (I didn't love the tomato sauce, but the fennel was good).  Beyond the funky service issues, I just felt like the tastes weren't really satisfying.  I felt like there was something missing from our meal.  The bread pudding was good, though.  As were the deviled eggs.  Sad!  I wish it had been better!

My friend has been wanting to try the Cookshop for a while now so we checked it out tonight during my stay in NY. I was extremely impressed with the entire meal. The service was phenomenal- they started by bringing out complimentary appetizers for absolutely no reason(delicious devil eggs and fried zucchini). For our appetizer we decided to on the Florida shrimp after reading the raving reviews on Yelp. I had scallops for my entree and thought it was very good. My friends tried the tuna steak, swordfish, and chicken- everyone was more than pleased. The table next to us ordered french fries that looked too good to pass up so we also ordered a basket of fries for the table- they were probably the best thing we ordered! We stayed after our meal so we could all enjoy a glass of wine and chat...the waiter was so nice that he didn't even charge us for our last round of drinks.  I would highly recommend Cookshop to anyone in NY and suggest they order a basket of fries with their meal!
Ok but nothing astounding. maybe I was expecting something more after all the fantastic reviews.

I've been here for brunch twice and I'm leaning more towards a 3.5 for this place.  While the food is good and consistent, it wasn't anything that really blew me away.  My favorite part of my brunch was my delicious bloody mary.  Another great plus is that this is one of the few spots in NY that takes reservations for brunch.  Since there are so many other great brunch spots in NY that are the same price, I could only give this place a 3.5.  Nothing here is bad, but it's just not as good as others.

Great food, great service all around - host, bartender, waiter. The Special Pork Chop had sold out just before we ordered, so I will not be reviewing the Special Pork Chop. Arrrrrgh. Sidecar - very good, oysters - very good, scallops - very good. 'Nuff said. Enjoy.
No comment
Sunday brunch was great! The pancakes were amazing and the bloody marys were fantastic. Not too spicy; just perfect.

One of my favorite places for brunch!  The food is consistently good, the service is always friendly and they make a great bloody mary!  The menu changes seasonally.  Had the poaches eggs with slow cooked brisket and idaho hash...and I would have licked the plate if I wasn't out to eat. :-)

One of my favorite brunch spots in the city.  A little bit of a wait never hurt anyone, right?  You can't go wrong with their menu, and the outdoor seating welcomes the cool Chelsea air while you and your friends enjoy yet another boozy brunch.

We went to Cookshop for Brunch on Saturday.  The drink list is great!  I had a breakfast mojito, and it was just what I wanted...fruity, citrusy, with a nice bite at the finish.  The atomosphere at Cookshop is wonderful.  I loved the fresh flowers and clean lines of the restaurant itself.  For starters, I had the yogurt and cucumber soup and my husband had a rabbit and toast point dish.  I loved my soup, and I stole some of the toast points from my husbands' dish for dipping.  He liked his dish, but didnt rave about it.  I had the frittata for my main dish, and he had a swordfish burger.  My frittata was a bit bland, but I prefer that over being too salty.  Doug liked his swordfish burger, but his fries were divine!  I would go back for the fries alone.  Decent wait staff, nice place to go.  I would go back.
No comment
No comment

Hands down best brunch in my hood. My sister and me love the decor and food here. The Huevo Rancheros are huge and absolutely delish. Their applewood smoked bacon is a necessity. Their biscuits are huge and flaky and buttery. All the food is very fresh. The cocktails are pretty yummy.
Love this place. Fabulous warm service, very, very yummy food, reasonable wine list.  The place is small so you are packed in but the energy is good.  DON'T skip dessert!

Just went here for lunch, the staff was very attentive, it was a bit cold where we were sitting by the door. I had the scallop tacos with pineapple salsa. It was amazing. Everyone was happy with their meals. : )
The cocktails are on POINT. The deviled eggs with salmon roe were killer. Good bread that comes with your meal. My salad was just ok, but everything else made up for it!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Very solid brunch at Cookshop.  It was packed on a Sunday and there was a long wait which wasn't a big deal because we were standing next to Professor Severus Snape (f/k/a Hans Gruber).  I wanted to ask him if he was here for brunch so that he could respond, "OBBB-VI-OUS-LY."  But alas we were seated.  Back to the food...it was great.  My wife had huevos rancheros which has got to be their signature brunch dish.  I had the poached eggs with housemade sausage and polenta in some molasses-reduced-broth that was drinkable.   The brunch cocktails were inventive and perfectly done.  Despite the overall energy and level of activity at Cookshop we felt perfectly comfortable and entitled to sit there for a couple of hours and enjoy ourselves.  I'll definitely be back.

Wish I had something better to say. I went on a friday night with my girlfriend- sat at the bar- ordered a few drinks and a pizza and salad. Drinks were good but it was so slow.  The pizza was pretty bad- I ate the crust off part of it and girlfriend had a salad.  How bad can a pizza with veggies be?  well I was hungry and not able to eat it.  Maybe I had the wrong thing that night.

Wonderful experience for Sunday brunch today. The wait was SHORTER than we were expecting!! Food was delicious, loved the creative choices. Very good service, great coffee. I liked sitting outside, though it was a bit chilly.
No comment
No comment

The decor is nice and the wait staff is nicer. We had the fried donuts which were really good. I also had huevos rancheros and coffee and those weren't that great. It wasn't bad but nothing to rave at. I'd come back to give them another shot based on the otherwise positive experience I had.

Met a friend for brunch had a pretty enjoyable experience. Since it was a Sunday and this is NYC tables were not readily available but we were able to snag a couple of seats at the bar. Service was excellent and the bartender was very attentive. My meal was okay but that might be because I was hungover and didn't have many taste buds firing that morning. I would give it another shot maybe for dinner.

I like this place a lot! The menu has a lot to offer and there are a lot of tables for seating. It appeared to be quite popular as there was a huge crowd of people waiting for a table. We both loved our meal! Walk a block to the Highline afterward! So fun!
No comment

Went here for dinner with a coworker. Super affordable, and the service was great. The server was very patient with us, and gave us great recommendations for all three courses. The restaurant ambience was perfect--they dimmed the light every half hour or so. I still remember that blueberry crumble from dessert. YUM YUM.
No comment
No comment

I went here for dinner during some time in town. I read the reviews, checked out the menu and everything looked ok. Well... I had a reservation and was able to it at the bar which was nice. The bartender was great. She knew the drink menu well and I was able to order something that wouldn't aggravate a food allergy (yes, I'm special). I had a ginger margarita that was delicious. For my starter I had the french onion soup which was delicious but a tad on the salty side. I had the sasso chicken for my main which was juicy but the seasoning was off - one bite of the chicken was a salt lick and another lacking seasoning all together. For dessert I had their tangerine sorbet which was just missing something. Nice room, good cocktails, great service, eh food..

We are visiting from S.F. And are food/wine/cocktail picky. To start with the bartenders were great, knowledgeable, friendly, and had great recommendations. The food was great too.  The only thing keeping this from being a four star review was that our 8:45 reservation became a 9:05 seating....  Did I mention how great the bar staff was?
No comment
No comment

This review is for brunch.  I LOVED the beignets as an appetizer and my pancakes were terrific but my husband's scrambled eggs were pretty mediocre and dry (he's sitting beside me saying "three stars, babe!  Three stars!) but I'm judging them by what I ordered and I think they're a 4.  I would give Cookshop another shot for dinner sometime.

Okay, so in short...if you want to read an "exploratory" Menu, eat Mediocre food and spend a lot of Money then go to Cookshop.  Seriously the only things our party loved was the wine and the chocolate chip cookies.  They should probably change their name to Cook"ie"shop.  It won't cost them much to rebrand.
Sweet sigh of a happy belly. The rabbit with gnocchi and roasted carrots -- heavenly.
Service excellent. Farm to table food pricey but very good. The cheese grits were fantastic!
Food is delicious. Also expensive. Outdoor seating is very nice, the waitstaff is terrific, and the indoor seating nice. Always busy at lunch. The desserts are also good, you should try one.
No comment

Dinner was awesome tonight!  We got there a little early and had a drink at the bar, which was great and the bartender was really awesome.  Definitely try the Ginger-Tangerine Margarita.  Our food was really good, great flavor and the entrees were the perfect portion.  The only reason I'm giving a 4-star review is because of the service.  Our waiter was OK but kind of a dud.  I asked for recommendations and what he personally liked and it was like he didn't really know the menu.  Other than that, all was great and would definitely go again.

One of the best brunch.. We had to wait for almost 70 minutes although they said 50 minutes. But they gave us complimentary champagne to make up for the extra wait. Food is awesome.. We had the french toast, scrambled egg (with bacon) and pancakes.. Their bloody mary selection is good. We also had that amazing bottled Cucumber drink which we are gonna buy on amazon now.. Overall the food is awesome, service excellent and slightly pricey but worth the wait...
