We ate breakfast here twice. Everything we ate was above average average in quality and flavor. The breakfast menu is a bit more interesting than your average breakfast menu. We ate different things both visits and everything was amazing. Get a side of grits, they are so good.

Ok this was an interesting experience. *Sparkling wine is complementary (yay) *the food list is small (boo) *the plates are super pricey for the serving size (boo) *Do not bring picky kids (yay - date night) *the steak skewers are AMAZING (yay) *the Cesar salad is ok - just ask that the anchovies be taken off ;) (interesting flavors)

Great place for a casual hearty meal.  Awesome casual ambience... a really nice open and airy space (always a rare find in NYC) space with high ceilings and lots of windows.  Brunch was yummy, esp the chilaquiles (similar to huevos rancheros), the mascarpone stuffed french toast was a bit too rich... must get the beignets next time.  Can't wait to try their dinner menu.

Our waiter was the best part of our brunch at Cookshop, although the food was equally enjoyable.  He was so nice and friendly, funny, and was so welcoming to all the patrons.  I love the decor of the place--a little swanky without being too pretentious, definitely a casual place that you don't need to be dressed up to be seen in.   My girlfriend and I really savored the warm jelly doughnut  appetizer, and I was in love with my cornmeal pancakes served with pears.  We'll definitely be back for another meal next time we're in town.

Went here for Easter Brunch last April and just reviewing it now. Everything my friends and I ate was delicious. Loved my French toast, loved the lamb stew, cocktails were great. Just a bit too pricey. Just don't see why. It is Chelsea, but who knows? Either way. A good place and definitely a great brunch, just wish it were a litttttttle bit cheaper. There are better brunch deals in the East Village and worth the trek for all of you who live on the West side.
No comment

I am in love with Cookshop, definitely one of the best restaurant openings of last year (2005). I guess I'd describe the food a modern take on American home cooking, but that doesn't really explain it. We tried the succulent pork chop and the rib eye, oh my, definitely one of the best I've had in years.
No comment

Cookshop is still going strong in my book.  Its not the type of place where you pop in unannounced - if you do, expect a wait.  If you have enough foresight, be sure to book your table in advance on opentable.
No comment

LOVE it when great places take reservations on OpenTable. Love it more when the place has a delicious, inventive menu with a banana split sundae to boot. A go-to spot on my rotation. Cool that its across from a HighLIne entrance.
No comment

We had an outstanding Sunday brunch here.  Ravished, I practically inhaled the House Smoked pork tenderloin with polenta, poached eggs and gravy and I wanted to inhale my sister's dish too, which was off the charts...our favorite: Poached Eggs, Ham, Grilled Rye Bread, and three cheese fondue.  soooooo good.  Among the other things I would have loved to try: Buttermilk fried baby chicken, Huevos Rancheros, Cheesy grits, buttermilk beignets, warm jelly donut, cinnamon bun, and pear pecan coffee cake.  I bet the Grass fed burger is the tops too.

I had lunch here when I was in town and decided to give it a try after all the positive reviews here on Yelp.  My expectations were surpassed once our food got to the table.  Though it is a relatively small menu I wasn't upset because every dish I saw coming out of the kitchen looked great and well thought through.  The only thing I would say however is that reservations are needed, even for lunch.  It was empty when I got in but within ten minutes the whole place was packed, I had no idea restaurants could fill up that quickly.

I had the pork chop and cauliflower, the pork was sweet and succulent. My G/F had the Thumper (rabbit) which did not taste like chicken at all ;-) quite good. The waiter was nice but needs to learn how to pour wine, he made a mess of both our glasses when pouring at the table. Save room for desert, I had the trio of sorbet, very good, and my better 1/2 had the pear tart which was amazing!

Mixed. Went for dinner Tuesday night. I enjoy the space, lots of room no one hitting your elbows and not too crowded. They also have a nice bar with more space than most. One of the cocktails, the dark and stormy, we ordered was terrible, didn't have more than a sip. They give plenty of bread before meal which is a plus.  Had a shrimp app which was amazing. The olives app was big enough to split between 10 people I think. The dinners were a bit disappointing. Some of the flavor combinations were strange in the steak dinner. The chicken was very hard to eat and although the swordfish was good it was the only thing that didn't come with a side, and it was then too late to order sides. The homemade ice cream was great! I might come back and try out brunch but other than that not too motivated to return.
Hands down best breakfast/brunch I've ever had. With bloody mary's that'll cure that NYC hangover in a jiffy.
Ingredients were fresh. Very simple food and clean presentation. I wore dark shirt and pants to dinner and I was offered a black napkin which I thought was very cool. Service was quite good.

In short, everything is good, but as someone else said, nothing will blow your mind. There's a tendency for your food to be not what you expected from the menu. The staff is friendly and generally on the ball.  I was afraid that due to the crowd we would be seated late but we were at our table at the desired time! In some ways so glad the west side is shaping up. But mourning the loss of another lower priced hood.
No comment

In addition to its role as pioneer on 10th Avenue, Cookshop is a great neighborhood restaurant. It's as easy to pop in for a drink as it is to have a great Sunday dinner as it is to entertain clients. The menu is not only fresh as promised, it's inventive and fun.

I can't speak for dinner, but Cookshop dishes up an excellent brunch. My friends and I visited this past weekend and were very pleased. To start, we had the beets and the bruleed grapefruit, both of which were delicious and perfect to share. For my entree, I ordered the fritatta with charred sweet corn, which was absolutely delicious. My friends had the brocolli rabe and provolone scramble and the huevos rancheros. The scramble was good, but the rancheros were excellent. I thinkl I would order them next time. The only complaint we had was that the service was a bit slow, especially given that we were there rather early for brunch, but overall it was a wonderful dining experience. I will definitely be back.
Amazing wine list. Had the pork chop on a Fall night in New York that tasted oh so good with golden raisens and sliverred almonds. They play really good music here too. Highly recommend.

I usually stop by for drinks and a meal when hitting up the neighborhood for some Chelsea shopping. Have never been disappointed at Cookshop. Usually a short wait but  drinks at the bar always make time fly. Food is always delicious.

The food was good and the staff was pleasant and attentive. My only complaint about my dish was the onion rings. They were tempura dipped and bland with a doughy consistency. The ice cream was excellent and uniquely flavored.

Excellent for Sunday brunch!  I've wanted to try this place for dinner, but never think ahead to make a res & thus never get in!  But we went for lunch today & really, really enjoyed it!  First of all, they do NOT rush you in and out of the place.  Second, there wasn't a big push to order from the bar - & we're not big drinkers, so that was a pleasant change from many brunch places.  We were thrilled with what we ordered - I, the huevos rancheros.  Came in a large oval cast-iron dish, baked eggs with creme fraiche, salsa, lots & lots of black beans - it was absolutely delicious!  My husband's  spinach & zucchini frittata was also in a cast-iron pan, served w. a mesclun salad.  The iced tea was not watery at all; the waitress was pleasant, efficient, accommodating.  We didn't want the meal to end, so we ordered a currant scone to share, & that, too, was excellent.   We will definitely go back to, & recommend, Cookshop for brunch!

I've now been to the Cookshop 3 times, and each has been excellent. I have had the baked eggs, chicken salad, and kale bowl. All were very good. We also had different pastries, which were amazing. We had to wait awhile for a table, and were given the pastries and mimosas for free, which was very classy and excellent service. I love the open environment and healthy chic feel. This is one of my favorite brunch spots, and of course the Highline right nearby makes it perfect for visitors as well. Highly recommend.
Excellent Service and food...a neighborhood favorite for lunch as well as dinner
No comment

I love the concept of the restaurant...rustic yet sophisticated! Went on a Sunday for brunch, beat the rush and got seated right away. The menu is basic, almost too basic for me. I ordered the Huevos Rancheros since it was a veg dish and they didn't have a lot of options for us non-meateaters. I guess I could of ordered something a la carte but I didn't want to be a pain. The rancheros were good but the eggs seamed a bit over cooked and the cheese was a bit hardened. My friend had the eggs, bacon and toast meal and the toast looked amazing since it was thick-sliced, homemade rustic bread but I didn't get any of that. Service was good but it wasn't super special to me in the end. I would of liked a few more veg items to choose from but hey, they aren't hurting so what do I know.
It's good but unsure of why people rave over it.  I was here once for lunch and another time for brunch.  Nothing I'm rushing to go back to.

This used to be a consistently great brunch spot -- it's recently been solid but not great. My sense is they're now resting on their laurels...and great location (next to the Chelsea Market and the High Line). In any case, it makes for a solid brunch spot in you're in the area, but not one that I'd write home about.

Mediocre! I ordered the Cookshop breakfast with my eggs over medium. When my food came one egg was well done and the other one was over medium. I substituted the grits for the potato hash. Big Mistake! The potatoes were cold. Yuck, nothing worse than cold potatoes. The sausage patty was luke warm. The only good part of my breakfast was the biscuit and raspberry jam. The wait staff was not very attentive. I left 85% of my breakfast on the plate. When the waitress picked up the dish, I informed her it  was cold. She apologized and offered to get me something else. It would have been nice if she would have stopped in sooner. A few minutes later, she returned with the bill. I was perplexed that she hadn't taken anything off since I only ate the eggs and part of the biscuit. She came back with two muffins in a to go bag as an apology. That was a nice gesture, but I didn't want more sugary food. I would rather had a warm meal to start with.
No comment

I had brunch at Cookshop recently and thought it was good.  I'd definitely recommend the egg dishes- they were the best.  I tried the walnut raisin french toast because it sounded different and it was good but unless you really like walnut raisin bread and something sweet for brunch, I'd stick with the eggs.  Also, I tried the beignets but they were gross as was the chocolate banana croissant.  Gross and beignet or croissant should never been in the same sentence together but they are here.  Overall, good service, good atmosphere, and good eggs.
No comment

Had dinner at Cookshop this evening, hadn't been in awhile and decided to try it again. Very disappointing. I orderd the scallops with corn pudding and Persian cucumbers. It was cold, the cucumbers which were piled on tasted more like pickles. They didn't add that freshness you would expect. The three meat dish of lamb, pork belly and steak was smothered in BBQ sauce. Which was unfortunate. Too many great restaurants in the neighborhood to eat here. The service was very good.

I had a late brunch/lunch here and it was worth the wait. I highly recommend getting the pastries. Plus, I love that they offer mocktails! I'm a lightweight and can never really finish a Bloody Mary or a Bellini.  The peach fizz went perfectly with my burger.

Great casual American eatery situated next to the highline. I snagged a late afternoon 3pm reso in Sunday and the place was super packed when I went. I figured 3 was late enough to be not so busy but I guess not! Outdoor seating is plentiful. Brunch menu on weekends. Not a huge menu with a few egg dishes, griddle items, sandwiches, burger salads etc. The chicken liver mousse is ok, but probably should have opted for something else to start. It was literally like a huge scoop with the consistency of mousse but bitter like, chicken liver, like pate and some may not find it too appetizing. I enjoyed my chicken sandwich however and their burgers seem popular (don't forget to top it off with a runny egg). The menu is pretty basic, think traditional American. BBQ chicken sandwich, burgers, grilled fish, salads, turkey sandwich. Nothing tremendously unique but we weren't looking for anything fancy for a simple Sunday brunch so it was fine for us!
Sorry, not a big fan. I don't know... I mean, how do they charge so much food and have a bunch of hispanic guy working as their linecooks?

Wonderful perfect lovely dinner. Had the oysters (divine), brook trout (sublime) and wagyu beef (perfection) with the worlds best waitress, Ann. it was our 10th anniversary and she made us feel like it was a truly special evening. Superb food, relaxed setting, effortless attentive service. Thank you!!
No comment
Cool place in Chelsea! Love the food and wine, yeah, try the famous Huevos Rancheros, and the waiter is very friendly and professional, ask them to recommend some good wine for you!

Great place to spend a birthday! The waiter suggested a really great wine that didn't break the bank.  There was way too much to tempt and tantalize here.  The pizza was respectable for a non-Italian place, and we could have easily had a few more.The steak was other-worldly! What do they do to it to get a non-red-meat-eater like me to be stealing bits of it off someone else's plate when they're not looking? (I stuck to my own table, but did look around a bit.)  And desserts just should have been an "all-or-nothing" deal...Too hard to choose one or two. Chocolate peanut butter cake....oo-la-la! Service got a bit frazzled at the end. The hostess needs to give 20 minute advance notice when she needs the table you happen to be sitting at.
No comment
The Cookshop has excellent food. Went here on a whim and absolutely loved it. Great atmosphere as well, good for large groups or a date. The tables are wooden and chunky - love!

Someone I know raved about the huevos rancheros here, however, he should have warned me that that are NOT huevos rancheros. They are more like baked eggs and have pickled onions. The spicy-ness was good. Had high expectations that were not met - not even close. The main memory I have of these is that they were definitely not the best - mediocre to bad.

Went here for Sunday brunch and was very happy with the way everything went. One thing I always find difficult is a place that will actually take reservations for brunch!! I was able to book it online too so that made life alot easier. I'm glad I did make a reservation because the place was packed! But we went right in and sat without a wait. (woohoo!) It was very hot that day so we sat inside rather than out. Service was fast moving and you could see they were pumping out orders left and right. We never felt rushed even with the hustle and bustle around us. The place was loud and lively! Our food (and mimosas) were delicious. Based on my friends and coworkers always rave about this place I wasn't sure how I was going to feel....but my expectations were definitely met.

It's pricey, no getting around that, but it's also good. Had the steak...probably price $8 too much. Nice selection of drinks as well as variety of food. Service also very good. I went for dinner but would like to go back for brunch. I hear that's wear it's at.

Very yummy food and selection of mocktails for those of us with a bun in the oven. Great foccacia to start. The highlight though was the triple threat of the airy, tasteful space; good food; and lack of pretension. Service was particularly, almost shockingly, friendly by New York standards.
No comment
No comment

For Father's Day, my family and I came to Cookshop for the first time. Where to begin? First of all, the restaurant itself is open and bright and welcoming. The staff sat us and our server, though he's my friend, delivered great service! The plate of assorted baked goods and pastries were delicious! Every single one! Mom loved the blueberry scone and Dad loved the crumb coffee cake and I loved the pecan roll and the lemon curd donut. My mom said her bloody Mary was the best she'd had and the bartender was very accommodating to us with our allergies. My latte and fresh lemonade was delicious. Our dishes arrived and all three were fantastic. I highly recommend the "Dutch baby" pancake! The experience was great and the food was great. I will definitely come back and bring friends!
No comment
No comment

AMAZING. A friend took me for lunch since it was one of her faves and couldn't agree with her more. Love how their menu changes based on their selection of available ingredients. I had the fish tacos and a yummy cocktail called a "Hellacious Tea." The space was a little crowded at lunch time, that was my only complaint. Otherwise the service was spot on and the food was fresh and flavorful.
Get the burger! Amazing! And Chelsea handler sat next to us and we didn't realize until we got the check! Haha

Great atmosphere. Great food. Like everything in NYC a bit pricey, but worth it. I had three eggs baked sunny side up with a side of grits. Everything  was delish. Highly recommend. Located right off the High Line.

ya know what I love? Getting a table right away for brunch. Know what else I love? A frickin kick ass cheeseburger!! Cookshop you're right on time sugar. I made a reservation, so me and the girls got seated pronto and decided to share a few greasies, including said burger. We snarfed like ladies yo. We commented on it's flavor from the perfectly pickled pink onions to the butter crisp bun, gooey white cheddar and orgasmic bacon. The meat is so juicy and perfectly seasoned, grill smoked but not drippy. We almost forgot our usual spouting on how much men annoy us...almost! It comes with delicious fries so we also shared the escarole salad to absorb any lingering guilt. We bonded that day, over that burger, and friends, this is how NYC brunch is supposed to feel.
Great service and ambiance.  Simple and  scrumptious.  Great company - Great Food. The perfect stop after a Highline tour
No comment
No comment

Absolutely delicious!! And so reasonably priced! Their breakfast portions are very generous. My friend and I got their scrambled eggs on a biscuit and they had to be the best eggs we've ever had in a restaurant. The biscuit was also cooked fresh from scratch and was so flaky and moist. Dying to go back here!
The food is great but not trying the Bloody Mary here is a sin.....
No comment
Good brunch, good breakfast. Great bloody maries.

This place was fine, but very much overhyped. I came with a couple of girlfriends for brunch. The server was very distracted and not-too helpful. I had a breakfast scramble, and it was unimpressive. Not terrible, but far from memorable, or even good. Pretentious crowd, even for Chelsea.

Wait was long, but completely accurate, which I appreciate. Biscuits are to die for, but the French toast made with whole wheat bread, so-so. Service was kind and moderately attentive, surprising considering everyone there. Very cute.

Great atmosphere. Do make reservations or be prepared to wait at least 30 mins.We ordered a mushroom broth like soup and also a burger to share. Not bad but not mind blowing. My friend ordered the bacon bloody mary which seemed to the choice of many tables. That was nicely done  Right next to the high line. So you can take a walk after your heavy brunch or lunch.
No comment

It is one of the best restaurants in the Chelsea neighborhood. I've had both lunch and dinner and I've always had a great experience. The service and the food are both good. I love the ambiance that the place sets. I love everything from their steak skewers, the lamb to their desert. I would crawl back to Cookshop just to get their Alaska smores. The hostesses, sommelier, servers and managers are so pleasant. Jesse is a great manager. I just wish I took the time to have brunch there.
Seriously the best brunch I've had. ever.  Still thinking about it, to be honest, and I can't wait to go again.
No comment
No comment
No comment

overall a disappointing experience.  we've been wanting to check this place out for brunch for awhile, as it's always packed for brunch.  but the experience is really not too great.  the maitre d and check-in experience was a bit rude - felt like security at Madison Square Garden.  our waitress was nice, but the food was nothing special (the baked eggs with pancetta was fair) - certainly doesn't warrant the packed house and noise.  oh well - now we know.

Had a lovely NYC night with the girls and started our evening at Cookshop. The cocktails were delicious and dinner was divine! Everyone was very happy with their dinner choices and the atmosphere had a very cool yet warm vibe. I ordered the caesar salad which was probably the least adventurous item on the menu, but alas, it was basically one of the best salads I've ever tasted. Everyone ordered something different from the lamb burger, to the roasted chicken and finally the veggie plate. I sampled the beats over yogurt from the veggie plate and basically have been dying for that taste combination since.

I had been wanting to try the brunch at Cookshop after hearing great things.  I got reservations way in advance.  I went with a party of four who all seemed to enjoy their brunch.  I got the Buttermilk-Sour Cream Pancakes with caramelized bananas and cinnamon-chipotle spiced chocolate sauce.  I thought the pancakes were drowned in sauce, and the flavor of the sauce was just not right for pancakes, in my opinion.  The Cookshop scramble seems to be popular and my friend like it, as well as the huevos rancheros, so maybe order something besides the pancakes.
Delicious food in a smart casual atmosphere, a very nice and hard-working bartender; desserts were also fantastic.
beautiful decor but crowded and service was mixed. my entree came slightly cold and the food was just ok. i would probably not return as there are so many other places to try with equal potential.

all. praise. cookshop. You know those awesome brunches you have on Sunday's, which lead from one super awesome huevos rancheros and a breakfast cocktail to 'hey why not another round for everyone' then all of the sudden it's 4 am and you're in williamsburg and you're at your 7th rooftop bar? These brunches happen here. and they all begin with the elderflower cocktail. God speed.
They have great drinks!! I've never liked bloody Mary's until I tried the Oaxaca Bloody Mary! It was delicious! Great place for brunch!

Came here for dinner on a Friday night. Easy to make reservations same day and I was excited because I don't go to Chelsea often and I had heard great things about their brunch... This looks like a restaurant you would find on Lincoln Road on South Beach. Just not my cup of tea. I Don't like big warehouse style restaurants that lack character and remind me of PF changs. So already I was less than impressed. The food was costly and not worth the price tag in my opinion. I had the scallops and mussels entree which was very disappointing. The sauce was bland and it was more like an appetizer. The drinks were good and innovative and The bread came with a hummus like spread which was good. Would not return for dinner. Maybe I'd try their brunch for some much acclaimed bloody marys.

I met some friends at Cook Shop.  First time there for the three of us.  The service was most gracious.  We were not rushed and we enjoyed the food.  I would recommend a walk on the High Line afterward.

This is the newest restaurant from the owners of Five Points and it's terrific.  Unassuming, charming and delicious -- the menu offered so many choices it was hard to decide.  In the end, I would recommend the Grilled Shrimp appetizer, the Sauteed Cod entree or the Short Ribs.  And, for desert, definitely go for the Date turnover.   Don't forget to thank Vicki for another spectacular experience.  (Get to this restaurant before it's discovered by the masses!!)
No comment

Great place - amazing food delivered without all the stuffy pretentiousness of some NYC foodie places.  The staff are prompt and friendly, and Jesse and his crew at the bar (the bartender with the blue hair!) go out of their way to explain options and make sure everything is exactly as you want it.  The chicken liver mousse is INCREDIBLE.  Brunch can get busy, but most off nights are pretty chill.

Cookshop (Joel Hough) [from the 2008 Wine & Food Festival]- White pheasant bratwurst with new crop apple sauerkraut and brown ale mustard, you get a chance to showcase your talent and served um...a glorified hot dog..yeah...

Full Disclosure: I am friends with the executive sous chef. made a reservation for lunch with mom and was seated in a corner booth where we could observe the scene. I asked if my friend was in and they said he usually comes in later-here is where I thought Cookshop showed their worth-we had an amazing experience from before I asked if my friend was around and after he arrived and showed up at our table. The food was yummy would definitely like to have brunch here. There was way too much corn in the minestrone.
Probably the best breakfast I've ever had. No joke! It is a little pricey but it is a must go place. Great service and a amazing food
"Good brunch in the Chelsea area. I wouldn't say it's the best brunch i've ever had, but it was respectable. Such a scene though..."
No comment

Really enjoyed the brunch here. Started with these cinnamon donut bread that was warm and delicious while i dunked it in my cappuccino. For my meal I had the eggs on top of toast with spinach and Bearnaise sauce. It was good although i dont think i would order it again. 3 out of 4 of us enjoyed our meals. My bf didnt enjoy his pancakes. they were very egg-y tasting and the sides werent great. I also got a side of grits that was good but nothing too amazing. I want to come again and hope they have the sticky bun available.
One of our highlights in NYC.  Excellent service and the brunch was delicious.  Place was packed but it was worth the wait.

What all restaurants should strive for- gregarious and engaging staff (who feel like humans, not robots), great ambiance, food with integrity & a menu that feels comforting but also sophisticated. Just an all around gem- I come here often with my daughter and they are so lovely and patient and accommodating & you really cant go wrong whether youre having breakfast dinner drinks or brunch. Don't miss it.

Grits, grits, grits! They are so good here. I think they may change the menu daily, but if they have a starter with grits, Florida shrimp, and Andouille you must order. To die! And then there are all kinds of good melt-off-the-bone meats. The dessert menu could have been more appealing, but that is my only complaint. The atmosphere is very cozy and casual and lively. Git to the grits!
The food here is good and I love the design of the dining room and the open kitchen area , however it can get a little noisy and the service is a bit haphazard.

It's amazing how one bad waiter can ruin what otherwise would be an OK restaurant.  Had dinner there last night, sat outside.  Greeting by the door staff was pleasant and they quickly sat us.  But then this dismissive, snappy, bitchy queen of a waiter appears and it went down hill fast.  Inattentive, lousy, uninterested service paired with mediocre food does not cut it...just unacceptable.
Pricey but really good. Salad with almonds green olives and yellow raisins was perfectly balanced. One of those simple but brilliant things
No comment

We sat outside which was much quieter and had a great meal. I had the scallops and corn pudding which was delicious. My favorite part of the meal was probably dessert. We had sorbet, berry tart and cookies. Overall, good food, ambience and service. It's right next tot the high line which is convenient for walking off the one dessert too many.

I'm surprised at the 3.5 stars.  The food was very good.  The roasted chicken dish was my favorite, and everything was flavorful and fresh.  The only thing I wasn't crazy about were the drinks.  I found them really weak and not that tasty.  Service was great, and the atmosphere was nice for dinner, lunch or brunch.
Hit or miss. Have eaten there several times. Always packed. Great service. Food: sometimes fabulous, but other times, not so much. There's better options in the area.

Delish!  Just had lunch there.  Had the deviled eggs with lots of paprika.  We also had the hamburger (delicious burger, but I have to confess the bun is a little greasy).  Service sublime.  The mussels may have been the best I've ever had, spiced with bacon.

You can't go wrong with Cookshop.  Been many times and solidly a 4 star restaurant.  The scallops last night were awesome.  Brunch there is crazy busy, but worth it.  Make a brunch reservation and prepare to wait awhile for the table.  Worth it.

While it would have behooved us to have a reservation for Sunday brunch, the people watching while waiting for our table was quite entertaining! All the wait was well worth it once we tucked into our cubby sized seats and started noshing on our mussels et frites app. The frites were perfection and I've never had such plump mussels before busting with warm beer flavored broth. For entree I had a salad, typical NYC chick food. It was creative however and very yummy. My boyfriend had a burger that looked to be mouthwatering. The bacon was thick cut and smoked. Oh how I wish we could have fit dessert in our tummies. Cookshop is across the street from the highline which is a perfect way to walk off the gluttoness food perfection.
Very very good. The best bloody Mary I've had yet in NYC.
No comment
Yummy!  This place never disappoints.  It's great for lunch, brunch and dinner!  My favorite dish is their veggie lasagna.  I've never had anything like it. Hope it stays on the menu for a long time.

Went here for a birthday dinner with 5 people tonight and loved it. All of the staff were friendly and happy. The drink at the bar was great - can't remember what it was called but it had St. Germain and Prosecco. Starters of oysters were okay; I like my mignonette to be traditional with red vinegar, not a big deal, just a preference thing. Butter with the bread was AMAZING, like a whipped herby dream. I had the scallops for my entree and they were great. Grits were a yummy side. Dessert was the candybar cake, which was actually on 3 lollipops, which was fun and unusual and tasty. Finished it with a latte and a smile. Would definitely come back. Thanks to Cookshop.

Cookshop has become "ole faithful" in my Manhattan-based restaurant itinerary. Typically, I won't eat anywhere twice, simply because, well, you don't have to. But because Cookshop is just so tasty and has a seasonal menu, every time is a bit different and always delicious. The prices are reasonable and I have yet to be disappointed. The décor reminds me of eating in a restaurant in Napa Valley; it provides a warm and cozy yet elegant dining experience. Yum!
Food is great and very sceney for its location. The place does get really loud when its busy but a great place to go before heading out on the west side.

In a word: underwhelmed.  Loved the farm to table concept, the open, dimly lit and modern space, and service was good, too.  The food, while fresh and well-cooked, was nothing I haven't had in more interesting variations before -- the scallops were satisfying, but nothing special.  Portions are a good size, and the drinks are OK, but I wouldn't say this place is worth the prices, unfortunately.

Pretty cool place. Good for brunch and lunch. Though i must admit the menu is limited. I wanted lunch at like 3p on 4th of July and had only like 4 options to choose from. I went w the burger. It was good. I don't live in the area, but if am ever in the area again would rather eat here than anywhere else.

The wait for brunch here was about 25 minutes.  It was definitely packed, but the food was overpriced and not very good.  I got the Cookshop Scramble with pork sausage ($14) and it wasn't very appealing.  It was just eggs and sausage on a dry biscuit and the flavor didn't blow me away.  I had to force myself to eat it, and even then, I couldn't finish the dry biscuit.  My friend got the huevos rancheros ($15).  While that was better than my dish, it wasn't $15 good.  The table next to us ordered the same dishes and neither of them finished their food.  I also got a lemonade($3) which needed sugar and my friend got a root beer($4). After tax and tip, the meal ended up being $46...definitely not money well spent.
I thought it was just a-okay. I am spoiled by more creative brunch places with lower prices in Los Angeles. Nice that it takes reservations though.
Awesome brunch!!!!! I had a great experience. Food was delicious and service was prompt and attentive. A solid choice!!! I'll def be back.

OMG - go here now!  my coworker suggested this place and it was fantastic!  we made reservations and got walked right in while a ton of other people waited outside.  we got the pitcher of alcoholic goodness which was cool and sweet and yummy.  i had the huevos rancheros which were incredible.  my friend got the french toast with sausages and we also got some of those bomb biscuits and grits.  um yeah, we were a bit hungover and everything looked amazing so we just ordered it all.  our waiter was super nice and i wish i lived close by so i could visit this place every sunday.  if you're looking for a good brunch spot, go here and make a ressie if you know what's good for you.
No comment

Honestly, I was super excited to try this place for Brunch recently with a group of friends I haven't seen in a long time. However, I hate to say it, but it was really disappointing. The only thing I was impressed with was our waiter. We had a 3 year old with us and this waiter was so great with him! He was doing silly dances with him and even special ordered a big breakfast for him. As far as the food? It was blahhh. Seriously, nothing special or great at all. I split the French Toast and the Heuvos Rancheros with a friend. The French Toast has a wonderful description on the menu - too bad it doesn't taste anything like that.  We also all split the ricotta beignets to start, which I thought would be amazing! But they were blehh as well.  I also feel it was way overpriced for a Brunch. I am gonna stick to my favs in Astoria for Brunch!
I Loved this place!!! the food was to die for! Service was impeccable and the atmosphere was so upbeat. Cant wait to go there again and bring my friends!

We went for brunch one Sunday afternoon.  Excellent bloody mary, delicious frittata & cornmeal pancakes.  We sat outside & the service was polite, helpful and we had a lovely time - I highly recommend you put this on your list!
Amazing huevos rancheros. And I grew up in Texas and have lived in Los Angeles forever.  My husband said he has finally found the perfect huevos rancheros after a 9 year quest.

One of my favorite restaurants in NYC, I love that the menu is ever changing with seasonal ingredients. Great place for a late afternoon cocktail, brunch and dinner. My favorites are the fluke carpaccio, clam roast and pastas. The staff is so nice. When I brought my puppy here and the hostess rushed outside "to seat the puppy" and brought him dog biscuit made by the pastry chef!

I second Lisa's nod of approval -- the hanger steak was good (and plentiful), and I managed to finish the entire thing. I think they do very well for the price, and our waitress was nice and knowledgeable. It's chill inside, not too dark, so perfect for catching up with friends. Also to try: the "Love Apple" drink, because it has pomegranate juice.
"Breakfast is the most important meal of the day" has to be one of Cookshop's mantras because they do it right. The fare is warm and reminds me of what meals are all about... damn good food.

Tried Cookshop for brunch today- an outstanding experience.  The restaurant is bright and airy, and the menu I would describe as sophisticated New American comfort food.  Our group ordered the fried chicken, fritatta, chicken breast salad, and brisket.  Everything was delicious, bellinis were strong, and the staff was incredibly friendly.  On the way out 3 people thanked us for coming.  I will definitely return!

I had a really great New Year's Eve dinner here, and they put on a nice party for the occasion. It was fun. The food was mostly very good, especially the suckling pig I ordered. I sort of have the feeling that it's hit or miss here though, and that my 'great' experience here was partly due to the celebratory atmosphere. Nonetheless, 4 stars.

I wasn't as impressed with Cookshop as I expected to be.  I had the egg scramble with salmon, which was sort of bland.  I was hoping for more of an eggs Norweigan taste. My pineapple juice was served without ice, which I thought was a bit strange.  However, the place and atmosphere was lively and our waitress was fantastic.  I'll give it another go.

I think the only reason I'm not giving this place five stars is because the lunch treats are ready-made as opposed to fresh from a salad bar. That said this place is lush. Lots of yummy salads to choose from and everything is organic and home-made. The cookies here are good too. On a nice day you can eat in by the open window, a homely feel with friendly service and stock that you can buy to replish your kitchen supplies.

Based on (2) visits, Cookshop is meh for sure.  The food is all pretty good, but for those prices, it should be pretty good.  While I am not one to usually complain about service/atmosphere, I do feel the quality of service suffers quite a bit because this place is Cookshop.  Last night, the server forgot my wine after about 20 min and just said oops sorry while my friends finished their food and I sat with nothing in front of me.    Not even a comped dessert.  Whatever.  Prob won't spend another $40 here again; not worth it.

Probably the best dinner we had while in NYC for the week.  I had the suckling pig, which was tender and delicious.  But the real star was the side dish--drunken beans with bacon and dried fruit.  Doesn't sound that impressive, but it was prepared in a simple, but amazing way to really bring out the simple and delicious flavors.  Highly recommended.  Staff was very friendly with our large group.
No comment
No comment

Went here for a birthday dinner recently - and the table I was at ended up ordering one of almost every entree. All but one [grilled chicken] was meh. The place has a good buzz though, and watching the kitchen prepare all the food was loads of fun.

We went for Thanksgiving. I know the restaurant can be so different when it is not a holiday. It was pre-fixed at 65.00 per person, which I thought was high but if the food is excellent I would be ok with that. We were VERY happy with our appetizer choices, so we felt the experience was going to be great. We both ordered the Turkey since it was Thanksgiving. The turkey was VERY fatty and not good. I thought the sweet potatoes were good, but then I started to taste something crunchy in it during one mouthful and then a second and third mouthful and I gave up. I like creative and different but the Stuffing sticks were just not good. Oh well. Bummed because it was recommended to me to go there.
No comment

Great place for lunch/dinner when you are in the neighborhood.  I've been here maybe 5 times over the years, and I came here two days ago (Tuesday) for lunch with my wife and toddler for a quick lunch before heading to the galleries and the High Line.  ~$60 for app, two entrees, dessert sundae and coffee before tip.  We had the Montauk squid app (I think it was a special) which was deep fried but very good and didn't feel too heavy.  Also had the burger which was very nice - large, two huge strips of bacon, a thick melted cheese (I think it was cheddar), large cut pickle and pretty good fries.  And had the mushroom pizza.  I'd recommend sitting outside, especially if you have a toddler like we do -- he sat watching the people and was pretty chill.  Service was very good.  We also had the PB&J sundae which may have been the highlight.  It was not over the top in flavor, but was nicely salty.  Peanut butter ice cream, a grape jelly compote and some PB brittle/crumble with a salty whipped cream.  Great meal.  Too much food for the 2 1/2 of us, but everything was tasty and it was a nice day to sit out in the sun.  Sat a couple tables away from Maggie Gyllenhaal.  I never notice or recognize any celebs but my wife always does.
I have been here for both brunch and dinner. The menu is always different, because they use a lot seasonal ingredients. Food is generally good. Make a reservation. This place gets packed!
No comment

This is a fantastic place with great food and wonderful service. I highly recommend their Hell's Kitchen Bloody Mary and you should request James as a server. He is simply amazing and makes the experience feel like you're just at home with friends.

I normally wouldn't pick tuna for entree and was surprised that I enjoyed it. I think the dill pickles they put on was very good. I really liked the dish. Tasted some of friends salmon dish and it was interesting. Did not like my friend's chicken dish, nothing seemed special about it. prices are the biggest downside, I would not want to pay as much as I did for what I got in food and drink. service was great, bartender was friendly and fun to talk too
Great breakfast. Good service. Excellent meeting spot.
A tasty, fresh meal in a casual atmosphere with good friends.  What more could you ask for on a lovely fall evening?
No comment
This place was great for a weekend brunch, except make sure you make reservations! It gets really packed. The mac and cheese was fantastic but my favorite was the mushroom grilled cheese. Delicious!
The kale & barley breakfast bowl was fantastic. Super close to the Highline. This restaurant group is awesome. I'd definitely trust their taste.
Service and food was off the chart. These guys have the recipe for success. Awesome creative menu and drinks.
good place to have bruch...not bad but too many people

I remember when this restaurant opened when I used to live in the neighborhood. Everyone thought they were CRAZY to open a restaurant on "empty" 10th Avenue. HAHA- well the Highline opened, and the rest is history. Cookshop was also an early adopter of the farm-to-table approach, and their food has always been fresh and tasty. Always busy, but service is good, and they honor their reservations (no "feel free to have a drink at the bar" for 20plus minutes-ugh). I had lunch at Cookshop recently, and glad to see that it is still as good as ever. A nice neighborhood joint. The ONLY problem I have is that they have the most uncomfortable dining chairs in the city.

Cookshop changed my life. My cousins introduced me to pate and charcuterie for the first time and Cookshop does it best. Life-changing! Now everywhere I have charcuterie and pate (even in Paris), I compare it to Cookshop.

Beautiful restaurant - had a reservation for two on a Saturday night -at 7:30 and waited about 20 minutes for a table. Not a very large restaurant. Delicious food (especially deviled eggs) and strong/yummy cocktails (strawberry mojito & gentleman Collins) both for $13. Entrees were good and moderately priced, but portions small. Good service. Would go back. Beautiful outdoor sweating.

I got lunch from there today for the first time. Food was good and wait staff was nice. One thing to note though, is that this place is not $$. I would say it's more $$$ for lunch prices. The total came out to $58 for two people (and we did not get any alcohol).
No comment

This is some hearty food that will fill you to the gills -- in a good way. The braised short rib is humongous and rests atop a generous helping of creamy grits. My friends went to town on the buffalo hanger steak with red rice special. It's a big place so you won't wait too long for a table. The ceilings are high so volume levels are A-OK. And the service was top-notch.
Brunch was a tad disappointing but I would live here for the bananananana bread alone.  And then I'd get fat.  :(

The pastry basket is not to be missed. Very good service, except that we weren't allowed to order dessert because our waiter felt we'd had too much sugar. I think he was just kidding, but I'm really not sure. He was right though- we were all close to bursting after our entrees. Yummy bloody marys too- but very spicy.
Great simple meals, try the oatmeal cookies for dessert. This is one of the better places to eat in Chelsea.

Great brunch spot. Honestly, my only complaint is the location. The staff was very friendly and helpful with choosing from the menu. I ordered the corncakes with carmelized bananas and cinnamon butter, which were very good. Along with the sausage patty which had a bit of a kick to it which was nice. The frittata was very yummy, must have with the hot sauce!!!!! I would def. go back

Great service!  Great atmosphere.  The huevos rancheros my husband got were damn good.  I got the egg sandwich special.  The homemade sausage was some of the best I've ever had.  But the whites on my fried egg were runny - isn't this dangerous or something?  The juices were served warm without ice.  That seemed gross and weird.  I do love that everything is organic, though!

I ordered Heuvos Rancheros and it was ok.  It was not really Heuvos Rancheros, it was a white East Coast wanna-be version, but it was tasty.  My husband got a Frittata which tasted and felt like a sponge.  The coffee was nasty strong and they only brought one tiny thing of Soy to accommodate the entire table.  When I asked one of the bus boys for soy he directed me to the opposite end of the table if I wanted soy.  The whole experience was of course worsened by the cheapskate date that one of the people there brought.  He was an ugly hippy type who didn't really talk much, refused to order any food saying he wasn't a brunch type of guy and yet he drank a cup of coffee, used all of my soy and didn't pay for the coffee he drank.  Maybe next time when he is not there, the food will taste better.  I will let you know.
No comment
Had dinner at Cookshop last week.  What a treat!  Great environment, excellent service, food is all organic/ sustainable and positively delicious.   The braised beef was divine.

Once again Cookshop seems to outdo any other place for food.  My first time here for brunch, I was just as pleased as coming here for dinner.  Despite that the restaurant is always packed to the brim (hey, it means they have great food), sitting down you can still have a normal conversation without having to yell.  The options on the brunch menu are extensive ranging from sweet carb indulgences to hearty scrambles to typical lunch fare.  Of course typical lunch fare here is not typical.  I went with the Chef Salad with tuna and shrimp.  This was not your ordinary chef salad: fresh tuna and tangy shrimp atop a bed of local mix of greens with egg and a delectable pesto dressing was not the chef salad I expected--absolutely amazing.  A spicy bloody mary to top it off made this perfect. Of course, here at Cookshop, great company is what makes everything so much better.

Awesome food, great service, fantastic ambience -- one of the best dining experiences I've ever had, not just in NY but anywhere.  I know restaurants can have an off night, and I'm sure cookshop isn't immune to that, but this was one time where the stars must have been aligned: warm summer night with just a hint of a breeze, al fresco dining, nice waiter and bussers, terrific bartender (thanks, Kalani!), courteous hosts, and delicious, creative food.  In a city like this, it's hard to return to the same restaurant when there are so many new ones to choose from, but I think cookshop will be on my permanent go-back list from now on.
I cannot say enough about Cookshop, but the real reason I go is pastry chef Amanda Cook!! She's a wizard!!!
i'm always happy after leaving this place.  And the bloody mary's are off the hook.

Fresh organic menu which changes regularly! The drinks are fantastic and the brunch is divine. I highly recommend you make a reservation. Showing up can leave you waiting 45 minutes. Getting a reservation here is not hard

I went here last night after not having been dined here in about a year.  It was even better than I remembered.  Everything--the cocktails, the bread, the appetizers, the wine, entrees, the sides, and even the dessert--was thoughtfully prepared and delicious.  I had the bees knees cocktail, the sweet potato soup, and the ham entree.  Hubby had the apple cocktail, the deviled eggs, the beat salad, and the spaghetti entree.  We shared the brussel sprouts and the mocha sundae.  Those were the best brussel sprouts I've ever had; they were even better than those at the Vanderbilt.  I'm so glad to see that Cookshop is still turning out solid food in a fun, but not too loud, environment.
No comment
Nice outdoor seating. Perfect Brunch spot. Will definitely go again.
Probably one of my favorite little sports.  The food here is always a home run, ambiance is warm/inviting & the staff is so sweet.  The oysters were a fan favorite in our group.  Enjoy!

this place is pricey, no joke. pretty sure my husband's OJ was $8. BUT we were splurging, and the food was terrific enough to inspire price-amnesia. His Huevos Rancheros and my Cookshop scramble with bacon and a Platonic-ideal biscuit were both perfectly done, and we ate beyond our comfortably-full zone, loathe to leave anything behind. Worth the splurge!

I've been here twice- once to eat dinner outside and once to eat brunch at the bar.  Both times were fantastic.  Excellent fresh food, great staff and nice open atmosphere.  The menu changes all the time so I can't wait to go back.

I went a few years ago for dinner and liked the cocktails but found the food pretty unimpressive. My husband has been wanting to try so we went without a reservation yesterday and were seated pretty quickly at a bar table.  We really wanted to love the meal- had good wine and good service but were very disappointed especially given the prices are so high. Mediocre $40 steak is pretty displeasing. You can do better for dinner in NYC, but good for drinks, not sure about brunch.
No comment

Really yummy brunch.  It's no Clinton Street Baking Co., but hey what is?  Great service and food.  Their AC could use a little work - it drips randomly from the ceiling and they've got people running around wiping the ceiling with towels on the end of a pole (seriously, what the heck?).  But the food is good!

I recently did some training to work at this restaurant. Unfortunately, it did not work out but while I was working there the food always looked amazing, so I decided to check it out. I ordered the watermelon mojito, which was incredibly delicious and refreshing and the lasagnetti pasta with pesto, which was to die for. For dessert I ordered the nectarine shortcake, which was very fresh and just the right amount of sweet. The great thing about Cookshop is that the dishes are not overly complex because they get the best ingredients and they trust the ingredients enough to make them the star of the dish. You can really taste the freshness. i thought the price was fair for the quality I was getting. Also, the staff is incredibly nice and, even though the job didn't pan out for me, I have to say the management is awesome and super dedicated. I definitely will be back!

I went to brunch today and it was my cousin's first trip to NYC. So, with the weather pretty awful, the only way we could turn it around was order Bloody Mary's right when we walked in. We both got the Pickled Mary, which is their Bloody Mary house-blend with pickle juice and yummy garnishes. As a Bloody Mary virgin, I have to say I popped my cherry at the right spot. This mix hit the spot! Then we ordered hummus with seedless cucumber, sugar snap pease with chile oil and feta. The hummus came with flatter-than average pita bread that was so hot and steamy it paired well with the creamy and soft-toned hummus. The cucumber was fresh and crunchy as a topping. We also ordered the huevos rancheros, three eggs cooked with black beans, ranchero sauce, cheese, line crema fraiche, and pickled onions and jalapeños. It was out if this world! The chips paired with the creamy eggs and beans, sour from the onions and fresh sour cream made for the perfect brunch dish. I would definitely come back!

Possibly my favourite place ever. Only bad thing I've had here is steak which was pretty tiny but otherwise everything is fantastic. Yes, a little expensive but great quality food with amazing flavours. Recently came here both for brunch and dinner the night before a big race. Love it!

This review is for service during our brunch. I get it it's Labor Day, most places will be crowded. We sat there about 20 mins no one came to ask for drinks and water. My friend had to ask someone to tell our waitress that we need water. I noticed other table came in after us already got their drinks and been severed, but our table still empty. Fine finally our waitress showed up and she took the drinks and orders, when I told her that I might need few mins to go over the menu and choose my meal she looks very surprise, feel like she is sending me sore signal that I should be ready when she is talking the order. That's ok she left and after 10 mins someone just brought water to the table then after a while drinks arrived but not from our waitress instead someone else. I still haven't order yet and I was waiting when she come back but it's takes forever. I could have just wait on the table by myself. As I said, other table already finishing up we are just on the half way. Our waitress never come by to check on us but meanwhile she was very busy serving other tables. But thanks to other waitress even she is not our waitress but she still taking care of us. I am really disappointed today during the brunch.
Cookshop always delivers! My most recent visit included some a Bloody Mary to die for and Huevos Rancheros I will definitely be back for!

I was ready to tear this place up in a review as I initially had the most horrific experience, until  met the most gracious hostess, Sarah. I came in this morning for brunch and we were a party of 6 without reservations so I knew there'd be a wait. We waited at the bar until our party was called. Unfortunately, that wasn't for a quite a while and as I have two small children under the age of 3, we kept checking in with the host stand. Within 45 minutes we were still not seated and we had a manager sent over to us to talk to us about seating. It was the most bland and impersonal exchange I've ever experienced in an establishment. The manager spouted things that most managers would say and it all felt forced and impersonal. And then a few minutes into sitting at the bar, my 2 year old accidentally swung her arm over to the person sitting next to us and she gave us the dirtiest look and scoffed at our entire party. It's safe to say that the people that come here are entitled assholes that have no regard for anyone that has a complete family. This entire encounter made me feel so enraged and gripped with tears that I had to pardon myself outside (in the rain) where I shed a few tears for how horrific the people in this establishment were being toward our family. I then pulled myself together and came back inside to inquire about our wait time. The hostess told us it might be an additional 30 minutes considering our party size. I then broke back down in tears and told her of the horrific experience I had encountered at the bar and how defeated I had felt that day. No doubt this poor girl had a million people in the lobby trying to get in but she stepped away from her hostess podium, stepped down to the stroller level, held my hand and said: "I understand how you feel and I'd really like you to stay, but it goes against every fiber of my being to ask you to stay anywhere you feel your family has been disrespected." It was quite possibly the most genuine thing anyone has ever said and also quite possibly the most perfect thing a hostess could have said to me in that moment. From then, I would have agreed to wait another 5 hours. She then had a position set outside for us almost immediately and checked back in on us as she as leaving (turns out she's a resident physician, so her compassionate bedside manner comes as no surprise.) The food was good, the service was good, but the genuine kindness displayed in that moment of weakness by Sarah was priceless. It's quite rare to find someone as beautiful on the inside as she is on the outside. I tried to find a manager before we left to tell us how welcome she made us feel but was bombarded by the crowd in the front. I'm always touched by these acts of genuine kindness and wanted to write my first Yelp review about it. Thank you for making my day. Cookshop, you have a gem of a hostess.

Brunch today.  LOUD!  Something of a scene.  Delicious Dandelion salad and grits.  Fritata a little tough--maybe serving it in a cast iron skillet is cute, but leads to overcooking?  Our waiter? Very charming.
Yummy breakfast, good coffee, I'd recommend for a business breakfast.

Great brunch. Go here if looking for a place to go. The atmosphere is nice although can get a little noisy. Went there around 12:30pm and got crowded a little bit later. Call in advance for reservations and you should be fine.  Definitely would like to go back for dinner
Everything was great, service, atmosphere and food.  We sat at the bar and ate.  Deviled eggs and a steak.  Good times.

I've been to dinner at the bar a number of times and have always had a great experience. Creative specials, awesome wine, friendly staff and not over the top in price. Value for dollar is incredible considering many of the ingredients are local or farm fresh. Don't miss the deviled eggs or the duck empanadas!

I was not impressed at all. Nothing special on the menu. My seafood stew was way too salty and they did not give me enough bread to eat with it. Definitely not worth the price. I also really did not appreciate the fact that the hostess sat my party of two at a tiny table cramped next to a large group and the gate outside. Not the best dining experience. Pass
Hands down my favorite bloody mary in the city! I love sitting at the bar and always come to Cookshop for brunch. A must go!!

I'm in Manhattan for a conference titled, 911: The Conversation We Never Had with Odyssey Networks held at the Desmond Tutu Center. Right next-door is The Cookshop. I've eaten three meals here. One dinner and two breakfasts. Fresh and artful are the words that come to mind. Home made granola with Greek style yogurt and Bosc pears greeted my taste buds on my first morning, and for dinner the next night - swordfish with pine nuts, fresh greens and finished with a chocolate peanut butter meringue  topped cake and a micro ale that were all Deeeeelicious.  If you're in Chelsea it's right across from the current northern end of the High Line.
Really fresh and crisp food. I had a salad and a soup. Yum. Right across from the end of the hi-line park on 9th I believe.
This place feels like brunch in Chelsea should feel. As in nice ambiance, nice food, nice people, not so nice prices. It's good, but nothing to write home about.
No comment

Wow!  I have passed by the place so many times and finally went.  We each had different entres.  Pizza appetizer with peach/prosciutto was superb.  Morel mushroom pasta dish was perfect, I had the grill tuna and was spot on.  Bread served with farmer cheese and horseradish was tantilizing.  Desserts were the only less than steller items, both were ho humm: cookie chip sundae and tray of mutliple tiny bites.  Otherwise yum yum

I came here for father's day brunch and was must say, I was very pleased.  We got a table outside and ordered some bloody mary's, which were very good.  Then we split an order of the beignets, which I really enjoyed.  Then I had the huevos rancheros, which is new for me because I almost never order this dish at brunch.  It was really good and I loved the spiciness of the dish (not too much or too little.. it was just right.)  The beans were very nicely done as well.  It was a giant portion and I incapable of finishing but I kept picking at anyway because it was really good.  I would definitely recommend coming here for brunch & if you let them know you want outdoor seating ahead of time they will work to accommodate you.

Great brunch spot on the weekends. All of their drinks and dishes are tasty with lots of flavor. Highly recommend the Eggs Benedict. The restaurant is also across from the High Line so when you've stuffed your face in food, you can walk it off in the park.
No comment
No comment

Really great restaurant. It is a big restaurant but they somewhat manage to keep it rather cozy. Get there early definitely. Went for brunch and dinner. Dishes are amazing. Ingredients are fresh produce and you can taste it! Great service.

I went here for lunch with my family. They honored my reservation, which is unusual in the restaurant business. We were seated at a nice comfortable table. Service was prompt and attentive. We all had different items for lunch and no one was disappointed. Stand outs are; white shrimp salad, huevos rancheros, pulled pork sandwich and a juicy burger with a fried egg on top. Do Not miss the fresh ginger margarita. One of the best in the city. I will def retur.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Great place with good atmosphere try the Tuna salad you cannot go wrong here whatever you choose
No comment
No comment
No comment
Service was fine but breakfast not great . Had to return coffee and porridge to get another option .
I've always dug this place. The porgies are just phenomenal. The service is always decent (when crowded) if not superior on a normal night. You can always count on lots of hustle from the staff.

We had such a fun dinner here! Thanks to Jess for a wonderful experience. Our favorites were the eggplant appetizer, scallops main dish with a perfect wine pairing thanks to Richard's suggestion! Make sure you stay for dessert!
Awesome brunch. Call ahead or reserve on open table so you don't have to wait! Can't go wrong with anything on the menu
Good food, but very small menu. It is also very crowded, so calling ahead is preferred. It can also be a bit loud as a result.
Really great brunch. Started with figs and cheese and beignets.   Fantastic and got better from there. Good atmosphere.

The food was good. The restaurant fills up fast for brunch we had to wait 10-15 minutes to get seated and I already had a reservation; without one you wait 45mins to an hour.  I had the huevos rancheros and they were really good and my bf had the hamburger which was okay.  Def not worth waiting an hour for but it was okay.  In my opinion its a bit overpriced and the food is average.  It was good but not amazing.
Awesome food with average service. The place is absolutely crowded so you may wait for 30mn or more but worth it
I have my main meal in the morning.I like it here . I like its country style and portion size . Food was great

If i could marry a place to eat, this place would be in the running.   I have friends willing to travel from the Upper East Side just for lunch.    Outstanding service coupled with food that delights the palate and fills the stomach (always key for me).    The soups are in the top 5 soups I have had in the world.    I have yet to be mildly unimpressed with any entree.    I make it a point to enjoy a meal there each trip.

I really enjoyed the dinner I had here. The people in our group ordered scallops, duck, chicken and mackerel. Everyone's plates were empty by the end of the meal. Wine list is decent. The staff was attentive, but not overbearing. I was able to make a reservation on Open Table, which is always a plus.
No comment
Friendly, upbeat, cheerful service and room.  Well-executed if not overly interesting dishes.  A good go-to.

The dishes are overwhelmingly meaty, but if that doesn't define comfort food, I don't know what does. I would have felt more comfortable if I had remembered to wear socks that evening.  And the sausage skin? Don't get me started...
No comment
No comment

ICE CREAM CART REVIEW: A common trend in the summer, perhaps I'd agree if you told me the cart doesn't deserve a separate listing, mainly because the quality Cookshop's food and their frozen treats align quite well. So delicious, they doled out large portions and wooden to-go spoons, but no one seemed interested? Fools. If you were like me, you'd have stopped and gotten the Lemon-Curd-Pecan-Brittle-with-Salty-Caramel-Sauce for $3.50, a steal.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Interesting menu, prices OK, good service, nice outdoor dining. Too loud.

I've worked down the street from this swag factory for a year and a half and never bothered to poke my head in. Now I feel like a fool because I just went there for lunch and HOT DANG! This place is fully off the hinges. The apple cider sorbet is ridiculous. They give you salt with your bread (smart!) and the chipotle ketchup? Well, I would do unmentionable things to get my hands on that chipotle ketchup again. The Cookshop is hella winning.
No comment

This place is a must for any brunch lover. The bloody mary's are simply incredible - they even have a bacon one, with bacon also as a garnish (amazing). The food is impeccable - beignettes are simply delicious. The fried egg sandwich is amazing. The only negative and why it gets 4 stars instead of 5 is because there is always a line and a wait.

enjoyed brunch, strong morning drinks (hair of the dog) very important to start a morning off that way (or early afternoon as the case was).  Server was very polite - not overly attentive which is sometimes I find to be good thing, and in this case it was.  Ask for a booth in the back, as many of the regular tables looked cramped based on the customer volume they do there.  Great experience.
Great menu and good service, also fun to walk the highline after a big brunch!

Good for brunch because they take reservations. I got my reserved table in 10 minutes while they told people without rezzies that it would be 45. WOO! Otherwise, though, while pretty tasty, this was nothing all that special. The huevos rancheros were decent and came in a huge baked dish that could've fed two. My friend's frittata was, again, huge, but only okay flavor-wise. And even though I love beet juice and fresh vegetables overall, I really didn't like their Left Coast Bloody Mary. It tasted like soap. (I'm not one of those people who think cilantro tastes like soap, but this tasted like I imagine cilantro tastes to people who hate cilantro.)

The food is SO good "it makes you wanna slap your Mama!!!". Seriously! Please open one in Courthouse Arlington, VA next to Sushi Rock. You guys will make a killing! The morning 80's mix is a great addition to the meal. Thanks to Erica for the great service and Cookshop for the mind blowing meal :) This experience has made my top five...

A great spot for brunch.  The cookshop scramble was excellent when combined with the applewood smoked bacon.  Definitely try the grits (if you like grits) and if you have room (or bring a friend) try the French toast.

Went here last Thursday with my gfs for a bday and loved this cute little spot. We were sat by the fire and although it got a little toasty, we didn't mind that much. Our server, she was awesome, she offered to put out cupcakes in the fridge and since some of our friends were running late, like an hour late, she didn't push us to order or bother us, she was very accommodating and in great spirits. After the amazing dinner (we ordered seafood stew, the duck, porgy, the pizza and squash appetizer), the server came out with our cupcakes transferred to a nice plate and some little brownies (on the house) with a lit candle! We didn't t even expect it! Our server was knowledgeable in the food and wine and made sure we were taken care of. :)
I have always had a pleasant experience at this restaurant.  I love the concept, great wines, excellent staff and warm atmosphere.

OMG! OMG! OMG! This restaurant elevated brunch to a whole new level. It did not disappoint. I can truly trust the Food Network when they recommend restaurants. The service staff was very friendly and well informed of the menu. Our server recommended suitable choices for brunch that went along with my diet. I was surprised at their interpretation of the Amish Chicken Breast Salad! Though I still regret not trying the Baked Brioche French Toast with Butterscotch Sabayon, I still had a very satisfying meal. A definite destination place for me next time I am in town. It is a place where the food does indeed feed the soul. (09/01/2012)
No comment

Been twice for dinner, both times the service was ok...hostess bubbly and friendly buy waiters are all bearded "Mumford and Sons" looking no personality types.  Both times my husband and I had fatty meat...the beef the first time and the pork chop the second time.  Oyster appetizer poor quality oysters overly breaded and fried served on top of a bed of overly mayonaissed slaw.  Atmosphere is the only plus...loud and lively if you are looking for action.  Many better restaurants in Chelsea...
Perfect everything - fresh food, plate styling, servers and décor. We love it during the winter months because very cozy. Summer months they have outdoor seatings and it's great to people watch.

I must say I had an excellent angus burger here and the sample of my date's turkety sandwich was also quite tasty. Service was slow and they mixed up my order twice, in addition to having the waitress pour water on my new shoes twice while filling my glass!  But the food was very good.
This is a nice place in Chelsea, good atmosphere, very nice service, great food, good value for money.  Hard to go wrong with this place, and definitely recommended.

Had a great brunch at Cookshop with my boyfriend. Luckily we made a reservation because there was a little bit of a wait. I loved the natural light coming through large windows. I got the brisket egg potato hash and it was so delicious. And I topped my meal off with a warm chocolate chip muffin. Service was great, food was great. I would definitely go back.

So good. I've been twice on my last two trips to NYC.  The fried ferns were yummy,  crispy hominy was bland- skip it.  Their polenta fries are out of this world. My husband hates polenta and he can't stop talking about them.  Their steak is delicious, so are the scallops, and the halibut. I had it in May but it was off the menu when I went back last week. I had the eggplant "lasagna' instead. It was so cheesy and good. yum.  My husband got the pork and was a little disappointed, as it was lacking in sauce.  Be sure to save room for the banana / ice cream dessert...it's out of this world!
No comment

Dinner at Cookshop = One of the Best Meals Ever. You wil NOT be disappointed. We made a reservation for 11pm (which gave us the perfect amount of time to see a show, get a cab, and make our way to Chelsea on a Friday night.) They treated us like royalty and made wonderful food recommendations. The rabbit liver is INCREDIBLE and the wine list is lovely. We will definitely be returning to Cookshop in the near future!

Dinner at Cookshop on Friday April 2nd...NICE...I really enjoyed the whole experience.  Not the best location for people watching out the window but a cool area nonetheless.  Place was vibrant/busy which is so NYC.  Meal was fantastic.  Started with the deviled eggs and a beer, very tasty for an egg!!  Then ordered a scallop dish.  Each bit of that dish had its own unique taste and somehow you could taste each ingredient!!  Everything was so fresh and prepared well.  Chef was on that night!!!  HIghly rec this place and will be back!! --- woops, forgot the fries with mayo!!...YUM

We had a good meal here tonight, but the service was lousy. We waited while 3 other tables who were seated along with us were served and no food for us. Were we not cool enough? When we asked about our food... I mean, deviled eggs take how long to make?...they seemed surprised. Then a manager came by and disappeared only to have the food start to trickle out. No apologies. No offer of free dessert. My husband refused to complain, but I would have. If you want to pay a lot and have lousy service this is the restaurant for you!
Reliable and tasty. You can usually get away with ordering the smaller plates, as the portions are large.

I've been to Cookshop a few times over the past six months, and each time I'm glad I went. The food is always solid, drinks are inventive and delicious, and the service is friendly and helpful. Great for a date or dinner with friends. I'll be going back!

FIne, for the most part, but not at these prices. Most of what we ordered (rabbit, scallops, and an unbelievably dense pasta) was tasty enough, but everything save the pasta was slathered in oil. Fortunately, excellent bread is on hand to mop up the flavorful grease (Amy's?)--it's just hard to see why good ingredients are being put to such poor use. One caution: avoid the wreckfish. Ours was almost inedibly rubbery. Apart from this, the service was very good, and the spiced hominy is unusual and satisfying, like tiny tatertots enlivened (and degreased) with a smart wedge of lime.

Brunch was great. Drinks were better.  Our server was horrible.  There were four of us, three got our food and one did not.  Ten minutes later we had to flag down a busboys to please help us find the rest of our food.  Server never checked on us.
No comment
Our waiter, James, was only surpassed by the exquisite food. I have nothing but praise for all three courses I savored. My two dining companions were blown away as well. All I can say is just GO!
Make a reservation ahead of time. The food is awesome and the Bloody Mary selection is great.

Decent neighborhood food. I wouldn't make a trip to Chelsea here if I lived far away. But it would be in the rotation if I lived nearby. The place can get a little loud. The drinks at the bar are great. The scene is more 30 or 40-something. Which is kinda nice, in this area of town. Of what we had (spagetti squash, whiting, roast lamb, etc.) the beet salad was by far the best. I'd say 3.5 stars.

My friends and I heard great reviews about this place so we decided to check it out. Let me just say that they serve the best burger I have experienced in a lonnnnng time. The flavors just burst in your mouth not to mention the the white cheddar cheese and the bun complimented it well. The only thing I disliked was the long wait.
No comment

This place is great for brunch! My second time eating brunch here and love the food. Ate here this past Sunday. It was very busy with a 45-60 minute wait time. Luckily, had made an 11:45 online reservation and was seated a little after 12. Ordered a grapefruit momosa and the Cookshop scramble with bacon, served on a biscuit. Both excellent. My wife had a poached egg with a killer cheese sauce and chives served on a popover. This was extremely good. Will definitely brunch here again!
Pork belly was good, location is even better.
No comment
No comment
It's been a while since I had it... Since I don't remember neither anything good or annoying, I guess 3 should be fair...
No comment
No comment

We loved it....would go again in a heartbeat.  We had 6:30 Saturday night reservations (for 4) and were seated promptly in a booth in the back so I can't speak to the major part of the room - it was quite full by the time we left, and it does get loud in there.  Our server was delightful, we were never neglected (or rushed), water constantly refilled, bread basket x2, etc.  Snacks:  peekytoe crab beignets (2 small) were delicious; cheese churros (4 sticks) a great snack; deviled eggs (4 small halves) well done; little gem salad, sharp, tangy, herby, lovely.  Entrees:  lamb burgers (cooked perfectly to order) which disappeared (the potatoes are AMAZING); tuna with mission figs (melt in your mouth); mezze which, considering it's simplicity, was excellent (I couldn't finish it all, not even close).  Dessert:  warm chocolate cake (outrageous); fresh doughnuts (wow, that ice cream...)  2 hours, 5 drinks for 4 people, $250 with tip and we're still feeling full the next morning.  My takeaway?  It's easy to spend $28 on an entree in NYC and how many times have I come away from that experience saying "meh," or "not worth it."  It was a welcome surprise to experience a unique, fresh, well-prepared, well-seasoned meal delivered with grace.  (5 stars because we've had so many mediocre meals in recent years - this was really.good.food.)
Solid food. I had the duck enchilada, which was quite tasty. Wine was not particularly inspiring.

I've been coming here before their bread became ala carte ... Their bread basket was what made their brunch.. that being said: the food and their specials are always beyond amazing. Everyone always goes out of their way and it's probably one of the best brunches in NYC. Love it.

I've been to cookshop for both brunch and dinner. It has a dope variety of bloody mary's and the french toast is to die for. The sea scallops are a must for seafood lovers. This is a great place to go with a big group that takes reservations.

Bloody Mary's were incredible. Got the blt Mary but they have 6 different bloody options. Brioche French toast was a custard orgasm in the mouth. Stracciatella fig appetizer was creamy, sweet, delicious. Huevos rancheros was SO good and beany. Needed a bit of extra hot sauce though.
Huevos Rancheros.  A-MA-ZING!  Nice hip vibe as well.
Very impressed with the Brunch. Nice decoration as well. Staffs are really nice. Will come back definitely!!
One of my all-time favorite restaurants in NYC. Consistently delicious, fun atmosphere, great service.

I've been here a few times as a close friend lives directly behind this restaurant. We love the people watching aspect in the warm weather. The main draw to this place is the outdoor seating. Period. We stay away in the cold because what would be the point? The food is fine, nothing worth mentioning here.  Just AVERAGE. Why the crazy crowds? Not sure why. But we always have a good enough tasty meal, nothing earth shattering or anything. Enjoy small talk and the great weather plus it is near great shops.
No comment
