No comment
Total fan. Wonderful specialty cocktails and a rotating menu. Brava!
No comment
No comment
No comment
Love it. What more is to say that has not been written...... just go have brunch eat and enjoy! Do not be afraid of the brunch pizza it is so yummy and flavorful.
No comment

good service.. food is tasty but over priced... and not very personal... but if it was 5 bucks less on the entrees... would be a no brainer for good american fare. Kitchen is like a machine.... they got it goin on back there... fast and consistent.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Waited a long time for my table. The service was fine but not friendly. I started with the Razor clams, they were very tasty but a bit chewy. I had the Scallops with a creamy spinach and lemon relish as my entree. The scallops were delicious but a little heavy. I would go back if I didn't have to wait unfortunately they don't take reservations.
I had a great time out with their friendly staff and amazing food. Try the mocktails!
No comment

Totally packed for Saturday brunch but we stole 2 seats at the bar. The wines by the bottle are not that great unless you get the most expensive one. The food was awesome. Bartenders were fast and efficient.

We had a late weekday brunch reservation this past summer (in August).  The restaurant was nearly empty, service was good, and so was the food.  I chose the Cookshop Breakfast, which is a lot of food, my wife ordered the whitefish salad.  My food was definitely better, but both dishes were fine.  This is a place where most people will find something that interests them, and the food will be good.
A great range of seasonal and organic foods.  Perfect for a date, but also a great setting for a business meeting.  Stop by Appellation next door to pick up a bottle of organic wine on your way home.
No comment

As a fan of Five Points (same owners as Cookshop), I was eager to try this restaurant as soon as it opened. It was hard to get a reservation - a lot of prime times are blocked off on the Open Table profile of this place - and finally I just called up the restaurant and got a reservation for two on a Friday night at 8:30pm. We arrived on a rainy evening with enough fog to make it difficult to see the stacked parking lot right across the street from the restaurant. The atrium area was PACKED with people waiting three-deep at the bar and pushing up against the door. So, we waited about an hour for our table (although we had a reservation) and as a way to make up for the inconvenience, our waiter gave us two free "snacks": fried spiced hominy and baby felafels with yogurt sauce. The spiced hominy was AMAZING and I completely stuffed myself on it as my friend that I was with doesn't eat fried foods (all the more for me!). We shared a great duck entree and the suckling pig. Paired with a rose from the great wine list, this was an amazing dinner. Can't wait to go back!

I simply can't imagine a better value or more enjoyable dining experience in New York City.  The quality of the food is always amazing - I had the swordfish tonight, which I ordered because I never like swordfish, and it was freakin' amazing - meaty and delish and flaky and rich.  I tried the duck wings to start (unbelievable) and the carrot cake bread pudding to finish - autumnal and not too sweet or heavy.  And on top of that all, the service is unbelievable - we had late reservations tonight and were there 30 minutes after everyone else, and they didn't make us feel bad the way every other restaurant might.  Totally courteous, informed and chill.  Can't wait to come back.

Good spot for brunch.  Huevos rancheros was really good and hearty and had a refined twist.  Eggs were almost uncooked (which I liked), but if that's a problem for you, maybe say something in advance. They have a really hot hot sauce that goes great with it.   Egg white frittata was a large portion.  Would be a good thing to split and eat with a salad.
Our Sunday brunch had great food and service.  Great tastes. I loved the huevos rancheros. The pastry sampler was unbelievable.

Went here for brunch on a Saturday afternoon. Fairly difficult to get a good reservation time - we booked a week in advance and still couldn't get a table until 2:00. But that actually made me more excited because a restaurant on 10th avenue and 20th isn't busy because of the environment. We asked for a seat outside and the hostess was very kind to us. After we had a bloody mary at the bar she ushered us out to our seat - they were very accommodating to us. When our food took a little long to be delivered (although we didn't notice until the waitress mentioned it) we were given two complimentary bloody mary's. I ordered the scrambled egg on rye toast (not a fan of biscuits) and my boyfriend ordered the poached egg dish. The fact that he had no complaints about his food is huge. He will eat anything without complaining except for a bad poached egg. I'd definitely recommend it for brunch and I hope to try it out for dinner!

This place is EXCELLENT! Once you walk in you are greeted and seated immediately (if you have a reservation, luckily we did). They start you off with an assortment of bread with there special horse radish butter. To start off the meal I chose an appetizer which was there Little neck clams cooked in white wine with hand made pork chorizo with cilantro and lime. I'm a big fan of cilantro and that immediately caught my eye. It was refreshing... The dish was served in a cast-iron bowl. clams still in tact with the shell lay on the sliced chorizos that are bathing in the white wine sauce. Just squeeze the lime and provided and your ready to go. From the first bite I knew that the entire meal will be all good like this. For my main course I got the Hudson Valley duck breast Wehani. It came with a wild rice salad with red and black currant compote.... This dish had to be the best i've had so far in New York. All the elements came together and was not over powering. The duck was cooked with a little bit of red in pink in the center and it was very moist and juicy. The portions were very good. You can share with a friend and pass the plate around. I was very happy and pleased with my meal at The Cookshop. The price range is a little high, about $30-45 per person. I assure you that it is WORTH IT. They have a customer for life!
Seated us in a timely manner, food was great and service was fabulous too.  Even though there was a large wait line, the staff didn't rush us through our brunch. Would definitely go back.
Brilliant experience.  My tomato gazpacho was wonderful, just the thing on a hot day.  The steak was very tender and well-prepared. Service was prompt and attentive.
No comment

Here's a great story. I was having a spontaneous last-minute brunch at Hundred Acres in SoHo (same owners as Cookshop) and they brought over a birthday cake because they heard from their "friends at Cookshop" that it was my birthday recently! And I hadn't been to Cookshop in months - they remembered from last year! Cookshop is more than just great food - it has great people. Since I moved and no longer come here every week, I miss my favorite old neighborhood spot but it's definitely worth the trip across town!

As blase' as Little Wayne without the tattoos or shiny teeth.  As uneventful as Prom without the awkward sex (Jodeci playing in a stretched Hummer limo---girrrrrrllllll!) and the fake drunkenness.  This place did nothing for me and did nothing to me.  I ordered wrong though, and for that, I shall take responsibility.  You see children, I ordered the Mahi Mahi.  And to order Mahi Mahi, one must make a calculated deliberation in ones own head that they are not looking for something stellar (ridiculous oysters or swordfish).  Instead, ordering a Mahi Mahi these days is like purchasing a gray Van Heusen shirt and wearing it with a black three button wide shouldered suit with square toe Aldo shoes.  It is, at its essence, wrong, boring, and unremarkable.  Yes its there in front of you, but not really.  It was just this small piece of fish, next to the small portion of leafy greens with some water (I suffered a concussion by hitting my head on my own car-Larry David clutz style-and I was not able to drink.)  The waiter was, like the meal, Meh squared.  But this is not to suggest only my meal was blah.  The ladies who I ate with, one who had the swordfish, the other who had the Wreckfish, and the third, who lives on the edge, the pizza, all said their meals were blah at best.  The conclusion must either be that the restaurant was blah, or that the Xanax hit us harder than we expected.  Either way, I could not in good conscience recommend the place.  Oh, the Swordfish was also close to $30.  I would only purchase such a fish of such a size in the future if it was stuffed with $30.  Even then, I would expect the $30 that came out of the fish to be just blah.
No comment

I passed Cookshop every day on the way to work for a while, and it always looked appealing (but not the type of thing to do every day, especially during an unpaid internship where taking a full lunch was discouraged), but when my aunt requested a lunch I. It had a lovely lunch atmosphere, which filled up very quickly. The menu changes slightly daily to emphasize fresh ingredients, but I had the griddled cheese and my aunt had the brussels sprout pizza, both of which appear to be regulars (at least for the season). My sandwich was a nice portion, with a small salad on the side, but it could have used more pecan/cheese and less apple. Still lovely, though. The pizza was divine. We shared the assorted treats at the end, which was a nice but not-too-heavy way to finish off the meal. Caramels and cupcake were delicious, and the other desserts/ice cream flavors sounded great. I don't know if I'd go out of my way to go back regularly, but it's a great place to eat if you find yourself in West Chelsea and for whatever reason don't feel like going to Colicchio.
Yum! Great cocktails, delicious healthy food.
Food still great - Som (Richard) still on top form - we had nice St, Joseph that paired so well with the food.
the food and service were excellent;  only minus is the noise level, which at peak hour can make it difficult to talk across the spacious tables.
Great brunch spot. Expected a little more out of my huevos rancheros, but the awesome drinks and outdoor seating make it well worth the trip.
Nice brunch but over priced. You have enough money to spend for an expensive breakfast, this would be a good place. Good service.

loved the atmosphere, was psyched to sit outside but there was construction across the street that was driving me insane so we moved inside. Really great service, we had the duck, lamb and pork - all of it was really great! I think our favorite was the Pork Chop. The german Torte for dessert is a must!!!!!!! great texture and flavor.

Very good. Had the Cookshop scramble with smoked trout and BLT Mary, which actually had an entire piece of bacon! LOL. Everything was very good, although salty. I like salt, so it didn't both me, but it may for some. Very good service. The poached eggs and huevos rancheros looked amazing. I will be back.

More like a 3.5.  We made a reservation for a party of 8 for brunch yesterday (Sat.)  Nice decor - open, high ceilings, lots of light.  Alittle noisy but not too annoying.  Service was great.  Good Bloody Marys.  Loved the beingets - four little balls of light fried dough resting on a bed of yummy lemon curd.  We liked the free-range roasted turkey sandwich (half of the plate consisted of french fries though.  They weren't bad but there was so much of it.), the Cookshop scramble, casserole baked eggs, beef burger and french toast.  Unfortunately, I didn't notice that my young, cute little 13-year old cousin didn't eat her griddled cheese sandwich until we were all finished eating (sorry!!).  She didn't like it because the bread was super hard (she was right, you could have used it for dry wall!)  If I had noticed it sooner, I would have had her order something else.  Oh, and half of that dish was occupied by french fries, as well.  We didn't feel rushed which was nice.  Overall, we enjoyed our brunch so we wouldn't mind going back.

I like Cookshop, but I wasn't blown away by Cookshop and given it's reputation for an amazing brunch spot in Chelsea you're going to fight a crowd that I'm not sure if it's worth it. We came by a little after they opened and the place was already hopping, we were quoted about a 45 min. - hour wait which ended up being extremely accurate. Everyone in our party ended up ordering egg dishes which came out gorgeous. The eggs on the mushroom tostada that my friend ordered were perfectly poached. I had the huevos ranchero which came out in a stack and layered set up that was really interesting looking, unlike huevos ranchero I had ever been served and definitely the prettiest, but I've had more flavorful renditions of the dish in many a other place. The place is good, and the space is charming. We had a little table in the back next to the oven which was so warming on a chilly NYC fall day. However, it didn't really hit me enough to warrant the wait.

Last night three friends and I had an incredible meal at Cookshop. We were really hungry when we came in, which was probably for the best, since we ate heartily and shared several things on the menu, starting with the Brussel Sprout pizza and ending with the Chocolate Candy Bar Pie and the Gingerbread Pudding. We had a delicious Portuguese Red to accompany dinner and I ordered the Lamb which came prepared in a tasting of three preparations, all mouth melting, served on top of white flageolet beans and sauteed escarole. Other dishes we shared were the Spaghetti Squash with Hazelnut Cream, Dried Cherries and Fried Kale (DIVINE!), The Bosc Pear salad (not one of our favs), the Semolina Macaroni (delish) and the Cod in Chowder (super Yummy, but heavy.) It was the perfect amount of food for us all and the atmosphere was warm and inviting and we could hear each other despite how busy and full it was. I would definitely go back and would love to check out their brunch!

This is our go to neighborhood place. They have amazing brunch and awesome dinner. They have awesome drink that has cucumber soda and their steak is always amazing. If at brunch they have shrimp salad with grapefruit that is out of this world. Go and you wont be disappointed.

Great spot in Chelsea. The service was spectacular, the crowd was lively and sophisticated, and the food and drinks were great. We showed up about 20 minutes late for our reservation and were greeted by a completely packed house. However, the hostess was able to seat us immediately which was such a relief because we were starving!! The drinks were fantastic. I had the ruby red mojito. It wasn't bitter or too sweet, but simply refreshing. The bread and butter were yummy! I had the three bean minestrone soup which was very tasty but the broth was a bit oily. I will say the same for the cod that I had...the broth was definitely very oily. But the fish was cooked to perfection and the shell fish was delicious. I had the Affogato Sundae for dessert. I was a bit disappointed with this dish as the espresso they poured over it on delivery was way too overpowering. However, the Coconut Panna Cotta my friend had was delicious! I would recommend that. Overall, I had a wonderful time here and thoroughly enjoyed the food and the service. I will be back as I'm curious to experience brunch here.
No comment

So I went to Cookshop a few years ago when they first opened and I have less than stellar memories but they more than redeemed themselves when I stopped by for brunch on Saturday. The place was bumpin; there were people waiting 15 deep; people are serious about their weekend brunches (I get it, it's the best meal of the week and you can only have it twice a week). My mother was smart enough to make a reservation - she's handy to have around. I started with a Bloody Mary - very tasty, nice spice, garnished with olives and celery and spicy salt on the rim. We had deviled eggs - this was my biggest complaint of the meal because it seems like they just took them out of the refrigerator and served them to us - they were too cold and just not that tasty. I had the Moules Frites which were fantastic. The fries were perfectly crispy and served with mayonnaise and ketchup and the mussels were so well flavored and really plump and delicious. My dad had the smoked salmon scramble which was also really good and my mom had the poached eggs and grits - also excellent. Ended the meal with fabulous coffee. In a city full of brunch options, this is one of the brunch places I've been to in a long time.

Horrible service start to finish. The woman who seated us greeted us with "Let's go." It took almost an hour to get our drinks. Every course was set in front of the wrong person for every single dish. I contacted the restaurant about our experience and never heard back. The food was good but I think the service is better at Taco Bell.

I wish had taken a picture of the mussels so I could post it.  I dream about those mussels.  They were so so so so good.  And they were gigantic!  I've never seen such huge mussels.  The food here is superb.  I had the scallops for dinner and savored every bite.  It was absolutely perfect.  If I was not so broke, I would come here all the time. YUM.

What a treat. This restaurant is terrific in every sense of the word. The food is absolutely delicious (even though the portions are huge) and the wine list is great. We had the nicest waiter (always the icing on the cake) to accompany the amazing meal. The best part was the huge brownie sundae at the end. A real foodie destsination but if you're not into meat I suggest you look elsewhere.
No comment

Came here for brunch.  We were running really late but they still held our table for us, which is really nice, especially on a busy Sunday.  The huevos rancheros was massive!  Felt more like a plate of black beans though.  The egg sandwich was okay, nothing special.  The sticky bun and the brioche french toast were good. I would say they do a good job with the sweet breakfast items, but the savory ones not so much.

Bloody Mary / Bellini followed by roasted broccoli & cheddar scramble. The biscuits are great!! All was very yummy. We just walked in & got a table right away on a Saturday at 11:30-unheard of. Even the decaf coffee was good. Server was friendly & fun. A definite recommend.

Awesome meal.  I came here for brunch with two friends and had a great experience. The place was packed  but we had made reservations so we didn't have to endure the endless wait.   Pickled bloody mary was beyond amazing.  Beignets appetizer was good, but not spectacular, i think it needed more powdered sugar.  I had the burger with fried egg which was very flavorful though a bit messy (though I love a good messy burger).  My friend had a salad and said it was great. My other friend had the cookshop scrambled which i tasted and it was delicious.  The buttermilk scone/biscuit was the best part!  Overall, great place to enjoy brunch with friends.

This used to be our favorite brunch place in New York and the only one we'd travel out of our neighborhood for. We were there this weekend and unfortunately the food has gone way down hill. We both had the Cookshop scramble with smoked trout; it was tasteless and the eggs weren't fluffy like they used to be. It also used to be made with smoked salmon and the downgrade to trout for the same price is unfortunate. We also had an order of the home fries which had an odd taste which wasn't good. Unfortunately, the food was bad enough that we won't be going back despite the fact that our waiter was great.

lobster salad, chicken liver mousse, carpaccio, fritters and grilled corn were insane! everything we tasted was beyond amazing and i would go back again and again.  fresh, organic ingredients that were prepared in truly innovative and creative ways.

Came for brunch on Memorial Day and walked the High Line afterwards.  The restaurant is super convenient to the High Line. There was no wait at 10 am but by the time we left it was full and people were waiting. I would give this place 3.5 stars. We started off with the beignets, which were nothing like Cafe du Monde beignets but they were quite good and piping hot. My companion had the frittata which had some very good flavors but execution wise it was a bit of a miss, I felt. It consisted of a plain dry egg base with goat cheese, nuts and a salad on top. I had the spinach cheddar scramble which was served with a salad (same simple one that was on the frittata - it was ok). The eggs were amazingly good.  Loved them.  The biscuit - not sure what that was. You would not call the overcooked, dry flat thing on my plate a biscuit where I'm from. I didn't even eat it and asked for some toast which they provided. The service was great.

We were visiting NY from Boston on July 2, so it was an impromptu decision to walk in and have a late lunch at Cookshop. We saw a line of people outside and figured they must know what they were waiting for. After waiting for half an hour to be seated, we got a table. Man, the place was crowded! The menu was mostly vegetarian, which was fine, as we are not too fussy and willing to try anything. A waiter stopped by and asked us about water and drinks. After 5 minutes he brought the water, after 10 more he showed up with our beers. We were more than ready to order by that time, but he put the beers on the table and disappeared for the next 30 minutes.Then he showed up with a young lady and told us that she will be serving us. She took our orders - both vegetarian - which normally don't require long preparations. After almost 50 minutes we got the food. during this time we were wondering if the waitress gave our food to someone else by mistake, as she never showed up to give us an update, neither to ask us if we needed more water, beer, or anything at all so we could handle the long wait. The food was good, creative dishes, nice presentation. But quite frankly, 2 eggs on top of 4 pieces of tomato and burrata salad was not fulfilling, it shouldn't have been $18 and it definitely shouldn't have taken 50 minutes to make it. But certainly the lack of service topped it all. We left hungry, thirsty and disappointed for wasting almost 2 hours. And while many people say in their reviews the service is not there, I am puzzled how this place got high reviews and is still standing at all. Tourists beware: there are better places around.

Came to NYC with some girlfriends and had brunch at Cookshop on a Sunday early afternoon. DEFINITELY make reservations. We made reservations that morning which worked out very well, and skipped a line that looked like it would take an hour to wait through. We were seated right away, the drinks and food were amazing, and the service was great. Couldn't ask for a better brunch spot.
Seriously good food, excellent service. I love it when you can totally rely on a restaurant,
Good location and atmosphere, Attentive service...Great fresh blueberry margarita.....
No comment

2.5. This place gets slammed with the brunch crowd, the business dinner crowd, the business lunch crowd, the neighborhood crowd, the scenesters, the B & T weekend shoppers/gallery types, everybody at one point so it's a wonder the kitchen hasn't burned down from trying to churn out the volume.  Yes, they try to serve locally sourced food. Yes, the people at the reservation desk are a bit jacked, and it's not unusual to wait 10 minutes in line to talk to someone about a table or a reservation you had. The food used to be better... some side dish/snack things like the spiced hominy were too salty, other things, a bit bland.  But the fish is always fresh and cooked very well all year round, the pork, sweet and smoky, and the pastas are done right. The wait staff is good. The menus are seasonal.  If you can get past the noise, and risk dining in close proximity to networking people, it's not bad, especially if you do the sidewalk seating and can gaze out at the people walking their well-groomed Chelsea dogs if the scene gets too annoying.

I work in the area and eat breakfast/lunch or get drinks here probably 4 times a week because it's great!  The servers are always busy but very friendly and most importantly, they remember you.  If you go in for breakfast often, they'll know exactly what you order and how you take your coffee, which is pretty nice for NYC.  I highly recommend the fried egg sandwich for breakfast, fish tacos for lunch, and the cocktails, no matter what time of day, are so so so fantastic!!

I've been here twice with one great experience and the second tarnished by a waiter who rushed us out. Everything was wonderful the first time - delicious food, great lively atmosphere, and fine service.  On our second visit, for a special occasion, we were done eating our entrees 45 minutes after getting there.  The waiter then asked us if there was anything else he could get us rather than offering dessert and coffee or asking if we wanted it (we did). It was fairly early and there were plenty of empty tables, so I have no idea what the rush was other than that we look young so he thought we wouldn't spend a lot? I really have no idea, but it left a bad taste in my mouth.

One of the places with the worst customer service . Would never go there again . The person managing the seating was rude. Over phone they were giving different information and in person they were saying the exact contradictory information .

Great brunch spot. Pretty sure we're one of the few groups ever who ordered the breadbasket ... underrated, carb-y deliciousness. Super crowded in the front even though there is quite a bit of room, bit annoying to wait for a table with others invading your personal space ... but food makes up for it!
Love their beignets and the service has always been impeccable. Make a reservation for brunch!

I took a friend for brunch and the whole thing just wasn't as good as the first time.  We all split the assorted pastries basket which was mostly very good, but the entrees fell flat.  I tried the Cookshop Scramble this time and it was just ok, nothing that exciting.  My friend got the frittata and found it be be dry, a bit burned, and basically just an omelet, so I was a bit embarrassed that I had raved so much about this place.  The morning mojito I had this time wasn't as good as I remembered either, so maybe the place was just having an off-day, but my friend and I were disappointed.

Was a little nervous walking it at 9 pm on a Saturday. Was really dead, but it was January and like 5 degrees out. Table of three was seated promptly. Only small complaint was fish heavy appetizer list. So I went with the pulled pork croquettes.  Insanely good. Never had caviar before so I was nervous about the deviled eggs with troat roe. These were incredible. I will be making my own version of these on Easter. For entrée I got the Tuna steak. I hate cauliflower and they let me switch it out with squash. Everything was very good. Waitress was not 100% attentive but service was still solid.

Lovely, clear mushroom soup. The trout was perfectly prepared and seasoned, though the cranberries and pear were a bit too sweet with it. Wines by the glass list is short but very well chosen. Floor staff competent. The atmosphere for dinner is dark and buzzy without being noisy.

I came here a few months ago for a big group (of 10) brunch on the weekend.  This place is pretty big but definitely require reservations for brunch (and we did have one) as it got crowded pretty quickly after we walked in. Everything is a la carte here and there is no prix-fixe with drinks included. However, everyone in our party got both and were all very happy with both food AND drinks! They actually have a bar up front as you enter, that's how you know they make serious drinks! All the brunch portions are HUGE, and the quality is very consistent - fresh and tasty without being overly "saucy" or greasy. Even something as simple as a chocolate croissant was very delicious. This place is great for big groups or even groups of 5-6 (they have booths), but could get a bit loud due to the high ceiling and open space. The location is a bit out of the way but seems like enough people still find a reason to head that way and try it out!

Great brunch food but absolutely need reservations. Can feel a bit crowded and rushed as it's so busy, which isn't what I'm always in the mood for on a Sunday, but the food is worth it every now and again.

Our favorite restaurant for dinner in Manhattan. Interesting but unpretentious selections, helpful waitstaff, fun atmosphere (always crowded but not teaming)...I cannot offer enough praise for Cookshop. A great place to take out of town guests...a real taste of NYC...

Went here after reading all the solid brunch reviews. It didn't really live up to my party's expectations (3 of us). I got the smoked trout scramble - the scramble itself was actually really good, but I didn't care for the biscuit that came with it. The other people I was with got the poached eggs and hueves rancheros (which were very soupy - I thought they should have given him a spoon). The service was friendly, but slow. Overall, I think if you're looking for a great brunch you would find better value someplace else.

The dining room is very well decorated, and the ambiance is nice.  The seating is a bit tight, and I was sitting next to a French woman who seemed to be so interested in the conversation I was having with my friend, all she had to do was tune in, and she was part of it!  Doesn't help that the tables for 2 are small, and are filled with stem-wear and plates, baskets, etc. which seem like they may fall over if you make the wrong move.  The food was okay.  I had sea scallops with lentils and something else.  The scallops weren't that great-I've had better sea scallops at Japanese restaraunts.  The salad wasn't rinsed well enough-as I bit into grains of sand or dirt that made a strong crunch in my mouth.  The wine was yummy, I like the fact that they focus on local ingredients.  The waitress was on-point, but peronality-less.  Seemed as if they wanted you in, and out.  Felt no warmth or comfort from staff besides the two hostess' in front.

I don't find the food here especially amazing, since the dishes I've had taste pretty much like what you'd expect, but they take reservations for brunch! And the food is good enough--the quality is always good and the service always decent. All the people I've taken here have enjoyed their experiences. I also love the space--it gets tons of natural light. It's enough to make this one of my regular brunch spots.

Had a reservation for Sunday brunch but still had to wait 15 mins for our table. Got the Cookshop scramble with salmon and egg whites. I recommend getting the creme fraiche on the side so you can add at your own discretion. The dish was pretty good, especially when paired with the buttermilk biscuit and caramelized onions. Comes with a side salad.

Yes, everyone is on the locavore trend.  This place is no exception but wait...the food is good.  Make that great!!!  They have the equivalent of a fireplace, which they use to cook some dishes in but it makes it very homey.  I loved my entire meal.  I love tasting my friend's dishes as well and declared it fit for a gourmet.  So it was definitely not a fluke.  Eat here now!

Perfect summer brunch spot--or any time of year for that matter.  I've always had a pleasant experience both with service and food.  If you plan on coming for brunch, be sure to make a reservation or be prepared to WAIT!
It was perfect in every way. We had a magnificent and special pre-Christmas meal.

I think this restaurant is a bit over-hyped. The food was good, but nothing to write home about. I think what makes this restaurant stand out is the quality of their ingredients. You can taste the freshness. Otherwise, there was a lack of seasoning when needed and the sauces were a bit over-powering.

I was a fan until a few weeks ago. Food is great but customer service from a few weeks SUCKED. WHAT IS THE POINT OF HAVING US MAKE RESERVATIONS IF YOU ARE GOING TO SEAT US LATE? Come on now, we live in NY a place where people are busy and have places to go. It is just unacceptable to seat people late especially if they made reservations.  ON TOP OF THAT to make matters worse, the host sat people who walked in later BEFORE us. What's going on here? No they were not waiting outside before our party and yes they literally walked in and were taken to their seat right away. Please explain this system.   Food is great but you need to learn how to be prompt.
No comment

I had very high hopes for Cookshop. I left very disappointed. My fiance and I came here for the Huevos Rancheros after reading some pretty positive brunch reviews. The dish was surprisingly bland. It's really just a skillet with beans of the bottom 3 eggs and cheese on top and some tortilla strips. Nothing special, nothing memorial. I would not recommend Cookshop for the Huevos Rancheros nor will I be returning to try anything else.
Great brunch.  duck confit.  rabbit sausage.  oysters.
Went for Sunday brunch and had a great experience.  The service was excellent.  We ordered some of the server's suggestions and really enjoyed all of the food.  Definitely recommended.
Creative and changing menu built around what is fresh and/or in season.  Not everything is a home run, but mostly an excellent experience.
Tasty food, professional friendly service made for a great dinner experience while visiting NYC.

They're a little pricey for the selection but the variaty of dishes make up for it. I had the Carolina Shrimp salad but I wished I'd ordered the Steak salad. It looked soooo good on the plate beside me. Their deserts are to die for.

Worst experience in a restaurant in my entire 65 years. First, I was unhappy being seated outside where it was cold, and the surroundings were unpleasant. Requested to be reseated, but was rebuffed by the host telling me I would be forced to wait an additional time that equalled our wait of 30 minutes. Returned to my table outside to order. After waiting approximately 60 minutes for our food with the waiter often stating our order was next up in the kitchen. I went to seek out  the manager after noticing all tables around us had been served even those arriving 30 minutes after us. The manager told me that our order had been lost, and she asked us to seat down, and wait  for our order offering us some red beats to eat while we waited longer in the cold. At this time my family left without ever eating our lunch, and wasting almost two hours never to eat. This ruined my day, and our mothers day lunch.

Delicious meal at Cookshop. Service was superb, food was divine. Had the beer battered line beans, squash with blue-cheese, sauteed octopus to start. My trout for the main course was delicate, well seasoned and savory. The greens that accompanied the dish were crisp, crunchy and had an asian taste. Someone in my party ate the the lamb, which was buttery, yet light. For dessert we shared the Peanut Butter Tart, Mixed Berry Crumble and the Angel food Cake. I especially loved the tart and crumble. One of the best meals I have ever eaten. Everyone was very pleased!
get the heuvos rancheros. you wont be disappointed.  I cant wait to return to this place!!

Went here for dinner last evening for the first time. The atmosphere is lively and upbeat. We had little neck clams - very good - but nothing I haven't had before. Our entrees were 1. scallops ( very good), local Montauk cobia - the fish was completely dried out, very disappointing & steak ( mediocre & fatty). For dessert a selection of local ice creams & sorbets - all forgettable. I had read and hear so many good thing about this place -- I think all the good words must be about their brunch. Skip dinner here.
Good food, but the waiter got on my nerves when he asked if I needed change after I paid a $45 bill with $60.  Really dude? Really?
No comment
Food is consistently great, but the real treasure is Kevin the sommelier who is amazing at helping pick the perfect wine

One of the best dinners I have had ANYWHERE!  The appetizers were phenomenal -- tried different pates as part of an app plate.  Absolute favorite part as dessert (definitely leave room!) -- Amanda Cook (pastry chef) is one of a kind.  Deserves her own bakery and show to truly showcase materpieces to include sweet potatoe squares, my favorite carrot cake (with heavy layers of cream cheese frosting), red velvet cake and more (including homemade caramels).  I am still think about the desserts several days later.  Such a great location and experience.  Definitely will return again and again and look forward to sampling the amazing menu.  Our entire party was amazed by how much flavor each and every dish had.

Bar staff was very friendly.  We enjoyed the tomato soup and eggplant appy.  We enjoyed it so much that we went the following night again for dinner with 6 others.  Everyone enjoyed the atmosphere, wait staff and the freshness of the food!

Cookshop is my NY favorite! Took my gf for a special dinner, this place delivers. We had a cozy corner booth, the salads were fresh from the farm with delicious dressings, the scallops were over the top, chickpeas were a nice addition. Service from Andrew was courteous, friendly and attentive. Don't miss!
Good food and drinks.  Get the Devil's Tea if you like a sweet, ginger cocktail.  And the Porgy was amazing, if you can handle eating fish with bones in it.

Fabulous, as always. Took visiting family here two weeks ago for brunch and the ambiance was great. Fabulous cocktails (mimosas - got to love when they don't skimp on the champagne) and food. Would def go back.

It is average food with bad service. It is not children friendly restaurant even owner claims it is. Poor decoration. Chicken is very greasy. Would never go back. don't waste money for this restaurant. They are plenty of better restaurants in Chelsea area..for example,Trestle on 10th, Collichio and sons, Morimoto, and Bottino

Stopped in for quick drink and bite with my wife after checking out Chelsea area. She had and amazing blackberry mojito ($12) and I had a fresh limeade ($3). Shared the sweet sausage and grits ap which was amazing! Great tastes, presentation and simplicity. Great value for  $12 and we were very pleased. Nice outdoor sidewalk seating, although we chose the cooler inside bar area on this hot day. Definitely one of our NYC highlights!
Went for Thanksgiving Day dinner.  Best non-home cooked T-day dinner ever.  Corn bread stuffing was out of this world.  Family style sides made it feel like home.  One of the best meals I've had.

We went here for Christmas Eve dinner.  The entire operation was great.  The food was very fresh and their attential to detail was what should be expected in NYC.  A great experience all around and would highly recommend for a nice dinner outing.  The service was also very good.

Absolutely the best breakfast in Manhattan, a bold statement I know.  Get the eggs any style with hash and bacon and you'll understand.  *****However, if you have dark clothing on (a black suit, etc.) do not let these table napkins get anywhere near you.  They somehow leave a trail of lint on you that is impossible to get off when you have to attend a meeting in 5 minutes*****
WOW! What a great restaurant. Food, decor and service all top notch. Try the rotisserie chicken and the fresh shrimp. All desserts area fantastic. Can't wait for a second visit.

It has a nice atmosphere, but the food is okay. My husband ordered the steak. He liked it ,but it wasn't the best steak. I had the pan fried merluzza   and it had no flavor at all. We ordered the cranberry bread pudding. That was the best part of my meal.

This place reminds me of a restaurant in Seattle.  The place was packed, but we did not have to wait at all.  They seemed very well organized there.  The restaurant seemed a little upscale, but I'd say it was more trendy.  The wait staff we're mostly in nice dark jeans and collared shirts which was nice to see.  Some friends recommended this place to us and we came for the food.  They use a lot of organic/local vegies etc.  It was great to see that for a NYC restaurant. Who knew......  Unfortunately I was not that hungry that evening so we ate light.  We started with 2 different types of salads.  THey were both very different, but very delicious.  One contained beets & pears and the other was mainly greens.   I usually do not order Chicken, but I did that night and was really glad I did.  Good portion and paired with purple potatoes which were grilled.  My partner ordered the lamb.  It was sort of a sampler and paired with polenta.  For dessert we shared the ice cream. I forgot to mention the cocktails were good and also had a nice mix of wines.
A nice spot for brunch/b-fast. It is advisable not to get there late as it gets too crowded.
No comment

Went here after being rudely turned away at 'The Park'..   I highly recommend cookshop.. My food was excellent, my drink was perfect, and the $ wasn't bad at all for the location.. 4 people with 4 meals, 7 drinks, and desert came to about $200..  Service was perfect... overall i will be going back very soon! P.S. - the highline is a great after dinner walk! :)
Good spot for brunch, and a fun scene-y crowd. The biscuits are super-duper

Cookshop is my neighborhood (comfort zone) go to. Service is always reliable food is quite delicious. My only complaint now is getting a table these days with the influx of highline tourists is a bummer. Waiting 30-45 minutes w/o res and showing up early w/res hoping to get seated earlier no dice for dinner. I also love the lunch Chicken Salad is the best.

I had great dinner at Cookshop last week.  My reservation through Open Table never properly confirmed and the restaurant was packed when we arrived.  We explained what happened and they very kindly made an effort to seat our table of four in a very reasonable amount of time. The food selection is very interesting, I loved the snack menu. The portions are considerably large and the food well prepared.  This was my 2nd time there in about a year and I wonder what took me so long to return.  It was a very enjoyable eating experience.

Had the best grilled cheese sandwich ever and a lovely cream of broccoli soup.  Seriously I am a big grilled cheese fan and this is by far, hands down the best gourmet grilled cheese I've ever had.  Try it!!!!

Came here on Saturday night with a reservation for 4. They said they had me down for a 2 person reservation when I got there. When I told the host that I called earlier at 1PM for a reservation for 4 people, he told me there was no record of any reservation...even though he already told me that they had my name down for 2 people. He then told me that there was no way I called earlier because he was at the phone all day which was interesting to me because I made the reservation with a woman. He made NO effort to accommodate me and was extremely rude. I understand that people can mess up reservations, but the host took no responsibility and rolled his eyes at me as I walked out.

I have been to Cookshop several times now for dinner. The food and service are always superb. The atmosphere is lively and loud, so while It is a great place for dining with friends, it is not suitable for a business meeting. So keep it in mind when you are in Chelsea Section of NYC and looking to escape the business for awhile! Good choice of wines and cocktails, but if you want something unique that is non-alcoholic, try the blueberry fauxjito

The food was good, no question, so food alone is 4 stars. HOWEVER - our table service was poor.  The place was packed on a Tuesday night, but they should have more help.  Our waiter was barely present.

I loved Cookshop! The atmosphere was awesome. I loved the clean and simple decor. The portions are perfect. We went for brunch and I got the the blueberry pancakes. They were probably the best I've eaten. Service was impeccable too. I highly recommend Cookshop.
No comment
Good food. Enjoyed a very nice Malbec at a very reasonable price. Service was good. Nice restaurant convenient to the Chelsea area.
I finally went to cookshop. A bit disappointed vs. What I was expecting. The food was great, but the service was not that good. They seemed off in some way.  I will come back though.

Have been here before  with a group while staying at the Desmond Tutu Center...and it was pretty good.  Stopped in this time by myself and had a less than great experience.  Food was good, cosmo I ordered good too.  The service was the issue.  Was seated at the bar and was invisible!  I thought about walking out just to see if I would get some attention.  As a former bartender, don't ignore that single person, it will cost you!

We went to the Cookshop this Sunday to celebrate a *big* birthday for my husband.  We were a party of 6, and the waitress was outstanding!  (I wish I had gotten her name, so that I could give her a shout-out here.)  The food was fantastic from the appetizers to the entrees to the desserts.  We were treated like royalty the whole time even though they didn't know it was a special occasion until we left.  We had to wait just a bit for our main course, but we were busy in conversation and really weren't upset about it, but our waitress apologized profusely and made up for it in spades.  I highly recommend the Cookshop for a special occasion or any occasion.
Beautiful, clean, simple decor and tasty, rich, well prepared food.

I wish I were at Cookshop right now. I took my mom here for Mother's Day brunch, and we had the best time. We started with grapefruit mocktails, which we both loved. It was so nice to be at a place that offers fun and tasty non-alcoholic options -- it added a special touch to the meal. We then split the grapefruit brule. I don't know what we expected it to be, but this was so much better than we imagined -- bright, creative, and delicious. I then had the poached eggs with asparagus (it was a play on eggs benedict) -- the eggs were poached perfectly and there was a little kick to the sauce, which was perfect. My mom had the brioche french toast, which turned out to be more like a bread pudding. It was incredible. They could also serve it as dessert. Service was a little slow (more than a little, really), but it was Mother's Day, and they were absolutely slammed from the moment the door opened, and we weren't in a rush. Besides, it turned out to be worth the wait.

Until recently, I had visited Cookshop for lunch only and by and large enjoyed the food (dandelion salad, fish) and appreciated the efficient and pleasant service, all of which would deserve 4 stars. For a recent dinner, though, it was another story: the service was as good as ever, but the food was not. An appetizer of squid, bacon and beans was drained in grease, the squid somewhat flavorful (thanks to the bacon), but otherwise not a particularly appealing sight or taste. The main course of three parts of lamb was worse. The chop was both greasy (even for lamb) and overcooked. The shoulder was also overcooked but more palatable. The sausage was boring. All this, again, was swimming in what on the menu sounded like a good complement to the lamb. The reality was a messy mix of raita, chickpeas and way overcooked rapini. The nearly 40 minutes between appetizer and entree may explain the problem with the main course (had it been sitting under a heater?). The dessert (plum and almond tart) was fine, but not life-changing. To be fair, my dinner partner had the vegetable lasagna and enjoyed it, so perhaps my choices were poor, and it is worth another try for dinner, but at best it is hit and miss.

This restaurant is wonderful.  The menu changes daily to reflect the freshest ingredients.  That's one of the things I love about this place is they use healthy fresh pure local ingredients so not only is it delicious and beautifully prepared, it's also good stuff to put in your body.  The ambience is great and the servers and bar tenders are friendly and knowledgable.  The fish and meats are always cooked perfectly and the desserts are magnificent creations.  The Maine lobster salad and rhode island mussel appetizers are both scrumptious and the duck and lamb is he's are always delicious.  The cocktails are all great as well as their selection of non alcoholic drinks like the cucumber soda they sell which I can't seem to fin anyplace else.  And the sommelier is generous with his time and his taste pours, spending time with us amd oaying attention to us until we found something we both liked, which incidentally included choosing a wine that the sommelier makes himself.  A great establishment with great food and drinks. I'll be back there very soon.

really great food.  i especially appreciate that they have only a few options on their menu (plenty of them--i just don't like being overwhelmed with choices at a restaurant) but all the ones i've tried are excellent.  loss of one star because it's pretty pricey.

A visit to Cookshop for brunch with my parents today confirmed pretty much everything I'd heard about the place.  I've lived a few blocks away for 6 months and I thought it was time I gave it a try.  I did not have a reservation but arrived just as it was opening at 11am on a Sunday.   The hostess said she would seat us as soon as my full party arrived, which they did a few minutes later.  Before seating us the hostess said "we can seat you now, but we'll need your table for someone else in an hour."  I though this was a little strange and asked how long the wait would be for a table without a time limit.  She glared at me and said it would be mid-afternoon, and the waiter next to her assured me that an hour was plenty for brunch.  Not wanting to go on a hunt for a new restaurant, we took the table, but were rushed from the moment we sat down.  When the waiter first came for our order 3 minutes after we sat down, we asked for another minute and he gave us a pained expression and said that the food takes awhile and he wanted to ensure we had time to enjoy it.  It all seemed a little ridiculous.  Anyway, we ordered and the food came quickly.  The bus boy twice tried to clear the plate of food in front of my mother while she was still eating.    The food was good, but not good enough to offset the poor service.

the place is lovely at night - esp if you get a seat on the terrace. but the food last night lacked any subtlety - greasy does not begin to describe it. green beans and spinach drenched in not-too-good oil, and soggy polenta sticks. some bizarre acidy taste to the dips... drinks are delightful and so is the service tho. and great location by the highline. but if you want a decent meal... go elsewhere

sat down to dinner w/two friends after only a modest wait at one of their front tables with the bench seat. was immediately greeted by a host that put me at ease about the perceived dress code - this restaurant draws a well dressed crowd for sure, name notwithstanding. our waiter, a friendly good-looking guy, got right down to business discussing the specials and answering our questions about one combo of appetizers versus another pairing. we settled on the duck confit samosas and pizza with pickled peppers and red onion. great choice with great tastes. still, it was readily apparent that the vermont suckling pig with dried fruit mostarda was the only dish that could satisfy the taste of three decidely hungry men, two of whom were visiting from los angeles. and this follows on my wholy delicious thanksgiving dinner at campanelli's on la brea. similarly priced, these two dining experiences easily stand out either because i'm a fool from whom who's money he's easily parted or because i know good food. that said, have you tried the hudson valley rabbit duo?

We headed over to this Chelsea newcomer with high expectations.  The ambiance and decor are trendy and the dimly lit atmosphere makes it a solid spot for a date.  The service was friendly and our table was ready when we arrived for our reservation, something that can't be overlooked at 7:45 on a Friday.  We ordered some tasty oysters to start off and their version of a savory crepe which was a good pick as well.  Our main course however fell a little flat. Each dish had a component that was fantastic and one that seemed out of place.  With the duck came some sauerkraut type side that didn't really fit and the lamb dish, while there were some wonderful components, had a little brown sausage that was on the dry side and a completely different flavor profile than the rest of the meat.  We're not sure if it was a bad day or that these entrees just missed the mark.  Given the nice surroundings and comfortable feel, it would've been a home run if the entrees lived up to the hype.  That being said, we're contemplating giving it another shot in hopes that the other entrees are executed better. @datenitenyc
By far the best seafood place I have been to ever. And the fact that it's all you can eat makes it even better staff was pleasant and very attentive. My new favorite restaurant
The ambiance, the intimacy, the finer details, the food , the service..... A-MAZ-ING !!

Great place wonderful vibes and the food is really really good!!!!! The service is very welcoming! I came here for my birthday last year and back again definitely would recommend for a family gathering or date night with Bae. All you can eat is Everything! Definitely get the scorpion bowl is definitely a 10/10 and you'll be pleased with just 1. Parking garag across the street very convenient!
No comment

I came here on a Wednesday night with a group of 4 people. Someone had a birthday so just showed ID and got a free meal which was nice. We ordered the seafood AYCE option without lobster ($80 a person). We did two rounds and ordered most of the menu. I liked the fried sea bass with sweet chili sauce, Dungeness crab, and clams with oyster sauce the most. The food was pretty good for AYCE. Why only 3 stars? Service was severely lacking. We didn't get crackers even though we ordered crab. You have request everything including condiments. Also, we didn't receive a lot of items we ordered. We didn't receive an explanation, it just never came. It was an average experience for AYCE. If the service was better, I would come back.
No comment
No comment

Our 1st Crab House experience was a smashing success!! I'm happy to report that all the lauded praise is well earned and deserved!!  You absolutely have to have a reservation to secure a table on the weekends as they get literally overwhelmed by all of like-minded patrons waiting to get access to the seafood barrage!!  I had a 7pm reservation, but we still waited about 20 minutes for our table.  You travel downstairs to the main dining area and once we were seated, we were given an explanation of the paper menu ordering system, and we proceeded to choose a good variety of everything they had to offer.  The 115 dollar lobster option, in my opinion, is the only way to go.  Everyone at the table has to get it if one person wants it, but it is totally worth it.  One thing to consider is that they bring out dishes extremely fast, so take that into account because our table was completely filled in less than 10 minutes!!  Also, the portions are humongous, so one person can get a dish to share with the table, not everyone having to get a particular item each.  Largely, all of the food was successful, with the lobster, of course, taking center stage!!  Whether the steamed option, the fried option, or cold claws,  they nailed the cookery every single time!!  The other items like the Dungeness and Snow crab were cooked well, but a touch on the dry side.  The other items like scallops, whole fish, flat iron steak, shrimps, and salmon we enjoyed as well.  The server we had was quite friendly, and she was engaging with us thoughtfully throughout our whole meal.  Service was pretty decent as the wait staff were quick to remove empty plates and the big steamer pots that started to dominate the space and took any additional orders as we needed them.  I recommend that you skip the starches and fried items or simply order them last.  They give you 2 hrs to go in on the buffet, so you can fill up on the premium items and get those options like noodles, rice, vegetables, or anything you missed to take home.  They price it out according to what's on the table, but they were extremely fair with the calculations, so we left with a good amount of food.  They also will sing happy birthday to the lucky patron, with your meal for free with four other full price meals!  They honor your birthday meal the day before, of and the next day, which is super generous!!  We felt rushed at the end, but when we were leaving, we saw why?  There were like 80 people   waiting to try and snag a table!!!  So in that respect we gave them a pass. This restaurant is so worth a trip here, as you will leave filled to the brim and you'll already be looking forward to planning your next visit !!  Cheers to all!!

Came here for bestie's birthday! They definitely do not skimp on anything!!! You should starve for two days before coming here! We did the AYCE with lobster everything for the 2 of us was about $300+ but it's worth it!! Will definitely be back!
No comment

No comment

4.5 out of 5. We showed up around 3 and we're seated almost immediately. The food comes out fresh, hot and delicious. Service was good too. Wasn't sure exactly what to expect but I was more than pleased. All of the lobster was done perfectly, my other favorite was the spicy shrimp.
No comment

I'm not sure if my expectations were too high, but I was a little disappointed by crab house. We got the $80 ayce seafood option (vs the $115 option that includes lobster). There was a good variety of seafood on the menu which I appreciated. The oysters were good, very big. I mainly came for the snow crab legs, and although good, it was too salty. I prefer cajun style seafood and the snow crabs legs tasted like they were just showered with salt here. All of the seafood has a slight Asian flavor to it which was ok. Service was also not the best, we were not given any crab crackers/tools to eat the crab with until asked, which I believe should be a given at a seafood restaurant like this. There are not many AYCE seafood restaurants in the city, and this is still a solid spot if you're looking for one!!

What a great hidden gem! Visited NYC for the first time and made reservations. Place is under ground but legit clean! you get a paper menu to mark what you want to eat each round.  The hubs mashed a few lobster tails while I hammered out the crab legs. It's a big menu with 2 tiers. Everyone at the same table mait choose the same tier. If you over order you get charged! $115 per head. Highly recommend!
No comment
No comment

Got on the waitlist online on our way to the buffet. As we arrived we got seated right away. As you walk downstairs you could smell all the good seafoods being served. At first the seafood came out really quick and was still hot. After that it was a little more difficult to get our servers attention but it also started to pick up. My favorite dishes were the scallops, oysters, calamari, and Dungeness crab. The scallops were nicely buttered and cooked on the skillet. The oysters were big and fresh. There was something about the coating of the calamari that was so good! The Dungeness crab wasn't salty like the other crabs and was perfect with butter. I was nervous that we didn't eat our money's worth but with how expensive seafood is nowadays, I'd say we ate enough.
No comment

The food I had was delicious. It was the service that sucked. I firmly believe the server is the one who kept messing the order up. I originally ordered 2 of certain items and only got 1, also didn't get everything I requested. I see the owner walking around....it's a nice restaurant they have set up. I would not recommend the broccoli, it's doused in oyster or some thick sauce. We loved the flat iron steak and scallops!! It came out sizzling with butter poured on it. So delicious. I had ordered before the "kitchen closed" and sure enough, the items didn't come. Again, a kitchen issue or server? My server was not attentive and not friendly. So my guess is the server. The people next to us were very loud, aggressive, inappropriate. I wished they told people to cut it out or they would be asked to leave. It was $80? An adult and $30 a kid.

First time was a blast and will come again. Seafood was fresh, waiter was attentive and service was quick. Fried seafood perfect & lightly seasoned. Old Bay seasoned could use some additional flavoring. If you're a R&B head -- the music doesn't miss.

Enjoyed it! Jumbo shrimp are CLEANED! No long black dookie lines down the back. When I go to a seafood restaurant and see that it turns me off. I will definitely be going again.

If you want fresh lobsters this is the place.  Love this place. There is always a line, we were able to get reservation for group of 5 or more.  Everything was so good, from lobsters, crabs, to oysters etc.  will be coming back on my next trip to Manhattan.  Thanks to Lauryn for your great service.

$115/person can supply unlimited fresh lobster. However, there are only three flavors: salt and pepper, garlic, and cheese. Although they are all delicious, I strongly recommend garlic. I ordered it twice. The steamed healthier butter Scallop is very fragrant and very large. We also ordered the second one. I suggest that if you like oysters, you can order more times. The appearance is uneven, but the taste is fresh. The lobster legs are smaller and the taste is more tender. It is also very convenient to eat. The seafood party did not order any meat this time

Went out for a birthday dinner.  Made a reservation online for 4;30.  Got there and parked in a lot.  Walked in and was confirmed. There was a less than 5 minute wait. Was taken downstairs and given a booth.  I quickly realized that was a birthday spot.  Large groups were everywhere. We ordered our drinks and then selected from the menu.  They were out of lychee so I went with a Hennessy sour.  It was strong!  Then the food started to come.  We over ordered from the first sheet.  They bring 2 more sheets for additional ordering.  The food is great!  Lobster was delicious!  Mussels were too.  Steak is minimal, so we ordered it twice.  Dump bucket on the table and we bordered with another booth, separated by some sort of banister.  They should add privacy glass there.  I felt bad to throw our scraps in the bucket with someone's face on the other side of the bucket.  They didn't care because everyone is chowing down.  We had the wait staff sing happy birthday, I think ours was the 8th time we'd heard it for the night.  In any event,  fun place.  Mussels are amazing,  good sized lobsters.  Seafood has been cleaned.  Need the lemon juice sooner in the meal.

Free for BIRTHDAY people, but you need at least 4 people with you. major portions, and it's all you can eat. We ate there for lunch and stayed full for the whole rest of the day! The seafood was also so good, and the oysters were SO FREASH. Probably the best oysters. Don't be shy with ordering the corn on the husk. Best palette cleanser, since everything is super seasoned, the corn was key to keep you going.

If you love seafood, love places with the most bang for the buck and want to indulge and treat yourself - this is the place to go. Everytime we are in NYC we stop by here because all you can eat fresh lobster? Say less! The AYCE seafood menu with fresh lobster is $115 per person which in my opinion is soooooo worth it. Every single item we ordered was super fresh (especially the lobster), if you don't like lobster (what's wrong with you? Lol) their AYCE menu without the lobster is $80. My favorite items on the menu are the snow crab legs, raw clams, crawfish, sea bass and seared scallops!
AYCE seafood house! Great variety and service. They do seafood and lobster buffet and the food comes out very quickly. Was fresh and great Asian flavors
No comment
This place never misses! The seafood is delicious and fresh. I love bringing my out of town friends for a unique experience.

Finally got a chance to visit and did not disappoint!! Obviously a little pricey but i think it's not outrageous considering what you get. We mostly stuck to the lobsters, crabs, and shrimps but the scallops were a pleasant surprise. My favorite was the dungeness crab and both lobster options were excellent. They're not particularly great with the order quantities - as in, you don't necessarily get the quantity you order so be mindful of that (sometimes you get more, sometimes you get less).
I went last weekend with my friend and we enjoyed ourselves. Everything tasted good and fresh, even my cola. I will be returning

Actually get to know this place from a YouTube review and decide to give it a try. You can make a reservation via their site if you have more than 4 person with it. The seafood is good, occasionally a bit more salty to my taste, but in general, good quality.  The service is also very fast and attentive. The scallops and iron steak are must orders.

After seeing crab house in tiktok hubby and i decided to go to NY and try it. This place is awesome they do have a waiting  list online you will get notification and able to reserve your sit for an hr. So no need to wait in the restaurant for your turn . Adding the lobster in menu was really awesome but you can just do the regular for $80 and eat everything. This place is awesome and i will recommend it.
OMG the Crab House is the best! The environment, food and service is amazing!!! worth the wait!
Great food, great service, nice atmosphere. Seasonings were excellent. Loved it. Thank you!!!

The best all you can eat seafood in the city. The blue crab crab is amazing and the fried sea bass will leave you speechless.

I love this place because of the value. I've only been twice but I love that its all you can eat, and if you don't like something just order more of the things you do like! My favorite things to order are the scallops, steak, lobster, crab and the spicy shrimp. Plus if you bring four people on your birthday your meal is free!

The seafood is excellent here. Everything is very fresh and seasoned well. The garlic bread is good but don't get full off of it! My only complaint would be that they don't shuck the oyster for you so it's a little annoying to eat but I would definitely come back in the future.

Ambience, food, customer service is all amazing. You can join the waitlist prior to arriving so upon arrival no wait. The price per person you cannot beat it! Food was flavorful. We will be back. Thank you Crab House!

We were in New York and thought we search for a nearby seafood Resturant. I'm so glad we stop by Crab House. We got the All you can eat with Lobster. No regrets with the choice. All the food were delicious and full of wonderful flavors. We end our dinner with all the servers coming to our table with a cheese cake to wish me a Happy Birthday. Everything about this place is excellent including everyone who work there. This is a must go to Resturant when you are in the area.

Doesn't get much better pricing in NYC. I was a little worried that the quality wouldn't be good based on the price. But luckily, I was wrong. All the food we had was amazing. The whole fish, mussels, and Dungeness crab legs  were all our favorites! Only advice is go with a group so you can really get your moneys worth!
This place is a wonderful place for all you can eat seafood. Love the variety. Very flavorful. Highly recommended

Terrific, ambience and all-around wonderful experience. The food was fresh and cooked well. The menu for all you can eat is expansive and quality. My only critique is the lobsters are served cut in half with no claws. I would much prefer a whole lobster with an option for only regular butter, not garlic butter.
A seafood heaven with excellent service at one of the top cities in the word. That can't be beat ...

Everything we got was amazing in the crab house. Fresh and delicious food. Some food items were a bit too saucy for myself, but neither the less delicious. The staff was super nice and the vibe is great for any groups. Reservation is a must.
Great place! Lovd the seafoods and everything. GREAT LOCATION!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Food was amazing. Service is good and they keep the food coming fast. If I did have a reason to not give 5 stars it would be that they sometimes bring stuff you didn't order and the napkins they use are of poor quality. If they can get that worked out, it's a 5 star establishment.
I am currently here with my brother, his girl, and my boyfriend. Let me tell you their food and service is A1. Everything is so good and this scorpion bowl is to die for.

One of the best all you can eat buffets out there. Service was fast and food overall was tasty. Although it is a bit on the more expensive side at $115 per person, the fact that you can literally eat as many lobsters you can make it worthwhile.

I think buffet/all you can eat can be intimidating with how you view quality etc, but crab house busts that myth. Two of us went for lunch, and did the classic option and so enjoyed. Service was really nice, they made sure we had the opportunity to order more when wanted, without hovering. Personally found the crab and steak the stars, but it's nice thar you can try anything no pressure. Also worth noting I'm allergic to mollusks, and they made it easy to keep to crustations, while still having so many options to enjoy!

This place was so good. Usually when I think of a all you can eat especially with seafood I imagine not fresh filled with msg food but this place completely changed my mind. Everything taste fresh and delicious. I would definitely return.

I was a little hesitant given the $80 cost for the all you can eat buffet, but it's well worth the cost. Everyone should try this place at least once, and please make sure you bring an empty stomach. Be mindful though as they bring all the food to you instead of serving yourself like a traditional buffet. The literally give you a check list to choose the items you want, and if you're not careful, you'll have a table overflowing with food right out the gate. Everything was delicious. Though, for the shrimp, I enjoyed the spicy shrimp (skewers) more than the hand-breaded shrimp. I think the snow crabs make this buffet well worth the price. If you want lobster though, you have to pay for the premium buffet, which is $115. The sides like garlic bread and broccoli in brown sauce weren't bad either.

Never disappoints! To prevent waste they are now asking you to let them know how many lobsters, clams and oysters you want in the table. Makes sense because there's no doubt people will waste. I had very high hopes with yelp reviews and youtuber videos and maybe that's where it started out wrong. We went at a busy dinner time but was seated within 30 minutes. It's a casual space with ocean themed decor. Also a popular spot for birthdays. The server explaiend the menu to us and that was very helpful. The food also came out pretty quickly, though in both orders we ended up getting things we didn't order. Some of the food looks better than it tastes. The scallops were amazing! The clam steamers and shrimp were great! The dungeness crab is not usually my favorite but was actually pretty good. The oysters were sandy and falling off the shell which makes me question the quality of it. Snow crab was just salty and some meat was mushy which felt less than fresh. Blue crab was well seasoned but the meat also didn't feel like good quality. Overall felt overpriced for the quality of the food and probably won't be back.
Great place! Nice atmosphere and interior! The staff was very accommodating and explained the menu. We didn't have a reservation, but they gave us a great table as a walk in!

Great service, fast prompt and quick. The food was fresh and the crab legs were steamed and not over done so that the shells were mushy. Food was a tad salty but it comes with the territory. Highly recommend them for your AYcE seafood fix!

Didn't really enjoy the food here as much. The old bay shrimp was the best item. The noodles and fried rice were a bit bland. The crab legs were just ok not much meat in them. The steak was cool. Overall it wasn't as good as many people said on their reviews. Yes it is all you can eat but the quality of the food could have been better. Especially for the $80 or $110 price tag. Kudos to the bartender though who made our drinks on point.

As a walk in, our wait wasn't bad! The check-in system is amazing. Everything was super smooth. What a great experience.

I was really excited to try this place however it fell flat for me. My crabs were overcooked. And i didnt care for a lot of their sauce. If i were to ever go back I'd definitely bring my own sauce with me. Also i don't understand why everything has to come family style. Its such a waste of food. Especially if 1 thing is being ordered for 1 person. We were 2.5 people. I say half cause my daughter is 5 and eats the size of a peanut. When we ordered edamame it was a huge dim sum basket size. And it was full. I understand they want you to get full off the cheap items before you get to the seafood but if i don't wanna eat it you're just wasting it. What they should do is lower the portion sizes and just charge people less. Then maybe you would make more profit as well.

Went here for my birthday and this place is amazing!! All you can eat seafood and the service was great! Everything tasted amazing. They also have non seafood options for those who don't like seafood. Very comfy yet fancy environment. Definitely my favorite restaurant.

The vibes and seafood were amazing! We had such a blast eating here before a concert-- meaning speed and timing were key. The service was exceptional, and the scallops were a particular standout. Will definitely be back soon!

Mhmmm!!! JAM UP is right words to describe this joint. Best AYCE seafood in NY- not like there's many others especially Fresh and Made to Order. How can you go wrong?! If you haven't tried it yet, you definitely need to. Keep in mind that you MUST book in advance or join the wait list as soon as you know you're going to go!!!! Just geeeet it.

This place came recommended and I wasn't sure because it seemed pricey.   We came for a birthday party (birthday girl eats free) and we got the seafood buffet (not including lobsters) which is $80 per person.  We got to choose from crab legs, shrimp, steak, fries, fried rice etc.  I underestimated how much food was going to come out and the quality.  Everything was fresh, aromatic and delicious.   I would suggest starting off with a few dishes then working your way up.  We ordered so much when we sat down that the portions are big and it is indeed "all you can eat".  I am definitely coming back here and you get your moneys worth.

Run don't walk and go enjoy. Get there before 5 and you don't have to do reservations. After 5 and you are sure to wait. We went Christmas Day and was seated quickly. The waiter came and explained everything and we checked off what we wanted. Honestly this was so much food. We enjoyed the steak, scallops, the lobster, shrimp fried rice. We enjoyed almost everything. Wasn't a fan of the snow crab legs with old bay. They were just steamed and they just sprinkle some old bay on it. Besides that everything was great.

This is your sign to head over to the Crab House! Everything was super delicious and fresh. It was reasonably priced for all you can eat seafood! They give you bread to start which was good but it will fill you up which is not the point. I wasn't crazy over the calamari but the old bay shrimp, the Dungeness crab, spicy shrimp were all delightful! I can't wait to come back and add the lobster!
Great place very home friendly lots of families enough servers by fire to service every table. it under $20 for all you can eat any kind of seafood lobster crab anything great place.

Food is amazing!!!Best seafood buffet ever!!!!10 out of 10  ilove everything....esp the crabs and shrimps!!!

Not many places in NYC can boast unlimited seafood for an AYCE (all you can eat) and this place does not disappoint. The lobsters ,crabs, scallops, oysters, clams were on point. What surprised me the most was the speed and efficiency of the order to food in front of you. The service was excellent and the food fresh and tasty. The steak, while good can be skipped as well as the crabcakes. Will definitely come again after a long diet...

Yes, it's all you can eat seafood and they have a decent variety of dishes but honestly I felt like the food was mediocre and I was expecting better for $80 per person. They advertise that it's better than  buffets because everything is made to order but I'd say the food quality was only slightly better-- certainly not better enough to justify the price tag. Service was decent, although they mixed up our dishes a few times. Felt like the crab legs were over cooked and sometimes too salty, the clam chowder was incredibly floury (more flour than actual clams, that's for sure) and the "fresh" raw oysters didn't taste fresh at all. The sea bass was alright, steak was decent, and the mussels/clams were probably my favorite thing; shrimp was also fine although again a little over cooked.

Truly endless. The food just kept coming. The price was amazing, I wld go with a little different type of seasoning, but over all the good taste great servive was great. This was my first time there and I will definitely be back.
