I loved this place! Our serve, Ken, was amazing and attentive. Our food was soooo good. A little pricey but I mean it's all you can eat seafood. Definitely recommend
The food was great you can eat as much your stomach can hold, or just plan and roll out the building lol, worth ever cent , if you don't eat a lot that's not the place for you

The service was superb and on point at all times. The variety was phenomenal. My favs were the mussels, sea bass and anything with the spicy sauce. Was it the best seafood I've ever had? No. Was it very good? Absolutely.
I loved the food. Nice place to come if you want to eat a lot. Great service and the prices are affordable. I will be visiting again.
No comment
So worth the trip. The food was amazing definitely will be back. The salt and pepper shrimp was very good. The crab was tasty and the broccoli was crisp. The drinks were good as well
The lobsters are fresh and delicious! I will highly recommend this restaurant for every seafood lover.

Here I sit, in this wonderful booth not haven eaten all day. As I have just ordered, this place offers an ambiance that inadvertently commits you to delicious meal guaranteed foresight. And sure you could say how I could just blatantly commit without question...you'll just have to come and EAT for yourself!!!:)
No comment

We went with parents and in-laws today, everyone left happy, satisfied and FULL! We don't eat raw seafood but ordered all the different kinds of cooked seafoods. The consensus was the "Super Spicy Shrimp" which wasn't that spicy was the favorite among the adults, the Steamed Sea Bass was the favorite amongst the kids, scallops, little neck clams in black bean sauce were tight runner ups. We preferred the Snow crab to the Dungeness crabs and if it's your birthday, you get to eat for free! This is really good value for money, don't let the $55 price intimidate you, the food was fresh and so worth it!

My family and I dine at this amazing seafood restaurant last weekend. The place has a nice decor and wide selections of seafood choices. My kids loved the garlic pressed bread, old bay shrimp, clam chowder and fried calamari. Some of our favorite dishes are the pan seared salmon teriyaki and scallops, crab leg, snow crabs,  fresh oyster and clams, sizzling sea bass and iron steak. Our waitress Valerie was very nice, attentive and comes frequently to check on us to see if we need anything.  Also, the manager, Vincent came to our table to greet us and make sure we are enjoying ourselves. We will definitely be coming back soon.
the restaurant is very clean, the host are very polite, it's a total vibe will be coming back

I absolutely love this place! I highly recommend you make a reservation prior to going because they are always very busy. Regardless of how busy they are food is always hot, fresh & a very good taste. My favorite dishes in particular are the Dungeness crab legs, shrimp, clams in garlic sauce & garlic noodles and the fried flounder. Definitely glad I found this place
Seasoned very well almost don't need any butter. The portions are perfect and quick per each order.

This place was great! We were a party of 4 and we were all impressed, the service started fast, you select the food you want to eat, servers will bring you the fresh hot food each and every time, we had little necks oysters steak blue crab shrimps and snow crab legs and a few other food,we also ordered the "Scorpion drinks" it was delicious with plenty of spirits. Our waiter was "Dash"and he was very nice and he kept the food coming. Everything was perfect we truly enjoyed the dinner

My husband located this place through google. I could not believe there was an all you can eat seafood restaurant In NYC, well it is and the food is delicious . Aside from the seafood , the shrimp fried rice is authentic Chinese fried rice, and so are the fried chicken wings . The Dungeoness Crab legs and scallops were fresh , crab cakes made with real crab meat and not a lot of breading , the raw claims etc. all are amazing for the price.
Had a great experience...drinks were great..seafood was fresh, and plentiful...had clams on the half shell,  king cran crab legs,  scallops,  corn on the cob, ..will return

My friends wanted to try this place because we love seafood. It was just okay. Most of the dishes had the same flavor, so not much variety in taste. The service was good and the food arrived hot. We tried a variety of dishes. However, the best bang for your buck is stick with one or two dishes and eat all you want. Be mindful if there are leftovers you will be charged to take it with you.  They could do better with some of the dishes, most everything was loaded with soy sauce and too salty. If my friends and I return we decided we would order just the snow crab legs and a shrimp dish. Paying $70 per person is too much for just okay food.

Best all you can eat place especially if you're a seafood lover like me!! So many different options to choose from at a decent price point and every single thing we ordered was absolutely delicious. Great and friendly service as well. 10/10 recommend!

This place was AMAZING! I must have eaten 20 scallops lol. The crab legs were so good. The crawfish sauce was a little too sweet for me but other than that, it was sooooo good! I will definitely be returning here.

We have been around the world. The Crab House by far, blows all restaurants out the water. Best seafood and all you can eat. We was in seafood heaven. The service was so amazing and indescribable. You have to see for yourself. Vincent and Conney. We can't thank you enough for the fabulous service and great seafood. We from San Francisco Bay Area and will definitely come back to New York just to eat here at the Crab House. Fantastic job and hope your business continues to grow. People need to know about your restaurant. They are missing out.

All I can say is....EAT HERE, you won't be disappointed! Honestly, I was apprehensive about an all-you-can-eat seafood buffet in NYC of all places. I been to other seafood buffets that have an 1 1/2 time limit, not once at the Crabhouse were we rushed. Buffet may be the wrong descriptive word for this place, more-so, a seafood restaurant where you can order anything off the menu, as many times as you want. Our waitress was absolutely incredible (think her name was May). Everything ordered was delivered to table in less than 5-10 minutes. All fresh and hot - seasoned to perfection!  I read several reviews that the restaurant is expensive, to those I say you don't really eat seafood then. I most certainly ate my $69.95 share of crab legs, raw oysters, crab cake and jumbo shrimp!

AYCE places usually trade quality for quantity, so I did not have high expectations when we came here. However, I was shocked at how good the seafood was here. Now, it was quite pricey, even accounting for the NYC environs, but the quality more than made up for it. Skewers of jumbo shrimp tasted very fresh and tasty, not at all overdone. Unlimited jumbo sea scallops, properly seared, which meant they must have been the more costly dry and not the treated type, were delicious. Even the clam chowder, which was probably canned, but nevertheless was piping hot and tasty. We could not complain about the snow crab or Dungeness crab either. Service was very efficient and friendly. The meal was a highlight of our stay, even with low expectations going in. We will definitely return the next time we are in town.

Awesome, awesome spot. Food was perfect service was great. Make sure you ask for Ivan or Crystal they were our servers and were kept the food coming along with suggestions. Only wish they had liquor, or we knew you could BYOB before we got there, other than that I'll definitely be back very soon!
This place is amazing! The food is delicious and fresh. Nice environment, very clean establishment with a courteous and attentive staff!

This place is IT for all you can eat seafood! We loved the variety from shrimps to crab legs to oysters. We came without a reservation early on a Sunday morning so we were seated right away. But we suggest getting a reservation because this place gets super busy. You have to have all of your parties present in order to be seated. The host is a little bit on the edge and has a so-so attitude but the server May is EXCELLENT!!! Request her when you make the reservation and she'll take care of you! Some recommendations are raw oysters, iron steak, mussels in black pepper sauce and the dunganese crab legs

Really enjoyed the ability to go out and have all you can eat food. The location was clean the food was quick after being ordered it tasted good my one but the one advice I'll give to the next customer is don't order more food than you're ready to eat.

My friend and I were looking for an all you can eat seafood buffet in the city and this place came up on my facebook. We decided to check this place out today after work. The place was a little quiet when we sat down but the servers were friendly and very attentive. They explained how it all works: it's all you can eat, check off what food items you wanted and it'll come out fresh. We ordered the iron steak, scallops, bbq ribs, crab Rangoon, crispy shrimp with butter sauce and old bay, 2 order of crab legs, 2 orders of raw oysters, and the mussels! All super delicious! We also got free garlic bread! The bill came out to be about $60 each not including tip and our server, her name was May, had explained to us about the free birthday meal and gave us a business card for our next visit or birthday! We will definitely be back!! A great place for friends, family, or a date!
No comment

I would give zero stars if I could due to what I had encountered. It was my first time coming to this restaurant and I was excited. The ambience was good and our server was amazing but unfortunately the food has caused me to make this review. They are giving out bad dungenous crabs. As soon as I started eating it I smelled ammonia. At first I thought I was losing my mind but then the next batch smelled the same as well. Everyone knows that when crabs start to smell like ammonia that means that they are no good. They really want someone to get seafood poisoning. Smh. They really need to do better and even if they do, I will not be coming back.

Absolutely the very best seafood and steak the clams are super fresh waitstaff always coming by 6 of us with ooze birthday free terrific present  seafaring feeling every item was individually prepared  Vincent the manger is very helpful    Eat up evErythIngs  great affordable for the high grade quantities. Enjoy everything you can eat.

So glad this place opened in Manhatten! So, as soon as you walk in there is sanitizer. You write your name and address on the clip board and your temperature is taken. You go down quite a bit of stairs and YOU'RE THERE!! The decor is nice but the food is better! They give you paper menu to check off your items and bring it to you FRESH! Most dishes are small portions, some to share. Shrimp fried rice bowl could've fed 3 people easily. It was delicious. We also ordered snow crab legs, dungeness crab legs, old bay shrimp(big), fried wings, scallops, raw clams, crab cakes and fried sea bass. I had a healthy serving of rice and shrimp left and was charged $5 to take home. I think that price was based on my portion though...Oh, I forgot about the steak!!! It is served raw in a cast iron skillet that is HOT!! When it's brought to your table it has started cooking. I flipped it one time and it was done! 30 seconds. I don't what seasoning is used but that steak is DELICIOUS! There's a small alcohol menu and drinks are $15. Wine and beer,  $6. Bathroom was SPOTLESS. I appreciate the enclosed stalls. Most of all I didn't feel rushed as with most buffets..I will be back. $55 per person, well spent!

It was a great experience took my girlfriend knew we had a blast a good only thing I wish is that they did have a alcohol license but you're still a kid friendly place for the family to come go celebrate nice gatherings and everything service was excellent though can I complain they bring you food and bunches they serve you with a great smile you know good place

The place is nice and clean! As soon as you walk in you are greeted and immediately seated. The staff are super friendly and the food is amazing! Many varieties and each dish was delish! Highly recommend this place and I'm deff coming back soon!

I have to say, I'm very impressed with how the quality of their food has actually improved since Covid. We came here the first time before the pandemic, and only loved the crab legs. This time around we came for crab legs but decided to give a few things another chance. I loved the little neck clams in black bean sauce. We also enjoyed the spicy crawfish, though sadly the sauce did not soak into the meat, it was still tasty. Raw oysters have definitely improved since the last time. I'm also glad they finally got their liquor license. I do wish they had some dessert options. It's always nice to finish a salty meal with something a little sweet.
The best all you can eat seafood buffet everything tasted fresh and it had flavor. It was very clean, neat and the staff were friendly.

Kind of expensive but the quality is great and you get anything you could want in terms of seafood with the exception of sashimi. Service is good. Indoors kind of sucks because of this place always being busy but they had guards up between every booth. I still would've been more comfortable dining outside though. Still- highly recommended!

Food and service has always been top notch. There are many choices and all of them are great. I have been to Crab house many times and continue to choose Crab house as one of my favorites. Highly recommended!!

The food here doesn't have outstanding taste, but meets my expectation for buffet - I suppose you can't expect the food quality to be too high if they come with zero marginal cost. In fact among all the seafood buffet that I've been to, the food here is probably on the top tier - they serve everything fresh from the kitchen, which is better than some buffet places where food gets cold/lukewarm after staying outside for too long. I didn't get to eat much since I found most food here to be too salty or greasy for me, but if you are not as picky you probably will enjoy the unlimited supply!
Best food hands down . Straight to the point . Service is quick and inviting ! Staff is amazing ! Been 5 times and i have no complaints
The food is always good but there isn't really a wide selection of choices however it tastes delicious and very fast. The waiting to enter is a bit long with or without reservations

Great vibe! Not overly bright nor too dim, clean decor(restaurant and restroom) was nice and not cluttered  friendly fast service from our waiter Ivan! Food full of flavor and portion wise rather large! Great mirrors for taking fun pics with friends too haha

The highlight was the fried sea bass! I had them prepare it while, but you can request no head. Just know you'll miss out on the cheek meat that's so good. It and the scallops were very fresh as there was no smell or taste from the scallops. Don't be scared off because it's $60 per person--this is all you can eat and it's far beyond worth that price. The staff is also incredible. Jasper served me and was awesome! I'll be back when I'm hungry enough.
Good deal for the price. I would select the snow crabs and shrimp on a skewer only. I didn't care for any of the other items in the menu

came her valentines day 2021. this place is amazing. crab house has a  wide selection of foods to choose from( scallops,snapper, shrimp,oysters). Crab house Even items that are not seafood like ribs and chicken( the ribs are amazing). The atmosphere is very nice. it has this i'm inside ship vibe, with the nice wood texture and fishing net above your head with little items in it like fish and other sailor like items. Overall experience is great some days it's going to be a wait but overall service is spot on. They have people constantly walking around to make sure you can get you grub on or to clean tables. oh one more thing they serve drinks here to which is a major plus.

I came here on Friday night for my friends birthday dinner. It was a group of 10 of us. When we were seated, we were explained how ordering goes and the process. You get a piece of paper and you check off what you want and then they'll just bring it. We ordered - snow crab legs, Dungeness crabs, raw blue point oysters, pan seared salmon, Cajun garlic butter shrimp, mussel with black bean sauce, crab cakes, pan seared scallops, crab Rangoon, old bay shrimp, iron steak, chicken wings, broccoli in brown sauce, Cajun fries and spring rolls. Everything was great. The only thing we didn't really like were the chicken wings but otherwise there were no issues. For drinks we ordered the a few lychee passions, Hawaiian sky's, Hennessy sour and scorpion bowl. The Hawaiian sky's weren't strong and tasted like juice. Our waiter ( I believe his name was Ky or Py? I feel bad for not remembering because he was great)  was amazing. He was on top of everything. He made sure we were good all the time and if we needed anything he got it for us. A really great experience overall. I wish the price was a little lower but I understand why it's $65. I'd definitely love to come back and I recommend.

warning to all urban ppl this place is horrible!!! it should not be called "crab house". the food was not satisfying at all!! the advertisement convays all you can eat seafood buffet and thats not what its!!!. its a high class chinese buffet but if you ask me the regular chinese buffet taste a whole lot better at $15.99. this god awful place was $55.00 per person and the food was tasteless. places like "the boil", claw daddy's, even city island restaurants but this hod awful place to shame!!! ive waited 2 months to get to this place it was an ultimate disappointment!!! i came with a party of 6 every last one of us was unhappy and really let down. it was a waste of my $184.00 i paid for 3 ppl. we ordered blue crab it came with 2 crabs the size of nothing in my pic is one crab
Amazing service, they were super fast with the food and kept refilling us when requested. Also, great seafood! We love the crab legs and fish :)

It's easy to pass but look at the building number! Food is great, they didn't mention that some of the food has an Asian influence but it's all great either way. VERY reasonable price and amazing service, I look forward to going back soon! Also they pay their staff well so that's a plus.

I was beyond happy to try a all you can eat seafood buffet... It was my first time here. A woman came to my table with bread and no one introduced themselves. I had no idea how this worked. About 15-2 mins in of just sitting there I asked a lady if there was a waiter so we can finally order. She took our list and came back saying she was unaware she was our waiter. Good servers are hard to find in fast establishments. The food seemed pretty good but What made everything go downhill was, Me and my best friend saw a mouse/ rat pass our table. We were both in shock. I've eaten at many restaurants even in the Bronx and have never seen this! Looked over to a vacant area near us and we saw another ! At this point my best friend was going to throw up on the table. Absolutely disgusting!!! I will never come back to this place. For a relatively new space. This should not be a thing !

More than enough food to go around for a group of people. I would like to say about 6 the most at a table to finish all that food. It's $65 per person, there's only one menu for everyone to check off from on a paper menu. You will receive your sodas in a can because of COVID but my daughter received her Shirley temple in a cup. There was so much food, my mother, daughter and I couldn't keep up. We were only able to go one round and took the rest home. Since it was our first time, the lady allowed us to take our food home and charged us $2 a piece for a small long carry out container. They give you all kinds of shrimp you can think of and only 2 pieces of crab legs. The shrimp is not fully cleaned, you still have to remove the "poop". My mother felt the food was salty, I did not. For some of the shrimp, you have to peel the shell off. Take the family and have a good time, I think it's worth it for $65 per person for rounds of seafood.

I really enjoyed my meal here! Some of my favourites were the crab legs, Dungeness crab, prawns and scallops. They were fresh and tasty that I just had to order multiple portions of them. We also tried the chicken wings which turned out to be really good and so were the shrimp fried rice and garlic noodles. The only dish I didn't fancy was the clams as they were a little fishy. We ordered a little too much and only paid a very small fee to take away the extras which were great because I had it for lunch the next day. Overall, it is a really good dining experience plus the staffs were friendly and I believe the Chinese guy who's the boss is a lovely person. It's great value for money in my opinion for the amount of seafood you can eat.
I give it 4 stars just because the wait was crazy we waited over  2 hours on a Saturday night but the food was worth the wait being it was our first time here

I live in California and "crab house" was a spot to check out while I was in NY. The food was okay I wouldn't say it was something I would come back to NY for. Cool experience but food was nothing to tell a friend about.
Soo goood!! Nice service nice nice nice!! Good vibes and 80s music while chomping down thousands of oysters and crablegs
Hands down the best all you can eat seafood around,  normally all you can eat places such but everything here was very fresh and tasted good

My husband and I went yesterday on Halloween. It was our wedding anniversary. The place is beautiful btw. They take temperatures. The waitress was great and sweet. The food was awesome. I wanted to eat more but my stomach wouldn't let all of it fit lol. Place is great though.

once I tried this spot no need to go to any other boil spot.. you get more than you pay for service is great, food is delicious and fresh to order. also nice decor.. only thing I'd recommend they have a option for how the Dungeness crab is cooked.. would rather it steamed not fried.. I will definitely be back again
got food poisoning from this place, the rest of my group also had massive bathroom runs. this is almost the worst case of stomach bug i've ever experienced.
The best buffets！Fresh seafood and good service! I will recommend to my friends without any hesitations.

When I say I was stuffed , I was STUFFED like a turkey on thanksgiving day. We order almost everything , but the sea bass fried was heaven on EARTH. The shrimps was on point as well.  I gave it 4 stars because we order the fried chicken and fried calamari that shit was horrible , it taste like it was frozen for years and they thru it in the fryer. Also I wish they would add more seasoning on the snow crab legs it was good but it wasn't exciting like the ones in city island. The waiters was very nice. When you first walk in side it's a little weird and creepy cuz you have to find your way to the basement(that where the resturant is located) I think the should either have a host leading as the way or make it Friendlier. They don't sell wine yet so it wasn't a problem bring your own bottle of wine . I'm sure that would end once they start selling wine and beer. Please go and enjoy the all you can eat. I don't know if anyone seen the movie " The Nutty Professor " but we was looking like the Klumps family.

So good. Crab House All You Can Eat Seafood is a small, clean and cozy place. The portions are big and the staff is very friendly. The service was good and prompt; and the staff were very courteous and helpful. This place rocks.
No comment

Just ate here. The staff is super friendly.  The restaurant just opened yesterday,  which I should have looked at more carefully when reading reviews (5 stars could have been from family members/friends at the grand opening). They tell you to try everything and then order more of what you like. However,  a lot of the dishes the portions are really big. The best dishes in my and my friend's opinion are the ones that actually were small portions, but better quality. Those were the scallops and the teriyaki salmon. Those both had only 2 pieces, so one for each of us. The sea bass was good, but it's a whole fish (small/medium size),  a lot for a taster. The steak was also tasty (8 pieces on a sizzling platter). The Dungeness crab was dry and a little fishy. They don't have a really good dipping sauce for the crab. They have tarter sauce, soy sauce, ketchup,  and cocktail sauce that you can get from the bar at the front. Also fresh garlic & lemon, but there was no utensils for the lemons and garlic to dish it out (probably just an oversight because they just opened). The edamame was okay, but the server said they steam it with the crab to give it flavor, but it tasted like just plain steamed edamame. The dumplings are like the frozen ones from the supermarket- not recommended.  The fried shrimp and calamari were typical bar food and just okay. The small piece of corn on the cob with the snow crab is good as well as the snow crab, but I would like melted butter to dip the crab in. The garlic shrimp and other shell on shrimp are good, but they give you too many if you want to eat other dishes. It was nice that they gave you gloves to eat your crab, wet hand wipes, and bibs. The blue crab is a whole small crab and even though I'm from Hawaii that is something my more adventurous friends would eat, but not me or my friend. They recommend the $55 all you can eat, but in small print they also tack on a 17% service fee.  I had 2 perrier waters for $7.50 & my friend had a $2 ginger ale. We split the bill and ended up paying $74.81 a piece. In my opinion overpriced,  but if you have a huge appetite you may be able to get your money's worth. I felt bad wasting so much food, but I feel the way they tell you to try everything and then order more of what you like is misleading.  If you want to take the leftovers it is an additional $15. In my pics the dumplings are in the dish with the edamame. My friend also had the clam chowder and said she's had better. The clams and mussels were good. They start you off with a garlic panini pressed toast, which is tasty. I also want to apologize to our waiter if our bill did not include tip, but I think the owner cannot tack on a 17% service fee and expect the customer to tip 15-20% more on the meal we received. It was questionable whether it was worth $70+. It definitely was not worthy of $80+ per person!
We enjoyed celebrating my friends birthday here, the service is amazing and fast ! There is a wait time but honestly it was worth the wait the food is just amazing

Food came very quickly after we ordered, all the waiters where kind and efficient, drinks where tasty, all around great experience! Good amount of food and good tasting food for the price. I would definitely come back again!

Excellent service, great decor and atmosphere, fresh good seafood. Our waiter Ivan was incredible, service with a smile and more he was perfectly attentive as was the rest of the staff. Exactly what they advertised and more. Both Obay shrimp and snow crab legs were the standouts but we did not have a negative thought about any item on the menu. Our waiter was happy to give recommendations and give half orders so we could taste some items without filling up on anything.

Do not come here. Came here for Valentine's Day with my boyfriend and we were both very disappointed. As avid seafood lovers we found the quality to be poor, especially the oysters and the crab legs. The crab legs were extremely small, the crab cakes didn't taste like crab cakes at all, and the oysters were not only coated in ice but looked suspicious. Also, the wait being so long makes the experience even worse. Do not come here unless you don't mind eating bottom of the barrel seafood.

I know nothing about the place so I'm not gonna ruin their rating with this review I'm just posting this photo so you guys are more aware because I wasn't and I'm really sad because I really want to eat this food
Very very worth it. The seafood is high enough quality and better than I expected. Vincent was very helpful and kind. We will be back for sure.

I was really excited to try this place. We drove all the way to nyc from CT only to find out it isn't actually wheelchair accessible. I had some friends enter the restaurant to see if their was an alternate entrance, because the yelp description says it is wheelchair accessible. They gave the lame excuse that it's a new place and they're working on it. Was really a let down.

Pricey but worth it.  Fried sea bass is amazing! Crispy with tasty sauce. Crab is fresh. Some dish is very large like shrimp fried rice. Can order multiple times. Waiter is attentive. Overall, very good experience.
No comment

I really LOVE seafood!  This place has phenomenally fresh oysters and clams. I also recommend the Whole Fish Sea Bass, crab cakes, and iron steak - all very flavorful!  New pristine place with great, clean, modern décor - great for any occasion.  A+ for quality, price, prompt service, friendly staff, and ambiance.
Best seafood all you can eat I have had for a long time while traveling through NYC. Highly recommended, everything was great and fresh!

Definitely not a place to go to if you want seafood boil. I have my own suspicions about ayce seafood, but over fried over seasoned, or even good non seafood dishes is not enough to justify the price for this place. As if I needed more fuel for this fire, our server... gave us allot to work with. She tried to bully us into believing we ordered something we didn't, it would have been ok if it was good, but neither of us are into crawfish and it just really wasn't good. We did not want to be those a**holes who just order for one bite and waste like it's no big deal. We  food. And I  spice, gotta say nothing was hot enough. Ambience is great and I really wanted to like it... but not worth the price. Strangely the place had plenty of patrons and everyone else seemed really happy, so just wasn't my cup of tea. Lack of liquor license didn't help.

Best value for the amount of quality lift food you get for $55  per person. The service was amazing. They checked up on us and mAde sure we had everything we needed and took away anything that we finished to clear up space for more food to come!

Absolutely loved this place, the ambience was cool and the food was delicious except for the crab leg they were kind of dry, but besides that everything else was exceptional. BTW the drinks are extremely strong so if your not a drinker, order some water or soda lol.

This place is absolutely incredible. My wife and I were here the day before Christmas Eve. I found out about this place because I am a NYC Police officer and I was working one night across the street and noticed a seafood buffet. I said to myself I have to come here. The staff is amazing, very friendly and always attentive. We had Connie as our waitress. She was incredible. She always checked on us and made sure everything was on point. The food is absolutely amazing. Everything came out very quickly and if you wanted more the definitely brought it out for you. The manager Vincent is a true gentleman. This place is an incredible place to go to in NYC to have some great seafood and other food. Me and my wife will definitely be coming back.
No comment

This plane is the best seafood place I've ever been to! I love how it's all you can eat but isn't a buffet style! The Food is packed with soooo much flavor!!! And the customer service is awesome. I would travel back to NY just to go to this place!
Idk what they cook with but everything taste the same i can't explain it but the service was to nice to the point they put the plastic bib on for me lol

First I'll say as this restaurant is down in the basement, there are no access to the basement for those with disabilities and those who are elderly. my wife's 90 year old grandmother had to walk down and up the many stairs with Her cane. I'm surprised the restaurant  got away with not having ADA compliance. The Lobster house in Queens is a better set up as you enter from street  level. There's more to say but i will end it here.
No comment

We had a long wait (much longer than the 15-20 minutes they predicted) on a busy Friday Valentine's Day evening. The kitchen also struggled to keep up with demand. All that aside, we had a great meal and would absolutely come back. You can sign up for the waiting list here on Yelp; but we didn't know that ahead of time.
Awesome place the food was amazing and our server Valeria was awesome! All you can eat is no lie.

How it works is they give you sheets with the types of food they offer and you just check it off and they give you portions according to how many people you have. The food wasn't too bad tasting. I would definitely avoid getting the calamari though, they were so bland. The garlic shrimp noodles were tasty but they give you so much! So that'll fill you up fast. The wait staff was really nice. The only reason I gave two stars is cuz I got food poisoning from it  even if I didn't get food poisoning, I probably wouldn't come back anyway just because although the food was decent, I don't think it's worth the price.

I absolutely love seafood and this place was awesome! I spent Christmas here and the service was great and all the food was fresh! Only $55 for all you can eat, what a deal and the food is great quality. Not only that but, my server Valerie was absolutely great! She was kind, attentive and super fast. She was always one step ahead of what I wanted. Definitely ask for garlic butter! Will be visiting and hopefully Valerie will be my server again she was one of the best I've ever had.
The food here is delicious beyond explanation, not to mention the staff are friendly and witty. I'm worried I might end up addicted to this place and spending all my money lol
All you can eat but have to pay to take food home. Which is odd because it's seafood and it can't be served again. ‍. Birthday person gets a free meal. Meals are 45/person
Food is excellent for a buffet.  The food is always made fresh and you order with a checklist.  Place was crowded on a Thursday night.
This spot is legit and the food is great. The service is fast and the drinks are lit.

Seafoods here are really good. At first, the raw oysters were opened for a while therefore didn't taste that fresh. After we told the server Ivan, he asked the kitchen to open new ones. Very recommend the old bay shrimp, mussel with black bean sauce and raw oysters. The qualities are higher than buffet standards and it doesn't limit times. Definitely worth to try.
Found this place on Yelp. Omg amazing. $55 all u can eat. Did not disappoint. Food came out fresh n hot. Lots of variety. Dungeness crabs were sooo good! Fries sea was was amazing
This place is awesome. They just opened, so they don't have any alcohol yet, but I don't care. All you can eat seafood, and it's good. 3 types or crab legs are all boss. Reminds me of city island.

Came here for dinner for my Dads birthday (make sure you make a reservation) the food was great! But the service needs a lot of help. As you're seated you get one menu for the table and you have to mark what you want so they can bring it to the table. We did noticed something our waitress was doing to everyone on her side. Your first round was fast and she was attentive but then would literally disappear. There was a point where she was gone for 20 minutes and no one knew where she was, and once she came back she even told us to not ask other waiter for service because this was her table. which clearly became impossible since she disappeared so many times. If you order crab legs just know they bring you 2 at a time which is hard when you're a family of 4. So make sure to ask for more or maybe sit close to the kitchen so you can ask for things faster. Aside from service food was amazing and for $67 unlimited seafood I'd be back!
I usually go to the one in queens to but now since there in one in the city, I'll definitely come here more. They are still working management out with the sauces so I can't really say much.

Amazing place right in midtown! Love, love, love the oysters and the snow crab legs!  Noise level was just about right and reasonable price for an all you can eat seafood place in Manhattan. Also, I love their decor! Definitely coming again next time.

When I came here the service was good, it is definitely worth the price. I do have to say that the lobster was fresh and they do are excellent with covid precautions. The host was very friendly and they didn't mind me staying even though I ate really slowly.

Took my moms today for her birthday. We couldnt get the free birthday meal. Because we where a party of 3 adults and 1 child. But waitress May made it special for my moms and came out with a slice of cheese cake and sung happy birthday with us. May is the best. Wasnt crowd because we got there a little after 3pm. My mother and son god mother love the snow crab legs. We all had our favorites as far as food choices. But well worth the price for the amount of food we ate. My 5 yr old isn't big on food. But the cajun fries. He loves. I would recommend this place.

Came here for New Year's Day and what a way to start a year. Place is lit af. All you can eat seafood say no more fam. Super helpful servers, I had Ivan and he was the man.  Basically fogo de chao of sea food. 11/10 would recommend.
Unbelievable food and service. Would HIGHLY recommend ESPECIALLY if you are a seafood lover.

I stopped by here the other evening and I must say I was pleased. We were greeted very friendly - and staff was attentive. I do recommend to get your food in waves as it is an all you can eat so you can enjoy your experience better. Me and a friend ordered most of what we wanted to try in one order and couldn't add more because of how full we were and how big portions were. Overall, It was great, I will be coming back to enjoy my experience the right way instead of one shot- which was my fault. Only thing I can say lacked were corn & potatoes. I didn't see it as a option I could have missed it- but any seafood boil ALWAYS needs corn & potatoes! I highly recommend to check it out.

The initial waitlist time was delayed by 15, but I had a larger party and we it was during a peak time (Saturday early evening). Immediately after being seated the wait staff provided us with drink and food menus. We received  warm garlic bread, a pitcher of water, cups of ice and straws along with our drink order in a timely fashion. With larger parties there's one menu per table with unlimited item selection. This worked great for us. The quantity was enough and came out really quick. The temperature on the food was in line with expectations. With each additional order placed the service and expectations never changed. We were able to split the check and have our credit cards process at the table. There wasn't a rush or implied rush to get up after the bill was paid.

Visiting for dinner tonight. Party of 3. Wait time wasn't bad. We had Courtney as our server and she was GREAT! Very friendly and a very nice smile. She also was very attentive and because of her we will be back soon! Thanks Courtney for your hospitality!

55 dollars all you can eat! The best thing about this buffet is you don't have to get up to get your food. The server brings it all to you! Each selection comes out as a small plate. I'm a huge seafood eater and that fact that this place exists is a foodies dream. Clean, friendly and delicious!
Rude management. Unclean kitchen. The food smells disgusting and if something fall off ur plate they put it right back in. Rhis place is a hazzard
Food was fresh and delicious. Its best to make a reservation if going on a Saturday, the wait is long if not.
My new favorite seafood place in midtown. Very Cozy place and good service.  crab legs are perfectly cooked, the best I ever had. This place is a must try.

First of all, I'm not one for writing reviews but I was very unhappy with this place. I had the worst experience here. We had a group of 7 people  last night  in which they didn't bring out enough food for . They tell you to fill out this paper with all the food items you would like them to bring out. We were there for almost 3 hours and was still waiting for food from the first order . We put in a 2nd paper and it took so long for that food to come out and we was STILL missing a lot of the food that we had checked off. Mind you, they don't bring out enough food in the first place . After we kept complaining they then starting bringing out the food. I asked can we pack up the food at this point because we sat there so long and the kids were beginning to get restless. I was told that they charge $40 to pack up food but he would only charge me $20. I told them I'm not paying to pack up the food at all because we would've been able to eat it there if it would've came out in a timely fashion and if we would've received what we ordered in the first place. I was very excited to eat here due to me and my family loving seafood but we left highly disappointed. I will never recommend this place to anyone!!
No comment

The food was ok they said all you can eat for $55 but when you get there its $59 then they charge $4 just to take home left over that you already paid for seems like a rip off to me and the service was not good at all

The worst food I have ever ate in my life! I don't know how people on here are saying the food is so good! It all tasted nasty. I feel so sick now from eating here. I would never come here ever again or recommend anyone to eat here! HORRIBLE

This place is very good.  You will not leave hungry... the mussels, the sea bass, the Dungeness Crab are all superb.  Connie is a most excellent server!  Thanks we truly enjoyed ourselves... maybe get some horseradish for the oysters.

This place was well worth the time and money. I came in from Atlanta to celebrate my birthday with wife and family. The staff including the manager was friendly. Great ole skool music and nice atmosphere.The food was fresh and very tasty. If you are looking for great tasting steak, vegetables and seafood do this place. Highly recommended. A diamond in the big city.
Wow! This place was fantastic.  The wait staff were very friendly and the food was just amazing. The music was on point. All of the dishes we order were delicious. I will definitely be returning.

Food wasn't bad... at all and service was amazing!!! I did not like the different sauces served on the fish.. food came out quickly and you and yelp and hold your place online prior to arriving which I recommend. The salt and pepper crabs were amazing !!! I would recommend and go back!
Great food. Great ambiance. Fast service. Only thing is they don't serve alcohol! Will definitely be going again.
I have to say this food was amazing hands down. Will definitely go back. I went with my boyfriend for his birthday and we definitely enjoyed ourselves.

Service was okay, the waiter was nice but my friend and I didn't receive all the food we ordered the first time. We figured it was okay since we can order it again the second round. The food took quite a long time to come out. There was a lot of people so we understood. The waiter did forget our drinks tho , so we had to remind her for it. The food was overall good, some things like the duchess crab was salty. Their scallops were really good. It's 55$ a person but with tip and tax and 2 drinks, it was $75 each for us. (Which is still a good price considering you can order as much as you want!)

I noticed this new restaurant by my office and was excited to try it. The staff was friendly and accommodating. There is a huge selection of food! My friends and I were definitely full by the end of the night. We will be coming back again the next time we are craving seafood.
I came here for a friend's birthday party. Amazing.... one of my favorite dishes is sea bass. It's so delicious. Also, the Cajun is my favorite too. I will definitely come back!

The restaurant is actually set up nicely & is very clean. The food however is not so great. The crab cakes had a weird taste & the shrimps were clearly farm raised. The crawfish taste like they were soaked in tea, the scallops had no seasoning at all, while garlic and salt overwhelmed everything else. The garlic bread was good but not $55 plus tax & tip good.  Maybe in time things will get better.

I went down to New York to visit families last saturday and came across this place. Connie is hands down one of the best server I've had. I was a little overwhelmed by the menu and connie gave me a lot of good recommendations and all of them were delicious. There is super good selection. Connie also make sure to make small talk with us even though she gets quite busy, and no matter what she always checks up on us. We left the restaurant talking about how great she was! So here I am writing this review. Will go back for Connie and the food whenever I visit NY!

Service is over and beyond.   Food was awesome.  Tried dishes I would normally  not order but all  the different items on menu gave us the opportunity.  Would recommend for a different experience than we were use too.
My family took me for my birthday it was my first time there great costumer service and fast food was delicious and yummy, I highly recommend to everyone

This place is all you can eat for 55 a person. Their food was fresh, the atmosphere was inviting and the music was awesome. They constantly bring you a new menu as they finish delivering your last order. I would absolutely recommend this place to people who love seafood. So glad I took a chance on this place !

We ate here last night. The location is large and could be great for large parties. They do not have liquor yet because they are waiting on their license. Not sure when that is coming. We did not do the AYCE as we were not super hungry but it looked like a nice selection. Our issue was that the service was kinda slow, didn't seem staffed enough. And we had ordered steamed shrimp dumplings and received a "lobster roll" which was actually gross. When we asked about them they said "oh we actually don't have the steamed shrimp dumplings anymore" they never asked if replacing them with those were ok. And assumed it would be. They were gross and chewy. We also ordered the seafood fried rice which had bits of shells from the mussels in the rice. Everything seemed a lot more seafood/ crab house than a creole restaurant. I would not consider it a creole restaurant at all. I would go back and try again for AYCE though for the crab.
No comment

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment
No comment

Got the spinach and mushroom wontons which were big, filled with spinach and skin was thin. They were tasty and flavored just barely any mushrooms only spinach. I also liked the sesame pancake with veggies. The pancake was fluffy, fresh and had lots of sesame seeds. This location is cash only; for payment with credit card only $15 above
No comment

Vanessa's has incredible dumplings for sure, and it's also very affordable!! The chicken dumplings I got were so so good. I honestly just wish I could have more. I got 9 dumplings for around $9. You can also purchase bags of their frozen dumplings to make in your own time too!! The inly thing really is that the place is small so you might not get a seat, but the food quality is amazing!! Definitely recommend!!

Really solid and no complaints.  Been wanting to check it out for awhile.  Spicy beef soup (lots of braised beef and excellent five spice flavor) is great and love the handmade noodles in there.  Nice broth.  Not too thick, oily, or salty.  Boiled chive/pork dumplings also great.  Cash only and price is fine.  Paid $14 total.  It was pretty busy even around 2 on a Thurs afternoon last week.  Looking forward already to the next time.
No comment
No comment

Food has definitely gone down in terms of flavor. I came here years ago before covid and the dumplings were pretty decent, on my recent visit not so much. Their shrimp and chicken wontons with spicy sauce was too salty. The beef pancake was ok.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

These dumplings are SO GOOD! I got the pork dumplings and they were lightly fried so the skin had a perfect crisp crunch but also was chewy when you bite into it. They have a few tables if you want to dine in like a cafeteria environment. They stay well as take out, which is what I did. The dumplings come out so quickly and the register ordering was simple. They even have bags of frozen dumplings you can take back home that are so reasonably priced. I got 7 dumplings for $5.50 hot off the pan, such a good deal!
No comment
No comment

If you're near Chinatown, I'd recommend Vanessa's for a quick bite. Great price, but I was told they only take cash. There is an ATM inside. You can also order ahead for pickup through various food delivery platforms. I got the chive & pork dumplings & they were pretty good (wish I had added chili sauce). Sriracha and soy sauce on the tables inside.

I stumbled upon this place randomly and decided to try because there was a long line. Usually long lines mean delicious, so why not? I ordered the shrimp and corn dumplings and the pork and chive. Honestly, I was a bit disappointed. The dumplings were really thick and not really refreshing. I expected that they be lighter and more tasty. The filling on the pork and chive did not work for me at all. It lacked flavor which made me sad-- I needed some chili oil, soy sauce, something! The shrimp on the other hand were delicious regardless of the thick wrapping. They could've benefited from some sauce too but overall they weren't bad. I probably wouldn't go back here but it was cool to try.
No comment
No comment

The dumplings here are tasty, but we were very disappointed by the noodles. We ordered the Dan Dan noodles, though I believe they gave us the black bean instead by mistake. They were not very flavorful, and the noodle texture was a bit over cooked. My parents definitely make better at home :) The dumplings are yummy but not any better than other options in the area. I'd skip this one since there are so many yummy options in Chinatown!

Kimchi sandwich was in its own league and with these prices, Vanessa's is a no-brainer. Suspicious service (several people ordered larger meals after us and were served first) but again, paying less than anything in the area for something uniquely good was worth it.
This place is absolutely deserving of all the great ratings. The dumplings are amazing!!!!!!

I remember Vanessa's being one of the better dumpling houses in Chinatown, but I guess with its rapid expansion and cutting corners, the quality is not the same.  The dumplings come frozen now and you see them store bags of frozen dumplings in their fridges in the middle of the restaurant.  So it doesn't surprise me that they taste like cheap frozen dumplings you get at the grocery store. There are better dumpling houses near Vanessa's, so will not be returning.
No comment
No comment
Personal 4.5, rounding up because it feels kind of special/unique to me :) Affordable, good for vegetarians, and delicious!

This iconic Chinatown spot has great dumplings but we also got bubble tea, noodles, and a sesame sandwich which were tasty. Cash only, they have a limited number of tables to dine in so if you want to sit down, come at an off time or be prepared to wait a while. The food here is so cheap and you get a ton of food- perfect for sharing, between two people we still ended up with leftovers.

column3: Central San Mateo, San Mateo, CA
column6: THIS PLACE IS A MUST when visiting NYC. I was recommended this place from a friend who lives in the city. She wasn't kidding that this place was delicious. I'm from the Bay Area so I had high expectations and this place did not disappoint. Definitely give this place a try if you're in the neighborhood or craving some really flavorful and fresh dumplings.

Super tiny spot enough for a few tables, cash only. Always packed and for a good reason! The food there is very reasonably priced. I always get the dumplings and the Peking Duck Pancake Sandwich was great as well. You can definitely walk out full for under $10.
Delicious- got the pork and chive dumplings pan fried with spicy sauce (a MUST). Don't let the setting put you off. Will be back to try more of the menu
No comment

The food was delicious and decently priced. We enjoyed all of the items that we ordered. We got the spicy beef noodle soup, spicy wontons with pork and shrimp, and fried chive and pork dumplings. There was a weird smell when we dined in. It might've been cleaning product. The beef soup could've had a bit more meat, but the broth was flavorful with a kick of spice. Overall, a good meal. I would go back.

This place has great dumplings of many varieties! Definitely felt freshly made and flavorful. More of a casual pick up spot as opposed to a dine in experience. It did take a while for our dumplings to be ready.
No comment

Super small location with pretty good dumplings. Got a pack of 8 and it was perfect for a snack. Good flavoring and good size. Location is super cute and the service is very quick. Definitely recommend.

I ordered both the fried Pork chive dumplings and the basil fried dumplings. Both were good. Definitely get the chili, garlic, cilantro condiment, it adds considerable flavor to the dumplings. Also ordered the pork wonton soup, extremely bland with more wontons than broth. Overall average food, nothing to brag about here.

The food was absolutely delicious and affordable. Our favorite was the dumplings. If you like a little kick I would definitely suggest adding the chili oil, it added great flavor.  The sesame sandwich was also delicious.

column3: Short North Arts District, Columbus, OH
column6: I like getting the frozen dumplings because it's a better deal and they're so good to have on hand! I want to try the spicy beef next!
Still a great place but I'll never forget when the dumplings here were $1.00 for (5) dumplings. Good times

There's a lot of hype around Vanessa's so I'm glad I was able to give them a try. All the dumplings were okay. The noodles were okay. Everything was okay. I would get the veggie dumplings out of all of them though because they were the most flavorful.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
This place. I have so many memories here and I've eaten at this place frequently. Their dumplings are really good and cheaply priced. I love their pancakes.
No comment
No comment
Literally so good and inexpensive. There was so much filling in the dumplings. I got the pork and chive dumplings. The spicy sauce is a must and wasn't too spicy.
The dumplings and soups we had were amazing, so tasty. We'll be back when we visit NYC next !!
No comment
No comment
No comment

I rescind my review, with all the expansions things have now leveled off to a mediocrity that is fine but I will not be back again when there's so many superb dumpling and noodle soup restaurants right around the corner for a fraction of the price.
No comment

Super good noodles and dumplings. We had the fried chicken dumplings, boiled assorted dumplings, fried pork buns and hand pooled peanut sauce noodles. We ordered 3 bottles of water. This was enough to feed three people. Very busy and constant customers coming in for dine in and take out.

As evident by the reviews and ratings, this is easily an incredible New York must-do! If you are even remotely a dumpling fan, don't think - just run to Vanessa's right now! I've been going here for years and they don't fail to impress despite the shabby state of the restaurant the food always, always delivers!! You just can't go wrong with their steamed or pan-fried dumplings. I specially recommend the Spicy Pan-Fried option which comes dunked in Chilli Oil with garlic and scallions! To die for!! You can even get their dumplings frozen to go so you can savor their flavors even when it's not convenient to schlep into Chinatown.

Foods are decent. Price is not bad. Noodles seem to be homemade and texture is nice. Wonton is good, and so is the spicy sauce for it. We did sit in. Although the foods are nice, the wait was bit long to sit in. Also, the inside was pretty crowded and we kinda got tired from staying in overpopulated area. It would be nice to do takeout and eat it in a peaceful park nearby or something.
Love love this place. Great prices, fast service, super friendly. Food always on point. Pork dumplings were THE BEST.
No comment

What a find! Was visiting the city for the weekend and tried to find a great hole in the wall with fantastic food. Dumplings were amazing and very reasonable priced. The place was fairly busy with a bunch of college students. I got 8 cabbage and pork, 8 chicken, 8 shrimp boiled dumplings. No one in my group cared for the purple cabbage and pork dumplings. The shrimp and chicken dumplings were great. Would definitely return.
For veggie dumplings, not my favorite at all. My dumplings lacked flavor, were a bit soggy and overall a disappointment.
No comment
One of the best dumpling places to satisfy your dumpling hankering! The anticipation was too real that I  I forgot to take some pictures. Will update you with some pictures soon.
Came here for their famous pan fried dumplings. We ordered the pork and cabbage dumplings. They actually came out soggy. It wasn't crispy but the flavors were good.
No comment
I ordered boiled and fried dumplings, sasane pancake sandwich.  A little pricey for the area considering the mediocre taste.
Fast-casual famed dumpling house. Limited seating, great food. We had veggie dumplings and pancakes -- the dumplings were good, but the pancake was something else. Definitely worth a try!
Good dumplings and multiple locations. Simple menu but there's something you'll like. They even have frozen bags to take home.
No comment
Yummy so good ! Hot fresh homemade dumplings  they have a good selection and it's made fresh by order. It's definitely worth the try

I can not say enough about this place. Vanessa's in Chinatown has THE best dumplings in town! Their vegetable dumplings are my favorite. Everything is so fresh, and the flavors are so balanced. 10/10 recommend Vanessas. I can't wait to try more on their menu!

I went with a group on the first day of the Chinese lunar new year on a Sunday. It was packed with a line out the door. The line moved slowly but the food was worth it. I ordered the fried cabbage & pork dumplings. Everyone in my party xca me away happy.

Perhaps I should just heed that voice in my head and not try Vanessa's dumplings after the previous lousy experience at their LIC location.  But I thought, maybe they will be different as this is their original location!  Things can't go wrong here!  So I went to get two bags of frozen dumplings...and voila! Three of the first five dumplings I took out of the bag had something funky attached...the look and texture seem to point to parts of a rag of some sort...disgusting!  Have to throw out the rest.  If a business can't keep the food clean, it has no business running a business!
No comment
Excellent dumplings!  They only take cash unfortunately or I would have brought some frozen ones home.

The wonton soup was light and tasty. The dumplings weren't anything too special but for the price, they were very good. My friends also got the sandwiches with pork and duck, and they all loved them. Definitely come here for inexpensive comfort food!

Especially loved the wontons which come in a delicious chill oil sauce with cilantro and scallions. We even dipped the shrimp steamed dumplings and the chicken sesame pancake sandwich in that sauce at the end.

This is where to get hot spicy dumplings. Everything was cooked perfectly. These dumplings have abundant spice in a good way. Indoor dining. Cooked to order. You wait a while for your food, but worth the wait. Came before Covid and now with Covid numbers dropping , we came again. It was worth it. Very good value for the money. There are plenty of dumpling places in NYC, but this one is outstanding.
No comment

The pork and chive dumplings are pretty good! The dumpling wrappers are thicker than ones that I've eaten elsewhere but it does have a nice texture/chew. Overall the pork and chive filling was good, and the dumplings are pretty big so you get a good bang for your buck. My wife and I ended up buying a bag of the frozen shrimp dumplings to-go. Also the workers are super nice here!

While I would've loved to have some dumplings, I actually came here for the sesame pancake with duck.  I was looking for something quick to grab and the pancake was the perfect thing.  While there is a decent amount of seating here, it does get busy and seating is just first come first serve.  I'll have to come back again to try the dumplings!

Haven't been to vanessa's in years and decided to drop by and grab something to take away.  Cost of food on some menu items has nearly doubled.  Their dumplings, which were pretty cheap back then is now over $5 and is hardly worth it when you can get much cheaper dumplings just about anywhere in chinatown.  Worse yet, is that the older woman manning the cashier couldn't care less about taking your order.  She was too busy playing with her phone.  Told her I wanted to order and just got a blank stare and she went back to playing on her phone.  Someone else had to take  my money and order and she just went back to playing with her phone while every single person was working.   Don't be surprised if the same happens when you go there.  I just want to order and leave, I don't have time for drama and shenanigans when I go to order food, ffs.  Looks like I won't be back for some time, if ever.

Got the pork and chive dumplings and so delicious. Fried perfectly. There was a packed house and long line to order but was able to grab a seat and eat. Highly recommend if you're in the area and want some tasty yet cheap dumplings.

SO SO yum. Got the veggie wontons in chili oil and a piece of sesame bread. The wontons were AMAZING I'd eat them any time. Like really any meal any time. The bread was also delicious! Sesame is my favorite flavor ever and this was delicious. My friend got the Dan Dan noodles and said the dumplings were better but still enjoyed them.
No comment

Not as the same Vanessa's as it used to be!  Bad food and pricey now compared to before when they becoming famous! Beef noodle soup sucks,peking duck pancake only fat duck in it, Pan fried dumpling soggy not crunchy! Wont go back again!
4.5/5 finally took my husband after talking about it for years. Worth the walk. We'll be back. Did the dumplings, next time want to try the sesame pancake sandwiches.
No comment
This place is a staple to New York society!!!!! I have been going there for years!!! Looks super sketchy but let me tell you. Some of the best dumplings in the city !!! Make sure to bring cash.

wow this was bad.  hadn't eaten here in years and i'd heard it'd gone downhill, but i still figured some dumplings for lunch would be a safe bet even if they're only mediocre.  these sucked.  got the cabbage/pork and the veggie dumplings.  it wasn't the filling (which was so-so) that was the problem.  that dough is an abomination.  it's thick and chewy; absolutely nothing like what good, handmade dumplings are like.  both the taste and the texture were just extremely offputting.  couldn't even finish, because why make myself suffer?

Went to the authentic chinatown location even though it was the farthest from my apartment- probably the best decision I made and it's a little cheaper than any of the other uptown locations. Since it's still pandemic times, there is no indoor seating but there also isn't a line to get in. There is a park nearby you can go to, to sit and enjoy this delicious Chinese cuisine. I highly recommend the spicy wontons- the chili pepper oil sauce that the restaurant adds to this dish is the bomb dot com! Probably the best item in the menu if you like spicy food. Also got the chive and pork pan fried dumplings, pork fried bun and the special noodles with meat and bean sauce (dry). The pork fried bun is a little misleading- it says on the menu that it comes with three but in fact it only comes with one big bun- was not a fan. The noodles were ok as well, tasted decent with soy sauce. Will be back!
No comment
No comment

If your in Chinatown there are so many other options, I wouldn't recommend getting your dumpling fix here. I ordered the boiled shrimp dumplings ($8) and I wasn't very impressed. However I do think they would have been better if I got them pan-fried. The noodle was grainy and the filling wasn't very flavorful. One order comes with 8 dumplings and it's pretty filling which was nice, but they don't have any good dipping sauces which honestly would have saved these dumplings. I didn't take a picture of my meal cause I was too disappointed.
No comment
No comment

Excellent food- staff are accommodating but weird. Be prepared for a long line and 1/2 hour wait for your order- they don't communicate well , Its a case of lost in translation. They do things their way. However that way is efficient enough to produce some of the most amazing dumplings in NYC. I found this place ( on Eldridge St) in 2000-2001. It was a hole in the wall, no one knew about it. Cash only- for $5-6 you got an order of steam dumplings and my favorite Scallion pancake sandwich that is off the charts amazing- Now it has 3 in NYC -went from hole in the wall to cash cow. It is worth the wait? Yes- On the weekends get there before noon and there wont be a line. They do not have hot oil, just chili sauce- hot oil is $- Worth it, go!
So good!! Friend loved the pork dumplings. Such a great place and I look forward to it after work. Love the vibe and fast service. 10/10
No comment
No comment
The dumplings are better than anything I can get at home, that's true....but the noodles are so good, I am angry at every noodle I've ever eaten before today. Have the noodles.
No comment

I was told these are the best dumplings in the city and my oh my are they good. You can also get a bag of 25 to take home with you (frozen) so you can boil/fry on your own. Awesome. Get the shrimp ones, you won't be sorry.

I don't understand why they have 2k+ reviews with a 4 star rating. The place is not clean and the food tastes bad.  I ordered pork dumplings, beef pancake, and hot sour soup and I threw most of them away.

This place was ok! The boiled dumplings ($6) were a little underwhelming, and the vinegar wasn't that flavorful, same goes for the hot sauce. The peanut noodles weren't what I was expecting, tasted more like dry-ish and peanut-y lo mein than the peanut noodles I've ordered in similar chinatown dumpling houses. Limited seating, and wait for food wasn't long- maybe 10-15 minutes when they're decently packed.
No comment
This place used to have great dumplings. Now it sucks. I wonder how a place that focuses exclusively on dumplings can manage to do it badly. Mah.
No comment
No comment
These are HANDS DOWN the best pan fried dumplings I have ever had. They were so crispy yet soft and highly affordable. Vanessa's needs to be one of your stops if visiting Chinatown.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Really good dumplings. We had the boiled chive and pork and the fried chive and pork. The first order we made the mistake of not ordering the spicy garlic sauce. Add the spicy garlic sauce it's only $1.50 more but it makes the dish. We also tried the pork sesame sandwich and that was also pretty good. Walked an hour and half for these, it was worth it.

I used to get Vanessa's often from the Williamsburg location and wanted to fulfill my cravings because I've never been to the Chinatown spot, assuming it would be better (it's the original location).  I ended up waiting 35 min for my order outside and also they increased prices (I understand because of hard times); they should have updated their menus with the new prices because a meal that should have costed $23 from their old menu was $35 (before tip..with tip was $41).  Pork and Chives Dumplings that were $2 are now $5 for example.  There were about 4 people in the kitchen and when I peeked in after 15 min they were just standing around not cooking anything.  The food was not as good as I remembered (from the Williamsburg spot) and we both had stomach aches after.  Won't be coming back to this location :/
No comment

Craving for dumplings yesterday, so we stopped by lower east side for some old good dumplings. I can say, I've had better, but for the price? This place is good enough. It was ready, waiting for us when we picked up and still hot enough. The pork and chive dumplings were the tastiest; the chicken and basil were hardly discernible, meaning I couldn't tell if there were basil in it and I love the taste of basil. We got fried wonton with spicy sauce. Again, the only thing I tasted was the spicy chili which asked for taro bubble tea and Gong Cha was nearby. Anyhoo, I might still go back for the pork and chives.

Ordered the chicken and chive dumplings, Peking duck sesame pancake and beef sesame pancake.  The pancakes flavors were very good and on point.  The chicken and basil dumplings I believe they gave us the wrong order and we received the pork and chive dumplings because it didn't taste like chicken or basil.  Price was a little bit expensive but overall wasn't overpriced since it is Manhattan I suppose.  As for if I would return I possibly would for the Peking duck pancake and perhaps to try their noodles.
No comment

Three words: Take my money. Holy crap I was craving for some dumplings so bad and I had always wanted to try Vanessa's. We had gotten the spicy shrimp and chicken dumplings, chicken fried dumplings and pork and chives steamed dumplings. All were super delicious but the winner was the one in the spicy sauce. I cannot express how amazing these tasted. So much flavor bursted in my mouth and wow. I was sad that it was over before i knew it. The only downfall was that the portion is kind of small for the price but overall it was worth it. Whatever Vanessa puts in these dumplings is amazing. I will be back to try more next time
No comment
No comment
Fantastic dumplings!  Found this place thanks to Yelp.  Packed but able to get a table and order a bunch of great food.  Dumplings, sesame pork sandwich, noodles, everything tasted unbelievable.

Walked past this place and finally decided to stop in, and let me tell you it was worth it. We only wanted a quick snack so we ordered the Wontons in Spicy sauce and the Cabbage and Pork dumplings, THEY WERE AMAZING. Definitely a spot to come back to and the goal is to try everything on the menu :)
first place i ate at when i arrived in new york. perfect way to start off my trip & affordable. super tasty
No comment

Fantastic, fresh dumplings at an amazing price, that's what I'm talking about! Ordered the shrimp and the cabbage/pork dumplings and both were delicious, so well seasoned. Bring cash and keep your receipt until you get the dumplings. Really glad I decided to try this place out!

Had to stop by and try these famous dumplings. It was super crowded but the line moved fast and somehow we found a spot to eat (pre-covid time). We got the dumplings and the Peking duck. Wow, I didn't think I'd ever like duck but this was awesome. Wish I lived closer or I'd be here all the time. Four stars just because I wish it was less crowded and could make for a better experience overall. Great for takeout or to go.
Dumplings are simple yet so flavorful. We had the pork and chive pan-fried dumpling and the peking duck sesame sandwich. Highly recommend for a nice hole in the wall joint.

Amazing! Wonderful service, ready in minutes. Only downside is there's a 16$ minimum for card transactions. But, I was introduced to the Sesame Pancake with Peking Duck, so it helped me try something new.

One of the rare Chinatown places that aren't just hype and/or americanized. Def affordable, and delicious as well. Can't really go wrong with a meal that could cost less than $5... Take out is preferable since the seating is minimal and always crowded, and the tables aren't wiped down as frequently as I would like. A staple when I come down to Chinatown, for sure!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I'm excited to say they finally have vegan meat dumplings! The beyond meat dumpling and pan fried veggie dumplings are really good! They take cash and card with a minimum of $15 (I believe). The sesame pancakes are tasty as well!
No comment

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: It took more than 20 minutes to get a single order of dumplings when it wasn't even busy.  They're not hand-folding them or anything, so this is completely unacceptable for how much they now cost.  The taste isn't bad, and the toppings are nice, but it's not worth the cost and wait.  Especially not with five people behind the counter giving pretty poor service.
No comment

the food is incredible, prices are pretty good, and their dumplings are out of this world! Spicy vegan beef dumplings + the chicken & basil are DELICIOUS! Their duck sandwich is oddly sweet in the best way possible. 10/10 every-time
My favorite place to get takeout dumplings from. You can get frozen ones but i like to order the veggie dumplings and edamame with chili oil!!!

The pork cabbage boiled dumplings were delicious, especially with the chili cilantro sauce.

I live the dumplings here, the pork and chives and the vegetables are my go to.  Also the pancake sandwhich is great! Its a small place but has seating area. They take card but have minimum of 15, pay with cash if you are buying less
So so so tasty.  solid staff, and they move you through quickly.  Just buy everything, including frozen dumplings to go for later!

I got fried chicken & basil dumplings, as well as the coconut milk tea, and i can honestly say these did not disappoint. the dumplings were rich in flavor and the bubble tea was delicious. i definitely need to come back here to get them again. 10/10 for both items.

My husband and I really enjoyed this place. We stayed right around the corner from it during our vacation and it didn't disappoint. Very tasty, really good flavor with the spicy sauce and garlic topping. Quick and easy!

Not only the food has gone south and the price has gone up. And the service sucks. I ordered pancake with pork and the meat was very little and taste bland. Beware your order is not served in the order you placed, even if you ordered the same item, the people after you might get their order first if you don't keep track. When I asked them why people who ordered pancake like I did after me were getting their order filled first and my order still not filled? Instead of apologizing they were giving nonsense excuse that people had ordered before me. Wow don't they know 185 is after 176? And both were same pancake orders.  There are better dumplings and noodle place just down the block on 295 Grand St ( Shu Jiao Fu Zhou), their food taste great and cheaper than Vanessa too! (Voted best cheap dumplings in Chinatown on Yelp!). In my opinion, Vanessa Dumpling House is overhyped and overpriced !
No comment
No comment

I asked for pork dumplings in chili oil (wanting to have a repeat of Sichuan style that I ate a few days before), and they came out hot and fresh with no scrimping on the chili oil.  My order was #10 and I saw other orders go out for higher numbers which was annoying, but I had plenty of time and wasn't in a hurry so why complain?  Looks like others weren't impressed with the thick dough wrappers but I saw them as good handmade product.  I have eaten so many jiaozi in my life that maybe I have lost sight of what is good and what is bad, and it could be argued that a bunch of chili oil can easily obfuscate other tastes, but I didn't have any major expectations so I was satisfied.  People came in and out getting takeout so I got the impression that folks tend not to eat inside here and I'll admit that there were sesame seeds and crumbs on the table, but I'm not really picky about that stuff at places like this.  It did what it was supposed to do.  4 stars because even a mediocre dumpling house is still pretty darn good.

The dumplings were great. Ate them in a matter of a seconds. I got the pork and chive dumplings as well as a scallion and egg sandwich. The wait was pretty long tbh... probably waited about 10+ minutes to get my food? Very crowded but we were an blue to get seats at one of the tables. Very happy with my meal and will be coming back to try more.

You can't beat the price to quality/flavor ratio. Hand made and sooo good, the green ones are veggie, pink are chicken (not in photo), and spicY beef were soo good as well. Amazing price, filling and satisfying.

Place is worth the hype. Very good and affordable dumplings. Not alot of seating tho. I would recommend bringing cash

If you're going for the scrumptious wontons in spicy sauce, I recommend getting them to stay because they have thinner skin than the takeout option. This is the primary reason why I recommend this place over the uptown Vanessa's, which continues to use the thick skin wontons. The vegetable wontons are particularly delicious.
No comment
No comment

We came here for a bowl of pork dumplings in hot oil sauce today.  I'm going to give this place 4 stars because of the value.  As for the taste, I'm sorry, there are better dumplings in Toronto.  And Din Tai Fung in LA has THE best dumplings in chili oil by a country mile.  I see that there are a lot of ethnic Chinese people giving this place 3 stars or lower, and I have to admit I was thinking along similar lines.  However, I don't want to be a hater.  First of all, I never tried their pan fried dumplings and those might be the bomb.  Second, the dumplings in hot oil I had today were decent.  And most of all, for the price, this place offers great value for authentic Chinese dumplings.

Been coming here since I was a kid. As of September 2021 they have reopened with seats inside for dining. Recommend the fried dumplings and beef sesame pancake w soy sauce. They accept card as long as your total is is over $15 so bring cash.
No comment
Love the veg sesame pancake - dream about the fresh cilantro and cucumber taste - must have had it about a dozen times now. All dumplings great. Affordable. Authentic.

Vanessas is super popular but as a picky Chinese eater, I think their food is very bad. The dumplings are overly greasy, not authentic and catered toward a Caucasian palette. There is also a pretty high carb to meat ratio. The place itself is kind of old and a little grungy, and because so many people love to come here, it's extremely crowded and chaotic at lunch time. I would instead venture to Shu Jiao next door which has some of the best dumplings I've had in New York, and is even cheaper (but similarly ghetto).

Bought two of their sesame sandwiches. Got a single piece of the thinnest slice of beef ever. One slice of beef on a big and thick bread. Come on
