I just want to know who Vanessa is, so I can thank her for helping me survive these broke times. Dumplings are delicious! Get the pork and chive! If I'm really hungry I'll get dumplings and a vegetable sesame pancake. Their bubble tea leaves me bubbly. I usually get the Thai milk iced tea, but I decided to get out my comfort zone and try the coconut milk bubble tea. It's creamed perfection.

The food was delicious we had a sesame duck pancake and it was so good. The only thing that needs to be worked on is the service and customer relations, the table was so oily I asked them to wipe it and the lady (she does not speak English) gave me napkins. I was Kind of disappointed.

My favorite place to get my fried dumplings in LES. Used to be $1 for 4 fried pork dumplings a few years ago but even with $1.25 is still very affordable. When your tummy calls for food ordering fried dumpling is good and fast. Order and eat. Lol. The dumplings are still big and juicy. Still yummy but I felt the past it tasted better. The cashier are friendly. There's a few tables and chairs. Stools in the window area for people watching. Restroom for customer to use. But if you ordering out the wait can be at least 10 mins. If you are lucky you can get your order faster. Depends on the availability of the food in the wok and steamer. I have been coming here for more than 10+ years now. Great place for fast eats and to be full.

Sorry to say this place has gone down the drain, don don noodle which is meat and bean sauce and look.. over cook noodle that seat in the water for to long the sauce is only a spoon full more beans the meat WTF... doesn't even cover the noodles when mixing it, the dumpling is so damn bad now from back when they first opened, sorry unacceptable.. tell or post this will it help since ppl that visit this place from the hype please the place next door has better taste the they have if it wasn't for working late and they're the only one open I would not spend a penny.. guess what I rather cook instant noodle at home and cook frozen dumpling which would taste way better... NO MORE people is a waste of your money. I wish there is a negative rating
Boiled dumplings are a family staple so we rarely eat out. But for this price, I will be back!
No comment
The dumplings were good. I had the pork chive. I feel if they had some ginger in them they would be great. Otherwise it was a clean establishment and enjoyed my dumplings.
No comment
Ordered cabbage and pork dumplings and a sesame pancake. Cheap and solid food. Love it.

Fast and efficient service with a good variety of options. I have had food from here at least a dozen times, and practically everything on the menu is delicious. The place is also dirt cheap. You can walk out of there stuffed for $6 or less. Things I have tried an enjoyed: steamed dumplings, fried dumplings, toasts, soup. During my most recent experience I ran in here quickly as I was driving through Manhattan. I got myself the fried pork dumplings and the the kimchi toast- refer to the photo. Both were very enjoyable for a fast, cheap meal. I WOULD NOT recommend this place as a sit-down option. It does have a few tables, but it is a very hectic restaurant which I would qualify as a fast-food parlor. The only reason I am chopping a star is because they quality of the food itself isn't exactly what one would want... But for the price, it is absolutely reasonable.

I love dumplings, so when I was hungry and in the area my friend suggested we stop here.  Walking inside it was insanely chaotic, everybody crowded around the counter where they give you the food.  The register is towards the back, I had a hard time seeing it at first with the crowd in the way.  I ordered pork and chive fried dumplings and the spicy wontons...total was around $7 so very cheap for NYC in my opinion.  It took forever to get my food...it was to the point where people behind me were getting their orders and I was still standing there waiting.  Not the biggest deal but I guess I expected it to be a bit quicker.  The food was good, don't get me wrong, but it wasn't amazing, definitely nowhere near the best dumplings I've had in the city.  I wish the fried pork dumplings had been crispier, the skin was really thick and chewy but not at all crispy.  The wontons were good, just not quite as flavorful as I had hoped.  The seating area was really small, not unusual for Chinatown. There were a ton of people in there and very few tables and chairs so we had to fight for a table...probably a better idea to take it to-go.  Service isn't super friendly but the ladies behind the counter seem to work really hard so I can definitely let that go.  Overall I think this is a solid place to stop if you want cheap dumplings and you just so happen to be right there next to the restaurant.  If not, there are better places in Chinatown you can go.

I have been to Vanessa's two times, the first was last year on a weekend and it was packed. If you want a seat during the busy times you should have a friend find one and you just wait in line. Make sure you know what you want, for me its the cheap dumplings and the sesame breads with duck or pork. The hot and sour soup is really good. The second time was a week ago on a Wednesday afternoon, I was able to order, and get out. This is a great place not a first date place , because of the noise and people. But its one of the best economic value in NYC.
Good for a quick and cheap bite.  Prices here are 4 dumplings for $1.50.  Not bad if you're on a budget.  At least they allow you to use credit card but there's a $15 minimum.

They gotten better with all the competition nearby. Much friendlier service now. The bash attitude is what makes them funny. More importantly the food has improved more back to when they first started and cared.
Very good and reasonable prices! Quaint spot in Chinatown. I had the hot and sour soup and steamed pork dumplings and my friend had miso soup and dumplings. I would recommend this place to others.

My office staff order lunch from here at least once a week because the food is tasty and substantial for a low price. I feel this food is oily but this is the nature of the beast. Fried dumplings? Fried pancakes? Sandwiches in a fried crispy outer sesame bread? Even the delicious sauces have a significant amount of oil. But it's a nice treat once a week. We order a lot.
No comment

Vanessa's Dumpling House is the go-to place in Chinatown, Manhattan for some cheap eats.  I would recommend trying their spicy wonton if you like spicy food and the pork and cabbage dumplings (I prefer cabbage over chives).  If you liked homemade soy bean milk, they do have that here, you can choose betwen hot and cold & sweetened or unsweetened.  Everything is priced under $6, so you could have a feast without going broke.  The restaurant is very small and offers very limited seats, so if you want a dine-in experience, you would have to stand behind some fellow diners like some hyenas waiting to devour the prey after the lions and tigers are done eating in the wild.  Usually people would get the hint and finish their meal and conversation in a timely manner and leave the table for the next customer.  With that said, this is not the place to bring your date to, even if you wanted to be a cheap date (order the food to go instead if you really had a limited budget for a date :D).   This place is CASH only, but they do have an ATM right outside the store.  When you walk into the restaurant, walk towards the end of the room where the cash register is and place your order by choosing from the menu in front of the cash register or right above the wall behind the cash register.  After that, you will be given a receipt with your order number.  People at the kitchen would then prepare your order and call out your order number.  The only issue is that the speed of people getting your order ready at this place is slow, so don't come here when you are super hungry, you will go bananas.  The bathroom at this place is an attraction because of the amount of graffiti on the wall.

Good dumplings for an excellent price. The one big downside was the very long wait, which was about 25 minutes for me. To be fair, I think I caught the dinner rush. Dumplings are not overly cooked, pretty delicious, but at one point I bit into something a little gritty. I'll still be back.
Best location is the original! Delicious, consistent, highly recommend, great to bring out-of-towners too.

Best place to go for a cheap quick bite when you need that dumpling fix! Also enjoy their scallion pancake sandwiches. And all around good food at the best prices you'll find in NYC

Dumplings to die for... short line, quick service, high quality. 10/10 would recommend.

Overall: The location was hidden in Chinatown, but we were able to locate it.  My friend and I ordered the sesame pancake with pork and dumplings.  The place was small with limited seats.  Since we were coming from SF, my friend and I researched and yelped the eateries in NY.  I'm glad we found Vanessa's.  We enjoyed both dishes.

I dont get the hype about this place. There's always a line whenever I come here. I don't know if was just unlucky but all the dumplings we ordered taste terrible. They are not only very hard but also very dry. I do love the szechuan spicy pancake tho.

Great spot. Been around for years. Priced for the quick meal. Quality.  Foodies will be picky. Sesame sandwiches are tasty, and the all dumplings/other items are fresh, delicious, and for everyone. Not a snotty place.

Really great cheap eats! I recommend eating the friend pork and chive dumplings and also their hot buns! For two dollars and you get 4 pieces it's pretty great price! I also had their bubble tea, it's not their specialty but it's good enough. It does get a bit busy and the line is long but it's worth the wait.

As a big fan of dim sum I was thoroughly disappointed with the dumplings here. The wait was significantly longer than you'd expect considering there was only one order in front of ours.  BUT despite the flop on the dumplings, they have great hot & sour soup, and I would order their chicken teriyaki ANY day.

Found this place with a friend from NC looking for something you cant get anywhere. It was a little walk from the Canal st\little Italy area but that have been because I was really hungry. When we arrived, the placed was crowded with people standing along the high top counter and all of the 4 or 5 tables occupied. Fortunately it didn't take long to order. We tried veg dumplings, pork dumplings, pork rolls, and were recommended the sesame pancake pork sandwich. It turned out to be my favorite! The sesame pancake was like a fluffy sweet fried dough (bread) and the pulled pork and carrots on it were good. Tables were stocked with soy sauce and Sriracha. Check this place out for a fun snack to share, or whenever you want a dumplings fix!

It feels-4  degree outside and pretty windy. I left with questions and dissatisfaction.

Deliciously affordable dumplings!  4 for $1.25.  I like the pan fried pork & chives and the pork & cabbage.  And if you want to eat healthier try their boiled dumplings.  I also recommend the sesame pancake with roast beef.  The hoisin sauce perfectly compliments the roast beef engulfed in a crispy sesame pancake with veggies to add to the texture and nutrition. Perfect for breakfast, lunch, or dinner.

Their dumpling with spice sauce is soo good! Cash only place,but they have an atm outside. Guaranteed to be crowded anytime.

We stopped at Vanessa's during a trip to Chinatown.  The sesame pancake with roast pork was delicious!  Crispy exterior loaded with Sesame seeds,  fluffy interior.  Smeared with a black bean sauce,  layered with lightly pickled cucumbers, carrots and fresh cilantro and topped with roast pork.  Its one of my favorite flavor combinations.  It's similar to bahn mi. The pork and chive dumplings were delicious especially with lots of sriracha.  Chicken and Thai basil was very Tasty although we prefer the usual pork and chive.  We bought a bag of frozen of each. You can't beat the price 50 frozen dumplings for around $10. I also got the sweet and sour cucumbers.  They were refreshing and had a nice kick of heat after a few bites. So good!! This place was much nicer than most dumpling places we have been to.  It was crowded but the line went pretty quickly.  can't wait to go back!

The perfect hole in the wall restaurant. Come here for the dumplings and stay here for the buns. On a hot summer night, this is a great place to have dinner of get a snack. Service isn't the fastest but they are very nice.

This place seems busy even on Sunday night. Ordered boiled shrimp dumplings which were OK. Maybe because I'm Eastern European, I prefer pierogies (varenyky) over dumplings. Visit "Baba's Pierogi" in Gowanus and feel the difference;)

The food is good. The service is so bad. The lady talks to you like she is your boss, and her kids are doing homework in the restaurant, and she constantly yells at her daughter, complaining they are slow. It was an very unpleasant dining experience.

Very nice and comparable to Prosperity Dumpling. It's also a chain so you can go to the location at Union Square. The potstickers and everything here is very tasty and cheap. Omg this is the best stuff!Man, those dumplings are magical. I wasn't expecting much in this hole in the wall. I was wrong people. I had the basil and chicken dumplings 2 orders. Very cheap lunch in NYC. That's why I love Chinatown. People ya'll need to come and yes I am from Texas.

Rating purely on food- the dumplings were doughey and not very well stuffed. Although the seasoning in the stuffing was great, it took time to chew through the dough to get to it. The 'dumplings with hot sauce' just came with the siracha. As did all other dumplings, so it was a little disappointing to not find a condiment of house-made sauce.  I guess I got my money's worth, not sure if I'd visit again.

Place and all the food was simple. Everything is super super cheap!! By cheap I mean $1-$3. We only got the dumplings and a scallion pancake. The fried dumplings were okay, can definitely tell they're homemade but to me nothing special. The scallion pancake was very dough-y and the parts that don't have scallions were very plain. It reminded me of the sesame seed ball that had the yellow stuff in it but without the grease( if you know what food item I'm talking about.) I think I only liked it because it was super cheap. A lot of people were eating noodles so I would assume it's good.

Food poisoning. Nuff said! Husband and I got their pork dumplings and chicken dumplings and both of us ended up with nasty cases of food poisoning. I'm throwing out a packet of their frozen dumplings as we speak. Never again.

It gets extremely packed during the regular rush hours.  My gf and I went in at around 6-7pm and had to stand like vultures just to grab some seats that we uncomfortably squeezed into. Service was extremely questionable because everyone is very fast paced so you feel rushed. But the meal overall was filling and so so so worth the few dollars!

Exactly what you want in Chinatown!  Great Dumplings (assorted was a wonderful choice), Bun, and Hot and Sour Soup.  Incredible, almost unbelievable pricing and a staff that is powerful and efficient.  Not much in the way of seating but that adds to the atmosphere.  If you end up in NYC, this place is definitely worth a stop.  You can get a lot of food for a little cash so be aware that Credit Card use has a $15 minimum.

Amazing dumpling place! Very cheap (4 pcs of dumplings for $1), delicious, fresh! I only wish there were more seats inside the store. We could not sit at a table and had to eat standing up at the counter table near the window. I need to study the menu more to enjoy more next time.

Goddamn amazing place. Jesus the wonton and chili sauce is straight out of Jesus' oven. Oh my god. They're pick up estimates are off but it is worth it. Nom nom.

I loved the pork sesame sandwich. The bread is so soft and delicious and has a texture like a oily focaccia (but in a good way). I like taking the sandwhich home and adding mayo and siracha. They definitely water the down the siracha there ;). Dumplings are aight.

Thought I'd buy some lunch here after being told by my friend that this place was very good. So I just had to share my experience because the food was very good but there was no space to even breathe. I suffer from claustrophobia so it was really hard for me but I managed to fight my way through the mob with eight dumplings in hand. Very affordable I might add

Dumplings are tasty, but they are frozen--you'll watch them take out handfuls of frozen pieces from the freezer and toss them into boilers. They'll also charge you .50 cents for extra sauces that are the tiniest little cups. Sure, it's cheap, but definitely not the freshest, but you get what you pay for. I would skip and go somewhere that is cleaner and higher quality.

We're visiting NYC and staying near Chinatown, so thought some dumplings would be in order. We were recommended Vanessa's. We went in expecting a very pared down setting, so that wasn't an issue. The prices were great, but unfortunately, the dumplings weren't. They sorely lacked flavour, but worse than that, the dumpling wrappers were just too thick and undercooked. We're pretty spoiled for dumplings in Sydney, where we're from, and are used to soft, delicate, almost translucent wrappers. These were more like very undercooked raviolis. We were hungry and in a hurry, so we ate them, but it was underwhelming.

Did not disappoint! We had some pork fried buns, beef dumpling in spicy sauce, pork & chive dumplings, and pork & cabbage dumplings, the beef noodle soup and the Peking duck sesame pancake sandwich. The soup and the pork & cabbage fried dumplings were the best! Want to go back ASAP, but these assignments  aren't going to get done on their own!

I grew up eating Vanessa's dumplings and to tell ya the truth.. I'm sad that now they've gained popularity over the years and has become a hipster hangout. Oh.. also sad that dumplings no longer cost $1 (but that's a whole other story). Thankfully all the same aunties work there and they still have their no-frill attitude! ;) which keeps this place authentic. I actually don't even order the dumplings all that often.. what you have to get is the beef scallion pancake. IT IS SO GOOD AND I CAN EAT IT EVERYDAY FOR THE REST OF MY LIFE! they also make a tuna scallion pancake (probably for the hipsters) cause Asians don't eat canned tuna... anyway, drizzle some soy sauce, vinegar, sriracha and you will be thanking me for blessing your tastebuds.

I would not bother even swinging by it. The dumplings are too doughy and the fillings are curiously flavourless. I ordered a hot and sour soup which was nothing to write anything about. The only amazing thing in the menu are the prices. Where can you get a soup for a dollar and half in the city? But then I would rather spend more and get good food than be dished out average fare. I have no idea how and why people queue up to eat there. There must be a reason which escapes me.

My go-to easy cheap satisfying meal! It's always crowded there, sometimes you have to wait a little while for your food to be ready, but you can also call and order ahead. My favorites include the wontons in spicy sauce (my ultimate favorite) and the kimchi pancake. I also like their dipping sauce which is vinegary, not just soy sauce.

Vanessa's Dumpling House was reopening and made the place very big. The reopening started at Wednesday August 1st

Awesome dumplings and definitely worth the wait. I'm so excited to go back...the Bathroom is also quite an experience!
Yes! Visit this place! Get so many dumplings it is inexpensive. The pork and chive dumplings (4 for $1.50) were my favorite!

I love this place, authentic dumplings and great food. My wife and I try this place when we come to NYC. Very small place, cheap fare and plenty of choices. Suggest the sesame sandwiches, we loved the Peking Duck sesame sandwich. Any dumplings we tried have been great, ask for added chili oil and cilantro for an extra kick. Wait in line, be patient and rub elbows with your dinner neighbor, enjoy.!

I wasn't too crazy about the dumplings plus there's no other choices as far as Chinese food if you're looking for other alternatives.

The spicy wonton dumplings here are so drool worthy! The mix of chili oil, peanuts, garlic and green onions topped with vinegar soy sauce is so perfect. Eat here, don't miss out. Did I mention it's only $5 for a generous serving and $1-3 for drinks. Are you kidding me?

With the amount of dough to content ratio, they might as well call it "boiled dough" instead of dumpling. No wonder I do not see Chinese people eating here. such a shame if foreigner think this is what Chinese dumpling really is.

There are a lot of options for Chinese food in this one single restaurant. It's just the exactly kind of feeling when you walked into a dumpling restaurant in China. Their food is close to real Chinese food but I would suggest please don't use so many plastic plates and bowls. It will look better if they use plates instead of plastic ones. Overall it's good food and good experience. Kinda crowded, you probably have to wait a little. It's definitely a good place for college students to grab a quick cheap good meal in the city. Would like to visit again if I cross nearby.

So I read up on some older reviews when dumplings were 25 cents cheaper but honestly, this place is still so cheap! For $23, we fed a family of six. We got orders of pan fried pork dumplings, soy milk, hot and sour soup, chicken and corn soup, two beef pancakes, and a dumpling noodle soup. I couldn't believe how cheap it was! That's why when you're on a budget for good Chinese food, you should just come here! They're always open and reliable!

I have also had the scallion pancake, just okay, really is just bread with some scallions but dumplings are superb. Great option if you're looking for a cheap meal.

Sesame pancake was good. It had duck inside which is always delish in my opinion. We also got fried pork dumpling. I wanted to love it but in my opinion it lacked flavor. I've had better dumplings.

We ordered fried chive and pork dumplings, hot and spicy wontons, some nice kimchi with hint of fruity flavor and bean paste noddles( the noddle on the picture). Everything was great but the noddles were too salty for our taste so we asked to exchange it for something else. The first lady we asked give us some attitude ("you want to return it after you have already ate it?" But like how we suppose to know until we taste it) and then after several minutes of feeling kind of uncomfortable and struggling to decide if we should go up again, I went up to another lady who seemed like a manger and told her about the noddles and she told me that "they put the same amount of sauce on all the dishes and it's up to the costumer to decide how much to mix it in." Of course I was like yeah yeah I understand (cause I ain't trying to start any drama here) but they really should've told us that if that was the case. we ended up throwing it out (for the food). Overall, this place had good food for a cheap price but no place should make anyone feel uncomfortable for expressing their opinion on the food, I mean it takes a lot for one to just express that at the first place.

I'm not sure what to write here, other than Vanessa's offers very good dumplings at incredibly reasonable prices. Probably cleaner than prosperity too.

This place is delicious, cheap, and fast.  I've had the pork & chive dumplings, fried pork buns, and sesame pancake with egg. Don't have a bad thing to say about any of the food! The place is a little crowded, but they move you along quickly and get your food to you in ample time. Also make sure you have cash on you, because you most likely won't reach the credit card minimum considering my entire meal cost less than a Starbucks coffee. Loved this place and can't wait to try more of their options!

This place was great. Cheap and tiny. They have a good selection of different dumplings (that you can take home frozen I believe). I tried a few things... The fried dumplings were simple and delicious. Exactly what you expect. The noodles with sesame were straight forward and had lots of veggies. I had a pork soup which tasted a lot like a pho. Sesame pancake sandwich with Peking duck was probably favorite. The bread had a lot of chew which I love, the duck was moist and full of flavor. Fried pork buns, again simple, straightforward, delicious. Seating is very limited so show up early or wait for awhile to sit. Order in the back and watch as they prepare/package your order. This is probably more traditional flavors of this cuisine. I am more about those fusion flavors, big and bright flavors. So while it was all delicious (and cheap) I would stop here if nearby but probably won't go out of my way for it.

The dumplings were AMAZING! Everything came out hot and fresh. The place was recommended by a friend and I will definitely be coming back. The portions are pretty good and it's a good amount to share with friends.

Here's what you need to know about the dumplings: the outer layer is unusually thick. You feel like you are chewing on a flour dough and the inner filling are sub par in quality and disappointing in terms of proportion. I liked the shrimp dumpling better over the chicken dumpling. I am certain there are better dumpling spots for that price range.

Whyyyyyyy is your sriracha watered down?!Where they do that at?! The shrimp dumplings taste like straight celery. The basil/chicken & pork/chive dumplings were bland and an ill texture. The sesame pancake was hard and tasteless and the Szechuan beef filling just tasted like vinegar. The bathroom smelled like a distinct blend of ginseng, poop & vomit. RIP Prosperity Dumpling, you are dearly missed.

Friday night, long line to order, longer line to get food - well worth the wait to get these great, tasty succulent lil pillows of joy. Shrimp and pork wonton soup good too. One guy cooks it all and 5 woman moving the food and people along. Its like catching BINGO when they do finally call your # - must listen closely and be close to fully comprehend them and you must have your ticket - forget no tickee no laundry here, no tickee no soup or food for you! Tables along the wall turn over quick - You pay, you eat, you gogogo -  Enjoy ^_^
No comment

Although I never have high expectations going into a restaurant based solely on reviews, I had a general expectation of having decent dumplings here. I would have to say that I was quite disappointed. We ordered an array of vegetable and meat dumplings both pan fried and boiled along with spicy sauce. The dumplings and sauce were not as flavorful as I had expected them to be. I had to douse them in soy sauce and watered down sriracha. The filling in the dumpling was falling out and the dumpling dough was very thick and unpalatable. My lychee iced tea tasted overly sweet and artificial as well. Perhaps my experience was just an unlucky one seeing the positive reviews regarding this place.
Best dumplings in the city! Queue can get big sometimes but wait and try the spicy soup dumplings- worth the wait. Their bubble teas suck though- too much ice.
This place is similar to tasty dumplings. The spicy wonton is really good here!! Order the spicy wonton. I didn't really like the basil dumplings though.

I've started coming here way before this place became trendy. I used to come here during lunch time when I was in high school. Til this day, this is my go to spot if I'm craving dumplings or sesame pancake with beef but to me this place is not super delicious or special. Somehow this is just a place that's been around for so long that I'm used to going to. The food tastes good but there are places that taste even better. I guess cause it's been around for so long, I basically grew up around it, it's become part of me. The price increased but it's still affordable and filling which I like. They actually have a small section inside the city acre market in the Fidi area and the prices there is triple the price here which is ridiculous! Overall everyone should try this dumpling spot! Cause everyone comes here now for dumplings!
No comment
No comment

Really great dumplings and just about anything else they make. You can watch them create the magic as you're in line. Canned sodas are about the only beverages. Really enjoyed inexpensive Chinese food after a day hoofing it around the City.

My friend and I were visiting New York for a whirlwind 12 hour day trip, and set out to find cheap eats we just can't find in our home base Washington, DC. Cheap dumplings in Chinatown was our first stop! Turning to my trusty Yelp app, Vanessa's had tons of rave reviews and was super close to the subway station. We ordered a few types of dumplings, both fried and steamed, and loved everything we got! While we have had tastier dumplings elsewhere, you can't beat the price and portions of Vanessa's. I loved the pork and chive dumpling, pork and cabbage dumpling, steamed shrimp dumpling, and bbq pork dumplings. My friend ordered a boba which she said was good, and cost just around $3. I really wish I ordered a sesame pancake since they were cheap and looked tasty, but wanted to save my appetite for the rest of the day. I will be back to try more when I'm in NYC again -- add Vanessa's to your list if you do a Chinatown food crawl.
Yum so good and so authentic. Like the area too.  I got the combo order and totally loved it.  I had to force myself to finish but I knew i would regret it since dumplings don't save well.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Quick service (sometimes). Everything on the menu is cheap so you can't complain about the food here. I always get the fried dumplings and beef sandwich. You end up spending at most $5/6!

Coming in, I had huge expectations for this place. There was a lot of space and it was relatively clean. The service was also fast. I, however, was disappointed with the wonton in spicy sauce. It wasn't spicy, the wontons hardly had any meat in it, and it was bland! There was more skin ratio to meat if that makes any sense. Definitely not worth $5 for eight wontons. You can get 20 dumplings with $5 and that's enough to last you the whole day, but the wontons didn't fill me up.

I used to go to this place to buy frozen dumplings and lots of other things. It was always good. Recent time I bought a bag of chicken dumplings. After cooking it at home, it doesn't taste as good as before. The meat doesn't even taste like chicken. Guess that I will not come back again for any dumplings. I also bought steamed bun with read bean and vegetables. None of them worth the price. Still like it's sesame flat bread and will keep buying it.

No comment
Great Chinese dumplings.  Small and cramped inside with limited seating. You may find yourself standing and eating.  Worth the trip though.

How can you not love this place?! My friend and I stopped in on a rainy Friday around 6 and managed to just beat the crowd. We ordered a bunch of dumplings, a large soup, and a sesame pancake with chicken and it came out to be $9 (yes, you read that correctly.) All of the food was great and for the price, you can't beat it! Will definitely be coming back when I'm in the area again!

I might come out as a weird case who loves their wonton soup more than the dumplings. Their wonton soup is the reason why I stop by this side of Chinatown. It reminds me the taste of home, the authentic Taiwanese or Chinese style soupy food.

Very very friendly staff... never been before so I asked the counter person what was best. She said, let me order for you and I agreed. We had dumplings and sandwiches on some sesame pancakes or whatever. They were both very good, very fresh and very inexpensive. Add it all together and you have the perfect lunch. I would definitely revisit. But who the heck is Vanessa??

The dumplings here are nothing but amazing. It's a fast pace environment so you'll get your order fast. It's very affordable and there's an assortment of dumplings. My favorite one is the vegetable and shrimp dumplings, they are about $4.50 each and it comes with about 7 for each order. Definitely recommend this place to anyone who wants to try good quality dumplings.

How could I not discover this place earlier?! Very cheap, huge menu, hearty food. I had pork dumplings with chives and a scallion kimchi dough sandwich for lunch for under $7! The soup is pretty good too. The best part is watching the cooks prepare the food. Cash only and seats fill up quickly so choose your hours. Wait can get a bit longer depending on which dish you order. One thing quite odd is I couldn't find the soy sauce anywhere...
Awesome place for some down to earth dumplings after a long day at work. Dumplings and sandwiches are both great and quite cheap. Try it out

My friend took me here while I was visiting NYC and I plan on coming back next time I'm in town. It's a small restaurant and seating is hard to get. This is the kind of place you go when you want a lot of delicious, cheap, food. I loved the fact that we were able to try like 10 things on the menu for less than $20. Don't skip the bubble tea too, it wasn't overly sweet like it generally is at most places.
No comment
This place used to be great but the owners got super greedy raising the prices by double and giving customers less
No comment

The fried dumplings were amazing!! Best dumplings I've ever tried in my life!! The almond bubble tea was great and the beef pancake was delicious too. Very affordable prizes. Is a must go if you're ever in NY. I actually visited this place twice in one day because I was obsessed!!

It's cheap, I think that's what makes it so popular. Anyone can grab a couple of dumplings and for the price be satisfied with it. When I came I got a few items and it can get a bit greasy after a couple of items. Dumplings was okay, the beef wrap was decent, didn't really like the duck wrap
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

In my humble opinion, I think that this spot is just as good as Prosperity Dumpling just down the street, and it's also a little cleaner inside and the seating is a little bit better as well.  I've been here a bunch of times when the line at Prosperity has been appallingly long, but beware, this place can also pack em' in.  The food is very good, and the prices are very cheap.

column1: Mr F G And Mrs M S.
column6: No comment

Some of the items on the menu were not personally for my taste but the meals are very affordable. I personally enjoyed the spicy wontons in how they were very fresh. The wonton layer was very thin and the inside had soft meatball like texture with a nice crunch of scallion/cilantro? I would definitely come for another visit to try out their other dumplings.

In the less-clean and service-less restaurants of Chinatown, I expect good food for good value, and Vanessa's definitely delivers on that front. My boyfriend and I ordered a beef noodle soup, a hot and sour soup, a plate of 8 steamed pork dumplings, a plate of 8 spicy shrimp and pork wontons, and a egg & ham pancake. All of this, which was more food than we needed, was less than $20 in total!! The egg and ham pancake reminded me of something that I can get from a cafe in Hong Kong. The dumplings were all delicious; the skin was on a thicker side, which I prefer. The wontons were super flavorful. Both soups were very yummy. Unfortunately, the beef is sliced and not stewed, but at least the noodles are super chewy and delicious. The soup itself had quite a bit of MSG in it so don't bother finishing the soup after you've eaten the noodles.
No comment
Delicious delicious delicious!!!! Very well priced! I recommend trying the sesame sandwiches!

Ordered the pork and chives dumplings, tasted great, thin pan fried skin, good amount of filling. Tasted like Japanese gyoza actually, very similar. Asked for the pork buns and the lady at the front said they didn't have any.. Bummer.

You get what you pay for. You can get a decent lunch for under 5$. The Sriracha and soy sauce at table side were so watered down that they would slide off my dumplings. That's probably my biggest complaint. The fried pork dumplings were pretty good but the shrimp dumplings were bland. They have dollar waters also which is a plus since they're basically extinct in New York. Paid 7$ for 8 shrimp dumplings and 4 pork and a water. Was it worth it? I would say so
No comment
Delicious dumplings and small food, especially sesame sandwich & chive and egg pancake!!!!
No comment
No comment
Will kill for this. The pancakes are amazing and the sweet and sour soup. Heard from some people that the beef noodle soup is a steal.
No comment
Peking duck sesame pancake and the dumplings are amazing.. The reason why I did not give it five stars is they have very limited seating.
I had the duck pancake, fried pork and chubs dumpling and pork bun. Not the best I've had tho. If I'm ever in the mood for dumplings I'll go to Spring restaurant on Catherine st.
No comment

Cheap, authentic, and delicious, Vanessa's is perhaps the most American-friendly low end dumpling house in the city. I used to live a few blocks away, and would cash in on 4/$1 pork and chive dumplings and sesame pancakes with veggies on a weekly basis. Always hot and fresh! Plus, I much prefer the east side location to the union square one. It feels more authentic and cozy, being on the edge of china town. Check it out! Pro tip: speak loudly and clearly when ordering, and pay attention to the numbers called. The staff will appreciate it, especially considering the slight language barrier. They don't mess around at Vanessa's!
No comment

I've heard so many great things of this place and remember going years ago for some dumplings. However in my more recent visit the dumplings all of the filling I had were horrible. The dumplings taste frozen and the filling taste as tho It's all imitated meat and seafood. I was very disappointed. They were greasy and I asked for steamed but the dumpling dough it self was thick and rubbery would not recommend to anyone looking for a good dumpling place.
No comment
This is my favorite go to place when it comes to dumplings. They know exactly what they're doing. The pork fried dumplings are my absolute favorite. Just posting this review is making me want to go!
The original dumpling house for Vanessa's! Dumplings are freshly made to go and taste is awesome! Pork and chives dumplings!!
No comment
No comment
The dumplings are mediocre at best. Service wasn't very welcoming and the place isn't very clean. Even though it is cheap, I wouldn't recommend this place for a casual bite.

Delicious boiled and fried dumplings, though the filling is a bit too fatty for me. But great value if you're looking for homemade dumplings. My favorite item on the menu is actually the sesame pancake filled with roasted duck. Great portion and super delicious.
No comment

No comment
No comment

I ordered 2 Bubble Teas--green tea peach and black tea flavors--fried pork buns, pork dumplings, and the veggie sandwich. If you order, get a milk tea; the black tea flavors were a bit too sweet, and if you get the sandwich, get one with meat in it, as the vegetables dont really stand up on their own. The dumplings are delicious though. Recommended spot for a quick bite, but it may be crowded so be prepared to take your food to-go if necessary.

Solid Chinese comfort food at a reasonable price. The chive and pork dumplings were good not great, were lacking a bit in flavor but nothing a little vinegar can't solve. The spicy wontons hit the spot. Plenty of shrimp in the filling and hot chili oil as always can do no wrong. This is the kind of place that I would definitely eat often at - lots of good food for a cheap price! Seating was a little cramped but hey it's Chinatown what can you expect?
No comment

Great cheap place to get tasty dumplings. I've been twice and the service is what you expect in a fast food dumpling place- abrasive and terse workers. For the price the dumplings are delicious. Spent about $16 for plenty of dumplings for 3 people. The sesame pancake was crisp but sort of bland and oily- next time I might get one with a filling. Definitely recommend the dumplings with spicy sauce. Don't expect to get a seat unless you plan on awkwardly hovering over people waiting for them to finish, but you could get lucky. Would go back because nothing can beat cheap tasty dumplings, but still waiting for prosperity dumplings to reopen!
No comment
No comment
Quick service and good food if you're looking for something on your walk downtown or to work.
No comment

Had to try it after reading all the reviews. It's more hipe than anything. The dumplings were larger than average but with little filling. The skin was very thick and doughy.  The scallion pancake was flavorless fried bread. The one with kimchi was a little better but basically the scallion one cut open and kimchi shoved into it. Once is enough.
No comment
No comment

This place was a great price for the food. I would definitely get the duck scallion pancakes and the dumplings. It gets packed so you might have to wait for a seat but the food comes out really fast. A great quick casual bite to eat.
No comment
No comment

Came here on a whim when Prosperity was closed, and this place does NOT disappoint. Had the vegetarian steamed dumplings, a sesame veggie pancake, and the seaweed salad. All were delicious. Dumpling filling was such a variety of bok choy, carrots and cabbage, and the flavor was so nice, you almost don't even need the sauces they give you (but they are nice for an added kick). The consistency of the dough is perfect- not soggy at all. Seaweed salad was good and juicy, but a little sweet for my preference. Sesame pancake was crisped to perfection and vegetables had a savory flavor. It's super affordable - unbelievable how many dumplings you can get for the price!

Place is massively crowded and it's difficult to find a table unless you are lucky. The service is what I would expect it to be, workers are basically unfriendly and pretty slow handed. The place is too small. I had the pork and chive fried dumplings, they were okay. Definitely not the best, but good enough. The sesame pancake with roast pork was okay, but again, I have had better. The food is alright, but I wouldn't come here again given how busy it is and crowded it is. There are other options in the surrounding area.
No comment
No comment

Always delicious and inexpensive to boot. My order last night was steamed veggie dumplings and a miso soup. Fried veggie dumplings were not available but I think the steamed were better anyway. It was crowded, as always, so we ate standing up at the counter where we watched the food prep happening and the two ladies having fun and giggling over pronunciation troubles. My man was laughing at how elated this simple meal made me.
If you want cheap, authentic Chinese dumplings, this is the place to go! Super delicious. We had the wontons in spicy oil and it was just the right amount of spice!

We got the vegetable dumplings and the skin is too thick, filling is yummy. We got them to go and we got a whole bunch of plastic with steaming hot dumplings. So un-appetizing. Get compostable utensils and togo ware. We would have eaten there but for the dirty surroundings (outside and inside, especially the bathroom). Not returning.
good food!  Sometimes it may take a while to deliver the order!  Spicy dumplings are really good.

No comment

Maybe I went on an off day. Everything tasted like a salt attack. The fried dumplings I had skin that was too thick and tasted like it had been sitting out for awhile. The didn't taste fresh. The boiled dumplings were a bit better but still overly salty. The wontons in hot oil were the most decent thing.

Never again. Currently experiencing food poisoning after eating there. I don't normally eat Take-out Chinese food or whatever those run down locations would be considered, since this normally becomes the outcome. Terrible.

Vanessa makes the best dumplings in NYC.  We particularly like the chicken ones but they are all good. Their kimchi is also wonderful.

Delicious! I love a good, cheap dumpling spot. I got the pork and chive dumplings in soup..8 dumplings for $4! You can't find a meal that cheap in NY anywhere else that's actually really good. Don't expect hospitality here. It's a order, grab, and help yourself to a seat if you can find one kind of place, but I like the no frills. The ladies behind the counter are constantly busy making dumplings and don't have time to answer all of your questions. Overall, a great spot if you're looking for cheap authentic dumplings.
Great value and taste. Perfect for a quick bite. The food was surprisingly good for the price, and the place was crowded but we did manage to snag a table.
No comment

This place was ok. Maybe I am just spoiled because I've had dumplings in China. Service was pretty fast. I ordered the #1 and #2 pork dumplings. 1 was pork and chives. The wrap was a bit thick and tough, making it a bit harder to chew that I normally like with dumplings. Inside, the meat just seemed like a pork meat ball with chives. Both #1 and #2 taste very similar. But great part is, they are only $1.25 for 4 dumplings, can't beat that.
No comment

Good and cheap Chinese food in a no frills, bare bones casual restaurant, kitchen is visible so you see everything being made. Limited seating, and it gets pretty packed. You have to be quick and grab a seat when you see someone about to leave cuz I guarantee someone else is eyeing that seat. If the weather nice, I would suggest taking your food to nearby park and watch a game of basketball while eating. They also have decent vegetarian options, my faves are the veggie sesame pancake and the veggie noodle soup. Restaurant is located close to train station, and I can imagine parking is difficult in the area (like most of NYC). Food is cheap and filling for less than $10. Cash only and you are given a receipt with a number. Make sure you don't lose your receipt because you need to surrender it when your # is called.

really cheap, really solid, you can't beat it. dumplings are a must have as well as the sesame pancakes. I like that they have a decent amount of soups that they offer since soup is one of my main food groups lol.

No comment

Been here only once and with my friends. We loved the spicy dumplings. Prices were fantastic for NYC but most of all the food was delicious! The downside is that it can get packed easily and there is limited seating :(

I like the vegetabe  dumpling in soup. It was pretty  good. The texture of dumpling skin  was good and stuffing  was delicious.  The place  was crowded  but pretty  enjoyable. The portion was generous and the price was moderate.  I also tried the pancake  and  enjoyed. I want to visit   this place again in the near future.

Pretty good and had alot of variety of things to try and pretty cheap too if youre trying something new for the first time. I wish they had more room though.

This place can get really busy at times. But if you want some good dumplings without breaking the bank definitely check this spot out. Oh and don't forget to try the pancake sandwiches. All are good especially the duck and pork pancake sandwiches.

Where do I start? Overrated, crowded and low capacity seating joint. The service was not great as the cashier was very rude and the cook was eating while cooking my food at the same time. If you need to use the bathroom,  I suggest you don't do it here, because you might throw up, maybe is against the law to at least clean the bathroom once a day. Two stars because of the price.

This place doesn't have a ton of seating, but that's pretty much the only knock. The dumplings are delicious, and you have to try the sesame pancake sandwiches. The bread is perfect, and they have all kinds of fillings to choose from. Everything here is so cheap that you can leave stuffed for $5-6. Will be back!

I enjoyed my inexpensive lunch here very much. My eyes were bigger than my stomach, but I enjoyed an order of pork dumplings and a sesame pancake. I would return!

Definitely a must go to place! Whether you're a dumpling lover or not! I never really liked dumplings until I went here! They're really good dumplings. They also have really good sesame pancake especially with the veggies inside!

Mobbed w/ people and vastly overrated.  Mushy pork and chive filling in dumplings, soups tasteless (with horrible brown vinegar-ly filling) and an overall disappointed experience.  Yucko.

Can't beat this place for quality and price. We stop here whenever downtown. Fast service excellent food.

This place is great! Love their boiled pork and chive dumplings with spicy sauce! It's a bit slow, but they boil them fresh when you order them, so it's fine. It all feels weirdly disorganized to me, but it seems to work for them and they turn a lot of tickets pretty quick. I also recently tried their sesame pancake sandwiches and they are to die for! I highly recommend them!
It was very good. I had the shrimp boiled dumplings and the shrimp dumpling soup....
No comment
No comment
No comment

We found this place on a whim and I am so glad! The food was incredible and the prices were even better. For $15 we got an order of fried dumplings, steamed dumplings, sesame pancake, chive and egg pancake, bok choy, and chicken and corn soup. There was not one thing we didn't enjoy, the service could have been friendly but with the steady stream of customers I guess the employees don't feel the need to be. The restaurant is small and you have to order at the counter, so unless you get there at just the right time expect tot ake your food to go or have to wait for a seat.

This place is pretty solid. My favorite thing to get here is actually the sesame pancake sandwiches - specifically the duck one. Haven't found another place that does this, and it's pretty cheap for what can be a whole meal for me. Dumplings are tasty and cheap too, but I preferred the old prosperity dumpling spot (now east dumpling, I think). Try one of the pancake sandwiches!
Great spot for dumplings! Very crowded and there's no table cleaning service. Other than that it has good food and great price!
Got soup, dumplings and a sesame pancake all for $5.50. Great price, food was good and service was fast! Will be back for more.

Always my go to place when in China town. #4 and #5 please. The noodles and peanut butter sauce must be eaten when hot and the dumplings are so juicy and fresh.  provided 4 stars and not 5 because I don't think food prep should be so close to the garbage and bathroom

Had the spicy dumplings and they were fabulous! We also tried the sesame pancake sandwich which was similar to a bahn mi sandwich. It was a "hole in the wall" place but it was really yummy and a unique experience. Best food I had in new york!

This place was great. It was busy, the food was quick, tasty and good value. There was a range of dumplings to choose from and there was also soups/noodles and sesame pancakes. The beef sesame pancake was good. There was lots of ingredients and the actual sesame pancake sandwich was tasty. There were also seats to sit down and eat. Defiantly recommend this place!
Worst service ever! The cashier guy is so rude! Food wise, we waited so long and the guy wouldn't even give us hot sauce. I wouldn't come back due to the rude, horrible, guy.

Insane yumminess!!!!! I've been out all day and had brunch at Hotel Chantelle...then went to Casa Mezcal....drink a ton and NOW!!! I'm hungry again...gotta do it...I love this place... Not my first time at this fabulous Rodeo...best dumplings ever...so I don't "smoke" but to my 4/20 friends...this place is a must!!! Oh...what did o have..spicy pork cabbage dumplings...mike dropped!
Soooo good recommend the spicy shrimp dumplings and scallion pancake. Real and authentic place. Very fresh

One of the best places in Chinatown to get the best bang for your buck! Don't expect great service because this is a no frills get in and get out kind of place. But do expect great food for the price point. Nothing is more than $5! The fried dumplings are a must get! Also the pancakes are to die for! The pancakes alone or stuffed with veggies and meats are so flavorful, crispy, and the right amount of breadiness. Go in hungry come out stuffed!

I love Vanessa's Dumplings! For the great taste and cheap prices you can't go wrong. I recommend getting the pork and chive dumplings. I also recommend the duck and egg sesame pancakes. This place doesn't cheap out on the portions and these items are both very filling. The only con is that this place is usually very crowded and it is hard to get seating. I would recommend going with a friend so that you can order while he waits for a seat. Also remember to bring cash because they don't take card!
lifelong NYer...these dumplings are horrible. Thick and soggy dumpling with tasteless fillings. That's why they're $2.00 Leave this for the hipsters and the tourists. Really gross.

Dumplings were good and cheap. Had  steamed pork and chicken and took a long time because of the chicken. Also tried to bun and was not a fan. Next time I'll stay with the dumplings only
No comment

No comment
No comment
Looking for cheap place to eat with a good size portions. Definitely place to go. Not much seating. Apparently  the locals love it  was very crowded
love their dumplings!! Had some shrimp dumpling today with spicy sauce! The price is great and dumpling taste delicious! Definitely going back there and recommending to others!
No comment

I first tried vanessa's 2 weeks ago when my coworkers ordered.  I had the fried pork & chive dumplings & s sesame beef pancake.  OMG. pure heaven! ! It came to $5.40 with tip & was totally filling. I loved it such I begged to order there again this week. Vanessa,  I'm a fan!!!

Came here to pick up a bag of 50 pork and leek frozen dumplings for $10. The meat was fresh but they could have used some more flavor. The skin is a bit too thick, which neutralizes the flavor of the filling, and also sticks to the pot too easily (on some occasions I had to use steel wool to scrub off the remains). Overall, more salt and less skin would have been better.

I can't speak for all the workers but this one lady she asked for the receipt, from my recollection I didn't get one, on that part I completely take the blame but, she gave me such a nasty look and with such nasty attitude   told me to go back to the cashier. She could have been nicer or just compassionate when stuff like that happens. I finally found my receipt and she just threw my dumplings at me. Plus my friend almost waited 30 minutes for 8 dumplings. Which I only had to wait 2 minutes and I ordered after and ordered the same thing. I never wanna purchase anything from them again. I was still hungry by the end and refused to get anything.

Dumpers!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!scallion pancake coke in a can dumpling burps in 1 hour after. Very cheap and delicious.
No comment
Amazing! Me and my friend got 3 pork buns, 4 pork and chive dumplings, and peking duck sesame pancake for only 5.25 USD. Unbelievable price.  And the place is tidy and cute for being so busy.

There were so many outstanding reviews for this place, and this was our first time in the Chinatown area in New York. So, why not give it a try? The eating area was very small- only around 5 rectangular tables to sit. For a better view of how the dumplings and pancakes are made, you can sit at the open counter. I talked to a local who told me that people usually share tables together. Ordering the dumplings were very easy, and considering the amount we ordered, they came really fast. They were a lot thicker than your average dumpling. I was expecting a lot more soup than I got in my boiled dumplings, considering the thickness of the skin! The basil filling wasn't too strong, which I was okay with. Usually when you eat out, the food can get really salty, so eating here was an enjoyment. On the contrary, the wontons were very good! The skin was thin and very chewy. The sauce that it came with was also surprisingly delicious. Now for the beef pancakes- not soggy at all! Light, thin, airy- yet,still crunchy. It was a little bit on the saltier side, but that's alright, since it balanced out with the dumplings evenly. I got an order of wontons, two dumpling orders, and a large beef pancake all for $18. You can't beat the prices here! I'm not sure if I would come back, since I like my dumplings on the thinner side.
I tried the chili oil wonton(pork and shrimp) and the chili oil dumpling(shrimp), personally prefer the dumpling. Come earlier than lunch hour or you will have to wait in line for a while!
Absolutely at the top of its game. There are others at its level, but it's a very high level. Just get pork dumplings or else you'll be waiting forever.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Chicken and basil all the way! Ordered both steamed and fried. Both were great but I preferred the steamed.

Can't go wrong with cheapo dumplings in Chinatown, but this spot is one of my favorites for a quick lunch. It's always packed but the line moves quick, just don't forget that most of these places only take cash!

4 stars for Really good food for cheap. Obviously not a place you go for good service , the people are pretty rude. Had the beef noodle soup and it was amazing , meat was flavorful , noodles soft and silky and not greasy broth at all. My favorite are there sesame pancake sandwiches , I had the one with Peking duck and it was awesome. Heard the roast pork one is pretty good too. The wait is not that bad but if it's busy you might have to wait a while

I am a huge dumpling fan and have been looking forward to this all week.  Unfortunately, I'm sad to report that these dumplings didn't satiate my craving.  I tried the fried pork w/chive dumplings, boiled pork w/cabbage and the spicy wonton.  I found all three to be pretty bland.  The spicy wonton had the best flavor, but without the sauce, the wonton would not have been very flavorful.  I think the dumplings at Prosperity are far more flavorful, although they are greasier, and there isn't anywhere to sit to eat there.
No comment
Wait can be long but worth it . Basil chicken dumplings are the best with some spicy cucumbers  I always buy frozen bag of 50 to keep in freezer . My daughter favorite is beef pancake sandwiches .

I got food posioning from this place I will never eat from here again . I ended up in the hospital with IVs for 3 hrs on pain medicine I was sick as a dog . Stomach pains everything eat here at your own risk
No comment
No comment

Cheap and delicious Chinese food, what more can you ask? I love their sesame pancake sandwich and fried dumplings. It's nothing fancy and will fill up your hunger. There's always a line of people ordering and limited space to sit in.
Cheap eats! Delicious food. Would definitely recommend and go back!
No comment
No comment
No comment

This is the only place I've ever had a hard time spending a minimum of $15 . We got 8 dumplings an order of wontons Thai tea a soda and some other Asian thing for $15!!! Such a steal. &. Everything tasted pretty good  definitely recommend this place. $2 dumplings. Nuff said

The dumplings weren't bad. They're for a very good price but the wait was incredibly long for the steamed dumplings in particular. By the time I got them the steamed dumplings were pretty soggy and tasted okay, so I'm not sure how to feel about them. I've had their pan-fried dumplings before though, and they were very delicious. I will try this place again, but I probably won't have the steamed dumplings from here. I highly recommend the pancake sandwiches they have here too.

Been here once, invited by a good friend with similar taste. Boy oh boy, it is worth every penny. The dumplings are just AMAZING. Make sure to try this place out. Great to have a quick bite or stuff your stomach with goodies. ;)

This place really serves good dumplings. I ordered the spicy chicken dumplings and they were really good. I also ordered their red bean bun and that was very tasty. Their Thai bubble tea here is pretty good too! Pretty much everything I ordered was good. For everything I just mentioned, I paid $9.50. Its almost impossible to find cheap places to eat in the city that actually tastes good. I finally found my go to cheap nyc eats. I do wish they had more tables as this place does get crowded. If you're looking for a cheap place to eat in the city or even good dumplings with bubble tea, I definitely recommend this place.

This place is crazyyyyyy busy so don't plan to sit down. Just get your dumplings and run (sit in the park to really enjoy them). Amazingly cheap and soooo good. Perfect for when you're in the area and starving.
No comment

Been here a couple of times. The sesame pancakes are great... The dumplings are OK/good... But the chive and egg pancake was not very appetizing. I had tried the vegetable dumpling which was bland on it's own if without sauce, the red bean bun was eh (personally I like it when the beans are well mashed/ground), the shrimp dumplings and chicken dumplings are both pretty decent. The prices are all fair in my opinion... Soooo all this in mind I gave the place 4 stars. Sitting space is limited and tight since the place attracts large crowds. This all said, the sesame pancakes are my go to for sure here.
Always yummy, fresh and affordable. Consistently good value for money. My favorite 4 fried dumplings with pork and chives + soda = Only $2.50!

The only place I'll get dumplings from. Their sesame pancakes with roast beef are absolutely amazing. And literally all flavors of their dumplings are a must try. I love the assorted dumplings in spicy sauce so you get a little taste of everything.

No soup dumpling here. Most of the dumpling was bland even with dipping sauce and chilli. Duck noodle soup was also bland. Black bean noodle was salty and the only tasty thing was the duck sesame sandwich.
No comment

We've been on a dumplings binge lately and came to check out the dumplings at Vanessa's on a Saturday night. Overall the dumplings were good but felt a bit doughy? The beef noodle soup was good. It was a busy night so service wasn't particularly fast. Definitely a popular spot and dumplings are worth checking out.
Super packed, with extremely fast and consistent service. The most exciting part (to me) is that you can buy them frozen and make them yourself. Worth it. Pork and chives are our favorite!

If you are around Williamsburg and you are looking to have a late bite Vanessa's Dumpling is the place to go.  Amazing dumplings for less than two dollars. Service was very quick and nice. Perfect for after a night out!
loved the spicy won tons. tons of flavor. enjoyed the pork and cabbage dumplings. much lighter than the dumpling spot down the street. be aggressive when you look for a table.
No comment

They're inexpensive and delicious. I had a whole scallion pancake with  buns and it was a real treat. The best thing is that you know they're fresh as they make it in front of you. Any dumpling lovers would find this place enjoyable.

The service here is efficient and the just-emerging sesame pancake was larger than most, dished out quickly for a buck. The lack of any line and the larger space were reasons enough to head here over Prosperity if you have a hankering.
Quick easy food cheap and yum yum in my tummy would order more next time 5 isn't enough just a snack size amount

very tasty .... packed flavors . i really enjoyed dan dan noodles .. and the fried dumplings with spicy sauce . dumpling wrappers are thin and decent size lots of good flavors . i like spicy food and i'm glad i ordered from this place . delivery was bit late but food was awesome !!! i would def repeat

It's an experience. Very cramped and busy with employees shouting at one another, but it's lively and the food is delicious. We were a large group and had to wait a bit for a table, but we were seated by the time our food was ready so no stress. It is ridiculous cheap, but sensationally tasty - personal favourite were the duck pancakes. The only inconvenience was that they said online they accepted cards but were cash only upon arrival, although they did have an atm outside which was handy.
Greattttt dumplings and super cheap! I only wish there was more seating because it gets crowded.
Hands down the best dumpling place I've been to. A must visit if in New York. Can't beat their prices or food
No comment

Went to Chinatown cold specifically on a Yelp recommendation. Not a mistake. Mostly takeout with a few tables and seats at the window. Very quick service. The dumplings are unbelievable. Fresh.I had the vegetable and they had spinach dough. Yum.

Let me start by saying that there is a lot of really, really, good dumplings in Chinatown. Vanessa's, unfortunately, will not be on that list for me. I tried dumplings at three different places back to back in Chinatown, and Vanessa's was kind of a let-down. When we walked into the restaurant, it was completely packed. There were absolutely no seats and we literally stood there with our food for a few minutes until a big group left. Your order at the counter and pay right there as well. We got fried pork dumplings that came out really fast. In terms of dumpling quality, however, it was pretty meh. The meat itself tasted fine, but the wrapper was really thick and they did a shoddy job of "frying" the dumplings. Guess I shouldn't have expected great dumplings from a chain? Given the amount of good food in NY, I doubt I'd come back here.

It's on the same street as Prosperity Dumplings, about two blocks away. So on a Sunday morning when we walked to Prosperity Dumplings and found out they weren't open yet, we decided to give Vanessa's a try. It's a way bigger place, with about 5 or 6 tables. I ordered the pork dumplings and some sesame pancake with beef. Comparing to the pork dumplings from Prosperity, Vanessa's were a little dry, and the skin wasn't as crusty. Price is the same, 4 dumplings for $1. Would I come back instead of going to Prosperity? NO. Trust me, the wait at Prosperity is worth it.
Nice cheap little place in Chinatown.  I didn't find the dumplings too outstanding here in taste, but it was cheap and filled me up.
Best dumplings! Had a great time with some friends while we had great food. (Getting hungry for some while i write this haha) Definitely we will be going back.
You don't go for the friendly service. But do go for the sesame sandwich veggie and pork dumplings. Prices are good and the flavor is amazing. One of our favorite finds

I swung in here yesterday as part of a $10 a day budget in NYC Challenge. 4 Dumplings and a sesame pancake the size of my head for lunch. The damage was only $2.50. A broke college student's dream spot. The line wasn't long at all at 2 PM and I even managed to snag a seat. Definitely worth a trip in Chinatown.

dumplings were nice and fresh since i went during the lunch hour. everybody raves about the cheap prices, but in chinatown, $1.50 for 4 dumplings really isnt all that cheap. fried dumplings were good, but i didnt think it was anything special or spectacular, seems actually like a normal chinatown lunch for me. even got a bit of attitude from the woman packing my 6orders in 2boxes when i asked for an additional small takeout box. pork and chive dumplings are better than the cabbage dumplings if youre choosing between the two, simply because chives pose a stronger flavor. stop by if youre in the area, but not worth going out of the way for.

A classic. Pork and chive dumplings and pancakes (I favor tuna or peking duck) remain standouts. Bubble tea is so-so. Experience of ordering, waiting for order and fighting for a seat remains lousy. Wish they adopted the Xian system of no sitting until you have your food. Would restrain the worst human impulses to hoard what you don't even yet need. But no; here, chaos rules.
No comment
No comment
What can we say, you go for the great dumplings and the authentic experience. Price is incredibly cheap. It became one of my go to each time I am in NYC.
Best dumplings I've ever had. $5 for assorted (shrimp, veggie, chicken & basil), and $3 bubble milk tea, also great. Service is good, too. Definitely recommended for a late night bite!
No comment
Delicious and generous portions, especially the scallion pancake sandwiches, which are huge and super cheap.

Decent food for very little money. Open late. Great options, friendly staff. Pigged out with my friend for $20. Veggie bun required a little more salt but better less than more, right? All the other places that said they were open till midnight had closed and this place was bright, inviting, clean, and spacious. The food seemed clean and relatively healthy. I felt good afterwards, not super oiled down or heavy. Great value.

I was trekking around little Italy and Chinatown and saw the great reviews for Vanessa's dumplings.  Because I was pressed for time I got it to-go.  I recommend eating it ASAP though. It was still good when I got to the hotel but I know it would've been better at the restaurant.  I loved the Peking suck pancake, and got pork & shrimp dumplings. All of it was for about $11.50 & that was a delicious cheap dinner!

I have tried most of the suggested replacements for Prosperity Dumpling and Vanessa's comes the closest by a pretty wide margin. At $1.50/4 fried pork and chive dumplings, 2 orders will make a delicious and cheap meal. They have some indoor seating, but it can get kind of mobbed during peak hours.
A quaint small space that has limited seating and a little bit of wait time, but the food more than makes up for everything!  The spicy wantons are amazing!

Stopped by this place on a weekend afternoon for some dumplings. They were OK, not great. For me, the wrapper is too thick. The fillings tasted OK. I tried an assortment of meat and veggie dumplings. It's cool that you get to see them prepared in front of you. The place does get crowded and busy. Note that there is no wait staff and limited seating inside. For better tasting dumplings try elsewhere.

Finally tried out this dumpling shop and honestly I'm not that impressed. It's inexpensive, yes, but the dumplings are not as tasty as I'd like. The dough is also on the thicker side and I prefer thinner. As far as similar dumpling shops go, I prefer Prosperity dumplings over these.
No comment

Prawn dumplings is the most juices dumplings.. how've pork dumplings as slightly a bit thick for me ..
Cheap and deeeeelicious. We also now have a giant bag of 50 dumplings to eat at home, all for a mere $10. Just an all around gem of a place.

Never had the dumplings here so can't really give an assessment. Always come here for the pork fried buns and sesame pancakes and they are so satisfying and hit the spot. This place is always packed at any part of the day and the wait is sometimes somewhat long but worth it.

My favorite place for dumplings and beef sesame pancake! I've been coming here for years!! Since they were the tiny tiny shop that barely fit 10 people. And I continue to come here still. The quality and taste has not changed even though the prices raised a bit but not by much. You won't break the bank here since everything is super cheap. It won't take a lot of money to get full. Plus everything is always hot. fresh, and tasty!

The dumplings deserve the ratings it has and more. It's inexpensive and delicious at the same time. Will definitely come back.

It was pretty good.  Read that as it was just okay.  My wife and I ordered 8 boiled pork and chive, 4 fried pork and chive, and 4 chicken and basil.  Let's start with the positive.  It was tasty.  So tasty, in fact, that several hours later, and my belches are still godawful from the amount of flavor in the dumplings.  Now let's do the negatives.  We ordered 16 dumplings, but only received 15.  When you order 4 chicken and basil dumplings, you expect to get 4, not 3.  Also, you might expect them to be hot, or failing that, warm.  You'd be wrong.  These were served at room temperature on the coldest day of the year, so the room wasn't even above 60°F.  Any person entering any restaurant might also expect a clean table.  Wrong again.  It was filthy.  Does no one clean them?  I also suspect that they make their own Sriracha in house and just fill an old bottle with it.  The stuff at the grocery store is thicker.  I must say that they got the flavor right on.  At least there is that.
No comment

Amazing, cheap dumplings with Korean Hite on draft? I'll take it. 5 stars for their great selection of veggie options and friendly service over the counter.
No comment
So delicious - i would heavy up on dumplings, especially the pork chive ones :)

This was my first time coming here and I would have to say my experience was not bad. The dumplings did now take a while to make. I ordered steamed shrimp and fried pork dumplings. By the time I got my dumplings, the fried ones were not too hot anymore, probably because the shrimp one too long to make. I love their steam shrimp dumplings tho, very healthy but tastes great with hot and soy sauce.

Each time I visit NYC I make sure to stop by here. The duck sesame pancake is amAzing & so is their soups. I've have not been disappointed yet. Bette did the fact that it's open during snow day! I trekked through snow to make it here because I know that I will be disappointed if I left NYC without a visit. I highly recommend this place!
Fantastic fried dumplings, and extremely affordable ($1.50 for 4). The steamed buns and sesame seed pancake were also delicious.
Loved the wonton with spicy sauce!  This place is always packed despite being located on an awkward street.  Cheap Eats!
So glad we stopped by for a late night snack. Amazing dumplings. We got over 50 dumplings for less than $30.... everyone was very full.

Vanessa's Dumplings were always the epitome of cheap eats in college. I recently visited again after graduating almost 4 years ago. It was just as good and satisfying, just as crowded, and most importantly still just as cheap even after all the hype and publicity. My go-to's are still the pork/chive fried dumplings (4 for $1.50) and sesame pancake with beef ($2.50). The sesame pancake comes out fresh and hot, given the high turnaround. They're pan fried and cooked/baked in the pan so that they're crispy on the outside, fluffy on the inside, and fragrant from the toasted sesame crust. I love beef shank because of the tendon part and the five spice marinade. It goes so well with the vinegary pickled carrots and fresh cilantro. Throw in some sriracha and it's as good as it gets when you're looking for tasty cheap eats in the city. I'm glad they're still around and still just as cheap. I have seen the other chains pop up near Union Square and Williamsburg, but there's nothing like the original Chinatown one... I just don't use the bathroom there though!
No comment

No comment

One of the best dumplings in the city, and of course, at an amazing price! Bubble tea was a bit too sweet, but just as good! Only $3. Shared fried dumplings and spicy dumplings with a friend and we were both full. Great meal for a great price!

Whet to this place after some YouTube recommends damn this place sucks. I'm such a fan of dumplings but this place is no better than any local Chinese takeout. First they are not the thin skin type, the filling was generous but had a weird taste and after taste as well. Had both shrimp and pork type. Also had for the first time the sesame beef and pork pancake sandwiches and both were bland but edible. If your hankering for some dumplings try Trader Joe's instead of this place. Damn such a let down. PS the staff were the typical rude attitude unless you are Chinese.

Should have known better when the place was full of non-Asians. Food came out lukewarm and obviously not cooked to order. Fried cabbage and pork dumplings (4 for $1.50) were ok, and the only things I'd consider eating again. San jin bao (pork fried bun; 3 for $1.50) were cold, bland, and not juicy. Red bean bun ($1.25 for 1)  was huge, hard on the outside, and the filling was blah - glad they only give you 1 because we tossed this. I am still looking for a replacement for Mei Mei red bean buns (on Pell across from Joe's Shanghai) over 10 years later. Sesame pancake with Peking duck ($3.25 for 1) was also lukewarm and tasted blah. The person comparing this to Din Tai Fung is on crack - XLB are an entirely different animal, and besides, DTF sucks big blue moose balls.
Amazing food at insanely low prices. I recommend any of the sesame pancakes and the chive+pork dumplings.

Excellent food and cheap. Their flagship dish is the pork and chive dumplings but everything I've had is great. Pick up 50 dumplings for $12, throw them in the freezer and use for awesome and quick late night snack.

No comment

I seriously do not think that you can get a better and more tasty dumpling for the price that you spend here. Both the boiled and the fried dumplings were absolutely divine. The texture flavor and overall deliciousness was absolutely tops. If you have a craving for dumplings, come here.

This place has gone down hill....as far as the dumplings go. I use to come here all the time but now I only go every once in a while and its always iffy. Ive started the hunt for a different spot as of today. Still cheal

Worst place ever lady texting and taking her time pretending I'm not in front of her super slow service

What I ordered was dumplings w spicy sauce. What I got was dumpling soup. It was ok bc it was freezing out & I was able to avoid the inevitable stomach cramps. My daughter didn't care for her chick dumps, they were a strange pinkish hue and even at 8, she knew that wasn't right.

Stopped here for a quick bite with a sesame pancake pork. Really fast and really nice food to get quickly.

I am obsessed with dumplings and spent a good amount of time looking on Yelp for great dumpling spot which lead us here. The dumplings are homemade which is a plus but they were just OK. We ordered the assorted dumplings in spicy sauce, fried pork dumplings and pork wontons in spicy sauce. The fried pork dumplings were fantastic but the rest were just meh. Good thing this place is inexpensive. The girl at the register was so incredibly rude - we asked if she could give us a towel to wipe down the dirty table and she handed us a stack of napkins. I figured she would wipe down the table herself, especially since there's limited seating and the tables turn over pretty quickly. I mean, that's the right thing to do but she could care less. If you're in the area, it's worth a shot since it's cheap but don't go out of your way to come here.

This hole in the wall dumpling place is great for cheap eats.You can get 4 small fried dumplings for 1.50 a soup for 2.50 and some scallion pancakes for a dollar each.For 10 dollars,2 people can easily eat here and it tastes good! For a cheap and tasty lunch i would recommend this place.

Extremely cheap. Their chive and pork dumplings are a must. Also try their chicken dumplings and scallion pancake. You can actually get your scallion pancake stuffed with veggies, so its a nice touch. Crisp of the pancake, soft of the inside of the pancake, then cold crisp of the veggies. Need I say more?
