Why do you people who give these guys 5 stars continue to praise them?  I don't sacrifice poor/slow service for cheap eats.  Took me 25 minutes to get one beef pancake today.  There's no sense of urgency from these people and the owner is down right mean.  These guys have you white people wrapped around their thumbs
Streamed dumplings and Chinese pancakes are the way to go, make sure to know what you're going to order before hand because they take orders relatively fast.
Very fast paced environment but dumplings are and seats are hard to come by. Chive pancake is excellent.

This is a crowd attraction in LES.  The staff are not the friendliest give the abundance of orders and crowds to attend.  In any case, its a dumpling house with various dumplings, pretty standard (fried, steamed, boiled-veggie, chicken, pork), nothing in terms of wow factor, but it hits the spot when for a quick bite (assuming not a long wait).  I recently had their sesame pancake, pretty ordinary and doughy for the undressed version and their hot sour soup which unfortunately lacked in taste because it was strangely watered down.  Decent spot if you want the wait for a bite, but nothing stellar.

The spicy wontons are off the hook! That special Chinese taste I remember from a trip to China.  This place is quintessential New York hole in the wall, hoy poloy, nailed it, semi cramped in the best subway car tradition, gastronomic serendipity.   I love this place.  Those spicy slithery dumplings.  The kimchee sesame bun sandwich.
Really cheap eats, but the sesame pancake with roast duck was burned and there was a lot of fat in it. It's also pretty oily, you get what you pay.

Great dumplings! I came out from California and have never tasted such good food. I highly recommend this Spot.

If you don't have a lot of money and you want to have a filling meal, this place is great. I've tried the fried cabbage & pork dumplings and the fried pork buns. They were good but I did find them to be on the bland side. However for the price, you seriously cannot go wrong. I only paid $2.50 for my meal and I was satisfied.

Dumplings tasted ok, but both my dining companion and I woke up the next day feeling kind of crappy. We'll try again, there was some amazing looking coming across the counter.

The bomb! Once you go to the dumpling side of the force you never turn back! The dumplings melt in your mouth. The pancake sandwich is amazing! A wonderful gem hidden in Chinatown.

My fave food is dumplings. Silly I know but their dumplings are ON POINT. They hit the spot and they are SO CHEAP. I get the same 2 things everytime I go there. An order of the pork and chive dumplings and the pork sandwich. Oh My Goodness. THAT PORK SANDWICH THOUGH. SOOOOO GOOOOOD. If you don't want dumplings you HAVE to try that atleast. CHEAP AND DELICIOUS FOOD. It's always busy though so you do have to wait, but it's worth the wait.
I enjoyed this place SO MUCH! Everything was on point and VERY affordable. It reminds me so much of the little dumpling stands in southern China. I recommend this place to all my friends.

Came here for the first time over the summer.  It was late afternoon on a Saturday so it wasn't super packed.  Our group of 4 was able to get a table. Great value for food!  Got dumplings, a sesame pancake, and a diet coke for just $4.  Really enjoyed the spicy sauce on the table.

Amazing Amazing Amazing ! Dumplings were on point and super fresh with a light crisp.  Would recommend to all!  Great Find

Food was great.  Price is always great! The wait wasn't too bad in the dinner time, about 10min.  Seating is limited and don't expect customer service here.  We had the both boiled and pan fried dumpling.  We prefer boiled because it is a less greasy.

It's packed with lines waiting for their order. Their menu options include many varieties of things from dumpling with different fillings, sesame pancake with pecking ducks, noodles dishes and many more. Price wise it's a great place to get dumpling and you'll be satisfied with how much food you're getting for the amount of money you spend. Depending on how many stuff you order, the food comes out approximately around 2-3 minutes. There is no table service and the number of seat available is limited. Overall this is a great place to get your dumplings and won't break the bank, even if you were to go here often.
The dumplings are good but impossible to make similar if you buy them frozen in bulk to take home.

Vanessa's was exactly what I was hoping for. Authentic Chinese food that is made fresh. I received my order of chicken and chive dumplings and hot and sour soup quickly and with a coke, it was only $5.00! The seating is limited so you just ask to sit with someone at a table and dig in. The dumplings were big, I received 4- and delicious! It was a cold windy day walking around NYC and the hot and sour soup hit the spot. It had mushrooms and water chestnuts with plenty of broth. So good. The patrons were friendly and I will definitely go back again if I am ever in NY.

Everytime I'm in NY I make sure to stop by and stuff my face. I love that they have bulk frozen dumplings to go. Hold me over till my next visit.

This place is amazing. The service is extremely efficient and fast so even when there's a long line, you'll only end up waiting for 20 minutes or so to place your order and receive your food. I've dreamt about eating their sesame pancake after reading so many great reviews about them, and can say that it definitely lives up to the hype. The sesame pancake with Peking duck is amazing - for only $3 you get a sandwich that is tasty and stuffed with fresh Peking duck, cucumbers, and hoisin sauce that's enough for a meal. If you're too lazy to come here every day like me, they sell frozen dumplings in bags of 50 for $10. They're super easy to heat up, and are just as delicious as the cooked ones from the restaurant.

Dumplings and sesame pancakes need I say more.  Great quick meal at an affordable price. Dumplings are made fresh and are totally delicious. The restaurant is on the small side but who cares just get your stuff and go or pull up a chair and munch til your heart is content. I recommend Vanessa's Dumpling House to anyone who happens to be in the area. I don't care how many fast food national chains are opening up in the area (Why the hell would you go to those places if you are in NYC's Chinatown, are you kidding me??).  Vanessa's Dumpling is one of my top picks when I am in Chinatown.

Well it's cheap. Like really really cheap. The dumplings are very good. As far as ambiance or whatever goes, it's a small dumpling place in Chinatown. Use your imagination on the cleanliness and decor is at. Overall, good stuff and worth taking a trip to Chinatown and checking it out.

I was advised by a friend to eat in this spot without which many students of the NYU would just starve.  The dumplings' paste is extremely heavy, thick and definitely not tasty. Bought 250 dumplings for a volunteer event. The service is great. This is also a great place for vegetarian dumplings.

Pretty good dumplings... if you plan on ordering the dumplings with spicy chili oil.. make sure you either have a place to brush your teeth after with mouth rinse or a piece of gum.  They put a crap load of raw garlic on top of dumplings.  Delicious though.
I had they're beef noodle soup and it was delicious!!! The ramen noodle was thick and the broth and scallions where tasty.

So soooooo cheap and great veggie options. yes.

Food was good but not so good service. Took us extra long time to wait and didn't try to make up for the wait. I don't care how popular the place is, if they don't pay attention to every single customer, that's loser attitude and they need to learn be attentive to customers.

I went to Vanessa's last night for dinner since I had a mean craving for Chinese food. I visited Beijing last October and had been dying for food that reminded me of the amazing food on my trip. The food that I had at Vanessa's definitely took me back to the wonderful memories from my trip! I had some delicious pork and chive boiled dumplings and a really good vegetable sesame pancake. I'm craving this meal again as I'm typing this! It really is reminiscent of Beijing and I'll be back to Vanessa's anytime I need a fix!

I found this place on our recent visit to NYC when I found out that my favorite spot Prosperity Dumpling in Chinatown had closed. Vanessa's is a bit larger than Prosperity was, with some inside seating and a larger waiting area. When we visited it was very busy, and there wasn't a clear indication of where you line up to order versus the people waiting for orders already placed. There was a fairly large staff working for such a small place, and the cooking area is visible from the waiting area so we enjoyed watching how the food was prepared. The prices at Vanessa's are very low, 5 dumplings for 1.75. They had other items as well, such as sesame pancake sandwiches, soups etc. We got two different kinds of dumplings, some shrimp wontons, and a sesame pancake sandwich. Our order took over 20 minutes to be completed but the food was mostly still very hot. The dumplings have a thicker skin which makes them doughier than some other styles, but the flavor was good. We liked the Pork and Cabbage dumplings best. Our friend had the shrimp wontons and did not enjoy them. The sesame pancake sandwich was good, we got beef and I wish we had tried the pulled pork but we were too full at that point. All in all, a very inexpensive meal and a fun stop in Chinatown. We would definitely stop by again.
I may or may not be addicted to the vegetable boiled dumplings. Favorite dumpling spot in the city, hands down... and only $4 for 8 of them is ridiculously awesome.

I selected Vanessa's after an afternoon of trolling Canal Street for the perfect bag.  A friend had recommended it, and said it was worth biking miles out of her way for late-night dumplings when a craving hit.  Well, anywhere in New York that's worth going completely out of your way for a craving must be pretty good. After waiting in a somewhat lengthy line, I selected an order of pan-fried chive and pork dumplings, an order of pan-fried cabbage and pork dumplings, and a scallion pancake.  My grand total for 8 pan-fried dumplings and a giant, fluffy wedge of scallion pancake: $2.75.  Yes, I meant to put the decimal point after the 2.  Each order of dumplings was $1 and the plain scallion pancake was only 75 cents.  They offer scallion pancake sandwiches which are stuffed with various fillings and cost more, but I knew this would be filling enough as is.  So with my wallet less than $3 lighter, I filled my belly.  The chewy and crisp dumplings have a slightly thicker dough than what I'm used to in the past, but I prefer the extra texture here, trust me.  That bit of chewiness is all the difference.  And the scallion pancake, it's a thick, fluffy wad of dough, flecked with scallions within and topped with sesame seeds, lots of them.  You will get your money's worth, and you will never be hungry again.

Good and cheap super authentic. Prices are going up but so is minimum wage 2019 so I understand. Best dumpling spot in town!

If you're looking for cheap and delicious dumplings and sesame pancake sandwiches, this is the spot for you.  The steamed pork and chive dumplings are my favorite but the dessert dumplings are also quite good.  The sesame pancakes are warm and comforting no matter what you fill them with.  Sauces are readily available on the tables.  Tiny napkins make personal cleanliness a small challenge.  This place gets pretty busy but with a little patience I've found you can usually get a table.  Also, like many of the best dumpling houses in the city, Vanessa's is a bit grungy (to say the least).  It can be a little off-putting to out-of-towners but most seasoned New Yorkers will chow down at this joint without a care in the word.  This is not a good date night spot for a hoity-toity couple from Park Ave.  It's for down-to-earth, dumpling loving dudes and dudettes.

Hidden gem in China town- 2$ dumplings and 4.5 for veggie dumplings. Fresh and tasty.  Downside kinda grimy/dirty vibe.

really good, go oftern . It is worth the price, big amount. Everytime we go there its pack.

Came here with my boyfriend one night to order takeout. I got the spicy wontons and sesame pancake with peking duck. My boyfriend got spicy wontons, sesame pancake with roast beef, and pork and chive fried dumplings. I can't believe I have not heard about this place until recently since I go out to Chinatown so often. This place is a gem! The spicy wontons are really good. It's not too spicy and I love it with the cilantro on top. The sesame pancake was delicious as well. I will definitely be coming back.

Solid 4-star dumpling restaurant. I wasn't sure what to expect when a friend took me here but let's just say that I was very pleasantly surprised. They have a small menu with a variety of different dumplings in either 4 or 8 dumplings per order. We got the number 1 and 2 which were both fantastic. Pan-fried to perfection. There is dumpling sauce and sriracha on the table for you to dip. It's as good as it gets and also ubeeeeer cheap. The reason it rates a solid four-star is the combination of price and taste. I think we paid like $5 for a meal for 2. Come here for the best dumplings ever! Caution: seating may be an issue.

Place was completely packed foods a good price would eat here again, really good dumplings
We got a frozen batch of dumplings to take home since Prosperity Dumpling closed. They were really terrible and such an off taste. They were nice and had a lean interior though.

The place has very poor quality dumplings. Thick flour on the shell. Order was verbally repeated correctly by the waitress but came out differently e.g. beef noodle vs beef sesame pancake. Maybe it was just a less fortunate dining experience.

Every time I come here I skip the dumplings and go straight for their sesame pancake options, especially the pork one, and for the price it cant be beat. (less than 3 bucks). Seating here tends to be competitive as its quite limited for the volume of people that come (especially right before closing). As everyone else has probably mentioned, it is a go-to place if you are looking for cheap yummy food.

It was okay, the pork & chive dumplings we're good, the sesame pancake with duck, was flavorless but the siracha sauce helped alot, the pork buns needed salt, and the spicy wontons wasn't to my liking....but the staff was friendly!

VERY cheap... Makes you wonder what they really put in those dumplings, but at least they taste good. Fried dumplings are a lot better. It's kinda dewy inside and steamy and humid but the food is good. The boba tea is really sweet, almost too sweet. Don't get the watermelon flavor it made my friend sick. It was probably just because she has a sore stomach for sweetness so if that's the same for you i would not recommend. But she had a really bad stomachache and almost vomited. The dumplings are nice and greasy.

I come here all the time and I love eating here. The food is good, and most importantly affordable. However it's always crowded, so call ahead so you're in and out. Also, if your looking for smiles and super courteous service, forget it. They run on effiiency. They call your number, say "for here or to go?" And you're done. Get in, get out....perfect

Love this dumpling shop!   Fried/boiled jiaozi (dumplings) and pork-filled baozi (steamed buns) are just like those in Beijing and (if at all possible!) just as affordable in NYC!  $8 got two of us a filling lunch (sodas included).  Seating is limited, but even that rings true for a taste of true Chinese fast food experience.  Highly recommend!
No comment
Great mean one of few places to go for good dumplings besides others in the city. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS AS A PLACE TO VISIT IF YOUR A FAN

The best dumplings in Chinatown. Very reasonably priced and good selections. Service was attention and fast. Could be a little crowded during lunch or dinner time. So take out would be a better option if you are in a hurry. Every time I go to Chinatown I will get some dumplings and their sesame pancakes are off the hook! Can't wait to go back and grab some of those yummy food!

Vanessa's dumplings is the best place for a cheap and delicious meal! And I mean CHEAP. Stuff yourself with the tastiest dumplings and sandwiches all for 5-6$ total. Only reason why I wouldn't give this place 5 stars is because, as you might expect, the staff is far from warm & welcoming.. but what would you expect from a take out spot in the middle of chinatown anyway. Also, they need a bigger location, you almost never find a seat during lunchtime. Still, I've been back there numerous times for those amazing and cheap dumplings. Love!!!
No comment

Decent, cheap, still filling. I got 3 of the fried pork buns as well as an order of dumplings. They serve fast and it's not too too greasy relative to the other NYC dumpling houses, but overall I felt a lack of flavor compared to the others (e.g. C&L or  Prosperity).

My friend and I stopped by for a quick appetizer of boiled vegetable dumplings and iced tea and needless to say, it was delicious! Freshly prepared, one will be hard-pressed to find a better dumpling spot in NYC.

The place is really teeny in a stinky part of town, however what bothered me the most was the service. If you can handle the lady literally taking your order and glaring at you the whole time, go for it but I don't think the dumplings are worth it. The pancake however is incredible, so for that I can't hate. It's good and it's a great experience, just be prepared to stand and eat.
Pretty clean, efficient restaurant. Yummy dumplings that are good (although there are better places in Chinatown in my opinion) and delicious beef noodles and sesame pancakes too.

Went here for breakfast with the BF...yes, they are open at breakfast time, consider that! They have some decent dumplings, but nothing I would rave about. We got one order of boiled dumplings and one of fried. Paid less than 5$ and had all the dumplings we could eat...pretty awesome! The dumplings were a bit too doughy and the meat didn't have enough seasoning on the inside...it needed a lot of soy sauce. I would not say they were bad, they just didn't compare to prosperity dumpling which I later realized was only a couple blocks up the street.
I think I might like the dumplings here better than prosperity but the flip side is my beef seasame pancake dealie was simply not very good. But yea, v cheap. can't knock the hustle.

Just saw my original 4-star review for Vanessa's... and who am I kidding? Vanessa's is pretty much the best, even though I walked in the other day to find that the dumplings are now 4 for $1.25. No longer can a crisp five dollar bill acquire 20 perfect, super hot (beware!!) pillows of pork and chive. The extra quarter is definitely worth it, and worth waiting in the amorphous line. Also worth it: the sesame pancakes and anything of the sandwiches they make with them. Grab yours on a nice day and skip trying to find seating.

Food good, price great, one problem... My friend can't eat here because of her allergies and nobody here can/would answer allergy question. I get we are in china town but we are also in the US where we speak English so I recommend learning it even if it's only a few service industry words. Specially when there is a sign next to the register that says "ask about allergy restrictions" don't bother they can't/won't answer. This place gets a low review due to this! Food still very good but don't come if you have allergies.

Fantastic place to get full on tasty food with a budget. I tend to get 2 orders of pork and chive fried dumplings, a must. Next i go for their peking duck sesame pancake and a few of their side orders. Plan according for lunch time tho because the lines and frustrated workers repeating the number 10 times can get pretty annoying.
This place is super crowded on ny's day,  food is fast / cheap, but waiting for a table is a pain, u need to attack

I spotted this place as I was walking around the park near Chinatown. It's located in a shady street so it can be hard to spot. The item that attracted me was their flatbread sandwich that cost only $3.50 with  fillings such as duck, pork etc. I tried their vegetable one and it was huge. If only it wasn't so oily, it would be the perfect sandwich. I also tried their famous dumplings. Their vegetable dumplings were so juicy and chewy that I eventually brought a pack of 50 to bring home. Even though it has few seating,this is the best place to grab cheap fast food.

Nice did when you are hungry and dint have much money on you.  I remember this way back then when was that hold in the wall and now looks like a fast food joint.  Can get a bit busy though and the food probably has gotten worse over the years but still a place to try out

what took me so long to get here? Now I'm hooked! Cheap, delicious dumplings in the heart of the LES. Plenty of room to dine in. I always order an extra scalion pancake to take home for a midnight snack. Awesome!
It's a little hectic when it gets busy but my family of four can fill our bellies with dumplings and sesame pancakes for $13.
They're so rude. The vegetable dumplings were not good at all. I don't see what all the hype is about.

So I think the dumplings at Prosperity down the street are way better, but I do like the pancakes and sandwiches you can get here. Plus, they have seating. In the end, it all balances out and you win no matter which dollar dumpling joint you pick.

inexpensive but they're really good. Always a line and never seating but i dont mind the wait. 10 dumplings for 5 bucks... why not

I have put this place above Prosperity Dumplings because they give a better selection. It is a lot cleaner. I had the soup with dumplings and a sesame pancake. It a bit slow the service but so what I rather it be correct and cooked to order.

This place is good. Delicious dumplings, served hot, and for a low low price. Why 4 stars? because Prosperity Dumpling down the street is just as good but slightly cheaper(4 for $1 instead of 4 for $1.50). Granted it's literally coming down to just cents, but that's 50% more expensive! If you are in the area and don't want to walk that far however(or if you're in an area exclusively with Vanessa's dumplings; they have multiple locations), you can't go wrong here!

If I am able to give 0 stars, I would. Unfortunately, Yelp only allows a minimum of 1 star. I have never encountered a restaurant, especially a Zagat Rated restaurant to treat customers so badly. My friends and I came to this restaurant as a group of 5 and the employees were so rude to us. We ordered a generous amount of food but they gave us only 4 forks. We genuinely thought that it was a mistake and it's not big of a deal. However, when we asked them for an extra one because we have 5 people, they refused with the rudest attitude. They had no care in the world even if we had to eat their scorching hot food with our bare hands. I feel like as a customer, I deserved to be treated better because I treated them with respect. A problem that could easily be resolved if they simply cared for their customers.

Ordered the cabbage & pork dumplings and a roast pork sesame pancake sandwich the other day.  I didn't get to eat the dumplings because the bf didn't save me any (which apparently weren't good as the chive & pork dumplings) so I only had some of the sandwich. They cook the sesame pancake in a HUGE wok then cut it into pieces. The ingredients are similar to a banh mi: carrots, cilantro, and etc. The meat isn't your normal roast pork found hanging in the restaurant windows. The meat is actually pretty fatty and the pancakes are oily so this isn't the healthiest sandwich BUT it doesn't hurt to eat one once in a while. I'll be back to try the peking duck sesame pancake sandwich (and the dumplings I guess).

Unbelievable, the best Chinese I've had in a while: tasty, kind of communal, cheap cheap cheap. Will be back a lot.

Glad we stopped off in China Town and tried this place. The dumplings are delicious and had amazing flavor. Not a lot of room to sit, but the service is fairly fast.

I want to give this place another chance but I left extremely disappointed. Three stars because my dumplings were palatable.
The spicy wontons were ok, I loved the duck stuffed sesame bread. The corn soup and vegetable wonton soup were also just ok.

LOVED IT. Super cheap, super fast, super tasty. Bathroom was stinky.

Great dumplings for great prices! Ordered original pan fried pork and leek dumplings and wontons with spicy sauce. Both were made fresh on the spot, hot and steamy. Spicy sauce is basically chili oil topped with chili seeds, cilantro and scallions. Spicy, yet fragrant at the same time. Even if you're not the spicy lover, it's a kind of an addicting flavor! Give it a try, but expect a long wait. Four stars because they forgot about my wonton order, but I guess I can let it slide due to the crowdedness of the restaurant.
3.5 star. 3 star for their dumpling but 4.5 star for their pancake. This pancake is even better than the one I had in china.

This is my favorite spot on the lower east side! Great array of dumplings and entrees to pick from. I spent $6 and got a good amount of food - I was stuffed afterwards. Sometimes the line looks long, but usually the wait for your food is 8-15 minutes max. Not a lot of seating, so would recommend getting it to go for more than 2 ppl. Cash only!

The dumplings are top notch here. It is a great spot to hit up in chinatown. Though it is cash only the food is pretty delicious and cheap! We ordered enough food for four people and it cost 12 dollars! A great deal! So we ordered the shrimp dumplings it was soupy inside the dumplings and a ton of shrimp it was super tasty! My friend got a meat dumpling and he loves it! He goes here all the time and is always satisfied and loves the food. I got a sesame pancake with egg and it was huge and super heavy and filling. We also got a sweet and sour soup and that was quite delicious. The portion size was huge. All in all the quality of the food is amazing. The seating is very limited but the space feels pretty huge because of the high ceilings and the smaller furniture to make it feel not cramped. It was a pretty great experience and I have only heard great reviews about it from others before I came. I think the place lived up to the expectation.

After reading tons of rave reviews of this spot on Yelp, our expectations for Vanessa's were high and this little Chinatown shop did not disappoint. By the time we arrived at 11 a.m. on a Saturday, they had already sold out of the pan-fried pork dumplings we had our eye on. We settled for a couple orders of boiled pork and cabbage dumplings instead, along with an order of wontons and beef noodle soup. The dumpling wrappers were just thin enough to really made the pork filling the star. They tasted best dipped in a mixture of chili oil and soy sauce. Of the other dishes we tried, the noodles in the beef stood out the most for their doughy, homemade texture. The wontons were probably our least favorite dish, as they were drowned in a chili oil sauce that tasted a bit sour. For just a few bucks, we got some of the best classic Chinese street foods and were full for hours! We'll definitely be back.
Pretty good and certainly an institution. We liked the veggie dumplings the best, and the 'pancakes' are pretty good too.

Their fried dumplings, as a northern Chinese, are really just so-so. I am wondering why Americans love it so much....if it is for the price, you can get much cheaper stuff at other places with much more authentic tastes.
No comment

My boyfriend and I make it a point to go here every Sunday. Also into the Williamsburg location. This place is an amazing deal; you can get a solid meal for like $6. Splurge for the spicy sauce on the dumplings.
Prices are really cheap. Fried dumplings are pretty good but I wasn't a huge fan of the boiled dumplings

Cheap, Tasty and Filling.  What else could a girl want.  You can get away with having a meal for $1.50.  That is crazy!  I love myself some Pork Buns and also the dumplings to go are amazing.  Get the boiled if you are going to put them into a broth or fried if you are going to eat them plain.

My brother first showed me this place and I have made this a "must eat" stop every time I go to NYC. If you stick to the dollar dumplings and bring your own water, it is the cheapest meal in the city. Plus the dumpings are darned good! The sesame cake/bread? is amazing, and if you are adventurous, get the one with pork (makes everything better in my opinion).  The place is always busy, and ordering is a bit like the Seinfeld soup Nazi, but worth it.

This is the spot for cheap eats in the LES. I recommend the sesame pancake with roast beef or pork ($2.99) and all the handmade dumplings are just as good. It has become so popular over the years that it is almost impossible to find a seat unless you're there to eat by yourself. Although the lines are long, your order gets assembled relatively quick. The kitchen area is definitely a lot cleaner than Prosperity  Dumplings so that is a relief and it is not as cramped.

The spicy wonton is really good here,  along with their wonton soup. The dumpling is bit more on the dry side. But i personally prefer crispy dumpling over prosperity's soggy oily dumpling.  I'm also a big fan of their tuna sesame pancake and soy milk.
The vegetable dumplings weren't very good. Thick skin,  bleh fillings. Wouldn't go back.

Cheap and delicious! There's usually a wait as this place is small and busy, but definately worth it. Their dumplings are a little more "toothy" than others, so if you're into a flat, thin wrap you might be disappointed.  Not me. Our party of five ate until we were stuffed for under $35. Great find!
Vanessa's has always been the best place for cheap, fast and delicious dumplings.
It really tests the boundaries of what quantity of food is healthy to consume for under 10 dollars.
I Love Love this place. My favorite place for dumplings. Authentic and handmade on the premises!! I highly recommend this place. However, it is small & can get crowded.
No comment
There's no way it can compare to Prosperity dumpling on the other end of the street. No taste at all.. :/

Pros were that it was a big place and we were able to get a seat, which was nice. The duck pancake was good, and had more meat than Prosperity. Cons: neither the pancake or the dumplings were really flavorful. The ordering/ticket system makes ZERO sense.  Also, this place is super touristy. No need for me to go back.
No comment
Love this place, cheap eats, and oh so good. My favorite is the sesame sandwich with pork, but everything is good - dumplings, noodle soups, even the bubble teas.

Great (with some caveats) -the pancake with pork or duck is fantastic. The pork dumplings are delicious (even though the wrappers are a bit thick for my tastes). But, I would avoid the vegetable dumplings -only served steamed, and just not very appetizing. Prices are crazy cheap ($15 for 4 people, including drinks). It can get really crowded, so I would recommend visiting mid-afternoon to improve your chances of finding a spot to sit. Finally -the atmosphere can't be beat -an army of cooks behind the counter manning the humongous woks -definitely worth seeing.

This little dumpling shack is so popular and one of my favorites in Williamsburg, and Chinatown. This Zagat rated little restaurant is packed with customers who understand quality food at cheap prices. There is no waiter service, just be prepared to listen and be called up. There is a wide selection of dumplings, soups, salads, and scallion pancake sandwiches, which are extremely popular. We had ordered two beef noodle soups, filled with noodles, vegetables, and beef. We had also purchased the pork and chive dumplings which were a delicious compliment to the soups. Along with this, we also bought the duck sandwich, which was so juicy and tasty. I can't find one flaw about this place, other than the limited seating. Best of all, you get to watch the kitchen perform their wonders...

Hard to beat, everybody knows it. The dumplings are done perfectly which is surprising since they cook them in bulk, hot and fresh and not very greasy. I had the BBQ pancake sandwich and a wonton soup, and 4 pork and chive dumplins. This was $5.25, did I say hard to beat. It's in the older part of Chinatown off of Canal but it's worth every step!

Nice to sit at a dumpling place.  Fairly priced. Tasty but more chives than other places. Service moves pretty quickly but people hog up the seating like if they were in Starbucks, so you might as well be prepared to take it to go. Overall, I still prefer the taste of my other spots but I will stop in here again if I am in the neighborhood.

I don't know if it's just me, but I always get shafted on the service every time I come here.  One plus is that the food is cheap (people who complain about the $0.25 increase from $1.00 shouldn't be allowed to leave their house).  The guys expediting the food are clueless.  I'll think I'll save the aggravation and walk the extra block to Prosperity Dumpling next time.

Pretty damn good dumplings.   We tried the chicken pork and shrimp and all came out fresh and hot. There are a few tables to eat in so thats nice. Sesame Pancakes where amazing! Pork and duck are recommended.
No comment

I tried the pork and chive pan fried dumplings, spicy shrimp wontons, and the sesame pancake with pork. The dumplings were super juicy inside, which was unexpected. It was definitely a nice surprise, and the filling was very tasty. The spicy shrimp wontons could have been spicier, but it was full of flavor so I can't complain too much. The pancake was pretty heavy; I would have preferred it to be thinner so that it could be more crispy but the flavors itself worked really well together and almost resembles a Vietnamese baguette but obviously with a Chinese twist. The service was quite efficient - you just order, look for a seat ( seating is moderate) and they call your order pretty quickly. A definite go to spot for a quick and easy meal.

Satisfying for the price. The veggie and pork with chives dumplings were good, but the pork with mushroom dumplings and the veggie soups were pretty unnecessarily bland. Everything was really fresh though. Pretty healthy meals for cheap in the heart of Williamsburg.
I work in the area  for that last 9 years. Their sesame pancakes are the best!!!!!! .... THE SERVICES HERE SUCK THEY ARE VERY RUDE...  sad

We tried the pork and chive dumplings and boiled chicken and basil dumplings. The boiled dumplings took longer (freshly made) and there were many of them maybe 8 or 12?  Worth the trip there to see and smell the surrounding Chinatown markets and for the tasty dumplings. This part of Chinatown is very different than the area of SanFrancisco Chinatown that I've been to.

Came in in the middle of the afternoon and there were a lot of people waiting. Waited a few minutes for a #1 from a fresh batch. Not the best around (PD) but pretty good because they are usually fresh. I think the skin is thicker than other places.

Just go. Their dumplings are huge and the prices are amazing. A buddy of mine was raving about it till we actually went, and knowing nothing I was so surprised how good it was. Dumplings are great and I feel like I paid fast food prices. Try this place for yourself. Could get real busy, we happen to get there inbetween rushes and were able to sit. Def worth it!!
Solid dumplings. Had the spicy chicken and would come back again. Pretty small place but moves quickly, grab a sit as soon as one frees up.

Awesome little dumpling spot. Got assorted dumpling platter and noodles with spicy sauce. Recommend dropping in here for a snack or picking up to go as seating is very limited. Not good for big groups.

We stopped here while on our own Chinatown food tour that we put together and a lot of people suggested their Peking duck sesame pancake. There was a good reason for this. It was freshly made, the sauce was good, the veggies were crisp and the duck was yummy. I like how the duck was shredded where you couldn't pick out any pieces of fat. I like the idea of duck, but I always get grossed out by fat chunks. They didn't take the fat out, they just shredded it along with the rest of the meat so that the flavor was still there. Oh, also, it was $3.00. My wife and I basically spent $5.50 at a total of three places in Chinatown and were stuffed, good times.
They were ok but liked prosperity a lot better worth the extra walk.

Meh. I was warned it was over hyped by friends who lived here. For what it was, as a more hole-in-the wall style restaurant it's fine. My gripe, the clientele can be incredibly obnoxious both in their demands to the staff and to other customers. Food wise, I make a better dumpling. The Pork and Chive was too salty, the wontons not salty enough. Be prepared to wait once your order is in, and watch out for other patrons that yell at you to get in line when in fact there isn't really a line. That not how hole-in-the wall places work, just sayin.
Usually very busy when I come but it's good food for the price you pay! Pork and chives dumplings are great and so are the sesame pancakes.
No comment
The most overrated dumpling place. Go to the one in front, there's another dumpling place. That place is even cheaper and better

This is a cheap, divey place, serving delicious, freshly cooked dumplings. You wait in line at the counter and eat on shared tables. It seemed to be full of hungry students - not surprising, since it's as cheap as chips. Ideal to soak up beer or for a quick snack. A knowledgeable foodie Asian friend of mine says the food isn't that traditional but it was good enough for 2 Brits who eat out a lot.

This is the best dumpling place, been coming to get dumplings here for years. I remember it being only 1 dollar for 4 dumplings but now its 1.25 its ok they only raised it 25 cent more its understandable because ingredients for the dumplings cost money. The staffs work there are nice and friendly from time to time. they also are noddles soup and sesame pancake sandwiches both are great chooses  i recommend trying the sesame pancake sandwich with duck its awesome. This dumpling house is cheap, you can order food for less then 10 dollars and you will have a family meal haha. Overall this place is great from cheap eating to groups all is welcome. Will come back really soon maybe tomorrow before i go to work.

You can't get more bang for your buck!  Everything is good.   Just tried the wonton dumpling with spicy sauce is awesome.  all the dumplings, and the frozen dumplings are a steal deal!!! also miso soup and pancakes rock!

NYC Cheap Eats staple. Been visiting Venessa's for over 10 years now. They did a renovation a few years ago. I don't even go for the $1.25 dumplings anymore and opt for the sesame pancake sandwiches with tuna. You can truly be full for under $5.
Lines are out the door. Not much seating. Prices are VERY cheap. But the dumplings are just okay.

You simply cannot beat the taste and price of this restaurant.  I had plenty of leftovers to take home as well.  I thought the wait for the order to come out was a bit long for a quite mid-afternoon time slot, and there's absolutely no ambience - but who cares?  It's the food that counts - and they supply ample amounts and it's tasty and very reasonably priced.
great to place to pick up a couple dozen dumplings to throw in the freezer. Quick and great service

Good but not the best dumplings I've had. It is a great spot for some quick late night munching. My favorite item was their pork buns. Not too greasy and really good! Recommend getting one aside from your dumpling order

This is really good food for a really low price. I can hardly believe they break even! Tried most of their dumplings, the hot and sour soup and the sesame pancake with peking duck. Everything was very good. Highly recommended!
Honestly?  Overrated.  The dumplings were just alright.  The pork bun was dry. The bubble tea was weak and tasted watered down. I can't say that I'd make a point to return here.

This place has some great food and is ridiculously cheap. We ordered about twice as much food as we could eat since we couldn't believe how cheap it was. The dumplings were great. The "pancake" is actually a panini-like Chinese sandwich. Ordering was kind of tricky since I wasn't sure where the queue began, and it was tricky to find a seat (and it was cold since the door kept opening).
Awesome dumpling selection and soups. Just wish they had more seating!

pork sesame pancake sandwich + dumplings. sandwich was really good, greasy in all the right ways, extremely satisfying. dumplings were aight, the skin was too doughy imo. way better off getting dumplings next door at shu jiao fu zhou.

I use to come here when I was in secondary school. Those were good times, when the dumplings were a dollar and when it actually taste decent. Now my experience at Vanessa s seems deteriorate with every visit. The dumpling skins are too thick and the sauces on the tables are always watered-down. I guess when restaurant the started to become more of a franchise the quality of food went down with it.

Prevailing sounds of Chinese scripture menace the air into a cult called Chinatown. A man is waiting at the stall and abbreviates "Mr. Chin has been in there for so long." The stall is peppered with graffiti and dumpling sauce. He reasons "It's those chive dumplings man." Mr. Chin walks out of the stall and continues, A sanitation rating. Meanwhile a Western crowd scowls at the remark. We search for a toilet to wash up in and the most authentic Eastern restaurant in Chinatown. Shit I forgot the key in the stall. Chive, pork and stew make certain a bathroom is needed. Your prayers are answered when you enter the linoleum room and your stomach satisfied with roasted grub and the sight of efficient hair buns. Not the most eastern and not the most Imperial but a locale for the ratchet and in between.
No comment

Want to tuck in the best dumpling ever...this is the temple for it! Ambience sucks...hardly any seating. Those 5 stasrs are just for the god. But the dumplings esp pork ones are mind blowing. Also their sandwiches. We were 4 hungry huggers & the entire bill was about $30...crazy cheap. Not for elderly though...ok for kids.
Great dumplings! Only a $1.00 for eight dumplings Wow is all I can say! Also while we were eating there I was speaking with locals who live near by and they told me they were the best in the city.
Loved this place. Vanessa's is going to be my go to dumpling restaurant in Chinatown! Only negative is they didn't have cups...

I don't understand why people are raving about Vanessa's dumpling, every time I come here it is crowed and I don't have the time to wait for food and a seat so I just go next door to the fuzhou place that has dumplings just as good as Vanessa's.
Salt much? The skins were too thick, no flavor to the meat. I was thoroughly disappointed. Price is great but I would have gladly paid 3 times the price for better food.
Less than $5 per person for a super quick, delicious and filling meal! Highlight was the spicy noodles and fried pork & chive dumplings. Just amazing!!
No comment
Great food and cheap. The service is on the real side so be ready to order and have your money ready. The place is nice clean and the once again the food is delicious

amazing dumplings, amazing prices, I eat there once a month
Small hole in the wall in weird location but by far the best dumplings ever! But be prepared to feel a big greasy after eating here.. Not for the health conscious
Probably the best deal for the best food ever! I had to search for the place but it's well worth it. For the cost, I don't think I've ever found a better deal for food that good. Highly recommend it!

The food is good.  However, I paid with a $20 and was given change for a $10.  Both my son and I caught this mistake.  I know for a fact I gave her a $20, as I keep my bis in denominational order and did not have a $10 spot !!The clerk got very defensive.   Hopefully when they cash out their drawer tonight they will realize their mistake and realize that before you assume not everyone is dishonest and that you wronged an innocent, repeat customer

Went here yesterday to get an order of Chive & Pork Fried Dumplings. I heard from friends that this was a good dumpling place in Chinatown. It was 4 pieces for $1 which was quite a good deal. The dumplings came clumped up together which is a big err in my book. I originally would have given 5 stars, but had to take 1 away because the dumplings are always stuck together every time I come here and another because I don't like having holes in each of my dumplings every time I tried to separate them. Also don't like having the filling come out of the holes as well. Oh yea, and the packet of hot sauce that comes along with it? The Red Rooster Sauce is better. The taste and non-burnt condition of the dumplings are decent and rare among other dumpling houses I've been to.

Good cheap food. 10 dollars can feed 4 people and be very filling. They make every thing in front of you and get you out quickly. The place is a hole in the wall type place so don't expect 5 star service. They take your order, make your food and nothing else. Short on cash and this place is a great place to fill up on limited funds. Have money? Still a great place to fill up.
These were cheap and fantastic. Expect a wait no matter what time you go.

The dumplings and the food weren't like amazing but they were pretty good. If u are Chinese u probably get the same dumplings at home. But it does remind you of your moms cooking. I would recommend this place because it's a cheap place to eat the prices are just unbeatable.

Updating my previous post- I want to give -5 stars.  My dad decided to buy dinner and I Just found a roach in my beef noodles. =/  if only I can attach a picture to let you guys see how amazing this place is.

Wontons in chili oil were amazing. Lots of garlic and hot spicy chili oil. Dumplings were fantastic. Had a sesame pancake with roasted beef. Dipping the sesame pancake in the chili oil.  This place is fantastic.
Delicious, fast, fresh, and cheap! Can't beat it. I stuffed my face around 3pm, and was full the entire rest of the day. Just how I like it, haha

I was shocked when hearing the total for two  people, $11 this included two soft drinks. The food is good I especially  liked the Peking duck sandwich. The service was fast considering the long line. I can't wait to go back.

The food here is really great. We got pork and chive fried dumplings ($1.50/4), pork buns ($1.50/3), a roast beef sesame pancake sandwich thing ($2.50), and coconut bubble tea ($3). All the above food was really tasty and definitely deserving of 5 stars, but the bubble tea was kind of gross.

The BF brought me to the very authentic Vanessa's Dumping House in Chinatown last weekend.  We split an order of the fried Pork & Chive dumplings which were doughy and delicious.  This is the real deal - DO IT!
Wow great price for the amount of food they deliver .. Great duck pancakes  sandwiches and  chicken dumplings ...
Price hike! It's no longer $1 for 4 dumplings. It's now $1.25 for 4 fried or $3.00 for 8 boiled.

Cheap, good and quick. What's not to love. Favorites include pork and chive (with soy and siracha) and the seaweed.

Yay! Chinese fast food that is not takeout, but is it more of an authentic northern Chinese cuisine. Definitely go for their pork and chive dumplings and try their sesame pancake with duck. This is also one of those rare dumpling shops with more than 5 seats and has a health grade of an A. Just keep in mind that after you order at the register, look on your receipt for your station and ticket number. Station 1 starts right next to the register!

The dumplings are delicious the first time I went I wasn't watching them cook today I did and they are disgusting digging in their ears,sneezing right into their hands ,wiping their noses,ect ..Very nasty and they aren't friendly they are rude ..Rude and gross ..Too bad because I love the dumplings with spicy sauce ..I literally saw one of the cooks sneeze directly into her hand and not wash her hands soooo disgusting .Mind you there is a sink right behind the counter and they're doing all this nastiness without washing their hands ..Their attitudes aren't in the least bit pleasant either ..
Noodles lack flavor, dumplings are ok. Cheap food but you're getting what you pay for. Service is also rather rude. Not much seating available in the establishment.

This was not a bad place, but I felt a bit disappointed. Perhaps we did not order their best items. We had four different types of steamed dumplings: shrimp, a couple of kinds of chicken dumplings, and veg. They were not made on the spot, but cooked from frozen, which diminished the appeal for me. The dumplings were fairly tasty and juicy (especially the shrimp dumplings), but I was just expected that little extra something.. Perhaps my review would go from a 3 to a 4 if I were to sample their sandwiches or fried dumplings, but for now Vanessa's is pretty average to me, and not a place where I would go again for a second visit to NYC.

4 stars for food quality, but because of the questionable ambience of the place, 3 stars should be appropriate. But don't  get me wrong, their Peking duck pancake is AWESOME! And it goes so well with their jasmine tea (there was a chestnut on it if I am not mistaken), the only complaint I have is the setup of the restaurant and the sanitation of the tables and trashcan.

Great food, cheap, and fast. Always a crowd. Filling. They have this nan type pan fried bread used as a wrap for cabbage, roast beef etc to make an unique sandwich. Dumpling soup is fantastic as well as fried dumplings which sell for $1.50 per serving of 4 big dumplings. Fried pork buns are delicious you. Highly recommended. Cash only but they have an ATM outside. If you like kimchi, probably the best in NYC.

This place have been featured in several food blogs- ( think serious eats) . so is this place over hype? Do people like it because this is the only dumpling place they have exposure to? The answer to all these question  lies in the freshly made dumpling ( it's almost cook to order, considering how busy they are) . the filling is nice and plump, the skin is slightly brown with a great crunch.  This is the only place with 4 dumpling for $1.25  - a tad over price considering other dumpling house charge $1 for 5 dumpling . that's right guys, this cost more with less dumpling. Is it worth it? This is the only dumpling place that looks relatively clean with cool air and ample seating. So take you pick!

Vanessa's Dumpling House is a no-frills but gratifying dining experience. For $3-$4, you can enjoy 8 fresh-made dumplings in a variety of flavors. The sesame pancakes are also a highlight. The lines can be long (and the seating limited) during peak dining hours.

Good food and reasonable pricing.  Only downside is the wait time.  That's why I subtracted 2 stars.  The first time I went there, they missed my order and I ended up waiting for 1/2 hour!  The lady insisted that they were working on it.  Second time, I waited for more than 15 minutes before I got my food.
No comment

I'm not sure how I feel about this place...it's so over crowded that I can't really enjoy what I'm eating ... I hate over cowered places...but this is deffenrtly one of the cheap eats located in mahatten...lots of people and I mean lots come here for lunch /dinner...every body enjoy there dumplings...it's cheap...quaintly is there...and let not forget to mention quick...theres about seven people working behind the counter taking orders and making the yummy food happening... The prices are cheap... Like you can get two meals for twelve bucks... What not to like when you just want some cheap to go foods...There are seating but limited...since there is so many people dining here...i basically have yo wait out a table or take your food to go ....the restroom say out of order but in reality you just have to ask the staff for the key... They don't like people that aren't customers using there restrooms...
Good place to eat cheap dumplings. However the soup here is flavorless.

For all the dumpling fans (Veggie dumplings available), this place is a must try. It's packed with people pretty much every time that I've visited. The food is served hot and quick. Also a big fan of their passion fruit bubble tea! For the amateur home cooks, they also sell their frozen dumplings by the bag.
Updated review from about 2 years ago!! Still good as ever. Get the won ton w/ spicy sauce and thank me later.

I loved the Roast Beef Sesame Pancake - the crunchy sesame-crusted exterior and the slices of beef encased in its soft bread. DANG was what went through my mind when my teeth sank into that pancake-which-is-not-really-a-pancake. The dumplings and buns were good, but overshadowed by my memory of that sesame pancake. At these price points, you can't help but give them a try when in town.

This place does two things extremely well: the food is fantastic and incredibly cheap. You could honestly be stuffed for $3 if you just get two orders of dumplings (though you'd be crazy not to get a pancake sandwich). Seriously, the food is incredible. It's so delicious I usually eat here at least once a week. The downside is the service is pretty low quality, but there's a certain charm to it plus the food easily outweighs that minor issue.
No comment

Originally stumbled across this place trying to find a quick bite before a night out. Excellent food. Sesame seed pancake sandwiches and dumplings are my go to. Busy inside and can get crowded. If you're not concerned with service and looking for great, cheap food, this place is a winner. I prefer this location over the 14th street one.

This place is super convenient, cheap and delicious, if you are close to china town and hungry you should stop at Vanessa's Dumpling House and eat a bunch of different plates. The bathroom its gross though.

Recently visited NYC with a group... The group wanted to shop on Canal St., so we went in search of some good food and Yelpers didn't let us down. After walking a few blocks from the crowds, we were greeted with some great smells as we walked into this little place. The fried dumplings were great and we loved the sesame pancakes. We even brought more of our group back later in the weekend. We really enjoyed getting food to go and relaxing in the parks nearby.
AMAZING dumplings! Cheap! The only down side is it's crowded and hot inside....but after your mouth tastes those amazing flavorful dumplings you won't mind the hustle and bustle around you.
I don't what is the big deal with this place. I had better dumplings at Chinatown. The dumplings and the sandwiches are typical .
The cheapest food you can ever get in nyc! It taste good and 4 dumplings only for one dollar! I will suggest everyone go there!

Prosperity dumpling house down the street has the better dumpling, although Vanessa's Dumpling house the cleaner/bigger restaurant.  I ordered the classic pork and chive potstickers and felt they lacked flavor.  Their famous peking duck sandwich was also a disappointment.  Although the sesame pancake is made fresh, their peking duck is not.. and the meat was rather cold inside the sandwich.  This place is packed with people, but it is really all just hype.

I was really impressed! We got their sesame pancake as well as the steamed pork dumplings in their spicy sauce was absolutely delicious! My personal favorite. All in all, everything we had here was pretty good but the 2 I just mentioned were the ones that stood out the most.
No comment
The cheapest, best dumplings.  Don't forget to try the sesame sandwiches though; also pretty dang A+.  I've been going here forever, it seems like.
No comment

Great food and great price......but dirty and nasty dinning area-no one ever cleans the tables. Long lines and rude ladies behind the counter, God forbid you ask for any extra plates, forks or napkins.....a good lunch place for take-out but don't take someone there  for If you are trying to impress them....

Vanessa crushes dumplings.  My wife and I love Asian food, and we devour dumplings with great regularity.  When we decided to head to the lower east side for a night out, we stopped in to Vanessa's for a "cheap and cheerful dinner". We left full, satisfied and anticipating our next trip.  We ordered ALL the dumplings, two different type of fried and three different types steamed.  The steamed dumplings can also be served in soup, but it was like a thousand degrees out so no.  I also ordered a duck pancake, I mean, how big could it be?  At a total of 22.50, (including some soft drinks) we had enough food to take home.  The fried dumplings are crispy and the filling (pork and stuff) is flavorful. The steamed dumplings we got in a spicy hot oil, which was hot, but easily mellowed by the soy sauce vinegar concoction on the tables.  The duck pancake was the bomb. At three bucks it reminded me of a Chinese Stromboli.  Duck, cucumber, and cabbage served between two seeded scallion pancakes.  Unreal!  So the place is a little divey and I was surprised that it had an A cleanliness rating based on the dining room, but the food is solid and served hot at a great price!  Will be back!
No comment
Very affordable and top quality. Wide choice of dumplings and fast delivery. More often than not you won't be able to find a seat as place is popular.
One of my favorite place to go for lunch. The dumplings are so tasty and the price is amazing. But it is a little bit noisy and crowded. Oh, remember, cash only and no delivery.
No comment

No comment

Vanessa's is where it's at! This place is bomb and they make the best Miso soup that I have had in NYC. Vegetable dumplings are great, as is scallion pancake which is not too oily in comparison to other places around. Everything is so cheap whenever I hear my total I'm like, wait, are we still in New York? The wait is a little annoying and the ladies who put together your order are always sassy, especially if you don't know your number! Get yo shit togetha or else nasty things will be said about you in Chinese. All in all Vanessa's is a great go-to for a bite to eat with food and prices so yummy and low you you have nothing to lose.

I got the fried pork & chive dumplings and the steamed pork dumplings (way too many dumplings to eat all at once, but I wanted to try both, so I just sampled them), plus a can of Coca Cola, and the total bill was $4.50. I'm never in Chinatown, but next time I'm back, I'll be back at Vanessa's. The fried dumplings were good, but the steamed pork dumplings were out of this world. Seating is very limited. Also, keep on top of your order; my order was simple, and the line wasn't very long when I placed it, but it must have gotten lost, because I waited 15 + minutes before finally, gently, asking them to check. They did, and they got me my order right away. I paid cash, but I heard the cashier say to the person behind me that there was a $15 credit card minimum. In a place like this, that's a lot of dumplings!

Came here while waiting for dinner reservation.  Had the chive and pork boiled and fried and the chicken and basil boiled.  The pork sticky buns were good. I've had better dumplings but these are cheap and quick.  Would come back after a night of drinking. 3 stars
No comment

Love this place...where else in nyc can you eat a delicious ,filling meal for under ten bucks....the fried dumplings are fantastic.the soups are very tasty and so well priced.I can't get enough of their sandwiches,they are made on bread that's made in a wok on premises..you can't go wrong here.....
No comment

It was a bright but frigid morning and after parking nearby, I stumbled across a highly reviewed yelp favorite, Vanessa's Dumpling House. I was extremely captivated by the low prices and indoor seating and decided to give it a try. I ordered pan fried dumplings (chives and pork), boiled dumplings (cabbage and pork ) and a sesame pancake with pork (this meal was for 2). Although there were no other customers at the time, we waited about 15 minutes for our food to come. The fried dumpling skin was really thick. AND not even hot! The boiled dumplings were okay. As for the pancake, it had been sitting so long the bag was wet and the bread was soggy. Who wants to eat wet mushy bread?? Needless to say, I was not happy with my experience at Vanessa's. Maybe next time I'll go back to my old friend prosperity dumpling up the block.

It is really cheap.  Like $1 item menu cheap.  Lots of choices very carb and not veggie heavy.  Highlight of the meal is the bevie fridge has an alarm on it to make sure you pay for your beverage.  The pork fried dumplings were a favorite.
No comment

The food is consistently good. I don't eat meat but have options to choose from. I don't tire of the scrumptious dumplings, the sweet sesame pancakes--when they're served warm. Sometimes the fulfillment of the rest of my order is so slow that my sesame-veggie sandwich grows cold before the rest of my food arrives. The prices are very reasonable. The service is disappointing. There may be a language barrier, so beyond getting what I ordered, it's a struggle to get the rest of the items I need such as plastic ware, reminding the cashier that I also ordered a smoothie that no one has made yet, or finding out what goes into the bubble drink. I'm not sure that the restaurant staff has the time to respond to queries, or is even interested in communicating effectively with clients. I only go there when I'm tolerant of a frustrating experience.

No comment

This place has really grown. Their menu has gotten longer and business for them seems better than ever. I tried the peking duck soup and it was delicious on a cold winter day. Their dumplings are always a staple and a must-try, especially the fried pork ones. The staff is friendly. Seating is spotty at times, but what do you expect for a busy joint in Manhattan.

Been going here (Eldridge Location) since they opened up. Love the pork/cabbage fried dumplings and vegetable sesame pancake. Freaking best prices (one could seriously feed an army for $20). They're packed I'd say 95% of the time, so don't necessarily go  expecting to sit down. The good thing about that is Eldridge is littered with nice big stoops to sit on, so you're not S.O.L. FYI - they sell frozen dumplings too so you can make them at home.

I wrote a review at the 14th street branch, but this place is much better. It doesn't have that eat and get the f out vibe, but a real warm ambience that allows for legitimate enjoyment of your delicious budget minded meal. I felt the quality of the food was better as well. I got the duck pancake (just delicious), pork and chive fried dumplings (juicy), round dumplings (also juicy), and some hot and sour soup (just right in flavor with enough of the veggie tidbits). Needless to say I'm def coming back here again. Good work ladies, excellent work.
No comment

5 crispy fried dumplings for a measly buck?  Would you rather have a McChicken or Double Cheeseburger for $1 or 5 dumplings.  OF COURSE, dumplings all day.  I buy 2 frozen bags of the pork-chive dumplings for $20 all the time when I lived in the city.  Great and filling anytime or when you're on your last $10 bucks and you don't get paid til the following Friday.  Nothing like that Dumpling diet to get that figure back.
Nice place, nice price. However, Staff is pretty rude and the local is noisy. For a vegetarian, veggie dumplings lack a bit of flavour and veggie soup is NOT recommended. Pancakes are nice though.

Our experience fell short of the high expectation. Fried and steamed dumplings are fair but not to the wowing point. Sesame Pancake Sandwich w. Szechuan Style Meat Sauce was unbearably salty and we had to throw it away. Beef noodle soup is noodle plus the not-so-tasty soup base, and I cannot get the wholesomeness of the dish. The staff is not so friendly. We ordered a lot of food about $25 for 3 people but didn't know why they gave us 2 pairs of chopsticks and no plates. We ate out of the takeout containers in their store. To be fair In spite of my ok experiences here, My observations were many customers coming. Will I come back again?  Maybe, but only for dumplings in a cold winter day.

We did the Serious Eats tour of Little Italy and Chinatown (11 destinations... google it!). We had the Peking duck sesame pancake at $3 (!!)... it was large, warm, soft and filled with cucumbers, carrots, cilantro, plum sauce and a generous amount of sliced Peking-style duck. I'm not a connoisseur when it comes to Chinese/Sino-American food, but the sandwich was generous, tasty, salty-sweet, ducky... and the highlight of the day. Service was spotty--the cashier a bit nasty but the woman who served us our duck at the end of the line was all smiles and 'have a great day!'... we didn't eat inside, but as many people here have said, this is several steps up from other destination/dive/cheap Chinatown establishments like Prosperity.
No comment
No comment
If you want to wait 25 minutes to get six dumpling, this is your spot. Unacceptable behavior , not recommended

Meh. Don't understand the comparison to Prosperity; the latter has much better flavor.  And the women lined up like factory workers yelling orders disturb any pleasant feelings I get from ingesting one of my favorite foodz.

Holy crap. So cheap and so good. So RIDICULOUSLY cheap. The boiled pork & chive dumpling was fantastic - love the thick skin and flavorful filling. And I was crazy awesome surprised by the scallion pancake sandwich! I hear they're good without any filling, but I had to try the peking duck, and it was faaabulous. It had just the right balance of that pluim sauce and scallion, and the pancake itself was encrusted with delicious toasted sesame seeds -- just beautiful!!
No comment

Wow. Cheap! Great large fried dumplings (these are thick skinned not like the wonton dumplings or gyoza) 4/$1?!?  The sesame pancake sandwiches are also large and cheap. Tried the duck filled one and it was tasty. Fast service.
No comment
No comment
Favorite cheap eats.  Probably the best bang for your buck in the entire city.  Pork and chive dumplings and a duck pancake.  The dumplings are good any way.

ok i really can't believe the hype about this place. It's really average, my pan fried dumplings were soggy yet again. It's just average, yes even the cost is AVERAGE.  I've totally eaten better dumplings. Heck I can make dumplings from scratch better than this place.  The skin was way to thick and partially raw on my pan fried dumplings, the boiled dumplings were served to us with broken skin and yet somehow the skin was too thick.!?!?!?  People don't know chinese food who give above 3 stars for this place.

I came here kicking and screaming, because my dumpling loyalty belongs to Prosperity. No sooner did my husband and I polish off our respective 4-dumplings-for-a-dollar (ahem, it's 5-for-a-dollar at Prosperity), than I promptly got a stomachache. Later that night, my husband vomited. Over the course of the next day, our bathroom was scarcely unoccupied. The punishment was deserved. Prosperity Dumpling, I will never choose another over you again!
too busy!  food was fast, but customers sitting down to eat lunch, lingered and not enough seating foe people then.  dirty bathroom!

I've only tried the dumplings here but DUDE ARE THEY GOOD.  Four delicious dumplings for only 1 dollar?!  You can never find steals like that in NYC, making this place a sure favorite.  Yea, the wait was a little long and the place was super busy, but it was all well worth it.  Easily the best four quarters I've ever spent.

when I come here, I usually get the beef pancake, its something different and soooo yummmy.  I got the wonton soup one time and it was ok.  I had better from other places.  Their dumplings are also good too.  But if I want a snack on the go, i'll stick with the beef pancake.

Not as good as it use to be. They're very stingy with their packet sauces and their Sirarcha and soy sauce are water down. The fried dumplings are alright, but they're not very filling. I would not recommend the peking duck pancake. There are barely any duck. What a rip-off.

We weren't sure what to get so we ordered one item out of each category - Yum! We had fried chive and pork dumplings, chicken and corn soup, sesame pancake with vegetables, and noodles with meat and bean sauce
So fresh and crispy! Try the sesame sandwich, you won't regret it! The pork one was amazing! I also tried the Peking duck sandwich and that was good too.

This place is badass! Everything is very cheap and delicious. Less than 2$ for 4 dumplings, and 2$ for a sesame pancake is hard to beat. Also, the Szechwan beef noodle soup is definitely worth trying.  I will definitely come here again

so delicious. so worth it. the dumplings are delicious, the duck pancake is amaaaaaaaazing, and the bubble tea is pretty good too!

Dude - the line is worth the wait. Fucking awesome drunk food. So many carbs and spicy tones coming from sriracha and broiled pork; my guilty pleasure. These people mean business! The cheap prices and maximum efficiency is appreciated.

Great dumplings, Great Taste. Horrible decor and seating. Not for nothing, but the bathroom should be renovated.

So yummy! Vanessa's dumpling house is a great place to go for delicious food. They have many different types of dumplings and also have a selection of buns and savory pancakes. The service is a little hectic, but it is definitely worth it. For a family of five, we paid less than thirty dollars for more than enough food.
No comment
No comment

I always scope out for really good dumpling places but so far this one is on my top list. I ordered the chive and pork  fried dumpling along with their sesame pancake with roast beef. The dumplings are decent sized and has a lot of meat to it. I didn't really need to put a lot of soy sauce on it and it was flavorful to my standards. The sesame pancake was an interesting one as it appears to be a crossover bet. a Viet sandwich  and a Shanghainese scallion pancake. The bread is really doughy  but I think it would taste even better if it was crispier.  Overall, it was delicious food for under $5.  What more can you ask for?

My boyfriend and I go here at least once a week when at school to have an insanely large feast. If you're looking for a cheap yet satisfying meal, look no further. It's usually about $10 in total for the both of us, and we walk out with a disturbing amount of food. The dumplings (4 for $1) are my favorite thing here as they're always the right texture and never over or undercooked. The pork buns (3 for $1) are also amazing. If you're getting both of those you'd might as well get a sesame pancake sandwich while you're at it as well ($2.50, if I remember correctly) and go to town. Definitely get it to go or eat it down the street at the basketball court if you can't get a table inside, which will more than likely be the case. It's almost always crowded in here!
No comment

Vanessa's Dumplings is great! They have terrific dumpling soups, dumplings by themselves, and other assortments of bites for very good prices. The reason why Vanessa's get's just 4 stars? Frankly, their dumplings are good, really good, but they're not packed with as much flavor as other places in Manhattan. Vanessa's is still a great choice for lunch anytime.
this place is DISGUSTING! I saw roaches in the kitchen right before I was about to order. I walked out.
So much food, so cheap, so yummy! It made my entire New York trip. The only not yummy dish was the beef noodle soup. Everything else was amazing!
Cheap AND really good, never disappointing. Famous for the dumplings of course, but tried the vegetables pancake and would definitely recommend it
No comment
No comment
No comment
Cheap and filling. Its ok here. Its worth it to walk a few more blocks down to Prosperity.

Extremely inexpensive and tasty food - Obivously not the highest quality, but still pretty good. Fried dumplings are 5 for $1 and boiled dumplings are 10 for $2 - coupled with one of their sesame pancakes stuffed with veggies, beef, and sauce for $1.50, you've got yourself a gigantic meal for under $5 - The beef pancake "sandwich" really is like a banh mi, only slightly sweeter, a little greasier, and with softer bread - its delicious! Once you start eating it there's no stopping. One complaint is the less than quality cuts of meat used, but then again, what can you expect for $1.50! Service is a little lacking as they get confused, but for cheap yummy dumplings, who cares?
No comment
No comment

I found this place visiting from San Francisco and it made me wish we had a place like it at home.  We've got lots of dumplings but not this good at this price.  I came back twice to get more of them while in New York.  I think this place may be the best lunch bargain in Manhattan.  Elbow your way to the counter, get an order or two and head for the back counter where there is Sriracha chili sauce to slather on them.  Heaven.

Went in based on positive reviews. Wanted two bubbles teas and some dumplings. The cashier spilled the powder to make the tea on the restaurant floor, scooped it up, and proceeded to place it in our tea blend. We requested our money back and walked out. Absolutely disgusting. Will never go there again or recommend based on substandard cleanliness.
Excellent. Dumplings were fresh, tasty and cheap. Plus the space is large enough for some tables giving it the edge over Prosperity.

Great price, menu, and amazing dumplings. Their sesame pancake with duck is delicious. The restaurant is better in terms of environment compared to prosperity dumplings. They have good seating options and a bathroom.

Cheap eats...but  good cheap eats... it's true it used to be better, some batches of the pork dumplings can be bland. But the shrimp dumplings have remained consistent, and their pancake sandwiches as well. Getting a seat here can be impossible ,it stays  busy so take out is better option.

I think the dumplings here suck.  They use to be better when it first opened but it kind of went downhill.  Their sesame bread with beef is not bad.   Lots of riff raff during diner time.  This is a cheap ass's paradise for dining.
No comment

A special man took me to this restaurant last week. Is there anything greater than enjoying your own 'cultural' food? It just feels so homely & welcoming. I know this spot is located at Union Square too but since I'm rarely on the other side of Chinatown, I'm oblivious to the other restaurants. The restaurant is quite small but very busy & buzzling with customers. The food is pretty down right awesome! I got an assorted box of boiled dumplings. It was delicious and very flavorable. It sure filled me up. Another thing I loved about this restaurant was that they had like boiled choy. We got shanghai bok choy! It was slightly oily but it was still good. I would love to come back here again! Here's a secret folks, you'll be saving a few bucks because this place doesn't require tips after you're done eating.
No comment
No comment

This place was 4 stars for me two years ago.  Maybe the big difference was that we got the dumplings to go this time.  I've gotten dumplings to go before, but at this place, the 20 minute interval between getting our order and eating our order really must have made that big of a difference.  All the juice in the dumpling disappeared or got soaked into the really, really thick dumpling skin.  It was dry, but at the same time very, very oily.  Will not be coming back here any time soon, at least not for take out.
It's chaotic and busy and you probably won't get a place to sit during the busy periods. But eat their wontons with spicy sauce and you will not care about any of that. So good, 5 stars.
I'm giving this place 5 stars because I can get EIGHT vegetarian dumplings for $3.  And they are actually delicious and fresh!  And everything on the menu is under $5.

If y'all are looking for some squeaky clean Asian joint, turn yo ass around and get the hell out a Chinatown!  If you'd like some Chinese ppeps to tell you how it really is, drop on by da Dumpling House.  Tasty goodness is all they serve up, fried meat or steamed veggie.  But wassup, I'm gonna show you a new trick, and that's to ask for the veggie sesame pancake, and you get a greasy asian pizza that's tasty D (not like like that fake yogurt crap).  D as in DELICIOUS.  Ain't no place to pop a squat, and by the looks of the Mr. Lover-lover's throwing their props at the place, ring up Milk and Honey and see what they think. Cuz it's time to get down with the Mao- ni how.

Agree with everyone else...not much ambiance, but great, cheap, authentic dumplings.  Make sure you also try the sesame pancakes/flatbreads (a couple of other reviewers have mentioned it as well) too, stuffed or unstuffed.  THAT is what makes me go out of my way to swing by this spot.  Mmm.  Carb gluttony!  :)

A dollar gets your four pan fried dumplings and they are fresh and delicious. The sandwiches are good too. You just have to be very persistent if you go during rush hours, as the store tends to get crowded even though they just finished an expansion.
No comment
The scallion pancake with the spicy meat sauce was great, but the dumplings fell short. They tasted a tad bit dry.
All fried dumplings are great! The sesame pancake with beef is delicious and the noodlesoup as well. We still need to check out the rest of the menu!!! Cant wait!!
No comment
No comment
Is there anything really left to say?  Where else can you stuff your face on quality authentic Chinese food for under $5.
No comment

I came here June of 2013 on a Sat night. Its a hole in the wall place, but their dumplings are bomb. The price is great too. I think we only spent 5 bucks on 8 dumplings. We left full and happy. Nice hipster spot in NY. It gets busy and crowded. You may have to wait for someone to leave so you can sit. I had a great experience as a tourist. hahaha. I would come back again.

I like food. I like to save money. I like to eat food and save money at the same time. See where I'm going with this?  Vanessa's is my go-to place for a cheap lunch in downtown Manhattan. Like so cheap you could pay with the spare change in your pockets or the money you made selling your spit. I usually get the #1 which is your typical dumpling cooked pretty satisfactorily. I usually supplement with a #20 which is the onion pancake with roast pork in it. Delicious. Or maybe its just the taste of money being saved. This stuff is fried though so I wouldn't eat it everyday (or I would, but I don't recommend it). Also the seating here is VERY limited so expect to eat with a stranger sitting next to you....or on you?
No comment

Had the scallion pancake with the Peking duck. It was highly recommended so we came here just to try this. It was just about ok. The pancake could have been flufflier. It was a little dry and cold and felt like it had been sitting around for sometime. They have a nice seating area and that's really helpful around here. Had the milk tea as well. Was a tea bag in a cup of milk.
