I'm pretty much addicted to dumpling house.  Their dumplings are 5 for a $1.   For quicker service, I usually go with the standard fried pork and chives but they also offer steamed vegetable dumplings which are great too.  While their menu is quite vast, I was so satisfied with my dumpling experience that I did not stray from my order for quite some time.  Then I tried a sesame pancake with beef and was pleasantly surprised.   I don't think I've ever spent more than $2.50 there and I never leave hungry!
No comment
Dumplings and steamed buns are still ok, but the food overall used to be alot better.  The line is usually long, but they're quite efficient, so the wait isn't too bad.
No comment
No comment
I don't understand the hype. I've had much much better dumplings. I guess if you don't want to make the hike to Chinatown, you could settle for Vanessa's, but Vanessa's got nothing on Prosperity!
I've definately had better dumplings.  Sauce has a big thing to do with augmenting the flavor and theirs was pretty regular.

I live in the neighborhood so when I need something quick and easy I go here. Actually it can get pretty busy here so I am always here early in the morning for breakfast. I love the hot and sour here the best. No other place makes it better. It is only $1.75 too. Their fried dumplings are really good too but I think if you don't get them freshly made, the skin gets really tough. Their spicy wonton is also to die for. Probably the only other thing I really really like here. It's boiled wontons (shrimp and watercress inside) with spicy oil and cilantro topped. Stop by for a quick snack or a whole meal.

I've been back too much, really, my skinny jeans are getting a little tight. My wallet is still sort of full, and my stomach is beyond happy. It's always crowded in here, and if you are sitting at the round table towards the back expect other people to want to sit with you if there is still room. The dumplings are still amazing, as are the steamed red bean buns, pork buns, sesame pancakes, as is the bubble tea in my honest opinion. Though,this is the only place I've actually had bubble tea, so I don't really know if it's amazing or not. Anyway, just get your butt over here and fill up on dumplings before I eat them all.
No comment

Yes, my second 1 star of the weekend.  Its just been a losing streak all around, down to the icky sandwich I just had working on night float.  But again, I digress.  Ew.  This place is just well...ew.  The dumplings are chewy and frankly kind of tasteless.  The soup was cold.  Hot and sour soup served cold.  I think in a land where soup was hot and fresh this one may have been a winner, but helas the LES on a Sunday afternoon was no such land.  The serracha sauce was watered down.  The only 2 things I liked were the cucumber salad and the bubble tea.  That's it.  Actually, the sandwich and the pork buns our neighbor I coveted greatly, but not enough to come back...so the search for the perfect dim sum continues...

Great dumplings, great price. Scallion pancakes are aight, not as much flavor as the other popular dumpling house down the road, just a handful of carbs. Dumplings though, compared to said competitor, taste of fresher and healthier ingredients. Seating is difficult to acquire, but doable.
Only been here one time by chance and read the reviews on Yelp... decided on the veggie dumplings and a sesame scallion pancake. .. is was really good and $5.00!!

SO GOOD AND SO CHEAP!! For a mere 10 dollars we got three boxes of dumplings (approx. 20 count), both fried and boiled, and two large things of sesame pancakes, plain. Regrettably, I don't know why I didn't get a topping/stuffing because after reading the reviews again it seems that it makes it that much better. I don't think I can pinpoint an absolute favorite, although I think I am partial to the boiled dumplings over the fried ones just because it came with 2x the quantity. In terms of food quality and selection, it's very comparable to Prosperity Dumpling, except that Vanessa's has more of a restaurant setting with an actual dining area (even though you order up front and there's no waiter service). Chinatown, once again you do not fail when it comes to places for a cheap, satisfying meal--honestly any time of the day!
No comment

Since I've been listening to Jay Z's "Empire State of Mind" for the past 2 weeks, it got me thinking about NY.  What did Hova forget to mention in his song?  Then it dawned on me, Dumpling House!!  I got love for Sesame Pancake Sandwiches. Oh so tasty... Only a $1.50?? What??  $1 order of dumplings?  Fareal?!?!  You can't go wrong with this place!!  How is it that I can't find one freaking Sesame Pancake sandwich in LA??  Let's hear it for New York, New York, New Yoooork!!

This is my dumpling oasis. I love their food. I used to go here at least once a week back whenI was in college, now sadly I cannot. Their location has expanded, and there is a considerable amount of seating space.Their tuna, veggie sandwiches were favorites, I believe it was $2 at most. I loved their soups. Ah, reiviewing this place makes me want to go right now.
This is a NY staple.  Excellent dumplings, sandwiches, ambiance. The place is a hole in the wall but very very cultured. Will definitely be back at this spot!

I read this place on Yelp and I had to see what the fuss was all about.  All dumplings, all the time.  Whereas the usual dumplings come in a variety of flavors, it's the sesame sandwiches that are the highlight of the place.  I had the roast duck, and it was flavorful, reminding me of a banh mi, sans that fattiness.  Service was less than desirable, but IMO, how could the waitstaff be happy when the patrons are such slobs?  In the short 45 min time span that I was there, I saw groups leaving their messes for others to clean up and even a group doing their nails!  Unbelievable.  I certainly think this place provides quality dumplings and sandwiches, however, I would hope that the crowds respect the prices and keep the place as clean as possible.
Best beef sesame pancake in the NYC, cheap but good quality. Even though store already renovate once, but still need more space to fit tons customers.

As you can tell from the reviews the word is out on this spot. I've been coming here for several years and the accolades just keep getting poured on. Luckily the price hasn't raised with its image. But it's increasingly harder to pop in and grab a quick bite on your way to something else. Even in mid-afternoon you'll be waiting line. The dumplings are awesome. I prefer the fried dumplings but the steamed are right on. My favorite dish is the sesame pancake with beef. It comes with carrots, cilantro, and hot sauce with some thin strips of lower quality beef so there's plenty of fat on it. $1.50. I've dubbed it "chinese pizza." I'll see you in line.

Kinda sad I can't  call this my favorite hole in the wall dumpling house anymore...well because it is not really a hole in the wall anymore! I can't shun them for giving me a comfy indoor space on a freezing cold day like this past Sunday...though I do miss the experience of eating food in the street.  I love this place, the food is great, the food is cheap and a girl's gotta have her pork dumplings!  Especially for a dollar!
No comment

I've been here a bunch of times.  The food is good.  The last time I went tho, I waited for 15 minutes and they ended up giving me the wrong thing.  I didn't realize it till I got home.  Make sure you check your receipt after you order so they get it right.
No comment

The steamed spicy shrimp dumplings here are extremely good. However, the place is a bit of a hassle, as I will explain, so be prepared and decide for yourself if it's worth it. You order by going up to a counter, ordering what you want, paying, and then they give you a number that they yell out when the order is ready. At 5 PM on a Saturday, the place was packed. Ordering was similar to ordering on a Saturday night at a popular bar. You kind of have to push and shove a little and be aggressive to get to the front and order before others who came in after you. There really isn't any sort of line. It was pretty crowded and then took about 20 minutes for our food to be ready. We were lucky and were able to grab two seats. Seats here really are limited. Don't come here with more than one other person and be prepared to take your food to go. There isn't even room to stand and eat if you had wanted to do that. The prices are extremely cheap so order whatever you want and decide what you actually like later. We got the spicy steamed shrimp dumplings that were extremely good. They were even garnished with copious scallions and cilantro. We also tried the peanut wheat noodles which weren't very good and the duck noodle soup which was okay. The sesame pancake thing with beef was also just okay. Basically, just come here for dumplings and be prepared to fight for them.
Noodles and dumplings are good, but not worth the detour. And the crowded tables. We were forced to wait 20 minutes for a table, while our soup got cold
Cheap, delicious & filling. Chive & pork dumplings were on point.

I was slightly disappointed after hearing all the hype about this spot.  (I mean even Jeremy Lin  pays this spot a visit!)  Yes, it's a cheap meal but it's honestly not that great.  We tried the pan fried dumplings, which were kind of all stuck to each other so all the juices from the pork were leaked out.  We had the sesame duck pancake, which I felt would have been better if there was  less pancake and more duck.  I also had the hot and sour soup, which was just okay.  Overall, I might come back and buy frozen dumplings to make at home, but I don't think I'll go out of my way to pay this spot another visit.  Sorry!  PS. Why is the soy sauce and hot sauce watered down?  :(
No comment

I have never been to a place that treated their guests with such contempt. Seriously, you would never see this behavior in real Chinatown in Flushing. The sesame pancakes were good (one star just for that) but everything else just tasted like fried bleh. Definitely not worth the crowded venue and mental abuse. I don't understand why this place is so famous either, are real dumpling houses nonexistent in Manhattan?

I love the dumplings here. Best to come during non-peak hours bc there is sometimes a long line. Their $1 pan fried pork dumplings are so tasty and yummy. I also highly recommend the wonton soup- it has seaweed in it and the wontons are very soft and delicate in texture. Hot and sour soup very good. I think that in order to get the full appreciation of the sesame pancake, you must order it with a meat filling. Don't get the bubble tea. Not so great.

It's hard to not give 5 stars when I spent $1 for some tasty dumplings. The dumplings tasted good, seemed fresh and my only criticism is that they were greasy but hey they're frying them right in front of you and aren't hiding anything. And I expect the fat content of these greasy dumplings is still far less than the equivalent floppy burger from MacD's and they taste so much better.  This place is a good reason to have a few too many drinks just so you can soak up the alcohol with these dumplings.

I am now officially addicted to the duck sandwich. It's soooo delicious and so cheap! If I lived nearby I'd probably eat it every day. The staff is a bit surly, but the deliciousness makes up for that.

I'm no dumpling house connoisseur, but this is one of those places that makes me feel extra-cool about living in the city.  The food is fresh, greasy, filling, delicious and dumb cheap.  I had the sandwich with duck (I think it was like $3) and basically stuffed the entire thing in my mouth in a combo drunken stupor and attack of mouth-ecstasy.  We had just left Milk and Honey and I was in heaven.  Be forewarned, when they say they're closing at 10, they mean that AT TEN they will be closed.  9:57 pm I'm shoving duck and pancakes and sesame things in my mouth and they're mopping around my feet (I'm standing at the window-bar because they won't let us sit down).  There was literally a dry pair of foot-prints in the floor when I left.  Awesome.
Try the $1 dumplings and the vegetable pancake. Everything else is pretty bland and doughy. Not a ton of seating but there are outside benches available at the park.

So damn good... for the price. It's really greasy... but it hits the spot if you're hankering for some deep-fried deliciousness. If that's what you're in the mood for (and you want to be full for a dollar or two), this is your place! Had the sesame beef sandwich... did not expect it to be that filling! And also had the pork and chive dumplings. Greasy... greasy... gone!

Vanessa got dumps that are cheap and good, anyone can eat a full meal drink included for $5. You might be saying, hey what about a footlong from subway, NO, WRONG, that's like $5.43 or something, with no drink. I usually get a pancake sandwich and 8 dumplings..that's $4 right there, and $1 for a coca cola classic. I haven't even had there noodles yet but seriously, you have to check out this place if you're near the area, it's far b/c I live on the westside, but I love coming here for the great food, there's also a nice bahnmi sandwich place near... mmm, ok back to vanessa, You will be satisfied, b/c the price is so cheap. Everything is better when it's cheap. and the taste is pretty good too. you can thank me later, tell vanessa fred sent you.

I've known about this place since before they charged 1.25 for four fried dumplings (they used to charge one dollar for five!). I usually get their fried dumplings and a sesame pancake with beef. Both are yummy and filling and CHEAP! Such a good place to go if you're looking for some food. There's always a line and never seats, though, so be prepared to wait a little.

5 Dumplings for $1, you can't go wrong!  They taste delicious, and are fresh because of so much traffic they receive.  They are delicious dumplings and are a good bang for the buck.  Do not miss out on these.  It is worth the trip if you are hungry and are looking for good/cheap food.
No comment
No comment

The fried dumplings are amazing and they are 4 for a dollar. How can you beat that. The pecking duck sesame pancake is delicious. They bubble tea never disappoints. All the soups are delicious too. Seating is very limited but has a quick turn around. I love this place. I drive here from about 55 minutes away on my day off just to eat here.
No comment

This is a great place to go to for cheap delicious dumplings!  I still think its insane that you can get 5 dumplings this good for just $1!  The place is very small though so it's really more suited for take out orders (it fits about 6 people max).  The dumplings and scallion pancakes are worth checking out but disregard the noodles though as they weren't good at all.  At the end of my visit here I bought 50 frozen dumplings to go for $8...

Greasy good food. The sesame pancakes are really filling and the dumplings are a meal by themselves. Excellent and ridiculously cheap. Keep an eye on your order, though, as they occasionally mix things up. Snag an open seat as soon as you see it or some tiny lady will muscle her way past you. It's kill or be killed here.

This place is great! the beef pancake and dumplings are good.  The service is great but limited amount of english but you can definately still order without a problem. Getting food that stuffs your stomach at this price is just wonderful. It's almost free. Who can go wrong with that? I put it 4 stars though because chinese food to me is just too common.

Oh, it's terrible. Really terrible. A waste of money and time. Please don't go. Odds are you'll add to the wait, and take a seat where I would prefer to be sitting. Please don't go, and don't tell your friends that it's the tastiest and best meal under five bucks in the east. That will only make the wait longer, and sometimes the wait is very long indeed. So yeah, please don't go. Especially don't go with your laptop and park there at a well-coveted table for 45 minutes past the time that you finished your last extremely yummy and supercheap pork and chive dumpling. The nerve of some people. Guys like that don't deserve the best deal in town. If you're one of those guys, I hope you spill soup on your keyboard. Get outta here. And please, don't even go in the first place. Go to Katz' Deli and pay way too damn much for pastrami on dry rye bread. Stay outta my way and stop eating my dumplings. I'll cut you, man. I'll cut you.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Im so upset i didnt discover this place sooner.  Thier dumplings and pancakes are really good.  You cant complain about the price either, very very resonable! My absolute favorite is thier mango smoothie; bangin!!!!
No comment

Great place for cheap food! They get very crowded so expect a wait for your food, but being able to get good food for under $4 and having a place to sit and eat without tips is pretty amazing. Their dumplings are always satisfying and their hot&sour soup is especially unique. The soup is packed with different type of vegetables and soft tofu (surprising since often times, restaurants always use firmer tofu), and their soup flavor is usually more sweet and less pepper which is perfect for my taste buds. Overall, great place to get something cheap in Chinatown and if you are able to avoid the rush hours, then it will be quick and cheap.
so good and affordable! 1.50 for 4 dumplings is amazing. don't hold your breath to get a seat though!
No comment
No comment

Followed reviewers before my trip to NYC. Had a very long wait on a Wednesday night and after finally getting our food, we were fortunate to get 2 chairs (everyone for themselves) at that moment. The food was very good and we loved the duck pancakes and dumplings. I couldn't get over how cheap! $6 for so much food! Definitely a place to try and enjoy a good and inexpensive meal. Popular for students and struggling actors. Expect a wait and try to grab a table if your with someone as soon as you get there.  A must try.
No comment
No comment

Great, authentic Chinese food and very inexpensive. I was stuffed and full paying only $2.50. Unfortunately they are closed right now for remodeling and won't open until beginning of 2008. I like the place, a classic hole-in-the wall in the truest sense. 5 stars.
The gold standard. Place can be crowded so either take them out and eat while walking, or buy them frozen and cook at home. Just as delicious!
Stumbled upon this place by accident and I must say it was worth it. This place and Prosperity has the best dumplings..sucks that the dumplings went up by a quarter for 4 of them but they are so good
No comment
Good Chinese food but probably not the best in Chinatown. Can't beat the price though, $1 for pork and chive dumplings and $2.50 for a large soup.
No comment
No comment

It's not fancy or gourmet food, but it definitely hits the spot when you're on 14th and thinking... I feel like something quick and not disgusting and greasy.  I've always been happy with the dumplings and the wonton soup at this place.  For what it is, it's a good spot that gets the job done - filling a void in my stomach and satisfying a craving.

This was a perfect way to end our snowy NYC adventure for my Birthday. We tried the Chicken & Basil dumplings, the Pork & Chive dumplings and a Peking duck sesame pancake. All were very good. I will be visiting again.

If you seek the city's best dumplings, you will have to look elsewhere. Vanessa's dumplings are not my absolute favorite but they are cheap and filling. The price is fantastic considering all the restaurants in the Union Square vicinity will cost 5x more for a simple lunch. The advantage of Vanessa's over Prosperity and other dumpling places is that there is actually a fair amount of seating. The place is kept moderately tidy so you can actually enjoy your meal right after you buy it. Decent bubble tea as well. Great choice for lunch if you are hungry and on a budget.
Amazing dumplings and pancakes for great prices! Definitely looking forward to going back.

I stumbled here since I was in the neighborhood. Who knew this was a sunday brunch hot spot? Anywhoo, I got vegetable dumplings, shrimp dumplings and pancake with eggs to go. My order took around 30 minutes, but it was well worth the wait! The veggie dumpings were very flavorful and so was the shrimp! Even though they were boiled it was just as good as fried dumplings. Not only that, I believe there was soup inside the dumplings too! Every bite was a delightful. The pancake with egg was a thick crispy crust of goodness! There was also cucumber with the egg. My overall total of the meal? 8 freaking bucks plus 50 cents!!!
No comment
No comment

my favorite china town eatery.. in the heart of chinatown, and far away (sorta) from the congested canal street.. yummy veggie sandwich/pancake and veggie dumplings (i eat veggie out).. and add in a cup of tea and you got a great meal all for under $6.00. This place is pretty small, but they have nice sized tables for a group of 4-6. and the place is semi-packed with a combo of native-chinese, midwest transplants, and native newyorkers. the only real downside, is that the wait is kinda long for fast food.. but its definitly worth the wait. slightly greasy, but it only add to the flavor.. right?
No comment

Im so glad my gf brought me here.  Where else can you have great chive dumplings and a sesame veggie sammich for $2.50?  EXACTLY!  NO WHERE!  The sesame sammich must be sprinkled with crack because Im hooked.  Their dumpling soup is FAB in the winter time!  Did I mention their prices?  Assembly line type of place so get their early to grab a spot!

When dining on a dime think outside the box (hotdog, dollar slice, street meat). For 10 dollars you can eat like a king and leave stuffed. Don't be fooled by the imitators (Vanessa's dumplings on 14th street just ain't the same). Fried dumplings are the way to go (not deep fried as I had feared), steamed are more like pierogies. Sesame pancake sandwiches are also delish and so cool to watch them make it. Don't miss the spicy wontons!
I found this place on Yelp, it's a hidden gem of lower east side. The food is great the atmosphere not so much..
Not much else to say that hasn't already been said, I just wanted to add to the number of positive reviews. This place is the best deal on dumplings. I get full from spending $2.
Great dumplings for cheap! Worth standing in line for a little while (the staff is not slow -- there is just always a crowd).
No comment
Wow this is like the cheapest cheap eats. $1 for 4 dumplings and a place to sit! What more can you ask for?!
No comment

Good place, their spicy wonton are awesome. The only bad thing is that they take a good while to make, and if there's a line (which there often is on evenings) it takes a long time to get your food. Count on 20 minutes. The system works like this: you order at the counter furthest away from the entrance. You pay and get a receipt. They then call out your number when your order is done. If you've ordered something that takes a long time to cook (like the spicy wonton) you'll have to wait a while.

Vanessa's dumpling is my 2nd go to place for dumplings.  My first is prosperity dumplings down the street.  Vanessa's dumplings cost a tiny bit more at 4 for a $1.  I go here only when I want to sit down.  Their store is nice and roomy with plenty of tables to sit and eat your food.  Their dumplings are good, but they are just not as flavorful and the skin is a bit tougher.  It is really hard to tell the difference unless you have them side by side...which I did.  The duck scallion pancakes are also really good.  Filled with meat and crispy, but still lacking the same oomph.

If you are in the mood for some cheap food Vanessa's Dumpling is the place to be. For $1 dumpling you can't go wrong with this place. This place is always pack and there is a line to order your food. But don't worry line move very quick and you be out the door in no time. Dumpling are made fresh at the store daily. You can order your dumpling steam or fried. Beside dumpling there are other stuff on the menu you can order like noodles, buns, and sesame pancake sandwich. Also you can buy their frozen dumpling for home. Would go back to Vanessa's Dumpling for more cheap eat at the L.E.S.
No comment
No comment

I'm going to go against the tide here and boldly ask, what's the big deal here? I know that the whole point of this place is that it's cheap food but honestly, I don't see the quality difference between this place and other fast food Chinese restaurants or just plain cheap Chinatown restaurants. Also have fried my own frozen dumplings and have had home-made pancakes that were better and way less greasier. It's fine for what you pay for but the way people talk about this place makes it seem like there's real magic that occurs in this joint and the truth is, you get what you pay for.
You get what you pay for. The dumpling skin is too thick, little flavor, and they don't seem interested in serving you if you don't speak the language.

The sesame pancake with the roast beef was really good, liked the soft n chewy pancakes..... But the basil and chicken dumplings were not that great, at best above average. Plus the long wait really makes me wanna go to somewhere less crowded.

The dumplings, incidentally, aren't all that great (although you can't argue with the price).  The real treasure here is the sesame pancake--they used to thorw in kimchee for free (if you asked for it), but now they seem to have caught on, and they charge you a bit extra.  It's well worth it, since the meat is a touch on the dry side.

The $1 for 4 dumplings is a great way to fill up for cheap. You cant find a better deal than this, people. I do sometimes wonder what's in the dumplings but I'd rather not know. But for the rest of the menu, They're all pretty good deals too. I always get the #7 shrimp dumpling. It reminds me of siao long pau with soup inside the dumplings. If you're around the LES and looking to get a quick fix, you might want to try this place.
The cashier was rude and unfriendly, my sesamy pancake was dry and fatty, place is dingy and hardly has enough seats. Dumpling are ok but i prefer prosperity d.

The price is right and the food is always good (veggie dumplings and sesame pancakes are my jam). The only thing that makes me sad is that they don't have shrimp or chicken sesame pancakes at this location like they do at the one on 14th, boo! But still a great place to get a cheap, delicious bite. Space isn't too big like the one on 14th, so can get crowded easily and you may feel like you're sitting on top of other people, but it's an opportunity to make a friend (maybe? if they won't eat your brains).

I tend to end up at Prosperity just a few blocks south most of the time but Vanessa's is definitely a cleaner experience.  Whenever tourists are in town who I don't want to scare I take them to Vanessa's.  Their is also a much broader range of dumplings to try here - I like the shrimp and chicken and basil ones but you can also get a variety plate, it's $4 for 10 assorted if memory serves.  Sesame pancakes here are also awesome (make sure to get it stuffed with something).

Went here while doing a dumpling tour of chinatown.  The pork dumplings here were my least favorite of the three places on my tour.  The pancake/wrapper was just much too thick and completely overpowered the tasty filling.  I do want to come back and try the sesame pancake with duck though but I definitely would not get the dumplings again.
Fried chive,chicken and szechuan sandwich are the best imo

Your on Eldridge St at 10am and feeling a bit hungry, but you only have a $1.50 in your pocket - what do you do? Pork and chive dumplings. This may not be the healthiest option, but it sure did taste good. Boiled or fired you decide - health is not an issue - it's 10am, your eating dumplings - you've got other issues, but a full belly is not one of them.

Cheap, amazing dumplings. 5 for a dollar and the chicken corn soup (also a dollar) is to die for. Sure, there are like 5 seats and the place is always packed, but I will wait for that food. Cheap and good, the best thing about New York. Long live the Dumpling House.
No comment

BEST CHEAP MEAL.  EVER.  8 dumplings for two bucks?!  Umm..  yea - and they are delish to boot.  You must try the scallion pancake veggie sandwich.  So good. We got 10 dumpings, a sandwich and a steamed bun and it was $8. Wow.  Best after bar food, best food anytime...one of the best deals in NYC.  I am thinking of it now as I write....mmm.....

Dumplings for a Dollar enough said! This place gets busy toward the end of the day. I get 2 orders of Pork Fried Dumplings with chives, Vegetable pancake and a bottle of Snapple for $5. Me and my girlfriend usually take it to go  and sit at the park nearby and eat out of a plastic container plate because it gets busy and theirs nowhere to sit inside.
Above average dumplings.  I would give it 5 Stars if they didn't water down the soy sauce laced with vinegar, and the hot sauce is too blend.  Order to go and enjoy at home with the right condiments.

My second favorite cheap dumpling place in NY. Steamed or fried, the pork and chive are a perfect quick, cheap meal. Go on off hours if you want seating or perch awkwardly at the counter with everyone else, stealing elbow room
No comment

I go at least once a month to Vanessa's in Chinatown. One reason: its really good and cheap as hell. Seasame pankcakes are amazing, think banh mi in a sesame lightly fried bread. delicious. pork dumpling soup is awesome as well. kimchi for 2 bucks, spicy and completely acceptable for the price. its always busy when i'm in, the place speaks for itself.
No comment

I can get breakfast,lunch & dinner with just a $10 budget.Great food.So many things on the menu,it's tough to decide.It's always busy when I go,but come on for $5 you can stuff your face so you can't even complain about how packed it gets.I usually just get my food to go anyway.They're pretty fast anyways.
No comment
The soup was amazing and the pork fried dumplings were delicious!!!!!!!! I will definitely be back. Although the corn soup is an egg drop soup so beware if you don't like the egg.

A coworker brought back dumplings to the office last week, and needless to say we were talking about these for the rest of the day. They have the best hands down vegetable dumplings I have ever had. They are much more flavorful then you usually get at your local fast food Chinese dive. The chicken and pork ones were delicious too! The dipping sauce had the right amount of tartness/vinegar without being too acidic. I will definitely be going back and buying them frozen to keep in my fridge whenever I have a dumpling craving!
Good and cheap. For $2 I got fried pork dumplings and the sesame pancakes. The pancakes were huge! Seriously, if you spend more than $2, you're insane.
No comment

dumpling house was one of my favorite finds in nyc. i love boiled dumplings and definitely can't find 10 tasty dumplings for only $2 in san francisco. the servers were very friendly although it may have helped that i spoke chinese. i loved how they've premade the soy sauce-vinegar mixture just right. my tuna-loving friend also got the tuna sesame pancake sandwich which he said was better than all the other tuna sandwiches he had in nyc. the place is very tiny though. we later passed by prosperity dumpling whose menu and prices looked the same but was more spacious. i wasn't sure if that's a competitor or a sister location.

A place to go to for quick cheap meal. Haven't had my share of dumplings from different places so can't judge quality of the food. They were tasty though. The almond bubble tea was yummy according to my boyfriend. They had a good amount of seating but looks like it can get packed from to time.
No comment

This is an amazing value. I have lived next door for the last 6 years and still love it (my heart specialist loves it to). Once you have gone through the dumplings make sure you hit up the amazing sandwiches.
I think Vanessa's deserves a special mention for its fried pork buns. They're out-of-this-world!
No comment

Small place and limited seating but if you're lucky enough to get a seat you can enjoy their fresh steamed dumplings right away. They are perfectly seasoned and very fresh tasting. A really good find in chinatown
food, taste, and service are getting worse. most dumpling shops in chinatown are as good. many noodle shops make their noodles from scratch. don't think Vanessa's does.
No comment

The only thing good about this place is the super cheap prices.  Then again, you get what you paid for.  Which is rude service, dirty tables, watered down sauces and no flavor.  IT is also filled with tourists who thinks it's the best dumplings they've ever had but clearly it's not.  We got the mixed selection and I couldn't tell the difference in the meat ones until we got to the ones with just vegetables. Dumpling skins were very thick, you really can't even taste the meat inside.  The selections were also very limited and not even worthy of calling a dumpling house.   The noodles with the broth were flavorless.  We got the beef noodles and the chunks of beef were fatty,dry and tasteless.  I recommend you invest in a 40 minute wait and just go to Joe's Shanghai. They might be rude there too but in Joe's at least the food is great.

Clean, commercial. Inexpensive. It tastes pretty much the same as other dumpling places around - good. But its really difficult to tell the difference from any of them. The fried pork buns are a great price at 3 for $1, but not that tasty - 3 stars for those. but the fried pork and chive is good and cheap at 4 for $1. BUT they had watered down sriracha sauce! how the f**k do you do that to sriracha?? based on that alone i dont wanna go back there

Amazing food for cheap. We got the spicy shrimp wonton, shrimp boiled dumpling, sesame pancake and pork and cabbage fried dumpling plus 2 waters for $12.50. We left full and happy. Def coming back whenever we're in the area.
This place is an operational nightmare, but it is offset by the cheap and good food!!

Delicious and inexpensive. Split the boiled pork and chive dumplings, sesame pancake with roasted pork, and red bean bun with friends for a snack for $6.75. The dumplings were simple and tasty. Sesame pancake was packed with flavor, filled mostly with pork fat rather than actual pork, but no one was complaining. Red bean bun was light and fluffy. There is limited seating, but tables turn over quickly.

Good and cheap. This food is a great value. For just a few dollars you can stuff yourself with wonderful flavors and THAT is amazing! I like the Pork Wonton Soup but also enjoy the duck pancake and the fried Wontons. Eat here for cheap!

Ok, the food isn't really five star. It's probably closer to four. But that's because dumplings really aren't the highest form of food; the trick here is in the value. And as far as value goes, there is no place that gives you as much for your dollar. Sometimes the food takes too long, sometimes the line takes too long, but it's always delicious and always cheap. Veggie dumplings are my staple, but the sesame sandwiches are by far the best item on the menu and are pretty filling on their own. Since the renovation its sort of lost its hole in the wall status
No comment

Vanessa's Dumpling House is a unique dining establishment on the Lower East Side. It is a small, cramped, very, very busy hole in the wall-type eatery. Totally unpretentious with only a few tables. A long line of customers snakes through the front door about 60' to the back of the shoebox-shaped eatery to place its orders at the chest-high counter that separates them from the big cooking ranges. There are menus, but your best sense of what to order comes from the amazing sites on the stove tips on the other side of the counter. Dozens of dumplings steaming or frying in woks the size of trash can covers are among the most enticing sights. Most people took their meals out when we were there on a summer weekend. The dumplings come cheap and are delicious. Well worth a stop.

I'm going to give Vanessa's the benefit of the doubt and assume they don't get their meat as leftovers from other Chinatown restaurants nearby (Hi Prosperity Dumplings!). That being said, I can already tell by the taste of the fillings that the meat isn't just leftover gelatinous tendon and sinew like that found in Properity Dumplings. I know white people gush over Vanessa's just the same...but at least they're gushing over something that's real and (relatively) healthy for you. We stopped here right before closing time (10:30pm on weekends, which is late for Chinatown) and opted for the sesame pancakes with pork and then duck filling. We also got a sample of potstickers to go. Everything was really flavorful and I was stuffed at the end. The entire meal cost less than $10 if I'm recalling it correctly. The servers were also incredibly nice and patient, despite it being 10 minutes to closing time. That definitely doesn't hurt.

They have the BEST HOT AND SOUR SOUP!!!  I've tried alot of places for a good hot and sour soup but they have the best taste... and their beef pancakes are delicious... it's so cheap and good what more can you ask for?!
Excellent food. Great Beijing buns, sesame pancakes, dumplings, soups, noodles, congee, side dishes, drinks. Delicious
No comment
No comment
No comment

We got the assorted dumplings and 2 other dishes and wow, TONS of food.  It was all great, and we even managed to get seating (had to share with a couple crazies though, but oh well).  Great place, but not near the main subway line so it's a bit of a hike to get there.
good for a quick cheap bite. the place looks really rundown and ghetto but the food is good.  lol

This is the best place to go if you only have a few bucks and are very hungry.  My boyfriend and I went there and feasted on 2 orders of 8 dumplings, 16 total, and a pork sesame sandwich for under 10 bucks!!!!!!!!  I'd recommend ordering to go, since there is rarely any seating.  Get it to go and eat it in the nearby park!
Fantastic food almost for free, I really loved this place. You can easily eat for 4-6 $ including tip. Try to go here with some friends and just order a mix of dumplings of their choice!
My fave dollar dumplings. If you can't find a seat and it's not too cold out, there are a few chairs and tables around the corner on Allen street

This place is right around the block from where I am staying for the week. It's delicious, very clean, and the staff were courteous despite being busy, would go there again! Somethings to remember though, there are more seats here then most NYC places, but it seems to be popular, so you might have to wait for a table. So just a fair warning, we took it to go and I couldn't have been happier!

i come here when i crave a nice sit down clean affordable dumpling meal in chinatown. the sesame pancakes are sooo good with meat fillings, the dumplings are delish and the soups are yummy too. perfect for a cold winter day. they do get really crowded and seating gets hard to find but turn around is pretty decent since its not a slow eating pace here. everyone is sort of on the go and just wanted to grab a quick bite. they also have a bathroom that isnt as dirty as the other chinese places in chinatown

I'm a big fan of dumplings, and recently paid my first visit to Vanessa's Dumpling House.  On the plus side, the sesame pancake is completely delicious, a treat that is absolutely worth seeking out.  The boiled pork and chives dumplings were tasty, the chicken and basil dumplings a bit less so (but a nice change of pace).  The pork buns were quite a disappointment.  Still, the food was ridiculously cheap (cash only), and the mango smoothies were a cool delight on a hot day.  I would have given Vanessa's Dumpling House four stars except for... the bathroom.  Oh. My. God.  Have you seen the bathroom scene from Trainspotting, with the "worst toilet in Scotland"?  For real, it exists, at Vanessa's Dumpling House.  It's an absolutely filthy bathroom, covered with graffiti - even on the toilet itself.  I've been to cleaner bathrooms at punk clubs back in the day.  If they can't keep a bathroom clean, why should I have faith in the sanitary conditions where they cook the food?  Another heads-up - there's not a lot of seating, so don't come in with a group of seven thinking you're going to be able to kick back and chat over dumplings.  My advice is to go to Vanessa's if you want to do take-out (they seem to do a hopping to-go business), and do your best to keep your mind from wandering and wondering about sanitation.   If you want a relaxing sit-down experience with a clean restroom, go elsewhere.

Cheap and quality food. I wasn't blown away, but I'd definitely come back to try other items in the menu. Ordered takeout, which was very quick. Had the shrimp dumplings, spicy wontons, sesame pancake with Peking duck, seasoned cucumbers, and taro bubble tea. The tea was bland. Shrimp dumplings, spicy wontons, and cucumbers were just ok. But the pancake was pretty decent. Bread was soft and dough-ey. Peking duck was tender, but seemed more like roast than Peking. Only minor complaint is not enough sauce.

Reliably delicious dumplings, soups, + sesame pancake sandwiches for embarassingly low prices. Seriously, I've never managed to spend more than $7 here, + that was for a massive spread. Crowded, stinks of frying oil, noisy as hell -- in short, precisely what you'd expect, while clean as a whistle. I stop by everytime I'm in the neighborhood.
The service here is atrocious. Everything on the menu is good though so I suck it up. If they could just hire some employees who speak English and aren't racist, this wouldve been a 5 star review.
Made to order dumplings. Had the fried pork and chive dumplings, sesame pancake and basil and chicken dumplings. Was good and got lucky cause wasnt very busy.

Cheap and gooooood. The boiled dumplings are like a dollar and the pan fried were $2.50. Nice and plump with substantial wrapper. Ordered the sesame pancake and got more of a sandwich, it came with pickled veggies (carrots and cucumber). Reminded me kinda like a vietnamese banh mi but on sesame flatbread....YUMMY. Got a hot and sour soup too, had leftovers for later that day. Total = $7 freaking dollars!

this place is ok.  the dumplings have too much dough for my liking.  I just prefer prosperity dumplings.  but this place has more space for dining in, and more options but the service was slow.  i say def try it, and let me know what u think :)

I'm not a dumpling monger so I can't comment on how thick or thin the dumpling skin is but I can say I was impressed with my meal. The bubble tea had a bit too much ice but was quite good. The peking duck sesame pancake was delicious and a bargain at $2.25, had much more meat than expected. The pork wonton soup was tasty but nothing special, and the fried pork and chive dumplings I ordered were quite enjoyable. I'm not a huge pork or dumpling fan but I will most certainly come back to Vanessa's. For around $15 my friend and I were completely stuffed without a single complaint about the food, something that is quite rare in this city.

There's nothing to be said that hasn't been said already. Great spot and their sesame pancake sandwiches are awesome. I remember before this spot blew up and it was half the size if you could imagine. It was a true whole in the wall and it was packed back then. Now it's just crazy. Good for them. This place is awesome.
We ordered things (2people) for 20 dollars and we couldnt eat all. Its a small restaurant always crowed. The food is pretty good and a lot

Its a shame they are called vanessas dumplings because they should be sesame pancake house. Their Duck sandwich is beyond amazing and so cheap. I remember when it was 2.25 and now its 3 dollars flat and still work every red cent. I thin their dumplings are great but no the best thing on the menu. Its cheap and good. Would highly encourage people to try it out. Go there with 6 dollars and order a sandwich and 3 orders or 2 orders of dumplings and try it out for yourself

Inexpensive meal. I always order their dumplings. It isn't greasy and tasty pretty good. I LOVE  their sesame pancake with duck, although it can get greasy. There's a lot of people eating and ordering here, so beware if you want to sit here and eat. It is always a smart way to call and order before hand. I always do that and then walk over there and pick up my order. It is also way faster. Also beware, if you order #2 pork and cabbage, make sure to check and ask if it is #2. They always throw in some pork with chives dumpling to my order. I am not a fan of chives.

I love their steamed vegetable dumplings so much that I am willing to take my whole lunch break to walk there, order, get food and walk back. Then I have to eat at my desk. I don't even care. I love that you can see them prepping the food behind the counter. And, if there is ever time, the place actually has space for tables/chairs so it feels a bit more comfortable than a food truck. I think the Chinatown location is significantly better than the Brooklyn location but it could be just in my head. If you haven't been, definitely try it out. The soups look good too but I've never tried them.

I've been meaning to go here for years - everyone I've spoken to about dumplings brings this place up. But I was disappointed -- the potstickers were chewy and hard, the boiled veggie dumplings were thick-skinned and flavorless. The only highlight - unique fried sesame-cake concoctions cut open with tunafish and veggies stuffed inside. Thank goodness the company was good.

I had never had a sesame pancake sandwich before coming to Dumpling House, and yes, they're as good as they sound.  A hot, triangular, sesame seed pancake filled with chopped pork, cilantro, carrots, and cucumber - yum.  I had this with the pork and chive dumplings (4 for $1), which were above average in my opinion, though not the best I've ever had.  My only criticism might be that the pork on the sandwich was a bit fatty.  The soups looked good but it was too hot to have one when I went by.  They do have some seats and tables, so sit down and enjoy!
No comment

Oh yeah I'm here whenever I'm near. The dumplings are amazing. I have been buying them frozen by the bag. Shrimp are my favorite, chicken a close second, pork and veggies are great fresh but I haven't bought them by the bag yet. While you are waiting to get home munch on the duck with the pancake. yum! Learn to say Ni How (Hi) and Chen Chen (Thanks) if you want the ladies to smile.

Incredibly cheap and delicious eats here. My only reason for 4 instead of 5 stars......well let's just say the dining area needed some attention the day I came. It was sort of gross to look at so my Lady and I took our dumplings and pancake sandwich to the park and devoured them. Seriously, everything we had was amazing- the beef sesame pancake sandwich, the pork buns, pork dumplings, even the weird sauce in packets was good. I got sad watching the monotony of the workers life behind the counter, but the food they are crafting is superb. You can make a helluva meal on very little money. I wish I worked closer to this place, I'd be coming here all the time.

I think I would have liked this place a lot better if I hadn't gone to Prosperity Dumpling first...darn it! On the plus side, while still pretty cramped, Vanessa's has much more room (not saying all that much) and a more extensive menu. The Peking Duck sesame pancake and the pork + chives boiled dumplings were my favorites. The hot and sour soup was decent but not at all spicy...(maybe they were going for temperature hot!) and the pan fried dumplings were a little too thick-skinned.
No comment
it is cheap but food rating were poor. It is not my cup of tea sorry.

This place has changed quite a bit, but there is no substitute for how full I get for so little money.  I always get the fried pork dumplings and a sesame pancake with tuna and the whole cost is under $5.  I always get frozen dumplings to go so I can make them at home! I am so glad they expanded the place so more people could come in and grab a seat, but you will find this place packed pretty much all the time.

I ordered too much cuz I couldn't decide. On a cool crisp Autumn day (or even worse, cold and winter) this is the kind of place that would save me. I love a good dumpling noodle soup. The food is totally solid, made to order, and value for money is off the charts.  Dumplings continues to be one of the best deals in NYC.  Service and atmosphere are not what this place is about, but get food to go if you want. :)  I had too much food for $7, more than I could eat.

The main selling point of this place is that it is cheap! So that is a big plus. Due to the affordability, it is usually pretty crowded, which means I hope you are doing take out, otherwise you'll probably be eating outside in the cold, or trying to squeeze in somewhere. Food quality is okay, good deal for the price but not amazing Chinese food by any means. I rate the overall frenzied experience 2 stars, but I can see how someone in a rush on their lunch break would rate it higher.

Better bang for your buck at Vanessa's (dumplings are 5/$1).  Tried the pork n chive and it tasted just like Prosperity on Eldridge ...and was just as greasy.  Anyone that yelps the ability to taste a difference either has the palate of Tony Bourdain or is a fibbin' tool.  Enjoy them both -  to go - since neither place has "ambience" or "seating".

$1 for four dumplings?! Um, yes, please! I've only tried the chive & pork fried dumplings and the cabbage & pork fried dumplings--both are tasty but I prefer the cabbage. The dumplings here are SO much more authentic than Rickshaw Dumpling. My only complaint is that the dumpling skin is a bit thick but hey, it's only 25 cents per dumpling. Great place to stop by if you're nearby and want to get a quick, cheap snack.
No comment
No comment

I dream about this place at night, especially the peking duck scallion pancake.  Moist, tender, duck with a sweet plummy hoisin sauce.  Wrapped delicately in a fluffy scallion pancake and garnished with crunchy cucumbers, cilantro, and carrots.  Top it off with some sirachi sauce and it pretty much makes my eyes roll into the back of my head.  The dumplings and everything else here is amazing too... and considering 2 people can eat here for around $8 makes this place even better!  I heart this place.

Loved this place even before they expanded.  In a way, I like it was it was just a hole in the wall, w/ just their standing counter space to eat-in, narrow storefront, view into the kitchen and backroom where all the dumpling making too place.  Was introduced to their sesame pancakes,  which are one on my top Craveable 5 Snacks List, years ago from a friend.  Use to work in the area so I'd had access to the beef pancakes, addictive vinegar soy sauce and pipping hot off the stove dumplings readily.  I don't like their boiled veggie dumplings, neither is their egg and leek pancake anything special.  Stick to what's advertised and what people are ordering in troves.  Soups are ok, but often resemble those free take out soups at your fake Chinese (fast-food) joint.  Hey, in their defense, sometimes you just want a cuppa to warm you up...on the cheap.  I get it.

There is a reason everyone talks about Vanessa's Dumplings...they are really good and cheep. Living in Chinatown there are a lot of little hole-in-the-wall places that sell dumplings. But Vanessa makes the best, in my opinion. And the sesame pankcake are very good too...not so much the pork ones. Now they have a location on 14th street too.

love this place... hate the lines and never enough seating, but that's what happens when you have a great place. Be prepared to take your food to go. Cant go wrong walking, shopping and eating, or sitting on one of the benches around the area.  The dumplings and sesame pancakes are amazing. the variety  makes my mouth water. I love them both steamed and fried and always take a bag of frozen shrimp dumplings home to make. The pork dumplings and the chicken are yummmmmy, the the shrimp still reign supreme. Get them steamed and fried so you can taste the difference. hmmmmmm might have to make a trip there this weekend :)

Oh Vanessa's... How long I have been coming here. Once a week, this is my go-to place before my bike ride on Thursdays. Super cheap, super tasty veggie dumplings. Also, the sesame veggie pancake sandwiches are definitely superb. I suggest trying the house-made kimchi. Plus the ladies here are hilariously awesome.

I had a # 1 which is "chive & pork fried dumplings" and # 26 "hot & sour soup".  The food was delicious.  But, I am now regretting not getting the frozen dumplings so I could make them at home.  So, I will make the journey out there this week to get my fix.

I was really craving some dumplings.  I used to love just paying a cheap amount for a heap of dumplings, but I think the memory was better than the actual dumplings I had.  I've never been to this place, but I don't think I really felt satisfied.  I was full, just not satisfied.  Maybe I should have gotten the sesame pancakes, but the dumplings themselves did not do the job in making me fall in love all over again with dumpling houses.

My Chinese family usually compares everything to a "we've-seen-better" standard.  But when I brought my mom and 2 aunts here, even they were impressed.  $20 to feed 4 people a VERY filling and satisfying meal?  (For the record, I generously paid!)  Even in wallet-friendly Chinatown, this is a feat.  Although technically Vanessa's is a Chinese joint, they serve increasingly diverse clientele, thanks to their proximity to the LES clubs and bars.  The beauty of this?  Authentic dumplings, noodles, scallion pancakes, and other great eats, freshly made on a continual basis thanks to the constant flow of customers.  You can even sit while eating, if you can snag one of the limited tables.  But local bar culture dictates that when tipsy, dumplings taste better while standing on the street corner, chopsticking attempts gone awry, sticky fingers getting in on the action.  Enjoy!
Wow 4stars? This place is horrendous. Skin is way too thick. Walk over to prosperity and see what a real dumpling should taste like.
No comment
I still crave their sesame pancake but the beef noodle soup is just average.  The beef was tough to chew and the broth lacked flavor.  I'll come back but only for the pancake and dumplings!
No comment

We got the pork chive dumplings, both pan fried and steamed versions. And also got the Peking duck in sesame pancake. The grand total was $5. For the price, vanessas is a good place to get full with pretty tasty food for little money. I brought my Chinese aunt here because of the outstanding yelp reviews. To preface, my aunt wraps her own dumplings and people like her coworkers and friends have asked her for lessons, asked her to make them, etc. We were both disappointed...

A true gem in china town. The dumplings are pretty good. But the sesame pancakes are amazing, stuffed with vegetables, sriracha, and hot off the stove doesnt get better. Very very cheap lunch. Great place to take friends who are visiting.

The dumplings here are cheap (4 for $1), but don't miss out on the scallion pancake with peking duck ($2.50)! There isn't much seating, and it fills up quickly during meal times, so don't count on getting somewhere to sit. Lucky, there's a park with plenty of benches just a few streets away.

This is a great little snack or lunch place.  It gets very busy but the turnover is pretty quick so by the time your order is finished, you've probably found a table.  The dumplings are good but not the best I've had.  The pork and chive are better than the pork and cabbage.  The pan fried are better than the boiled.  I was hoping they'd steam the dumplings but they do boil them. The sauce you put on them is a little vinegary.  Better than the dumplings though, is the sesame bread sandwich! You should definitely get one of these.
REALLY GOOOOOD!!!!  A real Chinese dumpling place.  I almost felt like I was in China again...Seriously, good cheap eats China style.  Loved it!

This place was my go-to dumpling spot as a young teen, before the dollar dumpling craze spread like wildfire. By the time the dust settled, this place had raised its prices and expanded from their modest storefront to a much larger space.  I haven't been back in a while, because....why pay more than $1 for less than 5 dumplings?

Place seems way overrated. Spicy wontons were pretty bland and had too little stuffing. Pancake with duck was a bit tasteless too and just way too doughy. Kind of a touristy place imo. Prices are very fair though.

One of the cheapest and most delicious meals you can get in NYC. Why anyone still goes to Prosperity Dumplings beats me. And not just because of the cockroach incident I had there (it probably walked in through the door - but still), nor the unshakeable experience of using their bathroom (or, moldy closet). Not knocking them - honestly I couldn't tell the difference between the food at Prosperity vs. Vanessa's - but the latter definitely wins on comfort and cleanliness (and, more seats!). Honestly, I can only assume that the reason Prosperity has 4.5 stars, while Vanessa's has 4, is down to some misguided hipster notion of equating diminutive and grungy places with authenticity. Eat here instead.

This is our go to place when we want a cheap satisfying dinner! We usually order pork and chive fried dumplings, sesame beef pancake, duck pancake, and we usually get the spicy cucumbers that are in the refrigerator with the beverages! We never spend over $12!
Delicious! Inexpensive! Reminds me of a fried dumpling place I went to in Shanghai. Bring cash (although they do take cards for $15 and up) and an appetite

This place is awweeesome. I keep coming back for their Peking duck sesame pancake. It is very greasy, but the pancake is fried and crunchy. The Peking duck skin is wonderful. The crunchy cucumbers add a nice texture. Next time I'll try out their dumplings. People seem to rave about it, but I say the pancakes are definitely another component that makes this place a hotspot. Oh, by the way its very crowded on weekends so don't expect to get a seat. The wait is not long.
No comment

Literally walked in off of the street.  What a find.  My shrimp and chive dumplings were not only cheap and delicious but they were enough to fill me up.  Someone with a larger appetite might need a bit more to eat but I would definitely recommend venturing into this place when you find yourself in chinatown

I was quite dissapointed. I got the panfried bun, sesame pancake, soy milk, and a cabbage and pork thing. The flavor overall is meh. They didn't execute the cooking the right way. I didn't like how they cook it and just let it sit there until somebody orders. The food was kind of cold. The quality of food was also not that great, the flavors weren't there. I'm sad this place was thumbs down because I was really looking for a good dumpling/bun place. But I guess i have to go back to china or california for them.

$1 for 4 huge, delicious, perfectly seasoned Chinese dumplings, are you kidding me?  The pork and chive dumplings are some of the best I've ever had.  I went on a Friday around 6:30 and there was no wait to order.  It took them about 2 minutes to freshly prepare the dumplings.  Vanessa's Dumpling House has easily become one of my favorite spots in the city--will be back.  BTW, the awning has "Vanessa's Dumpling House" if you are trying to find it.

This place is actually called Vanessa's dumpling house and is a really popular lunch spot so be prepared to wait. Unlike Prosperity Dumpling House nearby, this place had seating for ~15 guests.  We got the pork and chive fried dumplings (the tastest in my opinion), the pork and cabbage fried dumplings (4 pieces each), the chicken boiled dumplings (~6 pieces), a sesame pancake sandwich with duck (delicious!), another with veggies...these sandwiches are genious! A triangle of their huge sesame pancake is sliced in half and filled with veggies and duck or whatever. Also had two tubs of soy milk, and one tub of congee. All for $13!!  Wow what a bargain and great cheap eats spot. If you're lucky you can snag a seat in one of their tables (not that many). But if it's a nice day out, you could take it out to the nearby park to eat!

Beef sesame sandwich is so good, I could eat it every day!  The chive & pork dumpling is always a great pick.  And yes, you can eat like a king for $5.  It can get crowded at certain times but they're very efficient.
No comment

EXTREMELY cheap food! Sanitary. Cute old ladies rushing and cooking, reminded me of home. We were lucky to get a table. It's a little awkward if it's your first time coming because of the placement of the cashier at the end of the restaurant with everyone waiting near the door for their food. But it's definitely a place to eat if you're low on cash and you want a decent meal. The noodles were good and satisfying! Yum! It should actually be half a $. I bought wonton mein with warm soymilk for me and the same for my friend for only $9!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Cheap but not delicious. Not terrible just not flavorful. Come here if you're in the neighborhood, starving, low on cash and just want to feel full.

Visited Vanessa's Dumplings after a long, cold day of taking in the New York sights. I had heard on other message boards that this place was a great place to have cheap, good food. They were right. I had a 8 piece order of pork and cabbage dumplings, a hot and sour soup and a small drink all for under $5.00. When I picked up my order it was super hot and fresh and there was plenty of it. If you are in the area, this is definitely the place to go. Oh, and like others have said it is a simple place, not fancy, so don't expect a lot as far as ambiance.
No comment

i REALLY liked this place 2 years ago when it was a hole-in-the-wall, had no seating, and it was 5 dumplings for $1. Now that they renovated, changed the name from "Dumpling House" to "Vanessa's Dumpling House", it's just not the same. The dumplings have lost their luster, and the experience is too 'hip' for me. when i want dumplings, i want them cheap cheap cheap! quantity is key (with great quality) and this place just doesn't deliver like it used to. is it 2 star worthy? no... but def not 4.
No comment
No comment

My sister is completely obsessed with this place. They also have another branch on 14th Street but the food is not the same. I haven't tried any of the other locations but between this one and the one on 14th, this one is definitely better, hands down.

After eating so many times at Prosperity Dumplings, I decided that I need to give Vanessa a try, I mean it's only down the street!  Ordered the basics: pot sticker chive and pork, boiled dumplings chive and pork, shrimp wonton with spicy sauce, and chive pocket.   The dumplings and wontons are great, but for some reason it didn't give me the satisfaction that Prosperity Dumplings gave me.   The only thing that was disappointing was the chive pocket that the dough was not crispy, and the filling was a little stingy.  But over all, I still give Vanessa a four star for over all rating.  Having space to eat at is definitely a plus!
No comment

Delish!  Worth the trek downtown.  It is everything you want from china town.  They are some of the best dumplings I have ever had.  The prices are amazing; 4 huge dumplings for a buck. Best deal in town.  The sesame pancakes are amazing as well.

column3: Salt Lake City, Salt Lake City, UT
column6: What else can you ask for? Great dumplings at an awesome price!
No comment
No comment
I love this dumpling house but I prefer Prosperity's because they have more meat. Although this place has more room for seating and they serve good hong kong style milk tea.

Ladies behind the counter yell for your order and you better be ready or else they'll move on. It's part of the personality and atmosphere of the place though and I don't mind it one bit. Got the peking duck sandwich for $2.50 and it was fried right in front of me. Simple but delicious and filling. Best $2.50 you can spend anywhere.
Great tasting  dumplings! Cheap and yummy!  Great for snacks

Very tasty dumplings at affordable prices in a casual setting.  From the pork dumplings to a duck pancake, it was all very good.  Several tasty vegetarian options are also on the menu.  It would be difficult to spend more than $10 a person here on the food itself.  Yelp helped point me in the direction of this spot a few weeks ago and I am glad it did, certainly recommend it to anyone.

I live down the block from this place and always passed it. Decided to check out it because of the reviews from yelp and four square. Though I know it's Chinese foods, this place is quite inexpensive. Food was delicious, I was in a hurry so I just bought the dumplings, I'm very particular with my dumplings because you cannot beat grandma home-made ones. I have to say this place is great, wish the service was a a bit quicker just for 4 dumplings. Always seems to have a crowd, I would definitely come back to try something different. Like I always say give a place a try once!
Loving everything here.  How can you beat $3.50 peking duck noodle soups and 4 for a dollar dumplings?!

Fried Dumplings are good, Fried Pork Buns are good...i wouldnt go there for the Wonton Noodle Soup (there's more HK-style ones elsewhere) but overall a great place for a cheap dinner! Good luck getting a seat, this place gets BUSY! But people are usually in and out quickly! The sesame pancake I didnt rate so highly either - was a bit too "carb-y".

Long wait for totally boring dumplings that were bland and mostly flour with scant stuffing (I ordered the weekly special pork and shrimp dumplings).  The people behind the counter were also carrying on an argument amongst themselves. No place to sit or stand as the very few spots were filled up.

Literally speaking, there is no place in New York City  you can get more bang for your buck! For $1 you can get six delicious pan fried dumplings, which is the staple of this place. However, there are many other options to explore outside of the dumplings. A variety of different sandwiches and soups are equally delicious and affordable. $2-$4 for food more than enough for one person. I literally come here and spend $5 on food and drink and leave with a full stomach and happy taste buds. The place is small with about 4 or 5 tables, and a small counter for 2 or 3 people to stand and eat. I'd say it  fits about 20 people. You walk in and place your order at the register and food comes out in less than 4 minutes. It's a similar set-up to a fast food joint, where seats are on a first come, first serve basis.
Yeah so its cheap and thats why you sacrifice in quality and taste.  The dumplings mediocre and the sesame whatever also eh.
No comment

I checked out this place cuz it has many reviews from yelp. It's really cheap but the taste is just ok. Probably a lot of tourists came here and haven't tried really good dumpling before, it's over rated.
Best beef pancakes in town. Long lines, horrible customer service. It's cheap eats, what do you expect.
No comment

Yelpers! I always leave my heart in Vanessa's. Fast paced, little spot in LES/Chinatown. If you actually grab a seat you'll have a ball. I order right-a-way my regular sesame pancake with veggies, and 2 orders of chive and pork friend dumplings, plus ginger ale! The best part, I didn't waste more than 8 dollars! $. Bathroom is super cool(not in a clean way)
One of the better dumpling spots around.  Always too crowded to get a seat to eat in.

Found this place by accident while waiting for a table at the hot pot place down the block, and got an order of fried pork and chive dumplings as an appetizer.  The dumplings were served almost immediately, so fresh and hot that I burned the roof of my mouth, and were excellent.  They were perfectly crisp on one side, soft on the other, with a tasty filling--and at 4 for $1 it's hard to beat the price.  My friends had the steamed pork and shrimp dumplings, which weren't bad, but I'd stick with the fried.  Some of the other items being served (pancakes, etc.) looked great so I'm looking forward to going back and trying a few more things from the menu.

I probably like the dumplings at Prosperity better but Vanessa's feels so much cleaner and the availability of seats is a huge plus. I also really like the variety. I love the pork and chive while my girlfriend enjoyed the boiled, wheat, veggie dumplings. If this was up in Boston, I'd go as often as I could. Unbelievable that the food is so good and you can fill up with just a few bucks.

No doubt about it! Dumplings in morning for breakfast!! Haha can't get enough can't get enough of it. Pork n chives, pancakes, and more n more n more. For big portions at well well inexpensive prices that is extremely affordable! I luv it!!

Without a doubt my favorite dumpling house in New York. I am fairly certain they are pumped full of MSG, but sometimes that's just the price you pay. Faster than the veggie dumplings and equally delicious are the sesame "pancakes" (read: fried bread!) filled with julienned veggies.  I recommend eating them in the weird park the next block over between forsyth and chrystie.

We went at 11:30am on a Saturday and it wasn't overly crowded. The food was made to order and SOOOO cheap. I paid $5 and ordered more than I could eat.  There were out of a few things (including the pork buns) so it looks like I needed to go earlier for a weekend.

I come here JUST for their vegetable sesame pancakes. Luckily it's out of the way for me otherwise I would eat these every day! The sesame pancakes are fried and oily but their marinated vegetables w/ fresh cilantro makes up for it...right?!  It's one of my favorite things to eat in the city. And around $2 for each? You can't beat that!
No comment
Love this place. Especially recommend the fried dumplings and the sesame pancak with peking duck.
No comment

We tried the fried pork dumplings, the boiled shrimp dumplings, and the peking duck sesame pancake.  They were all okay.  I'd try other places before going back here.  The cost is mind blowing, but the food was meh.  I guess I shouldn't have expected more from cheap food.  I think the hot sauce and maybe the soy sauce are watered down.  I wouldn't mind spending an extra dollar to ensure my condiments weren't messed with.

Try the pork and chive dumplings- they're slightly fried with a nice crisp.  I also ordered the beef pancake which looked rather questionable and ended up tossing it.  I also ordered the shrimp dumplings which were decent.  I do wish they had spicy mustard sauce.
No comment

Potstickers 4 for $1 dumplings 8 for $2 sesame pancake with meat and veggies $2 bag of 50 frozen dumplings for $9! What can you not like about this place??? Oh right the Stalking and pouncing needed to find an empty seat, eh that's just part of the experience here at vanessa's!
No comment
No comment

The wait is annoying and tables are hard to get but it's so delicious and cheap!  The duck pancake is amazing, the steamed chicken and basil dumplings ($3.75 for 8!) are delish but I wish they would offer them fried like the pork dumplings that look better. I took mine home and fried them up myself. Make sure to get the kimchee too. Mmmmmm. The wait and lack of tables is worth it though.

I love this place!  Cheap & pretty good food & fast!  Honestly, could it get any better?!  Especially in this awful economy, it feels good to stuff your stomach with a variety of items for under $5!  The food is flavorful, especially for such fast food service!  Love it!

The dumplings were pretty good, definitely worth trying!! I ordered three fried buns, but they didn't have enough so they gave me 2 dumplings in replacement of 1 bun. The sesame pancake was really oily, but I guess worth a try if you're not afraid of the oil. =) I would definitely come here again for dumplings!
Good cheap dumplings. Don't go there for friendly service... go there for delicious cheap dumplings. I recommend them fried, the steamed ones sometimes don't cook all the way through.

Um are you kidding me? who doesn't love fried dumplings, they're so good! not to mention cheap. the sesame pancakes are good too. everything here is good. unfortunately snapple costs more than the dumplings. but you can still feed 2 people for $10. that's a win in my book. you might have to wait a while though, it gets pretty packed here.
Delicious dumplings and sesame seed cakes. Ridiculously cheap. What more do you need? I'm coming here to cure my next hangover.
Top of the line for cheap Chinese street grub fare. The only downfall is finding a place to sit. Good Luck!
I love that Duck Pancake. So delicious...

I use to come here all the time since they were still a small store next door, but stopped and went down a few blocks to Prosperity's. But I still come back here for their Hot and Sour Soup which I think is the only thing that's better.

Hands down best dumplings in NYC. There were a dozen of us so we pretty much sampled the whole menu, and no complaints whatsoever. good variety too, going from the chicken to the pork to the vegetarian, in soup or dry, with a variety of sauces. Plus service is super-fast and equally cheap. Best late night eat in Chinatown.

It was a very inexpensive meal. The wonton with spicy sauce was delicious. The pancake with Peking duck was great. The only thing I did not care for was the noodle with sesame sauce which ironically was the most expensive item that we had ordered.

Ended up here on a freezing night in December after walking through Chinatown and Little Italy for hours. About $5 fed 3 very hungry college girls. We sampled the pork & chive and the veggie dumplings. There's not much room because it's busy and there's always lots of people waiting so eat and leave or take out if you're looking to linger over your food. I can't wait to go back and sample some other items.

Cheap and very good! Definitely get the sesame sandwich (taste like jeen dui skin) and the pot stickers. Order at least two orders of it because its so busy you will not want to wait to order more. It's like a war zone trying to find a seat because it's limited. Don't expect anything fancy or even any typical server. Despite that, definitely come here.

Delicious, fresh dumplings.  I paid $4 for 8 whole wheat steamed vegetable dumplings-- and they were filled with real, delicious, fresh vegetables.  The pork and leek dumplings were also delicious-- and only $2 for 4 dumplings.  I wish they had more variety, because I will be stopping here frequently.

Haven't been here in a few years, but I can definitely say this place has left a good taste in my mouth.  They have a great menu, and I've never been disappointing when I previously visited. Besides their dumplings, soups, and sammy's - they have some really DELISH Bubble Tea's. I can't wait to return.
No comment

I love dumplings. Steamed, fried, whatever, as long as the skin is chewy and thick. Crusty bottom preferred. My father wanted some one day while we were in chinatown. Surprised to find that this is a popular place. Waited endless minutes to get the order of dumplings and soup.... And was TOTALLY DISAPPOINTED at how flavorLESS it was. Ugh.  Why is this place that great anyway? Where is the full yummy flavor I was expecting?
No comment
Solid spot for some cheap eats!  The pancakes and dumplings are pretty delicious and for the price can't be beat.
Best bang for your buck in NYC. $1 gets you four pieces of dumplings. The noodles are worth trying.
So. Cheap. Sesame pancake was pretty good, meat was a little lacking but for like $3 it's pretty damn filling.

I don't think my stomach can handle the amount of grease in pan fried dumplings that I get here [the skin is thicker and chewy and absorbs a nice chunk of pan grease], but they're better than Prosperity.  The peking duck sesame pancake sandwich was super delicious and it's so busy which means everything is....fresh...er? ?  Some guy came in with a craft organizer style plastic bin of shredded up peking duck which warmed my heart that small businesses were supporting each other [or he came from the basement].
No comment

Went here once with a friend and fell in love with the great food and prices. Tried a couple of different dumplings (I don't remember what they were exactly, since it's been awhile since I was there) and they were all pretty good. The place is tiny and its decor is far from "chic" (it's pretty much a hole-in-a-wall type place) but hey, for its price, the food is definitely worth it.
No comment
No comment

Great dumplings, I like the fried ones the best. Watch out for the mean lady behind the counter, don't get her upset at you or she'll be yelling for at least 20 mins, good thing I couldn't understand a word! We enjoyed our dumplings nonetheless. Definitely a stop when you visit NYC

Awesome!!  And dirt cheap.  Went here last night w/ my sis & shared a bunch of dumplings, bok chop and a sesame pancake w/ vegetables.  The sesame pancake was so good.  We tried the veg dumplings & the chicken w/ basil.  I can't wait to try the pork & chive.  Getting a table is tricky but so worth it.  This place is an experience!  Tons of tons of people come through this place too - a great NY cheap spot for goooddd food.

My sister and I ducked in here to get out of the rain, and were pleasantly surprised by the huge tray of delights we ordered!  This place is so cheap, it almost seems wrong.  We ordered a small wonton soup (which was actually quite big), a large duck noodle soup, an order of pork & chive dumplings, a roast pork pancake, and a black tea boba for only $11!   It ended up being way too much food, so I had my pancake reheated the next day- it was tasty, though a bit fatty.  The dumplings arrived piping hot and were great, really great, and the soups were rich, warming and yummy.  Definitely check this place out, it's totally worth it.

I always pig out when I go here. Everything I've had is delicious! And it's super cheap. I usually go for the assorted dumplings so I get a good mix. The pork pancake sandwich is one of my favorite items. The only downside to this place is you probably won't get a place to sit since there are only 3 or 4 tables and one small section of counter space if you want to stand. Just get everything to go and eat at home or in the park.

This place used to be a hole in the wall and they remodeled the place nicely so people can sit, though it's often crowded, a short wait will get you a seat. I love Vanessa's, I take friends there who are from out of town, broke ass pals or anyone who wants dumplings. I get hot and sour soup, a soda and a veggie scallion pancake and am out of there for less than $3. Top that, anyone in the world! I just wish they had fried veggie dumplings, which no one seems to have.
I'm not a chinatown expert, but these are hands-down the best dumplings I have eaten outside of China. The spicy noodles are also fantastic and the bok choy goes well with dumplings.
No comment
Awesome, cheap, fast dumplings. 4 dumplings for $1. Will go back a lot.
