Sesame pancake (plain or with filling) is so good right off the stove. (warning: it's cooked w/ oil). the wonton skin is very smooth even if the filling was nothing to write home about. The prices push them from 3 to 4 stars.
For five bucks, you can have a totally filling meal, and for ten bucks, you can pretty much try one of everything.  Totally worth going to.
No comment
I had the assorted boiled dumplings and a sesame beef sandwich. For $7. Delicious and affordable.

I don't want to give 5 stars away cheaply. I've heard Vanessa's was better "back in the day." I've heard "there are better dumplings in NYC." But this, for me, is hearsay. I'm into the dumplings - A-Ok. But I come to Vanessa's for the manna from heaven: the sesame pancakes. They are a clear 5 star food. And now I am craving them...
This place is amazingly tasty. The duck pancakes are a not-so-little piece of Peking duck heaven, and the prices are straight out of the 1940s... or China. Affordable, amazing food. I'm hooked.
No comment

This location was horible. Slow service, the dumplings I received after about a 10-20 minute wait were only warm, and the cooks were not hospitable at all. I went here cause a friend recommended it saying it was fast, cheap, and really good. I was dissapointed. Their other location by union square I was extremely pleased with though.

Amazing food for a really good price. Wait can be a little long, and ordering a little chaotic, but the spicy wontons are worth it. Hot and sour soup only so so. The sandwiches are really good too. Only big downside is there is very little seating and its usually packed with the hipster crowd. I miss on the LES and getting takeout.

If you want some of the best cheap eats in NYC, come to Vanessa's for some incredible dumplings, scallion pancakes, and bubble tea. You won't be disappointed! It will be dumpling heaven in your mouth.

On my way to work my $3 gets me 4 delicious pan fried dumplings and and roast beef sesame pancake sandwich. Add some hotsauce and your good. Don't go overboard and order too much because these two alone will leave you feeling full and sluggish while you attempt to digest while working. Lines are sometimes long but moves quite smoothly. Place seems  cleaner and roomier than their competitor on the next block.

I came here on a recommendation of a friend. Unfortunately, I did not have quite the love for the place as she did. First, I could have fallen asleep waiting for my order. Second, the dumpling did not taste good and were quite greasy. The sesame pancake was below average. I would go to prosperity dumpling over this restaurant any day.

Would like to give this place 3.5 stars but since it is not an option I rounded down because the dipping sauce could have been better. Actually I think you should be able to make your own dipping sauce mixture. At least they could have some different vinegar options, like ginger. Plus I don't feel so bad about the downgrade because the wrap consistency was not the best. But as late night cheap eats go it's pretty good.

Super cheap, yummy food.   Does it get any better than that?  The pork and chive dumplings were out of this world.  The pancake sandwich was made with fresh hot "bread".  I used it to soak up my dumpling juice and hot sauce.  Seating is limited.  Expect to stand while enjoying your yummy dumplings.  For the price it is worth the trouble.
Pint of Roast Duck Noodle Soup for $4 bucks on a cold NY day is all I have to say.

Not so much a House as it is a hole in the wall, but I'll take it.  It's dirt cheap for good food.  My friends swear by the fried dumplings but you definitely get more bang for your buck with the boiled shrimp dumplings.  They were savory and soft, just like they should be.  We also got the duck sandwich, which was good, but some hot sauce is definitely needed to add some pazazz to the food.  But $5 for dumplings and a sandwich is absolutely perfect for my broke ass.  Also, you should just go (if you haven't already which I'm sure you have) just because it's fun to battle over the limited amount of seating.  It's a battle to the death and I refuse to loose!

this place is always crazy packed with hipsters aka it's hard to get a table. The ladies here mostly speak Mandarin so it's best to use English if you're a Cantonese speaker. They serve fresh hot soy bean milk here. The dumplings are pretty good but what I really love is the pancake sandwiches. It's pretty greasy but the texture and crunch of the bread is awesome. Also food here is super cheap so you never have to worry about price. Cash only.

Not all that impressed with my last visit here.  Went with the #6 (basil and chicken boiled dumplings) and #11 (pork fried bun) this time around.  The pork fried bun was excellent.  But the dumplings were...scary.  There were huge chunks of chive in there, as well as chewy gristle in the chicken which had to be spit out.  Plus the fact they had an odd pinkish hue, the color of a newborn baby LOL.  I tried one or two and just had to toss them in the trash.

You will probably accidentally order more than you can consume the first time around because everything is so cheap.  For people who have never tried sesame pancakes (like me), I would describe it as a mix between bahn mi and navajo fry bread. It is good, a little heavy but worth it for the price.  Seating is a little meh, I will admit.  I am rating based solely on the dumplings and price because you don't go to hole-in-the-walls for cleanliness right?

Honestly, its cheap and delicious.  What more do you need?  Don't listen to the idiots complaining that it's too crowded there - it's crowded because they're amazing.  The shrimp dumplings are to die for!
No comment

This place has really gone downhill. Seems to have gotten a lot more popular over the past year and a half, and they just can't keep up with the orders. It was already a 5-10 minute wait before, now you can easily expect to wait 15-20 mins for your dumplings to be ready. It's clear they cannot keep up with volume of customers, and as a result the quality has gone down and their prices even went up! I now go to Fried Dumpling on Allen St., just around the corner. There are many better dumpling options now.

We got a meal for two for only $15 and still had leftovers.  Very unusual in NYC to find a place this cheap and the dumplings were very good.  Ordered the chicken and chive boiled dumpling and the pork and cabbage fried dumpling which was my favorite.  Its only $1 to $2 for 4 dumplings.  You must get the sesame pancake with roasted pork if you are a meat eater.  Like a grilled pork sandwich.  Love it.  Casual atmosphere, more of a takeout place with some tables and seats set up.  Worth trying

Where else are you going to stuff four 20 somethings late at night for under ten dollars total? Obviously we aren't talking high quality dumplings, but they hit the spot. The scallion pancake isn't the most flavorful thing in the world, but it will fill you up when you are in need. From a pragmatic perspective this place is awesome. From a "I want a quality culinary experience" perspective, you might want to do some searching.
$1 for four handmade dumplings? Can't fault it! Steamed ones are better than fried.
Ordered take out: Pork/chive dumplings, spicy wonton, and sesame pork pancake. Love all three!
Pretty good dumplings. I like the skins thinner but these are pretty tasty, hearty thick-skinned tasty dumplings.  And at 4 for $1 - no complaints!

Sometimes I feel so guilty paying so little for this food. Seems like everyone is working so hard to keep the line moving and making delicious fried pork dumplings and sesame pancakes. I've tried other things on the menu but keep going back for the pork dumplings and pancakes, nothing else. And don't waste your time trying to find a seat, just find a bench at one of the two parks that are close by.
Cheap, delicious & fast service! Can't fault these dumplings. Don't be scared away with a line up they get your delicious food to you in no time.
The cheapest of cheap foods. In Vanessa's vs. Prosperity, Vanessa's wins for sesame pancakes, Prosperity wins for dumplings.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Was recommended to my dining companion and I by his roommate so we decided to give it a shot. Upon entering I was pleasantly surprised by the large canvas oil paintings strewn about the walls in the small but ample dining space. We each ordered a set of steamed dumplings with a pre-arranged agreement to trade half/half. I went with the pork and he chose the chicken. Then we each added on a sesame pancake sandwich after seeing some fellow patrons devouring them as we waited on line. For drinks we went with bubble teas (my first taste of the trendy beverage) I chose almond and he went with vanilla. The order was made relatively fast considering the volume of customers and length of the line. I thoroughly enjoyed my dumplings and fell in love with the pancake sandwich. It lasted all of 3 minutes and I used the excess pancake bread to mop up the remaining dumpling sauce on my plate. As for the bubble tea I was initially in favor of the flavor and texture of the little balls (bubbles) that resembled marshmallows as I sucked them up thru the enlarged straw. However my counterpart did not share in my enjoyment and by the end of the meal he had convinced my taste buds to avoid the bubbles and just drink the actual liquid. Not an easy task considering I will eat/drink just about anything - ice cubes included. A major turnoff was the visibly watered down Siracha bottles present on each table. I found myself asking if the intention was to cut on food cost by saving on minuscule amounts of Siracha. If it was,  than they clearly are not in tune with the cheap impression it makes on the customer. This could've had a healthy 4 dumpling rating but unfortunately it loses a dumpling to a watery condiment.

Smaller spot but it at least has some (minimal seating). Was packed which I took as a good a sign. The woman taking my order was pissed about something (& she took my order wrong). We ended up w 1 Peking duck soup, 8 boiled chive and pork dumplings, and 8 veggie dumplings. Food was good but I found the dumplings a little soggy/ doughy. Prosperity Dumpling down the street is my preferred go to.
crowded with teens and 20 somethings, and cheap. Food was okay; I've had better.
No comment

It's so cheap you know those chinese people have to be laundering money but the food is good, fresh and consistent. The pan fried dumplings are reliable but if you are sick of dumplings try the duck filled sesame pancake, my favorite item.  The frozen dumplings ($12 for 50) don't come out nearly as good when you make them at home but still worth a try.
No comment
Cheap good food.  A crowded mishmash of, hipster bikers, old people, young, asian, non asian...  Can't beat $1 for 4 dumplings!  Sesame pancake is filling for the $, a little greasy though.
No comment
No comment

This place is the tits. and by the tits i mean the shit. basically its prosperity dumpling, but MUCH larger, so you can actually sit and enjoy your meal. It's still damn cheap, the place seems cleaner and more busy than prosperity. The beijing duck stuffed pancake was outrageously good, greasy, delicious and fatty - for just 2.25 thats a great deal. The potstickers are great as well, similar to those of Prosperity with a slightly thicker/chewier skin. It's a matter of personal preference, but because of the nicer interior and seats, I would go here over Prosperity

Is it rude to say that if you call dumplings potstickers you really dont have seat at this table.  Dumplings should not have thick doughy skin.  The meat should be moist not dry and bland.  I honestly dont get the line here everyday.  The noodles are not edible to any self respecting chinamen.  But they do have seats and i guess that goes a long way.
No comment
No comment
Cheap, good, effective.  Love this place.  A lot of fun.  Better than a soup kitchen in terms of value.

A friend of mine took me here for a quick bite the other day.  I loved everything.  I had one of the sesame pancake sandwiches, pork/chive dumplings, and the spicy wonton.  All where delicious and so cheap.  This place is a gem for quick good food.

Even after they recently raised their price from 5 dumplings for a buck to 4 dumplings for a buck, they are still one of the cheapest places that can make very reasonable tasting food. I prefer the fried dumplings over the steamed, but they're probably less healthy that way. Bought two bags of frozen dumplings to take home! They are huge dumplings....

We tried about 4 different kinds of dumplings here. Fried pork, boiled pork, boiled shrimp and the spicy wontons..The skins are thin and the fillings are tender. The fried pork ones were our fav but I would eat any of them again.
No comment

I used to love this place when I lived on Allen Street...you got your delicious dumplings quickly and easily. However, it seems to me the service has gone downhill in the last few years. I know, you don't go here for the great service -- you go for the cheap food.  That being said, there now seems to be no rhyme or reason to how the orders get filled at the counter.  My order was overlooked again and again; then the dumplings were dumped on my tray to get cold for another 15 minutes until someone decided to make my edamame (which takes about 2 minutes). Many people who arrived after me were served before me.  I'm sorry, but that's just stupid.
Hanging out in the city, we were famished and happened to get off at Grand St and walked in here. Ordered fried & steamed dumplings and they were delicious.
No comment
As if this place needs an extra review. Besides cheap- everything is fresh out of the pot and delicious. It's actually beyond cheap. $1 for 4 dumplings- where do you get that?

I've only had their pork and chives dumplings and so far it's good for the price you pay. It's similar to other cheap dumpling places..just more well known. Place isn't super clean but what do you expect from a super crowded cheap eat?

I have always been a huge dumpling fan and this place is one of my favorites in Manhattan. The prices are great and the dumplings and delicious. My personal favorite is the pork and chive, but I have enjoyed almost every type of dumpling they offer without regret (steamed or fried). The staff is like any typical New York small restaurant, either grumpy or extremely nice depending on their mood. Prices were very fair for the amount of dumplings you get. Overall, I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a cheap and quick meal.
No comment
No comment

Vanessa's dumpling used to be one of my favorite cheap eats. Back in the days, when they didn't expand the dumpling house nor have chain restaurants,dumplings tasted so much better. Dumplings were $1 for 5 pieces!!! Now they're $1 for 4 pieces. :( Beef pancakes were $1.25, now they're $1.75. =( Dumplings tasted much crispier and better back then. If they still maintained the price, quantity and quality of the dumplings, I would've given it a 5 stars. Still not a bad place to for cheap lunch, snack or dinner. You get every penny worth of food.
No comment
The beef sandwich is my old time favorite! The dumplings are great and can't beat the price!! Noodles just ok.
very nice place. Food was great and loved how fast it was. I had my first bubble tea there and it was delicious.
Very good dumplings and sandwiches. They also have boba tea. They call out your ticket and you can pick it up for there or take it to go. Extremely good value. I will definitely go back.

This is a larger, more spacious, and more well maintained than my other go-to, Prosperity Dumplings, down Eldridge St. But since it's slightly closer to me, I don't feel like I'm missing anything. Dumplings are a little pricier, but a lot less oily. Sometimes their crispiness is hit or miss depending on the time of day, but they're all hand made in the back room. Also the wide selectiom of other foods is great too. I love their hot and sour soup, and their sesame pancakes are tastier and (again) less oily than Prosperity's...but they're panfried dough so it's not exactly lean either. Service takes longer because this is a bigger and thus more crowded eatery. People often bring groups of 4+ friends here since it can accomodate.
I ALWAYS get the pancakes here.  Look at the menu, you are sure to find one that you'd like.  Been snacking here even before they remodeled and they have always been packed.

The dumplings and everything else is nothing less than incredible. If that isn't enough, the reasonable prices are refreshing for Manhattan, and that's what really keeps me going back. It's definitely small inside so sit in close with strangers and smile while you enjoy the amazing food. You'll love this place and want to go back.
Excellent pancake sandwiches and house scratch-made dumplings.   inexpensive and quick!   only downside is tiny spot, so take your order to go and eat in the park

Highly recommend this place for anyone in the mood for cheap dumplings. They're crave-worthy for those who love under the radar cheap eats. My go to: chive and pork dumpling. They skin to meat ratio is excellent, and you can count on the right level of crispness. It's an all cash establishment, but not surprising given the cost of the food. The non chive and pork dumplings are only OK. If you're looking to add some variety to the meal, I recommend the spicy wonton or one of the sesame pancake sandwiches (tuna, peking duck, or egg). Don't be intimidated by the long lines, even if they're winding out the door, as the line moves pretty quickly. If your order involves more than the regular dumplings and sesame pancakes (i.e. something from the boiled family), your wait is likely to be longer.

Ok when you go and eat there... BUT: dont order from them... they are unpolite, the delivery guy rude and pushing for higher tips even if yours is already very generous. They forget some items (happened like 5 times for me...). Id you ask for coke Zero, they will just give you randomly a coke.... or anything else. If you ask for additional sauce... you can wait for it cause it ll never come... Dumplings ok, but really the service is so terrible that better to order elsewhere, where people care about their customers.

A lot of people debate what's better: Vanessa's or Prosperity Dumpling.  I love both but I tend to go to Vanessa's.  They have available seating (though it can get a bit competitive during busier hours), which makes it a no-brainer on cold days.  Super-cheap and always great quality.
Got the fried pork dumplings and the duck pancake. Everything was pretty good. My friend and I were both full after $12, and we both had drinks too. Amazing!

In relation to the other big 2 dumpling shops, you're dead last. Your peel is too thick, your filling is too bland, your hot sauce is tasteless, and your dipping sauce...I don't even know. Shu Jiao next door is my favorite of the 3. Sorry but you can even tell by the clientele. Your clients are mostly non-Chinese compared to the other 2. Accept it or not fellow readers, that's a big negative.
Fried pork and chive dumplings were really good. Just got in and needed something refreshing. The cold spicy cucumber soup topped it off. Good spot for a quick lunch.

Not the best veggie dumplings I've ever tasted, but cheap and pretty good.  Unlike many of the dumpling places around, Dumpling House actually offers a vegetarian option (though the veggie dumplings are boiled in the same liquid as the meat dumplings).  If you're not into the multi-use liquid or waiting and eating in the tiny, crowded restaurant, though, you can always grab a bag of super-cheap frozen dumplings and boil / fry them at home!
No comment

Steamed dumplings and the veggie pancake are my favorites here-hot and fresh, made to order! Where else can you eat for $1-$2 and be completely satisfied? This place is great..sometimes the wait can be a bit long, however it's worth it!
No comment
No comment

With no fewer than 15 people working here at any one time, and approximately 35 people eating or waiting to eat, this place has no shortage of visible restaurant cred. It's active, orderly, and all about the food. After a quick wait in line, one can possess flavor-popping dumplings and a sesame pancake sandwich for less than a Starbucks cappucino. And it's 1,000 times tastier and more satisifying. The sandwich is my real love, particularly the pork, for its intense meat flavor, offset by fresh cilantro, hot sauce, and sweet carrots, all on a warm, airy, slightly sweet sesame bed. This is the kind of thing I want to rub on my body and attract good, salt-of-the-earth men, women, and dogs with. And for $2, I probably could use it as a daily olfactory bribe.

Excellent, ridiculously cheap dumplings and sesame pancakes/sandwiches. There are lots of options for vegetarians. We went on a weekend night and it was very crowded but efficient. The kitchen is completely open so you can watch as they cook. It's nicer than a hole-in-the-wall, but still feels authentic. The women who work there are a mix of very sweet and no-nonsense. There are a few tables, and chances are you'll have to wait for one.

SO DELICIOUS. The sesame pancakes are always amazing. The dumplings are delightful. The pork buns are made from bits of clouds from heaven. And the bubble tea always hit the spot. And it's all insanely cheap. Gets a little crowded, but it's so worth it.
Delicious.  Unbelievable.  The pancakes, the dumplings... all amazing.  and cheap...  They would be worth it at twice the price.
Pretty good dumplings and spicy wontons, passionfruit green tea was also OK.  Can find better versions of each in Chinatown, but it's cheap and good.
No comment
Sesame Pancakes with Duck are delish and only $2.50, I cannot wait to go back.  This place was so good, so cheap and very clean.
No comment

one of the best dumpling places around chinatown and I've been to all of them and I gotta say Vanessa's tops them all. Its always busy and crowded though and the dumpling ladies are constantly rushing out orders so dont expect a warm welcome haha.. but the food is amazing and dirt cheap!!
AMAZINGGG who doesnt love steamed dumplings and the smoothies mmm mm good!

Laughably cheap prices. And the dumplings are really amazing. It is seriously cheaper to eat here than to cook at home. My wife and I go here when we want to stuff our faces for 6 bucks total. Actually, I am literally about to go here right now.

It's good and crazy crowded.  No matter what you order you'll be satisfied.  I love any of their sandwiches.  The best part is you spend like $7 on enough food for 2 people, and then have enough money leftover to go outside and buy a fake Louis Vuitton. Awesome.

You can't beat the prices.  Food to-go is very cheap and dumplings to make at home (50 for just $9) are even cheaper.  The seating area is a little bit cramped and it gets a bit loud, but all in all its delicious food at a great price.  I would, however, avoid the "pancakes." They are a bit on the dry side and not really what i personally expected.  Could just be me though!

I love this place because I can eat like a queen for under $5. Which is great because I try to stick to a budget. I always get dumplings and a sesame pancake sandwich. The sesame pancakes are always fresh and fluffy. I highly recommend Vanessa's to all of my friends.

This place is a staple for us -- we are a family of five and can get a really filling and delicious meal for under $20 here! We always get dumplings (4 for $1), some duck sandwiches ($2.50/each I think), some kind of soup (everything we've had has been hot and wholesome), and a few bottles/cans of drinks. Everything hits home. I'm knocking off 1 star for decor/comfort -- there's no high chairs and it's pretty much always freezing. Would recommend whole-heartedly!
No comment

Very delicious. I love their hot and sour soup the most. It taste authentic and not watered down. The 4 stars is because of their limited seating area, every time I go there is usually no where for me to sit.
No comment
No comment

my god, can someone tell them to stop watering down their soy sauce and sriracha??  the food is as good as it was ~10 years ago when i first started coming here, but i can't eat there anymore.  the watered down stuff doesn't do the food any favors.  i mean, soy sauce is so cheap-really??
Chive & Pork Fried Dumplings that I ordered were pretty good.

For cheap dumplings, a good place to stop. As a broke ass student, it's nice and filling. And the quality isn't bad either though you could find better elsewhere, but for the fact of $1/4 dumplings doesn't give much room to complain about. I'm a fan of their dumplings, fried or boiled. Other stuff on the menu doesn't really appeal to me, but to each their own.
Very cheap and delicious dumplings with that Soup Nazi kind of vibe (the cashier's eyes will cut through you).  $10-12 will feed two hungry people.  Try the pork and chive fried dumplings
Top dumplings, chicken and chive were excellent.  Great cheap fair.  Good to eat in or take out.  Able to eat a full meal for less than $5.  Can't really beat that.

This place has great food. The sesame pancakes are incredible as well as the fried buns. On top of that, the value is unmatched. For $4 I can eat my fill and no other restaurant on planet earth has been able to do that for me.

Just went there tonight and was just amazed with the inexpensive meal I paid for. I would say that the zha jiang mian (noodles with beef and bean sauce w/ cucumbers) was a good pick; thought it kind of lacked the Taiwan-style or northern-Chinese authenticity that I'm used to home. The chive and egg pancake (jiu cai he zi), was alright but wasn't crispy as I like it. I will need to try the dumplings next time.

5 yummy dumplings for a dollar, how can you go wrong? Well, don't order the 3 pork buns for a dollar. They're actually better than the dumplings, BUT two out of three times, they're not fully cooked. But DO order the cucumber salad, which is amazing. This could be a five star take out place, except the ladies behind the counter are too hit-or-miss. I've learned to check my bags before I leave, because they often get the order wrong, and when they do, they can give you a hard time about it.  ...I wish they were open later!

Vanessa's is a MUST-GO. Simple as that. You can't beat the prices and the dumplings are really good. The pork and chive pan fried are my favorite-- 4 of these for $1. More seating would be nice but there is a park close so it's not that big of a deal. Next time you find yourself in China Town, you've got to visit Vanessa's!
No comment

this place has THE BEST dumplings I have EVER tasted!  a lot of people can't stand the smell but once they've tried it, they don't care about the smell anymore.  I have recommended this place and their dumplings to my co workers & friends.  this place is usually packed around lunch time, dinner time and still packed before they are about to close.  one advantage for me is that I live close enough to stop by before work (YES! they are open early) and get a few orders & take to work.  they are definitely the best cheap eats around :) A MUST HAVE & great find!!!
No comment

Great place to get your fried dumpling fix.  Limited seating= people hovering over you to grab your seat (hopefully, by then, you have already finished or almost finished your meal). Otherwise, yummy bubble tea and great fried dumplings. I've also bought their frozen dumplings (50 for $9). Yum yum yum!

I used to go to this place back when it was 5 dumplings for $1. Then again, it's still 4/$1, so not much of a change! The restaurant used to be just a bar where you'd order food by shouting a lot, then was remodeled with seats to make the hipster set feel more comfortable. But the food is still the same and delicious! When I used to live on the LES, I went here at least once a week for wonton soup and fried pork and chive dumplings. The pork buns are also good, if you can get them, but they're rarely actually being made (several people have to order them for them to start making a pan). Sesame pancakes are also delicious! I really miss Dumpling House.
No comment
No comment
Great sesame pancakes!    Their dumplings and tea are pretty good, too.  Good food at a great price.
No comment
ONE Dollar for Dumplings how can you go wrong but seriously it's cheap and good. overall everything is pretty good except for the noodles. get the pancake,dumplings, and pork buns all A+++
Great food! I love the spicy wontons, dumplings can get a little boring. I love the ginger hot tea!

Went here last night - looked on Yelp for a place near the Bowery Ballroom for something quick and tasty and was not disappointed.  The place was buzzing with all sorts - the atmosphere was great. $11 got us way too much food for 2. The wontons were perfect and the sesame bread was good. The pork buns were tasty. The shrimp and pork dumplings were a bit bland but at this price, I'd accept that. This is a perfect place for a cheap, quick tasty meal before a night out.
No comment
Awesome duck sandwich! Must-try.
Their egg sesame pancake is the best!! So filling and delicious, plus it's under $2! One is enough to fill me up!

Delicious and very cheap!! Food is quick and tasty. You get a ton of food for around $5. Pork dumplings and a sesame pancake sounds good right about now actually. Seating is limited and the bathroom is full of graffiti but it's really damn cool though.
Super good and bang for your buck! This place is never dead cause of its good prices and good food to compliment it.
Sesame pancake with Peking duck is awesome. The pan fried dumplings are equally delicious. Fast service and fresh hot food. Soooo good.

Can you say dollar menu? At Dumplin House nothing on the menu is above 3 dollats, famouse for it's fried dumplings.  This little spot near the park and hoston street is the prefect spot to grab a quick snack and sit in the park watching people play soccer, hipsters playing bike polo, or little kids playing tag.  Inside Dumplining house it is a bit dirty and sometimes it has a huge line, and I wish it was open late night... but overall it is a must try in new york.
Fast, delicious and fun. I shop for fabric in the hood and this is the high point of the trip-
No comment
Can't beat a dollar for 5 dumplings, I took one star away for the watered down siracha.

So far Ive been here 2 days straight on a one week trip to new york.  If that doesnt say much I dont know what will.  If youre on a tight budget visiting NYC (like me) this is a must.  Dumplings are good and filling... wonton soup is awesome, and the stuffed pancake with pork is amazing... just dont order the hot soy milk "soup" if youre expecting an actual soup...because its more like a warm bowl of soy milk... kind of what mommy gives you before going to bed.  Other than that, this place is gold... gonna head down there again for sure before leaving NY, for sure.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Oh, how I love Vanessa!!!  The dumplings are out of this world.  And so cheap. You'll find this little place on a side street in Chinatown and the seats will be packed at all hours, but do yourself a favor and wait, it is so worth it!!!  Simply marvelous!

Good, cheap and quick if you go at the right time of day.  Just a little hard to communicate and wish they allowed use of the service window (like they did when they were a tiny one shop deal and Vanessa was always at the window dressed to the nines) to make it easy to order and pick up while walking my dog.

This place is probably in every Lonely Planet, Rough Guide or other travel book out there, because it is always packed! It is a great place, cheap food and not too greasy, really enjoyable. I do feel like the dumplings and the sesame pancakes are the best, also really like the red bean bun. Anddd they make a mean strawberry smoothie!
I had the scallion pancake with duck which was good.  This place is really cheap and the decor is nice.
Cheap food, great price. Feed all your friends for 10 bucks. I have been here maybe 5 times and all 5 times I have filled my belly on about 5 bucks.
No comment

We tried the dumpling of the day and a sesame pancake with chives and an egg.  The dumplings could have been better although I appreciated the home made aspect and may have simply picked the wrong flavor.  Next time I will definitely try one off the menu, as specials are used for market research many times.  The sesame pancake was out of this world!!!!  It didn't even have meat on it, but would have only improved the flavor of this delicious pancake bread creation!  And the price is unbeatable for trying new food!  Definitely worth exploring!
No comment
Really good prices. The dumplings are really good. It's fine to buy and take to your house, the eating space is not great
Slow and uncaring staff. I ordered dumplings and at took 15 minutes. Go down the street someplace more authentic.

I don't get all the hype about this place. The dumplings are just okay. My experience was  a gnarly one when I asked for some information about the dumplings -- the server behind the counter seemed put off.Then, when I asked for a frozen bag of fifty bok choy and pork dumplings, I ended up getting chives and pork. Revenge for daring to ask a question of the annoyed employee?A mistake? Either way, I won't return. There are much better frozen dumplings at a place(that shall remain nameless) on Elizabeth, across the street from the Hong Kong market. (Hint--it's a block-through store with another entrance on Mott)
It's good but be prepared for a long wait and you will most likely have to eat standing up

Cheaper than cheap and delicious. I've had the pork and chive dumplings (fried and steamed) and the sesame pancake stuffed with beef. I love watching them make the giant sesame pancakes, which are eventually cut into triangles for your culinary pleasure. You have to be a bit aggressive to get up to the counter, and make sure to monitor your food being brought up to the counter, or it will be snatched. I've seen people walk up, put a couple dollars down, and take whatever was on the counter (despite yells!).
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Good food very good prices and Vanessa is a real person.
yum - i used to get the frozen dumplings to take home when i lived far away, and now i get to eat here whenever i want~!!

These days when I go back to NYC to visit, i go here because it is close to the bars on the LES that I like and it is open late.  Also it's slightly a more cleaned up location that can be more appealing to everyone.

wow, 1010 reviews.  the dumplings aren't as good as the ones my mother-in-law makes (i understand there's a bit of a question mark around whether one prefers their dumplings doughier or not) but a solid place to grab a quick bite, especially after a beer or five

My feelings remain the same for most part. Skip the shrimp dumplings. They're kind of bland. Always order the pork and you wont be disappointed. The chicken teriyaki is tasty but the lo mein's a little too greasy for my liking. Still, an excellent bang for your buck in the area.

Honestly, I don't understand why this place is always so full of people. I've had their dumplings several times (each time convincing myself that I'll like them better), and I can barely bring myself to finish. The skins are SO thick and SO flavorless, like eating cardboard. And the staff are exceptionally brusque and rude. Not worth it.

hold on to your receipt cause if you don't have it, they will hold your food hostage. mediocre dumplings and noodle soup, but cheap. you get what you pay for. the redeeming thing is that the sesame pancake is AMAZING. otherwise don't waste your time on this place.
No comment

I am absolutely in love with this place. I have visited the shop on 14th street as well, but this is my favorite location. The chive and pork dumpling (boiled!) are an absolute must: my go-to, every time. If you are a local/are staying for awhile, you can't go wrong with buying frozen dumplings. FIFTY pork and chive dumplings (do you know how many dinners that is?!) frozen for an even ten dollars; that's insanity. The pork fried buns are a must-have as well, three buns for $1.25 - the flavor that these three pack is amazing, they are never over-fried and have a crunch from watercress. I could eat an entire palette of them, they're so good. They give you soy sauce and hot sauce for the dumplings, but the flavor they have on their own is delicious. Also delicious: the hot date-honey drink for $1 ~ there is nothing better for a sore throat, or an upset stomach; it's a type of tea with tons of honey and infused with dates and nuts, which collect at the bottom with the honey. Delicious.

3.75 stars.  The Dumpling House is an excellent place to grab an inexpensive lunch or dinner in Chinatown.  They offer 4 dumplings for $1 which I think is quite cheap, but if you feel are being hosed, you can always go to Prosperity a couple of blocks further down on Eldridge.  I had an order of the pork and chives dumplings which used a thick wrapping and had a slightly drier filling than I would have liked.  Having said that, it was chock full of chives and appears to be more generous than their competitors in that regard.  I also had an order of pork wonton soup which was rather amazing; I especially liked the addition of fresh bits of ginger, cilantro, and seaweed.  Finally, I tried the Peking Duck sesame seed pancake.  Although it was an excellent item, I would have expected them to use a bit more sauce with the duck.  You can use some Rooster sauce to take care of the dry taste, but I wished that would not have been an issue.  Overall, for just for $5, I had an excellent meal that had a sufficient amount of variety to keep me entertained.  Strongly recommend trying this place.

I just ate some really good pork dumplings (4 for $1), and pork buns (3 for $2?? I forgot).  Cheapest prices ever, really good food, and the dumplings are pretty big.  I was eyeing a woman's sandwich that was sitting next to us....it looked pretty dang delicious.  I will be back.
this is my fave dumpling place. five for a dollar and i think it's really pork.

i'm roughly a once a weeker for the better part of a year now and for a good reason. great dumplings and amazing sesame pancake with pork. also, really good cucumber salad..  this has been my favorite dumpling spot for sure, **BUT** i went to prosperity dumpling down the street because of all the yelpers suggesting it...   here are my thoughts: prosperity has a different and possibly better dumpling at a cheaper price (5 for $1) and they have much tastier wonton soup. vanessa's however has a superior sesame pancake in my opinion (i love love love the savory pork variety) plus the extras like cold salads and a larger variety of other items...   all in all, vanessa's dumpling house is still at least tied for my favorite, depending on what i'm craving..

I just shared a feast with three people for $5.50.  I'm not religious, but dear God, I feel like I have sinned.  When you can get four fat scallion pancakes, a box of ten juicy pork dumplings and an overstuffed tuna sandwich for this price in Manhattan (even in Chinatown), it's like you're stealing... and of course the inexpensive nature of it all makes you prone to gluttony.

Swung by Vanessa's Dumpling House last weekend to see what the hype was all about.  After quickly looking at the menu I first thought that it was priced "per" dumpling.  Nope, Chive and Pork Fried Dumplings, five for a buck!  Holy s#!@ did I really just find one of the last few deals in NYC?   We also had the Peking Duck Sesame Sandwich, the price was right and it was very tasty. Some of the dumplings we had were a bit on the greasy side but I am not about to complain for the price.  Don't expect to grab any seats here, you can maybe hope to get a standing spot at the window.  Will definitely be back to Vanessa's to explore some other menu items.

This place is cheap but Prosperity Dumpling is cheaper and only like a 10 minute walk away. This place actually has a few tables so that might be worth considering. But unless it's 11 A.M. on a weekend, they'll probably be occupied by hipsters. So trek down to PD and save some money for laundry.

cheap. delish. filling. you gotta wait for a table to sit since it's almost always busy. Sesame Pancake with Beef or with Duck, dumplings with pork and chive, pork and cabbage. I prefer the fried dumplings. I get a small cup of dou-jiang (soy milk). absolutely a gem in chinatown.

too drunk to rate tonight but I'm gonna jump the first hurtle...get the shaved beef sandwich on scallion pancake for a $1.50, it's prepared kinda Banh Mi(Viet Sandwich) style ...that is all for now, you greedy muncher. smoke another bowl and hit the sack.
i was very disappointed by this place. the dumplings were just ordinary, and even though they said that they close at 11, they were trying to get us to leave by 10:15.

LOVE this place. One of the reasons I wish I lived in the city. I always get the fried dumplings (pork/cabbage + pork/chives) and an Iced Ovaltine. I've also tried the spicy won tons (which take foreverr...ugh), fried pork buns and various types of sesame pancake, which are all good and cheap, but I still think you should stick to the dumplings. This place is slightly better than Prosperity Dumpling down the block because it actually has at least a few tables (totally communal, just grub and go) and a bathroom. Sweet.

Dumplings were okay. Not bad. The dough was kind of think for dumplings. Usually the thiner ones are better. Service is terrible. Took 30 minutes for my dumplings to be ready even though there were only 2 people in front of me on line. Tables should have been cleaned. Over-hyped restaurant

Aside from the hand-made dumplings they serve, Dumpling House also serves stuffed pancakes, sesame pancake sandwiches, congee, and various noodle soups. The dumplings can either be fried or boiled and comes in various ingredients such as chive and pork, basil and chicken, or the flavor of the month. The sesame pancake also has various ingredients such as roasted pork, Peking duck, or even tuna salad. I decided to order the chive and pork fried dumplings, onion and beef pancake, and the sesame pancake with roasted pork. All the food is actually prepared in front of you. So see old Chinese ladies wrapping dumplings and using various machineries and wok to cook your sesame pancakes. The food isn't served on the finest silverware and China, but space is limited in Chinatown so you rarely see places with automated dishwashers. So I actually prefer the plasticware as it's usually a cleaner alternative. After biting into that first dumpling it was by far one of the best dumplings I had in a long, long time. The outside of the dumpling was cooked perfectly so that the dough was not too chewy and you taste the dough in each bite, yet it doesn't mask the flavor of the chive and pork. They don't skimp on the meat as every part of it is edible unlike some dumplings where it's made with that chewy fatty meat that you end up spitting out. The sesame pancake with roasted pork was also good as it is made with the mouth watering, flavorful, roasted pork that you find at every bbq house. Mixed in with the sandwich are pickled carrots and lettuce to balance the flavor of roasted pork and also adds a nice crunchy texture. The sesame pancake itself is coated with sesame seeds and is fried with sesame oil so that when you eat with your bare hands it makes your fingers a little oily but isn't overbearing or creates that greasy taste. The onion and beef stuffed pancake reminded me of the meat ball dumplings your order when you eat dim sum but wrapped in a doughy pancake. Overall the food was good but I wasn't able to finish it all which I normally feel guilty about for throwing good food away. But that guilt was mitigated by the fact that this whole meal only cost me $5! Yes, that's right $5!!! If this place isn't featured on Rachel Ray's "$40 a day", then I'd really have question her decision on picking places.
what more could you want?  the dumplings rule and the sesame pancake with duck is 2.50!!  duck for that cheap is nuts
No comment

Huge fan of this Vanessa location. Cheap pricing, sizeable amounts of tasty food, and quick service. Amazing coconut bubble tea. I eat there before I go to see bands. Minor negative is seating. Be prepared to stand and eat or eat outside by the garbage that's outside. Other than that, it definitely worth it.
whenever i'm here, i'm happy.  the dumplings are delicious as is the roast pork sandwich (sandwiched between layers of their sesame pancake).  one of the best cheap eats spots in the city!
Best dumplings and fried pancake sandwiches in nyc. Can't go wrong with the prices either.

their sesame sandwiches are VERY good and their dumplings are just a little below to other Chinatown dumpling contenders. the seating area is more comfortable than other dumpling places which make it on par with the other places overall.
So long as you're fine with junk food, this is great. The sesame pancake's what my friends got me, and it's huge and tasty. Quite greasy, but then, you should know better.

The only thing good about this place is that it's cheap.  Dumplings have the thickest skin with flavorless, unidentifiable stuff inside, vegetables are bland, and duck pancake sandwich wasn't filled with duck but rather duck fat.  Plus, it's crowded and the people who work there are totally rude.

An absolute fan of dumplings and all dumpling related items.  A bargain and a steal.  Four pork and chive fried dumplings for a dollar.  The menu is literally posted right outside so you can ogle before spending your hard earned pennies.  The restaurant itself is run like a fast food joint and is very crowded.  Although they have seats, its not exactly a sit down joint considering the crowd of hungry individuals.  The service is brusque and prompt.  Order at the far left and pick up on the far right when they call out your number.

I have no idea how the items on their menu is so cheap, yet, still have quality food. I don't think I can even find prices like this over her in SF chinatown. All their dumplings have a good amount of filling and tastes fresh. Beware though, rude and unfriendly cashier. I'll put up with that though for such cheap and good food.
No comment

If you have 5 dollars and are VERY hungry, go to Vanessa's. The sesame pancake with duck and fried pork buns are my go to, they are so delicious. Can't go wrong with the spicy wontons or the classic pork dumplings. I love this place.

From afar, sees big sign that says Dumpling House. Gets through front door, sees big crowd in front of a long counter and seating area. Walk walk walk to the back  of the restaurant and gets on line. The cashier speaks english, cantonese and mandarin. $12 bought us 2 orders of pork and chive dumplings (8 total), $2.25 sesame duck pancake (not recommended for very health conscious folks), 3 orders of $1.25 chicken corn soup (just right. not too thick), 1 order of #9 steamed dumplings. We crammed into a 2 seat table - the wait for the tables is maybe 5-10 minutes. definitely coming back here again - best dumplings in chinatown! Where else do they sell a pizza slice sized "peking duck" sesame pancake for $2.25 - pray tell :)

Four dollars.  That's how much my filling lunch at Dumpling House (now Vanessa's Dumplings) cost.  It's also how much I spent just getting to Chinatown for my cheapo dumplings, but hey, it's worth it.  While you might find better dumplings elsewhere, you sure as hell aren't going to find cheaper ones.  Fried right in front of you on the other side of the take away counter, Vanessa's Dumplings arrive hot on your styrofoam plate within minutes.  Not only can you see them fry, but if you peer toward the back of the restaurant, you can see several cooks diligently making dumpling after dumpling behind the glass window.  But how do the $1 dumplings taste?  Well, like dumplings I guess.  Frankly, I was too hungry to discriminate much on taste.  The cheap eats don't end with the dumplings.  $2 sesame pancake sandwiches swaddle tender roast pork, cilantro and shaved carrots.  The fried pork buns looked pillowy and delicious as well, and I had a hard time keeping my fork away from my coworker's plate (I figured that was out of bounds).  $4 and a stomach full of carbs later, I can happily report that I'll be back next time I feel the urge for a midday field trip.  Thank you, (Vanessa's) Dumpling (House).

OMG it doesn't get better than Vanessa's. My boyfriend and I went to the one in Williamsburg for three days straight when we were working in a studio that weekend. The food is seriously delicious. I love the pork buns and the sandwiches are fantastic too. I don't understand how you can get such delicious food for such a low price. Plus the people who work there are very friendly and have a good sense of humor.

I absolutely love this place. I used to come here almost every day when I was broke and unemployed. Can't beat the dollar for food ratio. Not to say the dumplings are lacking either. They are not the absolute best dumplings I've ever had but definitely in the top 5. But at this price you can't really argue. Their dumplings, both boiled and fried, are mighty tasty. I usually get the boiled dumplings. Note that they take a bit longer to cook than the fried dumplings. Their other food like the sesame pancakes and the noodle dishes are all really good too. Their noodle soups are simple, straightforward, and CHEAP. My favorite is the beef noodle soup. $3 for a generous portion of noodle soup packed with bokchoy and delicious beef chunks. Spice it up with a bit of Sriracha sauce and you're good to go. My only issue is that they dilute the crap out of the Sriracha sauce. So you see it come out all red and watery don't be surprised it's just them being cheap and cutting the real stuff with a whole lot of water. It still tastes great though which is what matters most. The seating space isn't too bad but this place is super popular so it gets filled up fast. I suggest you grab a seat first and then order if you plan to eat there. They do have a bathroom in the back but I wouldn't use it unless it's an absolute emergency.

Vanessas dumpling is a great place for cheap and awesome food. I stopped by there for the first time yesterday and had their sesame pancake with vegetables and eggs. The pancakes were really good and filling. Vanessas dumpling is a great place for quick, semi-healthy, tasty food.

Horrible service. I've been here a time or two. I went this evening and there was a dumpling shortage... at a dumpling house, no less. It would have been fine and all. I don't mind waiting. But (in hindsight) they made the sesame and duck sandwich (which is good hot) first and then let it sit for 10 minutes while waiting for the dumplings. When we got our food, while our dumplings were piping hot, the sandwich was cold. And ya know what? It's pretty dry when it's cold. You need to eat that baby piping hot. I asked if they could rewarm it and got yelled at in Chinese. Which pissed me off greatly since it was there mistake. I'll get my sesame sandwiches from the Dumpling House nearby instead.

you can't argue with their dirt cheap prices here, especially for the amount of food you can get with, let's say, $10 -- you can seriously feed three people with that much money. however, i do have to question their safe food handling practices because i pretty much threw up everything i ate there :(
These are tasty dumplings! Great for quick snacks on the go...I'm a big fan of dumplings whether they're fried, steamed or boiled...I love them all. This is a great find!

personally, i'm not a big fan of thick-skin dumplings so i didn't enjoy their dumplings as much as i thought i would. but their vegetable and red bean buns as well as scallion pancake were very good. overall, i think this is one of the best places to dine at in chinatown, considering the price value and authenticity of their food.

Great place for cheap eats!  Although it used to be 5 dumplings for a buck, 4 for a buck is still a steal.  It's changed a lot since I came here a few years ago - before, there was barely any room to even stand around, let alone sit.  Now, they made it bigger with a nice seating area, added more items on the menu, and changed the name to Vanessa's Dumplings.  It is still super crowded no matter what day of week or time of day you go, so good luck finding a seat.  Besides the dumplings, other notable menu items are fried pork buns and  sesame pancake sandwiches with beef.  I've also ordered a taro bubble tea here once, which was surprisingly delicious.  I have tried the noodle soup with duck and I wasn't crazy about it.  The soup was bland, the noodles were too thick, and there wasn't even that much duck meat, but what do you expect for 3 bucks?  It's best to come here for their specialties - dumplings and fried pork buns.
No comment

While I don't like the fact that every time I go there, there are less and less Chinese faces in the crowd, this place is hands down, the BEST DUMPLING HOUSE EVER.  The pork and chive dumplings are 4 for $1 and the sesame pork sandwiches are insanely good. I hope they never change their prices because this is one of the best deals NY has to offer.

The best dumplings I have had in New York! There is usually a long line to place the order and a crowd next to it for picking up the food, but its totally worth the wait. I took 5 of my friends there and somehow managed to get a table. The total bill was $17 and we were not left hungry!

I can't believe I have been in New York for almost two years and have passed by this place i don't know how many times and have never ever gone.  My friends talk about it all the time.  SOOO they finally dragged me last weekend.  Such a great deal. As  I'm not the hugest dumpling fan, I wouldn't intentionally seek them out. I was shocked when they were so delicious. I think you get several for a dollar.  Its basically order, then sit down and they call you up and you pick up the order. Two of us ate more food than we knew what to do with for $10 that included a water and a honey tea which was really syrupy.  The Hot and Sour soup was flavorful but could have been hotter...I added some heat and after that was perfection.  I'm a fan for sure.  The only missing star is for lack of any discernible ambiance (naturally if it keeps the prices as low as they are i'm all for it).  I'm just curious who Vanessa is....?
Best dumplings in Chinatown, NYC.  Unbeatable prices in their menu.  Nuff' said.  Come eat here now because everyone else is.

Pretty decent dumplings at reasonable price! Apart from the dumpling, the wanton in spicy sauce and sesame pancake are also quite good. I like that the pastry is not too thick (unless many Chinese take out joints), the fillings is juicy and tasty. The best I've had in NYC so far. The wait is a little long but it's worth it.
Great food for an extremely low price! It would be 5 but the only problem is that its to small and hard to get a seat.

even if you arent in the mood for dumplings you should go here for cheap chinese soul food! the noodle soup with roasted duck rocks! and of course, the dumplings are authentic for a great price! just an order of dumplings is very filling!

I don't see the fascination with these dumplings. I've got to admit the dumplings are really cheap but that's about it. The place is small and with only 6 tables they made available to their customers, most people are eating on the sidewalk. I'm no expert at making dumplings but I've had the fortune of eating varieties of them. Compared to the really good ones that I've had, the dough on the dumplings are too thick. Maybe that's why it's low cost, cause you are filling up on dough. The soup inside the dumpling lacked favors. Personally, I think that the dumplings should be small and bite size. You just throw one in your mouth without having soup dripping all over you. Personally I find it pretty hard to use my chopsticks, hold a container, and try to avoid dripping sauce all over my shirt and enjoy my meal. For a dumpling house, I only liked their dumpling sauce and the sesame pancake. There are other places in NY that have better and cheaper dumplings.

$1 for 4 dumplings. Can't get better than that? Uh yeah you can. Prosperity's is down the street and it tastes so much better. But Vanessa's not bad either. It's just not as flavorful as I would like.

I went to this place a few times. Yes, sometimes it can be busy and you have to wait. However, if you are waiting and only ordering dumplings than your wait time should be quick, unless they ran out of dumplings. There are sometimes no people there like on a saturday afternoon. There seems to be a lot of tourists coming to this place. There are also local Chinatown people there ordering food. When you order soup, your order will take longer like 10-15 minutes for wonton soup. I order the fried pork and chive dumplings and the fried pork buns. They were warm and delicious. I also tried the sesame rolls which were warm and tasted buttery. I tried the wonton soup and the roast pork with noodle. They put it in a plastic container and it was very hot. You have to wait for awhile for it to cool down before you can eat it. The roast pork was very delicious. The spicy wonton soup was also delicious. I guess the prices are higher than prosperity dumpling. The place is bigger with more seating options. I haven't tried Prosperity dumpling yet.

God I miss this place. I used to live on Broome Street and Dumpling House was a regular spot for me and my roommate. Even the gruff, unhappy cashier was all part of the ambiance. I never visit NYC without coming back here.
Another favorite touring band spot. Pretty good and CHEAP! As in a-big-tasty-meal-for-four-dollars cheap.

Vanessa's is amazing. The dumplings are all delicious and it is so cheap! There are also sesame pancakes and some side dishes for those who are less dumpling-inclined, but the dumplings are what's best. This location is better than the other one.
Yummy Dumplings and Super cheap.  Usually has a long line, but it moves fairly quickly,  It doesn't have much of a seating area so I usually get mine to go.  Definately worth the trip!
Look you can get a full on meal here for $3. Also it's very fun to watch confused first timers/tourists try and deal with the frantic winner-takes-all approach to ordering and getting your food.

Excellent food, great service.  The pancakes are great for the price.  The dumplings are served hot and fresh.  The ginger honey drink was too good for the price.  Worth the visit. Seating is limited.
tough to say more about what a great place this is. walk in prepared for the experience, and the wait, and the limited seating, and then melt as you have the dumplings and sandwiches.
No comment
move over cheese slice, the sesame pancake has arrived. for the price, you can't beat the dumplings either.

oh yes!! the pan fried dumplings here are the bomb!!  and trust you me...it's cheap!!!  when i mean cheap it's cheap...for like a less than 2 dollars, you get 4 pretty decent sized dumplings!  It's not the fanciest of places, I'm guessing this is how they keep the cost low.

Not the best dumplings in the world, but they are decent and for only $1 you can't really complain. I was a little disappointed that the sesame pancake was more like bread and not like the thin, flaky pancake I was expecting.  It was still delicious though. It's usually crowded but the line goes quickly and there's a nice park nearby with benches if you can't find an open table inside.
Great dumplings at cheap prices. They also have a ton of variety for vegetarians, and other little snacks in addition to the dumplings. Love this place!

I discovered this place when I use to work in the area years ago.They use to be a little hole in the wall with long lines going out the door and no seating any where before they renovated the place. It was my favorite dumpling place until I discover Prosperitys Dumpling a block away. The dumplings just doesn't taste as good as they use to make it. They still make awesome beef pancake, wontons and sweet & sour soup.
You get what you pay for and more here. The duck pancake is a hidden gem but everything else is what it is-cheap eats in Chinatown. Efficient kitchen with no nonsense workers.
Cheap food, good food. Wish there was more seating. The restroom is a trip.

Cheap eat and best deal for dumplings, buns, and soup in the Manhattan. Not only its cheap and great eat the foods are well prepare and quick too. yep!  $5 all you can eat to pay for your meal which can fill your big stomach. The dumplings you can get three for just a single bill w tax free, the roast beef cake which costs u for just 1.75 and the pan fried buns are nice as well. Small and crowded area to wait and seats are usually limited that ppl are fighting over the seats. So yea when I am thinking to order dumplings for take-out for the day i definitely thinking of this spot. Take out fans here!!
We love this place. Try the fried dumplings and the wonton with spicy sauce.

Visited for the first time this week and had the egg and chive pancake and the mixed fresh veggie pancake, which were from two different parts of the menu. The fresh veggie pancake had a thicker crust and was fine, but the egg and chive pancake was more like a crepe, and at $1.50 a real value...no need for soy sauce or any other condiments. It was wonderful and also nutritious.

Ahh Dumpling House! I finally went to Dumpling House today and their dumplings are not amazing, but they're very cheap and they were not so bad belive it or not. I got 1 order of Chives and pork dumplings, 1 order of pork buns and wonton soup. Dumplings and pork buns were very good, wonton soup not so much. They put too much cilantro all I can taste is cilantro nothing else. It was my first visit today but I think Iam addicted to their dumplings, Iam craving one so bad right now. In terms of service, th e lady there freaks me out but it's dirt cheap so no complaint there. I have a question, do they use MSG? to me it seems like they do. I always get thirsty after eating foods that have MSG in em.

Vegetable Dumplings.  The dumplings here are my favorite in NYC, and I have been eating here nearly once a week for the past 3 years.  They are always perfectly boiled and have a variety of greens, tofu, and mushrooms inside.  Great value: $3.  Friends really like their pork dumplings, and the sesame pancake sandwich is a great choice too.  All cheap.  Prices increased when they renovated last year, but its still ridiculously cheap compared to eating ANYTHING two blocks over on Orchard.

vanessa's dumpling house is a place you go to dine out when you're between jobs. for less than $5, you can get a meal out & while  no one working there speaks much english & sometimes has a hard time understanding your inquiries about the menu, you will be really hard pressed to beat their prices. i am a fan of their dumplings personally. i just wish they made more veg options.
No comment

this place is cheap!!! You can get a meal for $5 or less and be satisfied! I ordered the sesame pancake w/ roast beef, pork and chive dumplings and wontons w. spicy sauce. The sesame pancake was delicious, i almost wishes i ordered 2 of them! The wontons were really good. Loved the sauce, and yes it was spicy but "doable." The dumplings however were just ok for me. I've definately had better. maybe i'm spoiled since i live in flushing close to many dumpling spots!

Good dumplings, but not as great as I expected (maybe because of the incredible buzz about the place and the subsequent build-up). The dumplings are good and astonishingly cheap. The restaurant is small, seriously over-crowded, very chaotic, and the restroom is a filthy horror. But again, it's all about the dumplings

The food is delicious and really cheap. On the other hand, friendliness is not something you'll find here. The lady taking the orders was extremely rude and very angry for no reason. If you don't care for decent treatment, then you have a 5-star rating. I, however, think a smile and a thank you go a long way. Will I go back to this place? If I'm in the neighborhood and have absolutely nowhere else to go.
Cheap and tasty says it all.  Go for the fried although the steamed were decent, just plain in comparison.
pretty competent awesome authentic chinese. a serious compliment coming from a chinese who's tried 90% of chinatown's restaurants (even the rinky dink ones).
Don't know what I could say that no one did but so much food for such a little price at this kicky hole in the wall. Fresh fast and yummy!

When I first moved to the LES, I was desperately looking for cheap places to eat in the area.  I ventured into Dumpling House for the first time, about two years ago, before their major renovation/expansion.  Simply put, they offer the best food for the best value.  Their menu has expanded recently, but I still order the same thing every time I go: Fried Pork Dumplings with Chives.  Sometimes, instead of chives, I have the dumplings with cabbage; a slightly sweeter and milder flavor.  The Peking duck sesame pancake sandwich is also incredible.  They use a home-made hoisin sauce on it, which is absolutely delicious.  I used to eat at Dumpling House several times a week, when I was hurting in the funds department, but I limit myself, now, to only a few visits a month.  It's not something that you can eat every day, I've realized, and every time I dine here, I savor every last bite.  Best dumplings, period.

If your looking for a charming place to take a date, don't go here. I feel like alot of people are turned off by the lack of style--however when you can have a filling dinner for 4 dollars you stfu. Seriously- excelent dumplings for very little money, quick eats and absolutely unbeatable prices. Also try the pancakes, quite good as well.

Believe the hype!  This place has great food for pennies.  My favorite is the sesame pancake with duck.  Excellent and costs something like $2-3. Amazing!  Getting a table is virtually impossible because it's place is constantly busy. The food is worth all the aggravation.
Never had anything else but dumplings here, only two visits. It's cheap, quick, and tasty. Not sure if there is anything else to say about this place.
Dumplings aren't the best but good enough especially for the price. Wish they didnt water down their hot sauce! Their bubble milk tea is good!

why bother leaving a review when 741 other people already have? because vanessa's is quite simply one of the quickest, most inexpensive, homemade, delicious, satisfying and did i mention inexpensive meals available on this global experiment of an island. grab a $10 bill and a couple of friends and offer to treat. you'll leave with a full stomach and change.

Incredible dumplings- unique, delicious, steamy and filled to the brim with goodies. Unbelievably unfriendly service. Left the dinner time rush almost in tears on my last visit. Are the dumplings worth the emotional strain? I'll have a friend fetch Vanessa's takeout next time.
The pork wonton soup was bland and the wait for ordering it was long.

I'm confused with the reviews.  The dumplings were not that amazing at all.  Fried dumplings should have a crispy THIN skin.  But these dumplings have a really thick doughy outside and not that flavorful inside.  The sesame sandwiches were also lacking in flavor and the almond smoothie I had was icy and not creamy at all.  Do yourself a favor and don't let the reviews hype this place up!

Despite the limited seating and line to wait in, the dumplings are delicious and filling. I ended up taking the large majority of my two orders home (shrimp dumpling and pork w chives) partially because I felt bad for others standing and eating and because I was too full to finish. You get to see most of the food made right in front of you as you wait in line - so that is always comforting. The women working the line are pushy when you are ordering but efficient. Prices are awesome, just beware they have a $10 minimum for credit cards which is surprisingly hard to reach.
Great place to grab some quick eats and good asian food in the area.  Really cheap for the food.  It's usually packed and hard to grab a seat though.

I saw that this place was highly rated so we decided to try it today. The woman was screaming numbers that no one understood and then yelled at customers for "not listening". The food was mediocre. It is cheap but tastes cheap. The sesame sandwich was tasteless and had barely any meat. The only thing that was worthwhile was the mango tea. If I'm around the area again and hungry...not stopping. Though I'm American, I was raised on authentic Chinese from scratch and directed to the best unknown places. This was fluff that probably received high ratings from those unaware of the amazing culinary possibilities of Chinese cuisine. We stopped at a hole in the wall not too far away and they had the best stuffed sweet bread that brought me to my happy place...90 cents people. Go elsewhere for those who actually know Chinese cuisine and what it should taste like. I don't care if it's cheap it needs to be good.

I've been going to this place since it opened and I still love it. The price is great and the pancake with beef is to die for. I can't understand what some other reviewers are complaining about. If you don't want  a little grease don' buy fried dumplings get their boiled instead.

Boiled vegetarian dumplings are delicious but take 8 minutes.  That's the longest you'll wait for anything.  2.50 for 8 of them is like stealing.  My boyfriend likes the fried pork dumplings, 4 for a dollar.  We both like sesame pancake sandwich.  This is a cafeteria atmosphere.  Go in, get cheap food, eat food, and get out! Great for quick, cheap, filling, lunch.

Stopped in last night before a drinking session at Fontana's across the street. This place had come highly recommended, and while I certainly can't complain about the food or the value, I found it a frustrating experience. This place was packed to the gills. There was nowhere to sit, or even stand. We ended up taking our food across the street and eating in the bar. It also took them a long time to serve us our food, which I found odd because they have these dumplings constantly on the boil. It's not quite like they're made to order. Still, the dumplings were tasty, and the price was right. I subtracted one star for the crowding and slowness.
No comment
best value in NYC  great food. limited seating ,park is nearby
No comment
Very busy but worth the wait. The Sesame pancake with duck and dumplings are amazing. I definitely recommend.
This is one of my favorite places to go in LES. Can't beat cheap food that is GOOD. My fave is the pork and chive dumplings. This place can get pretty busy but it's worth it!

It is a requirement for anyone in the city to stop by this dumpling house!!.. probably one of these best dumpling joints around in Chinatown. You literally can just spend $5 bucks and you got yourself a full meal!! I would highly recommend the duck pancake and hot and sour soup!! they are to die for!! The wait might be long, but it is worth it and could be packed at times, but why wouldn't it I mean the food is amazing!!

I've heard a lot of good things about Vanessa's Dumpling House but I wish most of them were true. I've tried most of the dumpling in or around Chinatown and their dumplings are good at best but normally adequate. When I go to a dumpling house, I'm going to judge them on their dumplings despite having a menu of over 20 items. The skin is too thick, the filling is too dry and there is very little crisp to the skin. Their other hot item, the sesame pancake with your choice of meat, is meh. For better food go to Prosperity Dumpling 2 blocks away though Vanessa has better decor and a large sitting area, that is if you can find an empty seat, if that's important to you.

The food may be cheap and decent but the manager is the unbearable to talk to. She told me "The delivery man is "free-lance" so it's up to him whether or not he is willing to deliver to NYU and 120 dumplings is so little to their business they don't care for us..." I cannot believe she said that to me. What type of manager says that to a customer?!

Even though the dumpllngs arent as good as Prosperity, I give Vanessa's one more star because I dont feel like afraid to sit and eat there like at Prosperity.  Vanessa's has a decent sized seating area, even though you will be close enough to strangers that you can hear their every breath.  If you have a low tolerance for people, then maybe get your items to go.  I heard all about the 2 year order of protection the girl on my left got against the guy she occasionally lets stay over to "talk" and the law student's hilarious teacher- c'mon, for those of us who have been through law school we know the teacher isnt hilarious unless you are a suck up.  Anyways, I digress.  The sesame pancake with veggies was amazing.  Warm bread, fresh veggies and a hint of soy sauce for $1.75? Yum! I think it would be great with pork too.  The dumplings arent as good as Prosperity, but for a dollar who cares, they are good enough!

Floors covered in film and filth. A sort of localized fetor. A sign on the bathroom door that says it's out of service. Tables covered in bits of food, more film. Dust all over the floors. Someone called and the lady near the counter yelling, 'no no! we're closed. we're closing. [pause]. no! we don't have any more soup'. Bottles of what seemed like diluted sriracha, old bits caked around the top. We waited about 20 minutes for our order. Sat at a small table near the front, then switched to a larger one after some people left. A few other sets of people came in and more shouting at them, 'closed closed'. The food smelled funky, some of it was hot some wasn't. About all that could be said of was that it's cheap. One of the ladies to my right swept the floor, flinging bits of dust towards our feet. They overturned the chairs and set them on the tops of the tables after spraying them down with 409. We stood outside for a minute and those near the back took out a floor broom and put it in the cooking surfaces, which were filled with a green liquid, then scrubbed the back metal surfaces with it. Buckets of hot water and thrown onto those same metal surfaces.
nothing special anymore, dumplings are just ok and sesame pancake is too greasy for my taste, the only good point is the price, but you can find much better options in the neighborhood
cheap, tasty, bring cash, do takeout... I can't really add more than what hasn't already been said

Decided to try this place to see if the dumplings were worth all the hype.  The fried pork & chive dumplings weren't bad...the skin is a little bit on the thick side and the meat was a little on the dry side, but overall I did enjoy the dumplings and thought they had a good taste.  I also had the fried pork buns and the "popular" duck sesame pancake.  I thought the fried pork buns tasted pretty good, but didn't really care for the sesame pancake.  The pancake was very, very thick and had a bread like texture that I didn't enjoy.  Also, I didn't expect the duck to taste sweet...I think hoisin sauce or something similar was put on there.  So all in all, I would definitely come back to Vanessa's Dumpling House again for the fried dumplings and the fried pork buns.  FYI: watch out for the long line at this place...it's always crowded.  If you don't feel like waiting in line, I would recommend going to Prosperity Dumpling House a few blocks down.  That place is a lot less crowded and has dumplings that are even tastier (in my opinion) than Vanessa's dumplings.

Ever since I moved away from NYC, this is the one of the few restaurants from home that I truly miss.  Vanessa's Dumpling House is always one of the first places that I stop by when I go home every time.  You can't find any other place in Chinatown that ha better dumplings.  The dough is not too thick and the inside is not too oily.  Many dumplings in Chinatown have those two problems.  The dumplings at Vanessa's are perfect.  A perfect dumpling with the perfect amount of crisp to it.  Besides the dumplings, they offer sesame pancake sandwiches and noodles (soup and stir-fry).  The sesame pancake sandwiches are amazing and they have several selections (ham, duck, pork, roast beef) and makes the perfect compliment to some dumplings.  (My favorite is the roast beef sandwich).  Looking at the menu, there is not one thing that I don't like, there is not one thing I don't like and none of the items are going to empty your wallet.  For about $4, you can get a nice tasty sesame pancake sandwich with a side of dumplings and a drink.  You can't beat that anywhere else.  Just one con about Vanessa's is that it is always crowded and hard to get seats if you want to eat there.  But  I would just take the risk since this place is definitely a must visit if you're in the neighborhood.

As we walked in the door of Vanessas, the first thing we noticed was the sheer (somewhat-controlled) chaos that is the inside of this place.  People everywhere--at tables, in line, waiting for their food--it felt more like a packed subway train during rush hour than a restaurant.  I was unsure, though, whether it was the quality of food, or the ridiculously-low prices, that drove people to this small shop en masse.  My conclusion?  It is both.  Certainly this is one of the best deals in New York--who would have thought you could get a full meal for less than $5 (restaurants with clown mascots excluded, of course)?  As a larger group, we decided to try a little of everything--dumplings, pancakes, and buns.  Everything was fantastic--the dumplings were savory, the vegetables were crisp and fresh, and the buns were unquestionably authentic.  I would pay double their prices for any of it (but don't tell them that!).  The drawback is that it is both small and popular (=crowded) but the consolation is that you can watch them make the dumplings while you wait in line.  A true NYC experience!
