Canal street market is that place you go to not only escape the canal street hustle and craziness but to relax and grab something good to eat from a good variety of vendors. Def my place to eat and chill when I'm soho

The food court at the Canal Street Marketplace just recently opened and got to check it out. The place is brand spanking new so it's clean and pretty hipster. I wanted to try the ramen, which is by ippudo, but going to save that for a colder day. There were a number of other fast casual oriented choices with a seating area in the back. Ended up at Oppa, the Korean barbecue place. Basically, it's bulgogi beef, spicy pork, sesame chicken (no, not the breaded and fried Chinese version), or tofu in your choice of burrito, rice bowl, salad, or mini tacos format. I went with mini tacos since they're sold individually and I could try all the different meats. They all come with some combination of chopped lettuce, kimchee, carrots, tomatoes, and sauces. Here's the kick - as any true Korean BBQ lover knows, KBBQ is best when the meat gets a little char on it, caramelizing the sugars to add a sweet taste. Oppa flame torches the pre-cooked meat right before serving it to you, imparting the goodness of Maillard reaction! Genius! I thought the blowtorch would leave a fuel smell, but not here. Note to the wise, the mini tacos (soft corn tortilla) do not travel well because of all the juiciness - eat it there if possible. Otherwise, expect a bit of a mess. Basically, the sauces make the whole thing taste pretty good. Of the three, I would have to say that the spicy pork was the best. It had a nice heat without being overwhelming. The kimchee was actually pretty decent for not-homemade. The staff was hustling and grooving to keep the line moving. The one guy who torches all the meats was clearly working quickly but he was paying attention, so props to him. Plus the food is served in a container that claims to be fully compostable! All in all, definitely warrants a return visit.

Cool place to check out if you need shelter. It's not very big and seems pretty clean to me. They got an area to sit and eat toward the back and near the entrance too. A few shops to eat and to the left is a place to shop idk what but looks like hipster stuff. Free wifi but you need fb, insta or something else to connect to it. They got bathrooms too!

Regarding the food hall only, it's ok. There are several vendors but it still feels a bit limited. It's good if you're on the go and want 'fast food's that isn't McDonald's etc. I must say I do like the bubble tea vendor, nice touch.

In a section (and street) of the city that carries a reputation for lacking restaurants and being full of fake Louie bags, the Canal Street Market completely changes the stereotype. This place is NOT a market. I came here to get some basics.. carton of milk, eggs, toilet paper, frozen pizza rolls.. none of that was available.
The meal is just perfect , from portion to flavor you can't go wrong. A must try is Izakaya / Samurice

A lot of good creative conscious food seemingly well made- fresh ingredients and what not. I walked past Izakaya/Samurice and I noticed tiny bowls on their counter for display with rice and various toppings. In one bowl I saw some appetizing looking beans over rice (or so I thought). In front of that bowl was a hand written note that said "very healthy!" Nattō is what it was- fermented soy beans. Probably one of, (if not the MOST) unappetizing foods I have ever eaten in my life. The slime factor alone...couldn't do it. Anyway my issue is that Nattō is a Japanese delicacy and should be better represented other than just saying "very health!"..... I honestly tried to take it back and get something different and was told "Sorry we don't do that." The rice was good?...
Great stuff just pricey with targeted advertising to hipsters, great food though. High quality sushi, salad, and juices.

It was so aesthetically pleasing and I love the idea of supporting local businesses and artists! I really just came here for the food tho. I tried the steam rolls from Joe's and it was so good!! I didn't get a chance to try the other stalls but will be back again!

This is such a fun little place to check out while walking down Canal street, a bunch of vendors selling artwork, skincare products, handmade jewelry and even thrifted items. I didn't get a chance to go next door, but they sell food and drinks. It's also a nice break from people hounding you to buy their stuff, you can just browse and make small talk with the vendors about what they are selling. Support your local businesses and check this place out.

I came for a tiny exhibit by Mass Appeal and honestly, this place sucks. Firstly, it's very confusing because when you walk in there are booths selling a bunch of random things from jewelry, to leather bags, to cups. Then, when you walk to the left side there are food booths selling Asian fare. When I asked for assistance the employees were pretty snobby as if to say I don't belong there lmao. I went to get some bubble tea but the lines were ridiculously slow. I have no idea what the point of this place is but okay.

For a relatively small space, this food hall / boutique does a lot with a little. All of the vendors are unique and take pride in their craft. Dumplings were good and I really enjoyed the Peruvian ceviche and the green lemonade was fire. Call me a fan.

Good hipster eats. Ippudo, New Korean BBQ & Dim Sum dishes made for a filling meal. Lots of ramen, savory miso. Chipotle style bugulgi rice bowl & the dim sum set with cucumber chili side dish gavr us a taste of three asian cuisines. Nice ambiance, chil friendly staff. You can even do your bespoke shopping and get coffee or boba while you plan your Chinatown snooping.

I love this market! Great seating options, not too crowded in the middle of the day, and an amazing selection of delicious food. I'd definitely recommend Joe's steamed rice rolls -- the rice rolls were delicious, cheap, and super fulfilling. Quality place!
Really cool little market with several options for food and drinks, as well as clothing, jewelry, and decorative house items.
This place is great! There are a ton of great food options and there are a bunch of great vendors. Lastly, did I mention that they have a boba guys?! I will be returning.
I came here when the market was closed. But the office coffee shop was still open. I really enjoyed my time there. BEST cappuccino I have ever had!

I come here for Boba guys and to look at the local vendors. Canal street market is the new face of gentrification in Chinatown. The modern and minimalist design inside the market conveys the attitude of the millennials who grew up around the area. Prices are what you'd find anywhere in the city. Not crazy expensive but definitely not cheap. It's a pretty dope hangout spot though with all the local food and item vendors that opened up here. but yeah, I definitely have to admit I come here mainly for Boba guys, LOL.
No comment
Most of them take credit card. Must find sth you like here n good to support local business :) Next to subway station

Really cool indoor food courtish/market place. We had the Korean rice bowl with spicy pork and it was pretty good although it felt a little spicy. It might be a little tough to find eating space so you may have to wait for someone to leave
Good pizza And ramen... it can be crowded in there but the food isn't so  bad. A little pricey but not terrible
I would expect it to be bigger but it is more like a small food court with a few boutique store.

Cute, millenial-friendly place in the middle of Chinatown. If you find yourself in the area, it's worth stopping in for a bite, however, none of the stalls are stand-outs or are worth coming to from outside of the neighborhood. We tried favorites from a few of the stalls: Hong Kong bubble milk tea (run of the mill), basic ramen (SUPER expensive to add on normal ramen additions), and sushi burrito. As a frequent traveler, I've been to a lot of markets just like this, so I expected something to stand out, but they were all pretty forgettable.

I loved this market! We had boba guys and it was very good. Add more sweetness if you like sweet tea, because mine wasn't very sweet. This market is a good place for groups to meet up and wander around. The small shops are nice too look at, but very expensive! Also, WE SAW WINNIE HARLOW! Which made the experience there even more memorable.

Hand made goods shopping. Lots of food options, Ramen, Boba Tea, lobster rolls. I was there to rest from the haggling of fake knock off bags, drink some boba tea, use the restroom and charge my phone.
Very cute and perfect for window shopping, but everything is so expensive!  Got a cool present (a dart) for the BF under $20 though.

I am really pleased to find a modern, clean market and with good Asian food!  Well done and hope this is a continued trend to clean up Chinatown without losing the cultural aspects that make Manhattan a great place!

This is like a bad dream. Canal street is grungy as hell, and I love it like that... when you walk in "canal" street market it's like a hipsters wet dream. A bunch of urban outfitter wearing youngsters eyeing you down and waiting to suck your souls dry by selling u their special coffees from Brooklyn or little jewelries they made.... who cares, ok it's stupid and embarrassing , give me back pearl river market.
Another knock off food hall of mediocre food stands that would never survive on their own. There's a reason why...

Just went there this weekend, CSM is one large room with multiple "indie" vendors that come from NYC to California. Right now, CSM is a cute holiday market that you can browse for 30-60 minutes, maybe pick up something or two. Their stated plan is to become an all-year market with food options; when I went there was no food (besides Mast Chocolate. I'm thinking Chelsea Market, Grand Central Market, Gotham West Market, Turnstyle Market for the Chinatown/SoHo area)... excited to see that fully realized in the future for CSM.

Have been here a couple of times, mainly for the Boba Guys here but also to just drift around the goods vendors in the other room. There's a lot of food here that I would love to try, but it is Chinatown so there's so much other food to try & I end up already having eaten by the time I arrive! There's an Ippudo outpost here, which I'd be interested in seeing if I like better. The goods are SO cute!! The aesthetic of the whole market is also really hip and happening, minimalist in fact. There's a plant one, quite a few jewelry and candle/stationary ones. Rather pricey, but goods are really interesting and the artists are often present and ready to customize anything you'd like! It's always clean, not too crowded, and has a cute seating area in the back for people to chill or chat with one another. It's a really chill vibe, less claustrophobic than Artists & Flea in the area, and has a lot of really cute decorative knick knacks/jewelry catering to the young millennial.

There is much to love at Canal Street Market. The craftsmanship booths are full of pretty things and the food hall has many good eats. Best of all there's a Boba Guys location inside.  Better than best of all, inside you can find some of the cleanest bathrooms in Chinatown.

Cute, trendy spot to spend an hour or two. Grab a drink, some food, and dessert & catch up with a friend or enjoy some solo time. This place has a handful of food vendors that has a little something for everyone- from salads to Pokè, bubble tea, smoothie bowls, ice cream, coffee, and Korean/Mediterranean/Japanese/Chinese cuisine. The main downside is the tables in the eating area do not come with seats so you have to stand to eat unless you find a seat in the back lounge (which has limited furnished seating and looks like a modern museum exhibit). After grabbing a bite, take a stroll around the flea market to look at some creative and hippy artwork and cool handmade goods. There'll sure be something interesting you'll find that will strike up a funny conversation and some light humor. Overall, pretty cool place to walk around and chill. I would come back to try some other items that I missed next time.

This place is super cute with tons of different options when it comes to food. The boba tea is really good. Definitely going to have to come back and try the Ramen place. I will update this as soon as we get our order for the Dim sum place
Tucked around the corner from the office, I loved this place! Ordered the "Red Belt" ramen from Kuro-Obi -- absolutely delicious, highly recommend!
No accessibility for strollers but cool location good vibe. Only tried boba guys but want to try the ramen at Kuro obi and sushi at uma. No chairs but standing tables.
Took my traveling student group here, and everyone tried something they had never had before. It was great for options and I Loved the Japanese curry with fried chicken!!

Atmosphere is hip. Food is mediocre at its best. Something like this should have opened in soho/east village. Not chinatown. The food court in Flushing Chinatown is hands down the best! This is just another whitewashed tourist trap.

Fairly small food/goods market. They have a good variety of food vendors from sushi burritos to ramen to bubble tea. Came here on a Saturday afternoon and there was no line for any of the food. There were a lot of people just chilling in the back. Checked out the stores on the side selling stuff from jewelry to mast chocolate - interesting variety. Unfortunately I didn't buy anything. If you're around the area check it out
Wow - most amazing place - all local artisans selling their wares in a truly unique environment.  Hip without being too hipster!  Something for everyone!  Support local - great gifts!!
Great place in Chinatown. Like food court but more friendly environment.  Plenty of choices. Give the new life to China town.

We were walking in Soho and got lost, finding ourselves on the edge of chinatown. On the search for bathrooms, I saw a sign that said "food hall now open" and being a fatass, I held my pee to explore. WOW!! What a hidden gem! This place had some of the best foods to snack on and I am so glad we got lost. Bathrooms are so clean and there's a shopping area and lounge area with outlets.
No comment

i LOVE this place. There's a plethora of cute, healthy and tasty food booth options, which is mostly asian cuisine and also includes organic smoothie and fruit bowl bar, cupcake bar, cafe and more. the little shops are full of beautiful art, jewelry, plants and tons of other items that you wouldn't see in most other new york stores. although all of the items were pretty expensive, it was a great experience to browse through all the variety in the canal street market.

Ive enjoyed Canal Street Market since it opened last year as there are not too many places near little Italy where you can find a  clean  open meeting place with WIFI ,quick salad , a bowl of ramen, or a  coffee under one roof. The vendors are carefully curated presenting a local selection of jewelry, chocolate, fiber art ceramics and more

This review is merely for location choice.  It's literally located in no-where Canal St. far south end of Chinatown.  I guess this locale was scouted to give the food stalls a better chance away from the actual C-town eats competition.  It's a spacious outpost for those who may work near-by or perhaps a stop-over from the train station, otherwise its not a place with foot traffic.  There are a number of food stall choices and it seems most stations are efficiently turning take-out orders.  The right half of the store house the food vendors and the left half are for retail vendors.  The back of the food area does have limited seating for eating and not the best restroom.

This place is great! We ate ramen from the first store when you walk in. Don't know the name of it but it was incredible. So delicious and we got a coconut lime shaved ice from the last vendor. UNbelievable. So yummy. After we walked over to the market and I got the coolest earrings from beroep tech. They are minimalistic and really interesting and pretty. Can't wait to wear them. Will be back to Canal Street Market!!

A nice concept and a welcome space, but I could easily have given it a 2 star rating.  Unfortunately, the food is neither exceptional or reasonably priced.  The attached retail adds to a nice vibe, but the food component REALLY needs to up its game.  Still, the place draws a consistent-enough crowd - Canal St surely can use venue like this.  I'll keep it in mind as a place to duck into on a rainy downpour, but otherwise, Will stick to the boundless real restaurants in the neighborhood.

this place was nice. lots of food places to choose from and very cool local artists selling goods. bathrooms are pretty clean. only downside is that there are only two stalls. kinda wish they added more becuz this place gets pretty busy.
Great location with many options. Love the seating. Don't get the bubble tea it was watered down.

Really expected more exciting vendors in the craft area.  A food court in Chinatown is kind of superflous, don't you think.  Two stars because there are clean restrooms.  Noon on a sticky, warm NYC day and no a/c.

My first time here and this is what you call gentrification of the old Manhattan Chinatown.  This is definitely a newer establishment than I was here the last time. I like the place, it's half market and half food hall.  It's a popular spot, so get there early.  I tried Boba Guys and Loved It!  I'd definitely come here again seeing that all food halls around town are a popular spot just like the Dekalb Market Hall in Brooklyn, you should check that out, too!  My go to is also the Chelsea Market.  I love to eat!

Was a fun experience, with overall a strong assortment of vendors. For food I tried Kuro-Obi, ramen was good but for casual ramen in this neighborhood I far prefer Ramen Lab in Nolita (with rotating chefs, but always unique and amazing). I loved Daveys ice cream sesame and green tea flavors -though the single portion was a little too large. The retail part is very well curated, specifically I was impressed by the variety and quality of organic, local, unique, and often handcrafted cosmetics. You can also find a brand of fresh face masks (single use, refrigerated ones) and a florist selling little bonsai-style creations for your home, both of which i thought were unique and cool. Would have loved to see a few more good options, and some of the boring ones (eg fresh and co and nom wah which has two other branches nearby anyway) replaced by more unique ones.
Excellent service & food! The drinks were so beautiful and unique as well.  The duck fried rice and cucumber salad are delicious! Will be returning :)
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Excellent service and delicious food! Their pig ears raised the bar for me, and their mapo tofu was so satisfying. The crispy octopus was delicious as well, we just had to dig through piles of peppers for it. We goofed and ordered 3 spicy dishes, and this place does not hold back with flavor or spice. If you're rational and actually thinking about your meal as a whole, you'll have no problem!

My friend and i were absolutely blown away by antidote. The food was incredibly delicious and flavorful, without being exorbitantly priced. My favorite thing we had was probably the feihong fries, which were amazingly spicy with an awesome crunch from the peppers and peanuts it came with. The mapo tofu and eggplant were also very very good. They have nice big portions and kind service. My favorite cocktail we got was the red bean one. It is always a great occasion these days for me to find a solid restaurant in nyc, and im very excited to add this to my list of favorites.
No comment

No comment
No comment
No comment

Forgot the names of some of these dishes but they were all prepared well. We were able to snag a spot as a walk in party which was nice. The spot by the door was pretty drafty though. Interior is really nice and well thought out. They bring a little lamp to each table which I thought was cute. I would come back and bring friends if I was looking for something a bit nicer in the area since this place gives upscale vibes without being super pretentious.
No comment

My lord... where do I start?  Starting with staff, excellent people.. Food? Crazy inexpensive for the location they're in... Flavor? One of the best Szechuan restaurant in NYC. This is all coming from a local born and raised.

The space is lovely but the food was mostly meh except for the beef and one of the egg dishes. I know I'm spoilt because I get such excellent szechuan food in the east village so folks should factor that in. This is a perfectly good option for those who are interested more in finding a beautiful venue than in eating the best szechuan food in the city.
No comment
No comment

Antidote is a cool spot the vibes are lovely . I loved the place and the decor . First the service . That's why a star is off I felt like they weren't observant . It took a while to get just appetizers and drinks . Then our food came out . There wasn't someone coming back asking if we were good or needed anything . The servers were just very absent honestly . The food :I had the scallion pancakes. They were greasy and very flaky . I usually like my scallion pancakes with a little softness and flakiness to it . There was no balance . I did enjoy the eggplant with garlic sauce a lot . It's one of the best I've had . Also my other hiccup was the fact that rice didn't come with the entrees . Overall it's a cool spot will I be back ? Not sure but we will see .

A gorgeous restaurant, lovely staff and good food, me and my friend came here to celebrate one of our friend birthday, this place is packed so be sure to have a reservation. If you come with a large group they will charge you a 20 percent gratuity but they will let you know about it. Which is very good because some restaurants do not let you know beforehand at all. The food is good with reasonable price
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Are you ready for the 411? Here we go...took the family out to dinner to this spot and we enjoyed it immensely. The ambiance and atmosphere was inviting. We had reservations and was able to be seated right away even though our whole party was not present. It was not crowded when we arrived but filled up pretty quickly. The service was attentive and helped us choose our dishes from the menu. The food was tasty and we enjoyed all our dishes. The drinks were just right and we even had seconds. Check it out and let me know what your thoughts are!
No comment

No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Love it here! The menu is consistent with really good staples like the Kung Pao Chicken, but they have fun specials and new items all the time. The drinks are creative and cute. Plus the service is amazing! Wish they had a coat rack though lol would highly recommend! Thanks Lewis!

Wow! The dongpo pork is so tender it just melts in your mouth. Crab tofu was also tasty with the salted egg yolk. Portions were large and good for sharing. Soup dumplings were good but a little pricier than other places. Will definitely be back!

We came here on a Wednesday night for the live music and it was great vibes. the interior was beautiful, hints of greenery everywhere. As for the food, my favorites were the spicy cumin lamb and beef in chili oil -- must order if you enjoy spicy food!! Sadly, I was disappointed by two of their popular dishes, crab tofu and curry fried rice. The tofu was soft and cooked well but did not have much flavor, bland. The fried rice with the curry flavor also did not go well together in my opinion. As for the other dishes, they were all delicious as well! I definitely want to come back here to try the other dishes!! Once I curate my favorites from this restaurant, I believe this will be one of my favorite Chinese restaurants.

Dined here for my sister's birthday dinner. I loved the restaurant itself - the setting was very cute and cozy (plants and hanging lights). The food was really great!! My favorites were the dandan noodles (spicy), cucumber salad, and green beans. The cucumber salad was one of the best I ever had. The other dishes were really great as well. The service was amazing. The staff accommodated adding another seat at the table. They also brought out other dishes for a peanut allergy. It was really nice of them to consider that! They also gave dessert baos for her birthday! Would definitely return again!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Such a cute spot in WBurg. Wonderful decor. Not crazy busy for a Saturday morning and amazing food. We got the pork soup dumplings, duck fried rice and the eggplant. Everything was delicious. Not really a brunch spot since they don't have coffee or tea. They have limited dim sum options though. There was a lot of Asians there (some old folk too) so you know it's solid. Definitely recommend
No comment
No comment
No comment

Service was fine, ambiance was excellent, but the food was meh. We had the ribs (tough), the pork & crab dumplings as well as the pork dumpling (mild flavor), and the fried rice with shredded duck which tasted burnt. I definitely wouldn't come here again to eat, but it's a cool place to meet for a cocktail.
No comment
No comment

I came here for dinner with a group of 4 people on a Saturday night. I definitely recommend making a reservation on Resy in advance since the place was packed. The staff were really nice though and we did manage to seat us at a table outside. It actually wasn't that bad with the heat lamps and the outdoor seating area was enclosed. We ordered the whole steamed fish, the tea smoked duck (1/4 duck), the duck fried rice, the string beans, and the eggplant. My favorite dishes were the tea smoked duck and the whole steamed fish. The duck was flavorful and cooked perfectly. The whole steamed fish was lightly seasoned and not overcooked. The duck fried rice was a bit too salty so would pass on that dish. The eggplant and the string beans were also a bit too salty too. I would still come back and try other dishes!

Fusion Chinese. Good flavor on the Chinese dishes. Yet the cocktails are the shining stars here. Good blend of Japanesque plant, modern decor with high ceiling and spacious table arrangements greatly enhance the ambience and moods. Will definitely come back again to hit up the good ole drinks~

First time trying Antidote and couldn't be happier we stopped in. Great ambiance inside! I wouldn't want to sit outside though as it doesn't have the same charm. We sat at the bar since we didn't have a reservation. Service was solid, drinks and food came out timely. We didn't tty any cocktails but all 3 of us were impressed with the wine selection by the glass. We had pork and vegetable dumplings (both were good but the pork was better--also, the dough was a bit too thick for us). The King Pao chicken was a hit as was the Feihong Spicy Prawn dish. The waitress said we could eat the shells so we all gave it a try, then decided to peel them. I'll be back to try some other dishes!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Decadent Sichuan food in a trendy plant oasis tucked away in Williamsburg. Get the preserved egg (go outside that comfort zone), mapo tofu, cumin lamb, thank me later.

Great environment, great cocktails, we ordered Bad Influence and Gimme S'more, both were surprisingly good. Food is also above average, golden fish fillet is a must try, Dongpo Pork is very authentic. Cumin lamb to me is more southern China style though

Overall, the aesthetics and ambience were very nice, but the food was just decent, so for the price I won't be coming back. The Antidote cocktail was definitely pleasing to the eye, but not the easiest to drink or the most pleasant to the taste buds. The Dongpo Pork was tasty, but didn't have much meat. I think out of all the dishes we ordered the wood ear mushroom was probably my favorite.  Comparing this to some places I've been closer to Sunset Park, the food quality and value just couldn't compete.
No comment
No comment
By far my favorite Chinese place, the food is great and the decor is so beautiful. My fave would have to be the crab tofu! I would say to pass on the drinks as they aren't anything special.
I had a very good time here. Great food and great service. Their cocktail menu are very creative and fun to try every drinks.
No comment
Everything we ate was excellent, it's like han dynasty used to be when they first opened in NYC a long time ago ;)
No comment

Had a really lovely dinner with a good friend here! It's still pretty new so there were tons of available reservations on a weekend. We both got the flu shot for our drinks & really enjoyed it. We shared the whole steam fish, the sliced pork in garlic sauce & Dan Dan noodles. All the flavors were on point- the dishes had a perfect amount of spice for us. Definitely a great spot to check out for a dinner date or just catching up with friends!
No comment
No comment

The place was packed as to be expected on a Saturday evening and no tables were available but the bar seats shouldn't be overlooked. Bartenders were attentive and made an amazing cocktail called "Numb", which was not only a work of art but delicious as well. Food was a bit spicy for me but still very good. The sliced pork with garlic and chili oil, and the fries were great. Highly recommended, and make a reservation if you want a table.

The food was alright and was quite fusion as expected. The restaurant itself was pretty nice though, and it was fairly busy throughout the night. We were also celebrating a birthday, and the waiter brought out sweet custard buns and a candle.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
I could live here. The best food I've had in my life. The service and vibes were amazing and I'll be coming back a lot!
Overall great vibe. Ambiance is really nice and the food is just as good. Highly recommend!
No comment
Incredible! The Mapo tofu is my favorite in NYC pair that with some eggplant and cucumber salad and you have the perfect meal. The service is wonderful as well. One of my favorite new restaurants :)

Easily one of the best Chinese restaurants in NYC. Everything that we ordered was amazing from the cucumber salad to the fried vegetable dumplings then the Kung Pao shrimp & the garlic & scallion lamb. Every dish was packed with flavor. The drinks & the dessert did not disappoint either. This will now be a regular spot.
No comment

The aesthetic of the place is quite nice! High ceilings, dim intimate lighting, and a vintage industrial decor. The cocktails look fancy, but do kind of feel like they are trying too hard on being unique and don't feel as the quality as you would expect. The food was good, but didn't feel like it was amazing for the price. And to top that off, the quantity was relatively low as well - making you feel like you did not get a bang for your buck. The place is in a weird spot of making you feel like you're at a fancy place while making you feel like you're not getting too much out of the place.

Great place! Very spacious inside, beautiful decoration, lots of plants and ceiling window make a unique atmosphere. Service is exeptional, very quick. Food is delicious. Thank you for this experience! Recommend!
No comment
No comment

column3: Central City, Salt Lake City, UT
column6: No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Amazing peaceful atmosphere with beautifully prepared food options, and wonderful staff :) 10/10 would go again. In fact, ate here twice in one day because of how perfect the experience was :)

the place itself is super cute! there's a lot of seating and the decor is so cute and homey. the service was great and the food came out super fast! we ordered the pork belly, fish blossom, eggplant, wontons in chili oil, snow peas and duck fried rice. everything was so delicious and flavorful. highly recommend coming here for a cute date night or with a group.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Everything here is incredible! From the ambiance, to the service, and to the food. Highly recommend the pork soup dumplings and the bok choy! They were table favorites. They just added the fries to the menu and they are amazing. Best fries I've ever had. 100% recommend just ordering everything and anything off the menu, you won't be disappointed.

This is a great new spot for Sichuan food in Williamsburg! It's about a 13 min walk from the Bedford Ave station, and nicely decorated (outdoor and indoor seating). Our favorites were the spicy prawns and the crab tofu (don't miss the tofu!!).
No comment

Ordered the sesame noodles and kungpao chicken. Food was delicious. Asked for less spicy kungpao and was made to order at perfect spice level. Lots of chicken. Had enough for the next day. Doesn't come with rice so make sure to order. A little pricey for delivery but worth it - fresh, tasty and fast. And they didn't skimp on chicken.
Beautiful decor and ambience! Great food options too, highly recommend the cumin lab, fish filet with picked soup, and the jelly dessert. Overall great restaurant!
No comment
No comment
No comment

The food and drinks here are amazing! The drinks are very unique and yummy. We got the Scallions pancakes, Pork dumplings, Slice pork with garlic sauce, Pork soup dumplings, Sichuan Chili Fried Chicken and Dandan noodles. Everything was a great level of spice and flavor. The atmosphere is very tranquil yet chic. Definitely recommend!

What a great date spot! My date and I loved the Romantic and calming vibe. The plant arrangments around the restaurant were artfully done. My date and I had their awesome signature cocktails to start "The first Time" and Antidote 3.0 cocktails were well balanced in flavors, using top quality liquor in their recipe. For our dishes the hunan beef and crab pork soup dumplings melted in our mouthand paired perfectly with the Pieropan Soave. The spice from the Califlower and Dan Dan noodles paired wonderfully with the Soave and their light red wines.  OVerall the service was attentive, the food was unique with a lot of interesting flavors, and the owners were so welcoming. We will definitely come back on a Wednesday to try more adventurous wine and unique food pairings while listening to live jazz.    Antidote is a fine addition to Williamsburg
The food was so good my cancer, which was slowly killing me from the inside, was out of my body the day after I ate here.

I cannot say enough good things about Antidote! A beautiful restaurant with amazing food and drinks! We had the pork soup dumplings and scallion pancakes to start - both were delicious. Then, we split the Hunan style stir fried beef and vegetable fried rice. Both dishes were flavorful and filling. The drinks were delicious as well. I will definitely be returning!

Atmosphere is lively and modern.  Service is great and you feel tended to, was always asked how the food was and how we were doing.  The food itself?  Great, portion sizes are bigger than you'd think and the flavors are balanced and well spiced, not over or under.  Great experience, will come back again and would have no doubts that the other dishes are just as good as what we ordered today.

amazing atmosphere and delicious Chinese food. We ordered the hunan style stir fried beef, cucumber, golden fish filet, and the cauliflower. I would recommend all these dishes, but especially the gold fish filet. Space inside is beautifully lit and vibrant, not too loud. Our server Louis was so attentive and provided the best recommendations. Would easily recommend this to anyone looking for a trendy asian restaurant in brooklyn!
No comment

Really pleased to have Antidote down the street from us, it's a gem! The evening my husband and I went to dinner, there was lovely live jazz playing. The ambiance of this spot is lively and fun but also chic. We loved the soup dumplings (although M Shanghai reigns supreme in Williamsburg), the woodear mushroom salad, dandan noodles and the dongpo pork belly. The spicy items here are very spicy so be warned but I loved it!
I came here for the duck and I was not disappointed at all! I'll be back again without a doubt.

My friends and I came on a Saturday night and it was packed! But our server Vivian was so attentive and helpful with choosing dishes. She checked on us to make sure everything was ok!! Loved the food so much. Special shout-out to Vivian for making this a wonderful experience

Highly recommend antidote, they have an amazing ambience and if you're vegetarian or vegan they have a whole veggie menu! We got the mapo tofu, Dan Dan noodle, and the eggplant dish. They were all so delicious and well spiced. This is great date spot we will be back :)!!
Love this place! Really enjoyed the soup dumplings, the pork and the Szechuan chicken!!
Their food was so amazing & great really nice to have a meal here & the food quality was so amazing everything was properly cooked & seasoned.
No comment
No comment

Came here for a little birthday celebration and fell in love with this place. The food was incredible. Portions are small but were just enough to satisfy our hanger. The way they serve tea is absolutely amazing. We loved everything we ordered. Will definitely be back with more friends.
Had an amazing meal here! The wontons in chili oil, cucumber salad, fried pork dumplings and scallion pancakes were perfect. They also have a great cocktail selection.
No comment

Antidote has an amazing ambiance with its open space filled with plants. All of the dishes were tasteful and spiced perfectly! We ordered the following: wood ear pickled salad, beef tripe in chili oil, har gow, salted fish, spicy cumin lamb, fried rice with smoked duck. I highly recommend the wood ear salad, tripe and fried rice with smoked duck. The drinks were also really good. We ended with the moon cake and lava buns which are a must have and perfect way to end the meal. Our server was Luis who was super attentive and friendly.
Came here with my friends for my bday celebration. Food was delicious! Highly recommend the garlic eggplant. Will def come back to try out more dishes.
No comment
No comment

Excellent Chinese food. They had my favorite dish dry pepper chicken, which is a little hard to find. The pork dumplings in chili oil were fantastic as they were a little sweet and a little spicy in the chili oil. The Dan Dan noodles were excellent as well and had a bit of heat to them.

This was my second time at Antidote. I've sat at the bar and at the big table under the skylight. The food is absolutely incredible, the price is right and the room is trendy but not too hey look at me. There's not one questionable dish. Small plates, dim sum, noodles and entrees all top quality. Standouts are the crispy beef jerky, the fried chicken, shredded beef and bamboo shoots, Dan Dan noodles, wood ear mushrooms and the ribs. the ONLY thing they could improve on is the service. Both times I went I had to flag down the bartender or waitress after a good amount of time waiting without someone coming to the table to greet us, so we could order a drink and then again later so we could to order food. On the bright side though, the food comes very quick. Both times I went, I left with another reservation already booked. GREAT SPOT
No comment
No comment
No comment

Delicious and authentic Chinese restaurant! We got the famous pork dish, soup dumplings, sichuan noodles, curry fried rice and lava buns all were fantastic. Lovely cocktails and environment, absolutely recommend!
Beautiful, open space with high ceilings and lots of greenery. Food and cocktails were delicious! Crab tofu was a must try. Would definitely come back and recommend!
Great new addition to Williamsburg! Delicious cocktails and good portions. Pretty ambiance. Would come back again!

10/10 would recommend. The food, ambiance, and service (hi Louis!) are all fantastic. The food is very authentic, but approachable. I would highly recommend the green peppercorn fish stew, spicy cumin lamb (ask for less spicy because it's spicy) and egg tofu mushroom, and the egg lava buns (premium dimsum flavor explosion). As for drinks, the Cloudy Enigma was superb.

We've been wanting to go to this place for a long time, and I finally made time to stop by with my boyfriend today. All the food was amazinggggg, my favorite would have to be the eggplants with garlic sauce. The sauce goes so well with a bowl of white rice. We wanted to try so many things and ended up over eating. But it was definitely worth it!!! A big shoutout to our server Vivian, she was extremely attentive and friendly. Had a great conversation with her. On top of that she gave us great recommendations! Would definitely come back again, thanks Vivian!
It's a great place! Foods are awesome, one of the best places for Chinese food in NYC. Love the vibe there, and the service are also great!

Been working on music near domino park was looking for a good meal and a place to charge. Came here with the munchies based on yelp reviews. Yes to the veggie dumpling, wood ear and cucumber salads. The shrimp dumplings were fine but i would definitely order the other three again. Got the flu shot happy hour and enjoyed rhe buzz and flavor. I'll be back!
No comment

Came here on a Sunday night for dinner with friends. I was surprised at how good and authentic it was. The portions are good for the price point. My favorite was the sautéed string beans, the salted egg yolk golden fish fillet, curry fried rice and crab tofu. Some of the spicy dishes were SPICYYYY and you must caution when ordering. A lot of the dishes they use Szechuan peppercorns so it's a numbing spicy. We left stuffed and our bellies happy. It's a short walk from Domino park so we walked it before dinner and after dinner we walked to Taiyaki for dessert. Parking was easy on a Sunday night. I would definitely recommend if you're in the area for authentic Szechuan with a spin.
A hip spot in Williamsburg with pretty cocktails and good food. Definitely digging the vibes
Delicious dim sum and the cocktails are amazing. Such a beautiful atmosphere. A must try and hidden gem!

Straight up meh. Yes the restaurant is pretty and cool w some creative cocktails, but the food was thrown at us so quickly and the bar stools are not comfy. It's really expensive compared to Birds of a Feather, and imo, not as great. The staff was knowledgeable, but super fast to get us outta there
No comment
No comment
The food and the drinks are delicious. Service was great and love the vibe / space.  Would love to come back for more.

Super authentic and yummy food! The cocktails are also very pretty and tasty. My fav was the cauliflower in dry pot! We're a group of 10 people Vivian was really helpful with our ordering amount. Would definitely come back and also recommend to friends!!!
Immaculate vibes. Quality food. Great drinks. A great place to bring life to a budding relationship or catch up with old friends

The service was great and the food was amazing! We ordered 6 things and we finished everything. The peppered goat was one of the best we have had! The servings were properly portioned and the restaurant was nice and spacious.
What are the best restaurants in Williamsburg very low-key excellent feng shui and top-tier Quality Michelin food

A hidden gem in the heart of Willamsburg. From the ambiance to the food, perfection all around. I don't even have a picture of the food because it was eaten immediately and so delicious. The soup dumplings 10/10! Luis our server was very hospitable and accommodating. Highly recommend for large groups or an intimate date night. Will definitely be back !!
No comment
No comment

This place is go nice. The food is super good and customer service is so nice, you could really feel welcomed. The vibe in the restaurant is to nice, taking pictures there is just to pretty. Drink and desserts are also nice. The smoke tea duck and the Fish was the best I highly recommend that . Everything is clean you feel safe even during this pandemic. The bartender is super cool. If you guys don't know what to order you could also ask for recommendations from the server.
No comment

On a lovely rainy stormy day we found ourselves sitting in this room with great atmosphere spacious plants everywhere like a rainforest. we forgot it was even raining outside. Each dish was as good as the last. We started with an order of cold cucumber salad bright and crispy with a yummy sesame ginger sauce. Then an assortment  of dumplings arrived - shrimp, pan fried pork, smoked tea duck with black rice and mushrooms. Comforting and delicious. The scallion pancakes were out of this world so crispy, like we were reintroduced to something we thought we knew. Served on beautiful pottery. Then came string beans, duck fried rice and fish with hot oil and glass noodles. Yummy cocktails and tea served in sweet little pots. For sure we will be back again soon to try more of the menu.

The best Chinese food I ever have in my neighborhood. Vibe is amazing , foods are way tooo delicious to describe, and don't forget the cocktails, sooo smooth so tasty, I don't even remember to take a picture before I finished it. Better come next to with more friends so can tryout everything on the menu.
No comment
2nd time coming here and it was great again. By far the best things we ate were the Feihong shrimp and the lava buns. Would recommend.

I came here on a date with my boyfriend and I am glad we chose this spot. The food was sooo good.  My favorite had to be the Antidote fried rice and the spicy cumin lamb which was the right amount of spicy. I feel like other places tend to add way too much chili to their dishes to the point where you can't taste anything but spicy however this dish was perfectly balanced. I also loved the cucumber salad, super fresh crunchy and refreshing..
Great place. Wonderful people, awesome prices, and the food is scrumptious!

I recently moved to this neighborhood and was craving Chinese food. I wasn't expecting much coming to antidote since the other food I tried has been mediocre. To my surprise the food was very good and reminded me of my hometown. The flavors are authentic and the food was very delicious. Our server Rey is the best, he made sure we always had napkins and the food he recommended was exactly what I needed. I also requested a custom apple cocktail and raspberry cocktail and it was so amazing! I'll make sure to come back again.

Such a unique experience. I've heard of this place and I had to see it myself. As soon as I walked in with my girlfriend we felt a peaceful energy, the music and exotic plants definitely gave it away. Our server Rey, guided us through the menu and his recommendations were right on. Being a bartender myself I have to say their drinks are heavenly. We will definitely be back, keep it up Antidote!
No comment

What can I say... It's the best sichuan and dim sum in the hood! So much better than the birds of feather, and they have the full bar here. The food and drinks are just as amazing as their interior decor. Perfect place for a date night! Highly recommended!

Went here during their first week and my group and I did family style. I think I will need to return for a fuller assessment. From my first experience, it was somewhere between a 3 and 4. Overall, it was an average experience but the memorable takeaway was the spicy cumin lamb. I also felt disappointed that they had run out of whole fish that night so it's hard to judge a Chinese place without having tried a whole dish. I'd recommend this for a casual dinner especially with friends but I wouldn't come here for a special occasion.

The restaurant is so spacious, I would definitely sit inside if you can! The antidote drink was so unique and pretty. The rose inside was frozen and made for a slushy kinda vibe once you finished the drink. The fried rice was good and needed to pair with all the main entrees. The crab tofu didn't have any crab flavor but it was still a really large serving and super creamy and luxurious. The spicy cumin came with cabbage that tasted so good together and it was very refreshing. The Shui mai was good but I wish there were more meat chunks to give it more texture. I would definitely go again since everything we had was so good
SO GOOD!! The kung pao chicken is 10/10 with that spicy numby sauce. Wonderful dumplings and shrimp fried rice too. I can't wait to try more. Good quality, fast delivery.

Amazing place!!  Great service, good food , great cocktails... big shout out to Michelle, our bartender!  Super nice, helpful and phenomenal at her job!  If I didn't have to go back home, I'd be coming back here frequently!
No comment

My favorite dishes are cucumber salad，kongpao chicken and Mapo Tofu, the shrimp is good as well, I didn't took picture tho.  I think the restaurant is a post-industrial style(not sure) with very comfortable interior furnishing.  Cocktails are great too, especially the BRAIN FROG, a must try if you are there!

I had this place awhile back and plan to come back soon. The food was delicious and the service was amazing. I was having trouble ordering but a young gentleman, Ray, was extremely helpful and patient. He had explained and recommended me exactly what I had been craving. Wouldn't have such an amazing experience without him. I will be coming back soon with my husband.

The first time my friends and I came here, the food was all 10/10, we got the dan dan noodles, spicy cold beef tendons, eggplants, and the chili oil fish. We came here again the other day, basically ordered the same thing except this time the Dan Dan noodles were so tasteless. It had no flavor to it that we had to tell the waiter who was kind enough to take the order back and remove it off our bill. We were disappointed because the dan dan noodles is one of our favorite things here and the quality of it this time was not good! Not sure if they're in a rush or something but was very disappointed. Also, it took forever for our drinks to come. Our friend got her drink, and me and our other friend had to wait 15 minutes for ours, and our friend was done with her drink by then. I also don't like how each dishes come at very different timing, it would be nice to have everything come out at once or at least not too far apart from each other. I also recommend for the chili oil fish/beef to have a ladle with holes (with a regular soup spoon) as well because this way our plates aren't filled with oil completely.

Can't say enough good things about this place! The food here never disappoints, the ambiance is beautiful, everything here is so delicate. I love everything on their menu especially the salted crab tofu, duck fried rice, and steam fish.
One of the best Chinese restaurant in NYC. Food was authentic and delicious. Great cocktails as well.
No comment
Enjoyed every aspect about this place. From the atmosphere to the food to the service. Ordered a little bit of everything and it exceeded my expectations.
Nice place nice food, love the cocktails too! Definitely will be back soon! My new favorite spot!
The service was great and the food was great .It was traditional dongpo pork .You must be try ti.
Food was delicious. We ordered the crab tofu, dongpo pork, curry fried rice, and cucumber salad. Highly recommend the dongpo pork. Ambiance was modern and service was great.

We came here for happy hour on Friday after work. The icy spice drink is highly recommended! For appetizers, we started with the wood ear mushroom salad and shiu mai sticky rice and smoked duck. The salad has a great added spice to the soy flavor. For entrees, we had the egg tofu with mushroom (so PHAT) and the fish with spicy bean paste. It was really good with white rice. We for mild spice for the fish. Great flavor in the sauces and cooked perfectly. The happy hour is great, but limited cocktail selection. But like the food, their margarita cocktail dialed up the spice with an added pepper. Worth $11? Maybe not but tasted great! The restaurant staffs are really helpful and friendly in helping us choose the right dishes for the evening! Thanks!
Incredible. We've been 3 times, bringing new friends along. Thoughtfully designed dishes and great service. A must add to list restaurant.
Amazing food and awesome service. LUIS was a great server.  Super attentive and Informative. Drinks are delicious  but short. The spicy fries delicious and the atmosphere is chill and relaxing

made a reservation and was made to wait because "your table isn't ready because they're eating slow, they're only half way through with their meal". another table was open but we couldn't be seated there because "i have a bigger party coming". so what about the party that's already here? so instead, they sat us at a table in direct contact with the outdoor wind every time the front door opens.
No comment

This is our second visit here from Manhattan, and the food is great! The atmosphere is nice with good service. One small suggestion is to lower the lighting to be closer to the table so dishes look good and the table lighting can be removed, which is blocking some dishes. Highly recommended still

First time here and would come back again, atmosphere, food, service all 10 out of 10. We were so hungry before coming here and now we can't even walk out of here because of how full we are, came with a party of 3 around 4pm, got seated immediately and was able to get the food really fast. We were too hungry to take a picture before we started eating, as you can tell from our picture, we were already in progress of eating. My favorite is the  crab tofu with white rice, 10 out of 10 would recommend.
Favorite Chinese in Williamsburg. Would prefer this over birds of a feather. Would comeback

Came here for dinner on a Friday night. The restaurant has a great ambiance and prefect lighting. The food and drinks here are amazing! The staff was very friendly and the overall service was excellent. I would definitely come back.
Great food, cute environment and nice drinks! The fish with chilli oil is great! Love it

Really great food and atmosphere in Williamsburg. Highlights included the cucumber salad, mapo tofu (extremely flavorful with a kick) and cauliflower which came out on a sizzling platter. Service was excellent, and the meal ended with free dessert! The dessert wasn't the best part of the meal but it was free so hard to knock points here. Apparently they have jazz nights on first and third Wednesdays of the month, will definitely be back to check them out

Honestly! We really having fun in antidote tonight. Good food,good drink and superexcellence vibe here. I really recommend girls dating here. This is my first time that I find out the alcohol can be nicely like that. Very comfortable texture！Hope antidote can come out more cocktails menus. I definitely would like to try more "girl drink".
No comment

Came here for the first time and upon walking in we were seated immediately. The restaurant was well decorated and the service was fast and attentive. The food was also great, would highly recommend the pumpkin cakes. Overall, would definitely come back again.
No comment
Great food, amazing drinks and great service! Must try whole fish bean paste, crab tofu and lung pal chicken!
Love the crab tofu! The bean paste fish was also delicious! The fatty beef was also mouth watering!

Vivian was a phenomenal server. I've lived in nyc for 11 years and this was some of the best service and food I have had. 10/10 for service 8.5/10 for food. I will come back! If you come make sure you ask for Vivian!!!!!!!!

Just moved to Williamsburg and Antidote has been on the top of my list. Vivian our server was incredible and the food was delicious, plus you can't beat the ambiance of the space! Highly recommend the pork dumplings in chili oil and fried rice with shredded duck!
No comment
Delicious food with a great ambience! The dim sum dumplings were great, as well as the kung pao chicken with spicy bean curd!

The best Chinese place I've been to in a while. Ordered 7 dishes and each one blew my mind - Dan Dan, pan fried pork dumplings, scallion pancakes, curry fried rice, bok choy, stir fried beef, and kung pao shrimp. Service was also incredible (thank you Vivian)!!

Fantastic food and great ambiance. We came here on a Friday night and had the sautéed string beans, roasted duck siumai, Dan Dan noodles, and honey glazed ribs. Didn't have the cocktails but they looked amazing. Place is plant forward with an eclectic interior decor. Our server was wonderful and we will definitely be back!

Okay soooooo you have to go to this place. Their interior design is sexy as hell, the menu is simple, uncluttered, and full of Szechuan classics, and the cocktails are to die for. Every time I come I always get the Drunk in Love cocktail and the soup dumplings... today we tried the Hunan Beef and omgggg so good and spicy! And Vivian is such a lovely server. JUST GO!!!

Being that this was my first visit at Antidote i absolutely loved it ! Our server, Rey was extremely nice and helpful. Without his help I wouldn't have known what to order. I deff recommend this spot !
The antidote restaurant menu has plenty of options for any and all diners to choose from.

Everything is amazing here.! We came in for lunch and ordered a bunch of dishes. My favor definitely goes to the pig ears and the dongbo pork. Drinks are phenomenal. The bartender made me a special Antidote long island ice tea, while my friend ordered a Cloudy Enigma. Both of them are great, and we ordered another round of LI ice tea again.

Came to Antidote after a friend had recommended it to me, and so glad Williamsburg is expanding the Sichuan restaurant options! We got the Leshan chicken, mapo tofu, Dan Dan noodles, and beef in chili oil, and everything was fragrant and flavorful without being too salty or spicy. The mapo tofu was a bit on the lighter side, but it was fine given the flavors of the other dishes. The inside is super cute and will definitely be making my way back!
Best Dandan noodles I've ever had. Decided to try Antidote because of the great reviews and it did not disappoint.

We ordered the crab tofu , dongpo pork and the fried rice with shredded duck, they all tasted amazing! This is by far the one of the highest quality Chinese restaurants in Brooklyn, and the interior is very gorgeous!

food really good!  This cozy restaurant has left the best impressions! Hospitable hosts, delicious dishes, beautiful presentation, wide wine list and wonderful dessert. I recommend to everyone! I would like to come back here again and a
No comment

Had an amazing dinner date at Antidote. The vibe is so chill and relaxing and the service was great as well. All of our food and drinks came out super quickly and our waitress was so sweet. The drinks are a 10/10. Please try the "drunk in love". The taste and smell along with the dim lighting will have you in the perfect mood for date night. I'll definitely be back to try more of their menu, which had so many options that it was hard to choose.

Great food, very satisfied with the quality of the food. Definitely worth the price. Highly recommend the woodear salad as well as the duck blood. The duck blood is a dish that requires good quality ingredient and they definitely have it. Definitely made it into my list of must-visit again list

Love the decor and ambiance here.  We ordered soup dumplings, scallion pancake , beancurd in chili oil, sautéed bok Chou , Tea smoked duck and Antidote Curry special fried rice, all dishes were delicious. At the end of the dinner , they gave us complimentary tapioca panna cotta, which was very nice. The staff is attentive and friendly. I'd recommend this restaurant to anyone who likes Chinese Food.
Delicious foods especially crab tofu and tong bo pork. Service was good. Interior acoustics can be better tho. Recommended to try out!
No comment
Delicious! The duck fried rice was delicious, spicy cum lamb was BUSSIN and the pork was fantastic! 5/5 would absolutely come here again! Service was also fantastic!!

We were impressed. Everything was super flavorful and not too salty. Vivian was a GEM. She was very helpful to suggest we might have ordered too much vegetable dishes....AND SHE WAS RIGHT. We ended up with the perfect amount of food and super satisfied. Especially mind-blown by the crab tofu and cauliflower. Can say for sure we will be FREQUENT customers!

We will return. Food is amazing. Dined with two 13 year olds and they enjoyed every bite. My favorites were the pan fried dumplings. Dessert recommendation...pumpkin cake filled with Nutella Thank You Antidote

Delicious meal. Got the BBQ ribs, pork soup dumplings, crab tofu, hunan beef and lava buns. Beef and the lava buns were our favorite, but everything was delicious! On top of that, service was incredible!

This place is my #1 go to place in Brooklyn. If your looking for a place with good food + drinks + perfect service, it has to 100% be Antidote!!!! U can't go wrong with the drinks, they're all so good, and my favorite dishes: mapo tofu, buds and wife special, salted egg fish, beef with bamboo shoots!
Delicious! Chinese comfort foods made well and really fun drinks. Excellent service. Definitely coming back.

Omg this restaurant is amazing!!! The atmosphere is beautiful and so cool, every dish we ordered was so delicious. Took my parents here who are very picky and they just LOVED it here! You have to order the cold sesame noodles and the egg lava buns for dessert. Amazing spot!
Wowza this place is nails. Birds of a feather is in some trouble with these guys down the street. Everything we had was great and dozens of other things on the menu looked good.

I've came to this place twice and both times VIVIAN served my party and I. Her service is impeccable, the dishes i'm indecisive with she gave her suggestions which was a really big help. I'll definitely come back because of her! Food is amazing, ambiance is great as well.

Great service. Food was excellent. Really enjoyed the salted egg fish filet. Highly recommend that dish. Vivian was also a great server. One of the best. The hospitality was the best provided by her. Was super nice too. The sautéed stir beans was also a good one as well.
The food was delicious and the service was spot on. Our waiter was very welcoming. Will definitely be coming back.
Best Sechzuan food east of the Mississippi. Try the chili pepper chicken and you won't regret it. 10/10 atmosphere will return.

I don't leave many reviews but this restaurant is definitely a gem came here with my friends we had an amazing time staff is all extremely friendly and attentive,drinks are amazing and the food is to die for the spicy cumin lamb and curry fried rice was AMAZING and definitely don't forget to order the chili wontons,steam chicken in chili oil as well as the cucumber salad food was well balanced will definitely be back.
Crab tofu is awesome! I love the duck fried rice. Taste so good! Would definitely order duck fried rice again!
One of the best meals I've had in a long time. Antidote's food and atmosphere do not disappoint, not to mention a friendly and knowledgeable staff. Don't sleep on the tomato soup!!! We'll be back!

Been here couple of times now. Never disappoints!  Great food, great drinks, and the service is impeccable! Highly recommend to those looking for a good time. I recommend the fish with salted duck egg for the food and flu shot for the drink.

I came across this place as a first timer here in Williamsburg. I didn't notice this spot until I've seen their wall sign, and I was glad that I did. All the dishes were exceptional and starters were pretty good. Would come in for another time.

Amazing place ! Drinks were creative and refreshing pairing it along with small plates like the spicy cabbage, beef triple in chili oil and sweet and sour ribs. Our server Rey gave us very good meal and drink choice ideas. Will definitely be our new go to spot !
No comment
Great atmosphere, tasty food including traditional and fusion styles. Very relaxing place to hangout, highly recommend.

I came here with my friends for drinks and I can tell you that it was definitely the best, drinks are made with love and the food was Spectacular. The Server Rey was so Attentive and even took a shot with us !!! Definitely will come baca .

It's been years since I've been there the bar tenders were very nice no complaints glad to know their business still exist after the pandemic as we all know a lot of businesses closed anyways yes i would definitely recommend this place to a friend
Great service and egg custard buns! I definitely recommend coming during lunch to get the specials
No comment

Went to Antidote for the first time yesterday and had a blast. We were two couples and it was jazz night. First, let's talk ambiance. Decor and setting were awesome. Great place to go for a date night in BK. Food, 10/10. It was delicious. Spicy fries were an absolute stand out. From soup dumplings to sui mai and more, they really didn't miss. Drinks, another 10/10. Drinks were cool, delicious, unique, and their raspberry tequila drink is a top 10 in NYC. Music, Jazz music was crazy loud, couldn't hear each other speaking, that was unfortunate. Jazz was nice, just turn it down. Then, very weirdly, they did a last call for food around 9:45pm. This is NYC on a Wednesday night? At 10pm we tried to order a final drink...denied, bar was closed. By 10:08pm the lights were on and they were kicking us out! Overall, this spot has fire food and a great ambiance. Would tell them to turn down the jazz music and stay open later. Enjoy!
Phenomenal Chinese food. The Feihong spicy shrimp were amazing with lots of Szechuan numbing spice without being too overly spicy.

I had a birthday dinner at antidote and it was wonderful!! It was hard to find a place in Williamsburg that could host a large group and antidote was perfect. The service was amazing, the food was great (perfect for sharing!), drinks were wonderful (really interesting cocktails) and the overall vibe was exactly what we were looking for. All my friends had a great time, we will definitely be coming back.

Believe the 5 stars!! Had dinner at Antidote last night and it was awesome! Our waiter Louis was super nice and was great helping us decide between too many good options. We went with the cucumber salad (dope!), string beans (extremely dope), pork dumplings with chili oil (forget about the frozen dumplings that most places serve--these are clearly freshly made), and fried rice with duck. All were fantastic. Will definitely go back for more.

This was such an exceptional restaurant. The food was amazing, the atmosphere was so chill and the staff was so kind and really took the time to answer the questions we had without making us feel like we were inconveniencing them. Seriously a 10/10 dining experience.
I've been coming here for a while. The food is always delicious and my Sichuanese partner approves.

This cozy authentic sichuan restaurant is a must stop at restaurant in Williamsburg. Be sure to get the king paid chicken/tiger shrimp, string beans and eggplant! You will not be disappointed! And the cocktails are super fun!
AMAZING new place. Super good Chinese place. Menu in English and food felt authentic. Order: Crispy tofu, dandan noodle, wood ear. Tea duck.
Nice place! Staffs are super friendly and food is delicious! A good place to hangout with friends. Highly recommended.
Our server Vivian recommended our food and it was delicious. My favorite dish was the egg tofu with mushroom. Her service was very good. I highly recommend coming to this place.
Guys...this is the real deal. Manhattan's Chinese restaurants have nothing on BK's...the shrimp is a must-have!
Great service! The string beans are incredible and the cocktails are delicious and beautifully presented.
Best food and drinks I have had in NYC. LOVED the pork and crab dumplings and the happy hour cocktails were awesome. Great prices, excellent service, and good vibe. 10/10 recommend going here

I love this place so much! Great drinks, ambience, food. Super spicy and yummy! Stand outs were the egg tofu and mushroom dish, and the bean curd in chili oil, which had lots of sichuan peppercorn flavor for sweet drink aficionados should try the Cointreau Virus and the  Emotion Potion, which were stellar! The Flu Shot is on the sour side. Definitely coming back soon!
Warm, inviting ambience. Had the pig ears, curry fried rice, and goat. All delicious; menu had some unique items which was refreshing especially if you get Chinese a lot
Amazing experience! The food was super tasty, amazing and unique cocktails! The service was great, I highly recommend this restaurant! Will definitely come back!
Upscale and trendy Chinese spot with amazing food and ambiance. A must try and much needed addition to Williamsburg.

A really welcoming addition to the neighborhood -- perhaps the best Chinese restaurant in Williamsburg. Antidote knows how to balance the subtlety of Chinese cooking with spice. The "wok-hey" is there. I'm happy I live close by!

I brought my parents to Antidote when they came to visit and I loved it so much that I invited a group of my friends here. The food is so flavorful and really packs a punch. I loved the tiger prawns (super crispy) and the dumplings are so good. Their drinks are also gorgeous!!
100% wood come back! I absolutely love traditional Chinese cuisine and this place did not disappoint at all! This place is definitely a must visit if you are ever in Williamsburg!!
Great service. Top Chinese in Wburg, up and coming. Quite impressed with the selections and authenticity. Good vegetarian options as well.
My first time here and I love it! The tripe in chili oil is one of my favorites. Amazing service and food. Will definitely come again.
Delicious!! Great neighborhood restaurant for an authentic meal. Don't miss the duck fried rice!
It is a great Chinese restauant. The taste is amazing. Really recommend the fish and Dongpo pork which are very traditional Chinese flavor. Hey
Great Fried rice and cocktails. Really enjoyed the Flu shot, Har Gow and Feihong spicy Prawns. Soup dumpling skin was slightly thicker than I prefer.

My friend and I came here on a Monday night. It wasn't too busy but we got a reservation. We ordered the pork dumplings with chili oil, sesame pancake, Dan Dan noodles and steak with green peppers. The sesame pancakes and dumplings were delicious. The Dan Dan noodles were spicy enough but the steak and green peppers were so spicy. You can ask the waiter to edit the spice lever which we should have done lol. But overall it was still delicious! I also got a drink which was great too. Overall a 4.5.
This place has the best fried rice with shredded duck and the best cocktails! The service is really good, great ambience!

Given the glowing Yelp reviews I was excited to try this place. However, I was pretty underwhelmed. I understand we live in NYC and a $17 cocktail is expected at this point, but I found our drinks to be pretty underwhelming. I've had much better cocktails in Brooklyn for cheaper. I really liked our starters (mushroom salad and cabbage) but our mains were lackluster. My partner got the beef with bamboo shoots and I got the spicy chicken which was extremely dry and had no other flavor profile beyond just being spicy. We wound up ordering the fried rice which was fine but nothing special. All in all, this place seems like it was designed to be Instagrammable and they haven't gone out of their way to create dishes that are complex or special, which is a disappointment given the price tag.
The ambience is amazing! The servers are very courteous and timely. The food was amazing - spicy but tasty. Perfect date night. Loved it here. Cannot wait to go back :)
This place was sooo good! Service was amazing and the food was very authentic! Would highly recommend coming to this place!
Every dish as outstanding.  Truly.  The food is high quality and so is the service.  You will not be disappointed.
One of the best meals I've had in a long time! The atmosphere is so open and airy and the food was delicious

Very cute Chinese food place. We had the Dan Dan noodles, tea duck and string beans. The string beans were especially fantastic, had a really authentic flavors and takes me right back to Beijing. Would definitely come again!

Eggplant with garlic sauce and cold sesame noodles were so good. Steamed fish filet with green peppers was light and delicious. Also highly recommend the drunk in love cocktail for the mrs. Heed the spicy signs on the menu though!

Very good food must come back. Vivian very good service. Have to try the fish. The environment was exquisite. Modern but yet traditional food. Vivian reccomend Some very good options for a family style dinner
We tried at least 20 different dishes and everything was great. Our server Vivian was awesome and welcoming. Will come back for sure!
Amazing place for dates. I would recommend the crab tofu and tea smoked ducks. The drinks are pretty and tasty!
No comment

Easily one of the best restaurants in New york for date night. Come here if you want great food and service. The place has great drinks, dumplings, and entrees. Plus your right by Domino Park so you get have a great view after dinner. This should be your next restaurant to try out.

column3: Upper West Side, New York, NY
column6: Amazing food in the Williamsburg ... fantastic customer service and a spacious location. Highly recommend!!

I didn't try most of all of their dishes yet but the ones that I ordered were the spicy fish and pork meat which were really delicious. I enjoyed their desserts too especially pumpkin pastry because it has chocolate inside.
The atmosphere was very relaxing. Every dish was very flavorful, perfect when paired with rice. We ordered the pork belly and it was very tender. Worth a try!

column3: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
column6: Great food, attentive staff (Vivian was super friendly) . Whole steamed fish was superb
Great space and nice staff but still working out their service! Food was good but was not blown away. Cocktails (the one I got, anyway) were fantastic. Hope next time they get it together!

Delicious food, great service and beautiful decor! The staff was very knowledgeable and friendly. Will definitely be back to try other things on the menu. The scallion pancakes, soup dumplings and noodles are delicious!
Wonderful ambience and kind staff. The food is delicious. Celiac friendly with labeled gluten free items on the menu and a very knowledgeable manager- ask for Rudy!
absolutely unreal. very authentic. delicious. i would definitely come back again but make sure to make a reservation

This place is gorgeous inside and the food was truly amazing. We had light dim sum and drinks before doing some shopping nearby - and each dish was incredible. We ate the pork soup dumplings, wontons, scallion pancakes and had the mezcal chai espresso cocktail. Each thing came out and was just as tasty as the last. Highly recommend trying this place - we will definitely be back!
Excellent food, beautiful decor, wonderful service. Every dish we ordered was exquisite and presented with care.

we came with group of friends and ordered bunch of food. we all love every single bite. great decor and  environments. the best in the neighborhood. we tried the Chinese in the neighbors none of than can campare with it. highly recommend must try the cocktail it is the best. and the service is also great. our server chao is super attentive and caring.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I've heard so much about this place! My friend and I were able to get a reservation at 8:30pm on a Thursday. The inside has a cute tiki theme and the walls are lined with bamboo. We ordered the papaya salad, crab fried rice, squid ink fried rice, mango sticky rice, and pudding for dessert. Everything's was delicious! The papaya salad had a delicious sauce, the crab fried rice had a bigger portion than expected, and the desserts were great to finish off.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I love thai food, bit they all are so close in taste.  This one stands out with unique dishes and great flavor.  The sauces were left in the side which I appreciated so we could control the level if added flavor...I was the only one to use it.  Let's just say I totally understand why they get busy and are so highly rated by yelpers.  Delicious meal, even for the one member of my party who doesn't like Thai cuisine.
No comment
No comment

We ordered the crying tiger special and steamed fish to share. Both were unique dishes with good flavor! I really enjoyed the shallots and egg yolk in the crying tiger. The steamed fish reminded me of the one at fish cheeks -- it had a similar sour flavor. Sadly, the rice we were given was hard and not enjoyable, and the thai iced tea was watered down. I would opt for another drink.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The vibe is super cool in Lumlum, it feels like a mix of a Hawaiian and Thai influences. I almost felt like I was at a Tiki bar. Ordered the fried pork belly, would probably not get again since it was waaaaaayy to fried that it was kind if hard and waaaaay to fatty, there was barely any meat. The crying tiger was also very mid, the rice was very garlicky and tasty, but the steak was kind of tough and chewy. The rice really saved the dish. The BEST was their whole fried fish with chu chee curry. While the fish was a tad dry, the curry made up for it. It was just the right amount of spice, cream, and lemongrass and pair SO WELL with a bowl of rice! Would def come back for the fish again and to maybe try the steamed version.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The entrees we ordered at LumLum were both very flavorful. I recommend getting the Crying Tiger Special, which comes with well cooked steak and flavorful garlic rice. The Tom Yum Noodle Soup was good and packed with seafood, however, the portion was smaller than I thought it would be and the dish is pretty thick. If you're looking for a brothier dish I wouldn't recommend ordering this since it felt more like a sauce than a soup. Another thing to note about LumLum is that the space is very small. The tables are all really close to each other and it's pretty difficult to get through without bumping into people. The overall environment is very cute and nicely decorated. Definitely recommend that you make a reservation beforehand since the place is busy. We made one in advance and were able to be seated very quickly.
No comment
No comment

We ordered the Soi khao Gai, Tofu Pad kee mao and Som thum with Thai ice tea. The food was pretty tasty  but the portions are tiny tiny tiny. Food  came within minutes.  The Soi khao was served Luke warm.  The Thai ice tea was one of the worst I've had, diluted and watery with no taste.  We sat at the bar and service was non existent. No water refill. In all it was average. I wouldn't make effort to return.

Came here for a Sunday lunch and it was delicious. The place is super cute beach vibes. The food had flavor without being too saucy or oily. I'd definitely recommend checking them out.
