We didn't get one but some of the drinks came in cute tiki glasses. It got busy fast soon after opening so could be good to get a reservation especially if you're a bigger group.
Such a cute little Thai spot! That ambiance is fantastic. Feels like you're on an island. The food is absolutely amazing! So flavorful and filling!
No comment
No comment

The food is delicious and the atmosphere takes you away to a tropical island hut! If you've ever eaten at Fish Cheeks, it has a similar menu. The steamed fish was cooked to the perfect softness with plenty of tasteful herbs. It was a big fish that can easily be shared between two. The moo kob was ordinary to me but their sauce on the side complimented it well, a pretty one dimensional meal.  The crying tiger special had perfectly cooked meat with plenty of rice. There was no overpowering tastes. Nothing blew my mind but this place is a great place to come with friends and catch up.
No comment
No comment

LumLum has been on my list for a while but getting a reservation can be difficult. Difficult but not impossible. Luckily I was able to snag one this past weekend and it was worth the wait. LumLum has a great vibe and a friendly, casual atmosphere. The cocktails are very good. The star of the show is the food. Some of the best Thai food I've had in New York. Mostly seafood. Everything was fresh and flavorful. Even dessert was amazing.
No comment
No comment

I was finally able to get lunch here after walking by this place many times. My friend and I got the Pad Thai and the Pad See Ew, which were really good. I also got the Butterfly Pea Yuzu Soda, which tastes as good as it looks. The place was fairly busy when we stopped by, but it didn't feel cramped. And the wait staff was attentive and friendly. Will definitely stop by again as a reliable Thai place!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Would recommend getting a reservation here if you can; when I went at around 8:30 pm, it was still super busy. That being said, the wait for 2 people wasn't actually that long. Nice, tropical vibes, they really lean into the tropical island theme here. I had the crying tiger special, which is one of their most popular dishes and I can see why. The rice was sooooo flavorful. Steak was good but the standout was the rice. Also got the mango sticky rice; unfortunately, the mango was a bit out of season so it was a bit sour.
No comment
No comment
No comment

The food is amazing!! Taste like real Thai food in Bangkok! Bank is a very nice and friendly servicer. The music and environment are great. Easy and chill place to eat ! We got here 15 mins before they opened so we got a good spot to sit, no line and the foods were fast !
We loved the authentic experience and ambiance of LumLum. The food had a ton of flavor and tons of seafood. The cocktails were very good. Hope to visit Hell's Kitchen again soon.

Came here before our Broadway musical on a Wednesday night. Online I didn't see anywhere you could make reservations, but saw a tip on yelp so called and was able to make a reservation an hour before arriving for 6pm. Thank God I made the reservation, because upon arrival, they were already packed with people waiting in line as well. Inside the space is fairly small and the tables packed in but clean. The food was SO good. We ordered the fried fish, the Khao soi, and the Tiger dish that everyone recommends. Our favorite was the Khao Soi. Surprisingly the tiger dish was our least favorite. I'm not sure if it was because it came out slightly cold? It was still very good, but the other dishes definitely outshined. I can't wait to come back and try other items!

Cozy and intimate Thai spot with soft tropical decor. Our group shared dishes family style and the food was exceptionally flavorful. I most enjoyed the Crying Tiger - Thai steak, marinated raw egg and garlic rice. It was an artful and unique rice dish & it was delicious. Service was good but it was a popular spot so we waited for ~40 mins. All in all, the food was worth the wait

Excellent flavors and several Thai dishes that are different from the usual including whole crispy fish I really enjoyed. We ordered crab fried rice, fish with chu chee curry, khao Soi, a glass noodle dish, and Crying tiger. Everything was very tasty and seasoned well. I also loved the beach bar vibe and atmosphere, will definitely come back and eat another family style meal here with a group.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Very fun bamboo decor and warm atmosphere. Music was chill and I could hear my friend speak over the volume level. Food was very good Thai. I had the grilled prawns and pad see ew chicken. Great service and price is just right!

Came here for dinner on Sunday around 5 pm and it was really packed. We were a small party so we were able to get seated quickly at a table that was being bussed. There were parties waiting outside the door after we seated which was surprising since it was early dinner time. I wanted to comment about the Crying Tiger dish we got because I was mainly unsure of what the beef would be like since some photos showed really fatty slices though ours was lean but tender. It was really good (probably not as good without the sauce, as other reviews have mentioned). Would come again and try more dishes!

Very yummy food at @lumlumnyc after waiting in line for a long time. The steak rice was yummy but didn't taste very Asian. Grilled cuttlefish was super delicious and juicy, and both the papaya salad and tom yum soup were authentic and full of Southeast Asian spices. Not in the pictures, but their Thai iced tea was also good and not too sweet!

Food is OK, above average. Loved the chicken meatball green curry, the appetizers were mediocre (e.g. cuttlefish, River shrimps). Drinks are weak and forgettable. But the worst part was how hurried the whole dinner was, and how cramped the dining room. No space between dinner was. Service was inattentive and rude.

Always such a spot! Second time here in one month. Great Vibe - SEAsia Beach theme. Cocktails area all very solid. For the apps, I've tried the fried pork belly, grilled thai river prawns, crispy fried toro fritters. I would skip the prawns only because it's not fantastic for sharing. For mains, I have tried the crispy crab omelette, branzino, sauteed shrimps and ribeye steak. All of them were phenomenal but my favorite would have to be the sauteed shrimps (Goong Karee)- the flavors were perfect. Def not a skip!
No comment
No comment

Let's start with WOW. The food, ambiance, and service were PHENOMENAL. We were seated, served, and finished within 30 minutes of arrival. The staff was amazing and attentive. The food ??? Girl. It was amazing. Run, don't walk. Honorable mention of the Thai Iced Tea with milk that was not pictured but also amazing. Would highly recommend!

I love this place for Thai food ! I have been here several times with my friend and we agreed with all the hype and the taste of the food. The grilled shrimp and the steamed fish are excellent choice for seafood lovers. Also, the crying tiger beef with rice and egg is perfect for everyone !
No comment
No comment

This little place has it all. First of all the food is outstanding. Fresh ingredients prepared in creative ways make the food worth a visit. The service and ambiance complete the deal. If you're in midtown and craving Thai food give Lum Lum a try.
Excellent food, great friendly service! I had the pad kee mao and almost wept at how delicious it was. Just a heads up, depending on the time of day, you may need a reservation.
No comment

We were in NYC for my birthday weekend and found this place not too far from the theatre district so decided to try it out. What a cute place with such friendly staff. We were seated by the window which was perfect for people watching. We ordered the prawn appetizer (so delicious) and the grapefruit app (also good but the prawn was at another level). Our entrees were great but I really loved my husband's choice of baby scallops. The sauce was amazing. We ended the meal with the mochi and coconut ice cream. Delicious! Definitely come early for dinner, the line was out the door midway through our meal.

Delicious food. It was extremely fast and fresh. The service was EXCELLENT! They were constantly checking on you and you never had to look for someone to ask for anything. Very attentive my water was refilled constantly. Would recommend and I am definitely coming back.
No comment

I was really excited to try this place after seeing it online and was even more surprised to see that there was a line outside on a Wednesday night. We ordered the 2 most popular dishes (Crying Tiger & Khao Soi Gai) that everyone seemed to be ordering. The food is extremely mediocre and it didn't take very long to realize that the food is very salty. We didn't feel great after eating the food because the salt intake was just too much. It was extremely overpriced too-- the Crying Tiger definitely isn't worth $28. Both dishes also came out lukewarm. I definitely won't be coming here again. Instead of waiting in line here, there are much better Thai restaurants to visit in Manhattan that are way more palatable/flavorful and worth the cost.
No comment

What a great new addition to the Hell's Kitchen Thai scene! We got to the restaurant at 7pm on Friday and had to wait about an hour, which was expected (you can also make a reservation with a $40 no-show fee). We started with the taro fritters, where were unique. While they weren't extremely flavorful, their texture was perfect, and the sweet/spicy sauce it came with was incredible. For mains, we had the Khao Soi Gai Special and chicken fried rice. Both were bursting with flavor, the right amount of spicy, and imbued with smokiness. For dessert, we ordered the popular taro mochi balls, which came with this delicious coconut ice cream. It's one of the most unique desserts I've had and contained the right amount of sweetness. Overall, aside from the great food, what stood out to me was the ambience of the restaurant. It strikes a noteworthy balance between fun/tropical and modern/posh. I highly recommend this spot to anybody looking for a Thai restaurant on Ninth Avenue with good seafood and chicken dishes and fun vibes.

a cute spot in hell's kitchen, lum lum's crying tiger special is a must get! it is marinated steak with garlic rice and an egg yoke. the rice was absolutely delicious. the steak was pretty good although some pieces were slightly too red for my liking and a bit chewy. the sauce that accompanied was very good though! the pad see ew was decent. m were good but just a bit not strong enough. 4 stars for nice server, cute atmosphere, and the crying tiger special which i quite enjoyed aside from my comments above

I had a flight cancelation and ended up booking a cheaper hotel in hell's kitchen and was kind of having a rough day. For some reason I was craving Thai food and I decided to just walk around hell's kitchen and I came across this on Yelp as it was highly rated. I was a little tired so I decided to order to go in lieu of waiting for a table. I ordered the fried pork appetizer and pad see ew for dinner.  Oh my God both were super delicious so I could see why on a Monday night this place was full of people. Even though I was doing a to go order the wait staff were very friendly and nice. Definitely some of the best Thai food that I've had so this is a great place to stop in while you're in hell's kitchen.

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment

This is a place that everyone should make an effort to go to. We had a very late night Friday dinner here, and it was so worth it. We got to the restaurant around 9 o'clock and we were lucky to get a table. We ordered the pork belly appetizer. It was great and the sauce was so needed. We split the dinner, and I could've had another one as well. Everyone needs to make sure they mix the egg well and use all of the sauce because that is what makes this dish memorable. I will probably dream about this dinner in the months to come!

Run don't walk to this wonderful Thai restaurant  we had dinner there last night and returned for lunch today we loved it so much!!!! The food is amazing and the service is great too -- always busy so reservations probably best -- we walked in both times and didn't have to wait long.  Started with a wonderful gin cocktail -- Keanu forest!! Fresh and delicious!!! Also had green papaya salad, Thai style mussels and spicey lemongrass soup.  Had the coconut ice cream for desert!! Fabulous. For lunch the next day we had the soup again -- so yummy and Kra Prow, Khua pling and Brussel sprouts. Al great -- oh and I had to have the Krabi forest martini too. Love this place!!! We will be here every chance we can when visiting NYC again in the spring

Whether you're eating in or taking out, LumLum is going to be SO satisfying!  As a vegetarian, I wasn't expecting to get much from here since it's so seafood heavy.  However, they have THE BEST Tom Kha Kai I've had in a while.  They made it with tofu and also hit the mark with the spice level.  The taro fitters were very well-balanced and had an appetizing texture thanks to the peanuts.  The Pad Ki Mao was supremely authentic and flavorful!  My husband and I have come here for lunch and also done carry out and have always been very happy with the quality of the food and the service.  I'm so grateful to have a local Thai place that is authentic and caters to vegetarians.
Food was not particularly tasty. I'm used to really good quality Thai food and this fell short. One really good thing was that the food was not overcooked. Just spicing very deficient.
No comment
No comment

I've passed by here multiple times wondering why there's such a long line - fairly recent opening which I think deserves it. The food is yummy and more creative than some other dishes you would find probably around the area; everyone gets the fried rice with steak which is really good! It comes with a raw egg. Beware that the spice level is definitely intense for some of the dishes (I felt it on the pad kee mow) but overall it's a great spot with great food even for takeout which is what I did. The service is a bit slow and expect a line if you're going on weekends, next time I'll have to try some of their drinks too!
Delicious food, great customer service (super easy online reservations), and the ambiance is great for date night or smaller group dinners.
No comment
No comment
No comment
This place is amazing!! I've been to Bangkok Many times and this place hands down Is the most authentic Thai food I've outside of Thailand. As for Bank when you come he'll take great care of you.
The food here is A+. This is not your typical Thai restaurant. I can't wait to come back and eat through more of the menu
No comment

Best Thai food I've ever had! We're visiting from Houston which already has amazing Thai food so that's saying something! We got the crying tiger and khao soi gai. Between the two I liked the khao soi gai more, it's a super flavorful curry. The restaurant is pretty small and smelled verryyy strongly of fish sauce when you walk in but you get used to it after 5 minutes or so! If you hate the smell of fish sauce though it might be a little difficult to get past lol. Food came out in less than 10 min. We will definitely be back on our next trip to nyc!!
No comment
No comment

Amazing place serving up amazing flavors. I tried perhaps the most beautiful pad Thai I have ever had and thoroughly enjoyed. The service was nice and quick and the whole experience was great. I definitely recommend!
No comment

Great thai spot! Interior has great vibes and wonderful drinks. I got the phuket night - perfect combo of sweet and spicy. I got the kra pao with tofu, my bf got the kee mao with tofu, and my other friend got the chicken stew  that everyone is raving about. All were delicious and reasonably priced. Excited to come back!
Another solid Thai spot in the Hell's Kitchen area. Loved my beef pad see ew, but wasn't crazy about the chicken wings, super small, very few, and the sauce didn't wow.

Came back in town to visit with my wife. Easily the best Thai food in NYC. We had the pad thai which was flavorful and the crazy tiger which the steaks were super tender. The drinks were also on point. Small quaint little place. Must check out, we'll be back next time we are back in NYC!

Really good food and quick service. Loved the vibes although definitely crowded (would recommend making a reservation). Ordered tofu pad see ew and a Thai iced coffee and it was delicious! Will be coming back again.
No comment

Small restaurant packed to the brim , very busy and very loud. Not necessarily a surprise Service very efficient but that's about it. Our server was brisk and  unpleasant. She looked annoyed. As far as food,  tom kha soup was quite good, Panang curry special with short ribs had a tasty sauce but overall didn't stand out, pad Thai was not greasy and tasted good  but little chicken and no vegetables. Steamed fish was just ok, I ate much better. Overall, I had higher expectations and was underwhelmed.
Easily one of my favorite Thai places. If you're ever in the area, this place is a must try.
The steamed fish was amazing! I will go back. A short walk from Times Square. A small cozy place.
Authentic Thai flavours that aren't overly sweet with a variety of traditional dishes that are all really delicious! Great bright and beachy space, perfect for a relaxed meal in the area.
No comment
No comment

Came here on Friday with a reservation for 2 at 7 pm. Service was largely non-existent, with the front desk individual being rude and dismissive. Also reservation system was totally flawed- waited 35 minutes after our check-in to sit. The food was wonderful but everything else was awful. I'd recommend going somewhere else that is better organized / happier to have your business. Two stars for the food and drinks.

They have some special Thai dishes that I really enjoyed - the crying tiger and the bua loy dessert are must-gets! They were super interesting and delicious! I thought the pad Thai was a bit too sweet, but otherwise really pleasant dining experience! I walked in for lunch on Friday and easily got a seat - would recommend getting a reservation for weekend times!

Delicious food! I loved everything we ordered. The dishes are so flavorful and I love how generous they are with their meat portions. Probably one of my favorite Thai restaurants in NYC. The place is small and typically see a line outside the door but it's worth the wait! They do take reservations but I noticed those would have a small wait too.

I ordered a dry curry rice dish with beef and my friend got a basil rice dish with chicken. Both were very good, albeit spicier than I expected (especially mine unfortunately). The ambience was pleasant and I appreciate that the staff found a spot for us although they were busy and we didn't have a reservation. Given these redeeming qualities, I'd normally give this restaurant a minimum of 4 stars. But I won't because I'm feelin real salty. Why, you might ask? My dish came with a fried egg and I asked for the egg to be cooked through rather than runny. The waiter took the order like it was no problem. When the check came back, I saw that they had charged me $2 for "EGG COOKED LONGER". Are you serious??? I normally would not have paid given that this is a ridiculous excuse to charge more money (seriously...$2 for you to leave the egg on the heat 30 seconds longer??), I wasn't informed that it would cost extra when I made the request, and THE EGG WAS STILL NOT COOKED THROUGH!! but I didn't want to make my friend uncomfortable by being litigious over $2. Clearly Lum Lum needed the money more than I do if they're scrounging for every dollar, which is perplexing since they asked for our table after only 75 minutes of dining, so business must be booming. So wild. I'm still shook. Really unacceptable way to conduct business, especially at a classy restaurant.
No comment

Did not take pictures due to being with company, but this was easily the best Thai I've ever had. Make sure to acquire and reservation, as the line was long. Everything had a perfect spice level, tried many plates, extremely satisfied. Will be back!
No comment

Amazing food. We loved the crying tiger special. The garlic rice in that is out of the world. We also had the steamed Branzino - it's was very well prepared. Overall a restaurant added to my repeat list.
Wow, really good, authentic Thai food. The crying tiger is the best dish but we haven't had any dish we haven't liked. It gets crowded so expect to wait if your going at prime time
No comment
Not sure why i only gave this place 4 stars originally, but it deserves all 5! Love u LumLum
Pad Thai was best top 3 pad Thai I've ever had! You'll have to wait a bit without a reservation but the staff works hard to move tables quickly and their service was great.
No comment

LumLum closes at 11pm so I was able to order a late dinner after 9pm. It was my first time trying this spot out and I can say that everything was pretty solid. Nothing was over cooked or under seasoned. I didn't hate it but also didn't love it - it's still better than some other Thai places that I've had.

Proper Thai food with an innovative flair. Very sweet and accommodating staff and very well known knowledge of ingredients. I've dined in and done takeout and this is a solid stop. The desserts are to die for. No joke!
Got this to go once and it was good! Unfortunately my dish was a little too spicy for my preference but my friend got the pad Thai and it was awesome! A great local neighborhood spot.
The LumLum Yum Rice Salad is really good and flavorful. I never thought a rice dish could feel so fresh. Must try.
Very good food and cocktails.  Excellent staff.  One of the top Thai restaurants in midtown.

Stopped in for the lunch special (you have to look for it on the rather extensive menu)  Chose chicken tikka masala for the curry option.  Thought it was wonderful.  The two sides of the day were delicious as well.  And hot pillow-soft naan!  Friendly service. Highly recommend.
No comment

Went here for a late lunch and it was amazing. Husband got the ka soi  something and it was basically bone in chicken in a delicious red curry broth with noodles. Amazing fresh and super fast! Like came out faster than mcdonalds fast! I got the beef pad see ew and it was fantastic. Will definitely go back soon!

Amazing!! Ordered the crying tiger and beef tartare for the table and they were great. The tartare was fresh and tangy. The garlic rice was addicting. I ordered the Tom Yum soup, it was a fair portion and I loved the noodle choice.

Bangin food, bangin atmosphere. This place services authentic Thai food that is elevated and plated beautifully. Prices are a bit higher than typical Thai places but the food, location, and ambiance makes up for it. The service was quick and friendly. Knocked off a star because they missed one of our appetizers. We ended up paying for it but no big deal.

Saw this blow up on social media and had to come try this place. The food was honestly amazing and lived up to the hype. The steamed fish was actually my favorite,  with the seasoning spreading through each bite of the fish. The dessert was a little underwhelming / small though. There can definitely be a long wait at this place.

Decorations and the menus look interesting. They have a lot of common Thai dishes and there's a lot of unique dishes as well. The best for me is Goong Yang!! And definitely!! Do not miss the dessert especially BuaLoy!
No comment
OMG food !! Everything was perfect! Make sure of the spice level! I think there level 1 is enough spicy for you to upgrade! Very authentic thai!

Friends of mine had been to Lum Lum recently and highly recommended it. I had been out most of the day running errands and i went for an early supper since I don't eat lunch. It is on 49th Street and unless you know about it, you could miss it since it is not on 9th Avenue, where most of the other Thai restaurants are located. it is a small place, divided into two sections. You enter and there is a seating area. When you turn the corner, there is a bar and additional seating,It is small overall so my recommendation is to get there early so you can nail a table unless you prefer the bar but seating there is limited to 3-4 seats. i looked over the menu with the help of the Q code and after getting a glass of cold water, i decided on the drunken noodle dish, mildly splcy, with mixed seafood. It arrived shortly after the order was placed-it was hot and delicious. I always forget the Thai name for this dish. Anyway, it was filled with wide noodles, seafood and vegetables mildly spicy with just the right kick. The staff was attentive and accommodating. It is reasonably priced for the area and the restaurant is clean and well maintained. There is also a full bar. I would recommend and return.
Not bad, got the crying tiger special. It was good, but not impressive. Papaya salad was a little salty, not crispy enough, but it may due to mine was pickup instead dinning in .
I'm not really an expert in Thai Food but this restaurant is really good! Everything was delicious, even though I do not really like spicy food. Tommy, our waiter was really friendly!!
No comment

Yum yum! I can see why so many people mentioned the Crying Tiger. The garlic rice topped with fried shallots with the tender steak tasted as great as it looked. The papaya salad was good too, it had some salted egg yolk to give it more flavor.

Don't usually post reviews purely over bad service but this place didn't even give me the ability to try their food.  We made a reservation for 7pm, got there at 7 on the dot and still had not been seated at 745. At that point we left to go eat somewhere that didn't waste peoples time.
Food was amazing and better prepared than other Thai restaurants I've been to.  They're made spicy so be prepared.

Had high hopes for LumLum and they didn't deliver. Luckily got seated right away but food took ~45 minutes from time of ordering to come out. Table next to us asked where there food was. Haven't gotten their liquor license yet so can't get any alcohol here. I loved the fried rice but we also got the prawn and a fish dish which were too authentic for my liking and difficult to eat logisticslly with the bones, skin, etc i'd go back in 6 months to give it another try
Great food but the medium spice was overwhelmingly hot. It was barely edible. And I like spicy food, I'm not a wimp. The mild was more like a medium in other places.

Came in without much expectation but this place blew me out of the water. Food was absolutely delicious and unique. It's so flavorful and you'll be enjoying every single bite. I can't wait to come back and try other items on the menu. Got the Crying Tiger (grilled ribeye steak, marinated raw eggs, fried shallots with garlic rice) & Khao Soi Gai (thai coconut curry with chicken and egg noodles). Follow my Instagram page to keep track of the food adventure @twomobites

Decor was so pretty and refreshing! It's a small restaurant, but felt so relaxed. The khai Jeaw poo was alright (, but I would come back to try other dishes! My friends loved the shrimp fried rice and Khao soi.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Absolutely check Lumlum out if you like Thai!! Loved the food and the atmosphere!! 10/10 would recommend and return!
No comment
Food is a new take on classical Thai we see around the town. Fresh and nice ambiance, delicious food. A must try! If you go leave a space for the desert

Delicious Thai food! I had pineapple mussel curry which was different but delicious and had a little kick to it. Not many seats inside so come early or make reservations. We were lucky to get reservations beforehand. When we left we saw the loong lines outside!

Long wait, but food was good. My soup was a bit too lemony, but great quality. I should have not gone with medium spice, but I tried to hang. Bad move. I could barely handle finishing my food, even though it was delicious. If you're a wimp like me, go mild.

OMG!  This place was amazing!  The cocktails were delicious and so was the food.  We started with the fried taro fritters, and shared a crab meat omelet and squid ink fried rice with seafood, and finished with the 2 desserts (taro mochi balls with coconut ice cream, and coconut pudding) on their menu.  We are already plotting our return

This place needs to figure out timing from the kitchen and the servers need to coordinate the wait times better. When we got here the place was packed and there was one party of 2 waiting before us. The server notified us 15minute wait time, and we were waiting patiently. However we weren't seated until around 45minutes later, and 2 parties that came after us got seated first (because one had a reservation an hour ago and another party was a bigger party)- the reservation was understandable but not sure why the bigger party got seated before us. They took our orders while we were waiting so the food would come out fast but i think they just forgot about our table because we had to check on our food and then it came out 20mins later. The crying tiger was good but the meat was just so dry and not juicy. The rice with the garlic chips was good though. The pad see ew noodles were chewy but a little too salty for my liking. The yom som / grapefruit salad did not harmonize with their seasoning as it was spicy yet bitter. Also the food seemed a little bit overpriced for what it is. Maybe i'll try again in half a year when their service gets better.

Yummy new neighborhood Thai spot. Delicious crab fried rice, super lump and fresh crabmeat served with a lovely lime sauce. Beef pad see ew a tasty standard. Refreshing lychee mojito (virgin). Also had some spicy and scrumptious som tum thai (green papaya salad). Finished off with Thai tarot ice cream mochi balls and coconut ice cream. Friendly, and wonderful service. Fun decor. Looking forward to it becoming a regular haunt.

Great newer Thai place in Hell's Kitchen/theatre district. We had a reservation as we were going to a show.  The rest of my party go there on time and were seated even though I was really late due to train shenanigans. We had the pork belly, the whole fish, and a prawn and noodle dish that were all very flavourful. The thai iced tea was also good. The space itself is really cute with comfortable whicker chairs. It was a little more spaced out than many thai places in the area so you don't feel as though you're on top of the person next to you. A good pre-show option.
The place was hopping. Still, the service was fast and the food delicious. We also ardered the rice, which was good, too.
Service and food was super good. Every dish i had was unique and not what you find at other Thai restaurants. Definitely going to come back!

My new favorite Thai spot in Hell's kitchen! Perfect if you want to try different style of Thai food than what's normally offered in most places. We ordered a lot and my favorites were the Crying Tiger, the Khao Soi Gai, and the Khai Jeaw Poo

Cute little Thai restaurant in Hell's Kitchen. It's a bit pricey for what you get, but everything was delicious (and what isn't pricey these days?). The funky Tiki drink glasses added a bit of whimsy. Service was quick and everything was Covid safe. I happened upon the place after getting a Covid booster/Flu shot double whammy at the Duane Reade across the street. It was my reward for being a solid citizen and for taking good care of me.

We ordered crab fried rice, crying tiger and Tom yum soup. Crying tiger is a must try, the steak is tender and juice, with the raw egg, perfect! Tom yum soup is very good too. Fried rice is okay, I wish it would be more flavorful!

Tasty Pad Thai and love the decor! Pad Thai had a nice sweet flavor and was also nice that they had the chili flakes and peanut crumbles on the side. Pad Ki Mao with seafood was pretty good as well- it had some little scallops which were particularly good, though it was a bit too salty. Free dessert for writing a review is definitely a plus!
Unfortunately, the flavor of each dish was lacking.  The sauce for fish had way too much sugar. Tasted like the ingredients used were mass produced not fresh.

The place is small, deco is cute, and the food is great. The pricing seems to be a bit higher than other Thai restaurants in the area, but the spice level was perfect. Would definitely come back to try other items. Though it seems like they just recently opened and were having staffing issue. The service was definitely lacking a bit.
This Thai restaurant had some of the best time food I have had in a long time it stands out with the authentic dishes and how they are prepared it is a must try if you are a lover of Thai food

column3: Sugar House, Salt Lake City, UT
column6: Incredible food. The flavor is hands down the most flavorful Thai in NYC. Wish they had more locations!
No comment
A new Thai restaurant in town. Their menu are so unique. You should order Crying Tiger and Muk Tom Nam Dum. Highly recommended! We will come back again!

New place that opened in Hell's Kitchen!! With so many Thai spots in HK, I didn't expect much. BUT this spot exceeded my expectations. I got the Crying Tiger Special and the steak was cooked perfectly. The ambiance was also really cute! Will be back to try their drinks
If you are looking for authentic Thai food...this is the place!!!!! The service was wonderful and everything we ordered was delicious.
This cute restaurant served up some of the best Thai dishes I've ever had. The flavor is not too salty and was just right. We would recommend this restuarant anyone visiting New York!
Amazing for the price. Favorite Thai in New York! Great service as well. The food was enticing! Unique ambiance.
No comment
No comment
Tasty food, good ambience, a bit of a wait at times, but you can call to make a reservation!
Cute place with fresh, delicious food. River prawns were especially terrific. Service is lackluster and some other dishes could use more spice though.
No comment
No comment

Great food and ambiance - flavors were really interesting with multiple components! I had the Tom kha Kai soup which had chicken that just fell off the bone and was so tender + infused with flavors. The coconut and spice were well balanced. My partner had the pad see ew which was was good but not as flavorful as the Tom kha Kai. For dessert we had the Mochi which was deconstructed and rice pudding which had a nice umami flavor that balanced out the sweetness. Will be back!
SUPER GOOD. everything was very flavorful especially the steamed fish. the padthai, pad see ew, and steak were so tasty. Would definitely come again!!

One of the best new Thai spots in town. Recommend dining with a larger group, so you can order and try more items. Portions are on the smaller side for some dishes but great depth of flavor. Highly recommend this place with super friendly staff. Looking forward to going back with different people.
No comment
Ordered the crying tiger special and the steamed fish with Thai herbs. Both are decent but nothing really stands out besides the presentation.
Amazing vibe! Food was very tasty and full of flavor! Not your typical Thai food restaurant. Highly recommend!

The setting is small but very welcoming. You should make reservation. Service is very friendly and attentive to their host needs but this is not why you go there. The food is excellent! A rare find. The dishes are extremely well done and accommodate a variety of taste from non spicy to Thai hot (warning this is actually reserved to the initiated but excellent). To top it off the price is actually extremely reasonable a real must find in NYC!
Food and service are both amazing. I would def. recommend to try this and making reservations before you go. They get pretty busy for a good reason
This restaurant was terrific, very traditional and authentic Thai food... nice sized portions and flavor was incredible - will be back for sure!
Great food and awesome servers! Everyone was really nice and the menu options were very interesting.  Can't wait to go back!

We had a wonderful evening as we were celebrating our son's birthday. We were a table of eight. They were very accommodating to our dietary needs as many of us are vegan. The food was so delicious and the staff so warm and friendly I can't wait to return. A very special restaurant.

I'm really glad this spot opened up. Tucked away on 49th, the interior of Lumlum is homey with a fun tiki vibe. We got the fried tarot with duck sauce to start, the chicken curry with egg noodle, pad thai, and fried rice. All were excellent. The owners Mo and Sommy were both very friendly and accommodating. Looking forward to coming back and trying more dishes.
Love . Great foods great service. Went here with my friends for a quick lunch and we are obsessed. Totally recommend.

Warm and cozy interior with friendly staffs will make your food taste better! The "Ka Prao Kai" with crispy eggs is the best! And don't miss "Yam Som" ! It's so refreshing with sweet and sour taste. End with "Bua Loy Kai Whan" which is soooo good!
New favorite Thai spot in the neighborhood, and one of the better ones in Manhattan! Food is excellent, service is attentive & friendly, and atmosphere is cool, relaxed, clean and not too loud.

After returning from Thailand and going in-search of khao soi in my own neighborhood, I'm so happy I came across LumLum. I've had it now in three different spots in NYC and LumLum's version is by far, the best, including the luscious flavor, the pickled greens, raw onion AND to top it all off, one big, fall-off-the bone, tender and delicious drum stick, just as I had in Chiang Mai. But there other offerings are equally tasty (if not a little pricey for the size, but not unusual these days)  and a little less standard than the usual Hell's Kitchen Thai joints.  Their Tom Kha Kai (coconut soup) is great and includes white cabbage, which is new for me and a great addition; their kra prow with pork belly also delicious (the fried egg stays soft and yolky even after delivery); the crying tiger is unique and done well - the steak is typically medium rare and the rice (also with egg yolk on the side for delivery), with garlic and shallot bits is really tasty and worth the price; the pad see ew is standard but good, but I may have messed up the pad ki mao, ordering without chili and not spicy, taking away some likely critical flavor (the large shrimp that were included were wonderful, though, and unlike most places, had shells to suck clean:); the side of morning glory was also really nice (I haven't seen many places) even reheated the next day; and the dessert of coconut milk pudding was a great ending (really wanted anything with ice cream, but not a great idea for delivery).  AND delivery was quick and thorough.  Really looking forward to exploring the menu further and going in-person. Thanks!
No comment
Great restaurant with amazing interior. Went a week or so after it opened, with a group of 4. I had the chicken pad see ewe; so good ! Will definitely be coming back soon !
No comment
Really tasty food! We randomly picked this new restaurant after finishing a Broadway show nearby, so worth it:) the papaya salad is so impressive with a touch of salted egg yolk on top.
The food was great, service fast and excellent. and prices were reasonable.  Adorable decor too! I wish the the sisters/owners success!!
Found this place via Eater review and the food is definitely meet my expectations.  Interior design with Hawaiian style is very cute as well.

We ordered far too much food for just two people, but it was all really good. The bar is non-alcoholic which was a surprise but we had a couple of moktails which were acceptable. The river prawns/shrimp were really tasty.
No comment

CJ, Mo and Sommy were so welcoming and friendly. Gave us such a home-y vibe. The food is absolutely amazing! The quality is unbelievable as well as the ambiance. I'm from LA and know that this will be a place that'll eat every time I visit!

I thought I knew Thaifood, but clearly I didn't until Lum Lum. Every dish is incredible and it gets better and better at every dish. It's one restaurant that I am more adventurous with food than normal. It makes me want to try everything! Great service and love the ambiance! Can't wait to come back. I literally crave it!

We had the Crying Tiger Steak and Pad Kee Mao.  The steak was grilled well with a garlic and fried rice. It was super yummy and really garlicky.  We put extra chili sauce with fried pieces of garlic and it stuck great on the tasty Pad Kee Mao noodles.

Delicious and innovative Thai food - you won't get your boring green curries here! This place just opened up, the decor is charming, and the poppy music gives it a nice warm ambience. The crab omelette was very good; panang nue was tasty but beef was a little tough.
Saw a RAT crawling through the restaurant near the kitchen/bathroom area. Told the waiter, he just shrugged and walked away. Food was decent. Service was terrible.
Good food. I ordered Kee Mao, it was so spicy but also very good. The staff was very friendly and fast service
Came here after a Broadway play. There wasn't a lot of selection i.e. no curries, but the atmosphere was pretty and the wait staff wore Aloha shirts. And the cocktails looked nice.

Best Thai food in Hell's Kitchen. The dishes are spicy and so very tasty. My favorites were the pad Thai and fried fish in chuchee curry. Definitely get there early. We went on a Friday and it was packed by 5:30.

Review for delivery only. Ordered the grilled cuttlefish appetizer, LumLum salad, and Crying Tiger and each was delicious. My only quibbles are that I wish there was more of the delicious steak in the Crying Tiger and the food arrived was a bit hotter. The latter is to be somewhat expected given the 20+ block delivery.
This is food preparation and presentation that is completely true to what I enjoyed in Bangkok 30 years ago.  I will be returning and they are now in my speed dial.
Great food and service and very nice staff. Am looking forward to sitting at their tiki bar for a cocktail soon...
Definitely an amazing stop, especially prior to a Broadway show. The sauces were incredible and the whole fish (cha chee sauce) is spot on. Def call to make a reservation to avoid a wait!
Love this place! Thai fine dining with great ambience and phenomenal food!! I loved their coconut ice cream dessert a lot!

fav spot in the hood!! we call it YumYum cuz the food is packed with so much yummy flavor FR. the atmosphere is warm and cozy but also low key chic. it's a liL bright oasis in hot AF hell's kitchen. noodles, seafood, curry, grapefruit salad you honestly can't go wrong. the best part is exploring the menu cuz nothing disappoints.
Good food! Nice atmosphere. Nice service.. Tucked away on a side street. Good food!!!
Food here is incredibly authentic and tastes delicious! Well priced. Try the kor moo yang, khao soi and khao pad poo. We ate here twice already this week and the week's not over yet.
Lumlum is the best restaurant in the city. every dish is great because they get their ingredients fresh every single day. The desert is so good!! can't wait to go back!

I just discovered this newly opened restaurant and no hesitate to give it a try. The food is very delicious, and the restaurant is very well decorated. I recommend Crying Tiger, Khai Jeaw Poo, and Muk Tom Nam Dum. And for dessert I recommend Bualoy!!
got the pad see ew with tofu + thai iced tea and everything was delicious; very cute vibes inside too! so glad i stopped in.
Complex flavors. Be warned: Spicy means "spicy."  A tiny bit overpriced. Great service. Free dessert is amazing.
Beautiful ambience. Lovely staff. Great food. We had the beef tartare, drunken noodles, and crab omelette -- one of the better Thai places in Hell's Kitchen (and there are many!)
Food was really good, and the servers were extremely sweet and thoughtful. We had a great time, definitely recommend!
Food was delicious. Interior is very nicely decorated. Great lunch spot for a rainy day. Left very satisfied after a big lunch with family.
Hidden gem in Greenpoint: 9 courses including 2 desserts and very filling for a fine dining experience.  Favorite was squid soup. Classy experience all around.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I like it here. Everything about the space and the waitstaff is charming and pleasant. The concept is a space that hosts traveling chefs of importance. That's where it can get a bit tricky. You get what you pay for, so don't allow yourself to think that if a chef is visiting from an oversees multi-michelin-starred restaurant that they will be cooking their regular food as if in their regular restaurant. This is not me complaining, just sharing a realization. Currently, including tax and tip, the multi-course meal is $124 and the wine pairing is $78. So, no, tonight I did not receive any of the dishes I saw on Erik Anderson's instagram page from when he was executive chef at Coi when it had three michelin stars. But it also only cost fraction of that. What you get is an opportunity to have affordable glimpses with industry veterans and taste some of their expertise utilizing local sustainable ingredients, and I appreciate that. It's just sort of a downer, to be honest, because if you only have one chance to try the food of a lauded chef, you kinda want what they're famous for, even if it's expensive, because you're investing in an experience & a memory. But that's neither here nor there. Back to reality. Fulgurances Laundromat is a lively place that I really enjoy.
No comment

I don't have the energy to write this review, but this place is just not good. Maybe it's bc it's a short term gig for every chef. 1/7 courses was a protein, took forever to get a drink despite nobody being at the restaurant, mandatory 20% tip. $335 for a very underwhelming meal and experience.
No comment

Fabulous! Great, interesting, unique and delicious food. Wonderful service and a beautiful restaurant. The staff is passionate about the food, the wine and the restaurant. A perfect date night! Highly recommend
No comment

A review of this restaurant has to be more about the concept instead of the chef on any particular visit. And the concept is brilliant! An up and coming chef is invited here to show their skills for only a temporary several month stay. The setting is quintessential Brooklyn. The staff is regular and does not change. The service is great: relaxed and attentive. The wine pairing was fun and varied. And the food we had at our visit was great. We will be back with every new chef. It is like trying a new restaurant each time without having to search it out. We might be disappointed by the food at some point, but the anticipation and the possibility of discovery will always be there.
Food was bland. We waited about an hour between the first and second course. Service was fine. Meh.. not worth going.

I'm so shocked by the negative reviews, especially regarding service. My husband and I visited a few weeks ago on a busy Saturday night. We had made a reservation, but because we were early, we sat at the counter instead. I'm so glad we did. The care that the staff takes with the food preparation was a wonder to watch. We did the tasting plus pairing and added the cheese course. Everything was fantastic and beautifully presented. I felt like I could have been in Paris but for the warmth of the staff and lack of insecurity at my nonexistent French. Also it is worth noting that the space is amazing - I can't believe I used to wash my sheets and towels in there.  I am so happy Fulgurances is in the neighborhood, and I can't wait to go back.

I've now eaten here about three times with different resident and guest chefs and am so looking forward to continuing to come to Fulgurances when new residents join. The food is seasonal, so inventive and and the wine pairings are awesome. The price is incredibly reasonable for six courses and wine pairing - an absolute stunner!

jerks. i had to cancel my reservation here the night of due to a covid exposure, and they STILL charged me 50 dollars. i emailed to be like, hey, covid exposure, throw me a bone here, im being responsible and decided not to put you and your entire restaurant at risk..  and they were like nope. i planned to reschedule if they refunded me, however now i definitely will not be rescheduling.
Delicious and innovative food, fantastic wine pairings, and the friendliest staff. What more could you want? Highly recommend.
No comment
No comment
a very pleasant experience. Mannix expertly paired cocktails with our meal. he knew alllllll the best drinks. we will definitely be going back!

The food was good. My boyfriend and I got the deviled eggs, the Carolina caviar, and the Buffalo wings to start and i got the dirty cowgirl cocktail and my bf got The Boot. They were good but not mind blowing. Then came our entrees which were the pork spare ribs and the beef ribs. Both were tasty but lacking in sauce. Overall, food was good but not outstanding. Service was also okay, when they came to attend us they were kind and polite but they rarely came and they took ages to get us the check. It seemed that the servers were spread pretty thin so maybe it could be chalked up to the fact that we are here before the grand opening. Lastly, the ambiance was fun and lively and I enjoyed the restaurant vibes themselves. I feel that this place is good if you're looking to spend some money on some okay barbecue but it's definitely not top tier when it comes to the food which is the most important aspect in my opinion. There is definitely room to improve and I hope they do so that maybe I can add a start or two if I come back.

OK, for a spot that JUST opened, and knowing the investment in time that BBQ takes, we were super impressed with this SOFT opening at Boots n Bones. First of all it smelled great when we walked in & we were hungry. So...after speaking with the owner & finding that their 'official' opening is early April with the full menu...there's a lot to look forward to. We preferred the St Louis ribs but our pal who got smoked beef ribs like his better. Deviled eggs were delish, mac & cheese was the bomb. Good drinks and super nice staff *also* considering they are new. Wings were also very good. Might have given 4 stars but went for 5, just for effort and the quality of the food so far. Getting excited for a return visit next month to check out the full menu & that mysterious bar downstairs. (Note - we used to go to Blue Smoke all of the time, ate it everytime we were at Jazz Standard -- this chef is no slouch, he is kind of a big deal to be in JC.) We will be back!
Really over-priced for almost no food on each plate. Almost no meat on their flavorless, overcooked ribs. Poor meat quality. Far better options in the area.

I was really excited about going here but to be honest, I was quite disappointed. I paid $16 for a drink but it seemed really weak and I felt like I paid $16 for a sweet fruit drink. I honestly question whether there was any alcohol in it. We ordered cornbread which was good but nothing special. Same with the mac n cheese - it was good but nothing special. I was also irritated that they added a credit card surcharge. I understand why certain businesses do that but there are other restaurants in the neighborhood that are owned by a families (not restaurant groups) and they don't add a surcharge. If they're going to do that, they should let customers know by printing a message on the menu and on their website. For me, the only plus was the location and the music. However, I feel like you can walk less than 1 minute down Newark Avenue and get better food and get your money's worth and not have to pay a credit card surcharge.

Most of the food we ordered was good.  We ordered deviled eggs after being told that you received 6 eggs.  When the plate came there were only 4 eggs which was not worth $9 as you are really only getting 2 full eggs.  That got sent back and was taken off our bill.  My friend didn't care for the baked beans as they were flavorless.  The pulled pork, mac and cheese, and cornbread were all good.  Yes the cornbread was small but they were like mini corn muffins and we got 7 of them.  I'm still not sure what the difference between the pork sandwich and the pork platter is and what more you get for the platter.  The sandwich was $18 and platter was $24.  We were told they both come with coleslaw and pickles.  Not sure why you'd pay the extra $6 for the same items.  The menu did not mention that we would receive fries with the sandwich and I wouldn't have ordered the mac and cheese had I known that.  They do add a surcharge when paying with credit card so we paid cash.  The waitress took the check and was gone for a bit before coming back to ask if we wanted our change.  They should never assume that the difference is their tip.  Then when we received our change what we got back was based on credit card amount so that had to be corrected.  I don't think I'll be back.  There are other BBQ places that are just as good and cost about half the price, and I end up with leftovers.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Best Japanese curry in my opinion, they are consistent and quick. If you want a good meal, I would definitely recommend this chain restaurant.

Came here for chicken katsu curry. The sauce was delicious and sweet. The tempura and sausage adds additional flavour. The chicken is fragile and crispy. Recommend to eat slowly. Overall, the meal is fulfilling as one whole meal.
No comment

Great spot for a quick and delicious bite to eat. I love their katsu, enjoy their sauce, and always have a hard time deciding which of the many add-ons/options I want to enjoy. If you're hungry and in the area, stop by. And if you're hungry and not in the area, travel to a Go! Go! Curry! near you.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Food was tasty. I felt like the portions were fair for the price. Ill be honest and say it was good the best Japanese curry out there but was definitely good for fast food. Service was good. Nice staff. This location has a small dining area.

Great portion for the price. Curry dish we got was really good. The rice was well done. the fried Chicken meat slices were deliciously cooked. The curry was flavorful and wasnt too spicy at all. The space is small so order quickly. If you like Japanese Curry and youre in the area, try this place out
Super good.  Nothin fancy but worth to try . Dont miss this place near  Brooklyn bridge
No comment

Hey guys I will tell you about this place this is very nice wonderful please I have good experience about this this make me happy there is a family environment friendly environment all the employee for friendly and honest recommended all new user for this place ok thanks

Big portions and convenient! The shop is small but the selection is great. The portions are also very generous and lasts me 2 meals! The ration of curry to rice is also very good. My favorite is the chicken curry. I came in here on a rainy day after a long day out and just wanted something hot and filling. This place did not disappoint. It have decent katsu and the toppings are great
No comment

What can I say...Go Go Curry has always been my go-to spot for comfort food over the past several years.  There's no better pick-me-up after a long day than inhaling a Home Run Curry.  It comes with a nice mix of katsu, shrimp tempura, sausage and egg to satisfy all of those cravings.  The wings are slightly dry but extremely crispy and the sauce is delectable.  Prices have definitely increased and portion sizes decreased over the past few years but Go Go Curry still remains one of my favorite spots in NYC for some quick, satisfying comfort food!
No comment
No comment
Ordered takeout and was disappointed with the food, the curry is on the sweeter side and the pork was very dry.

Got go go curry recently. I ordered the Sausage curry. It's a dish of rice cabbage curry and sausage. It wasn't as great as the go go curry I had ordered from years before. I also only got 3 sausages which is the standard serving size but I think is a bit too little. The curry in its own right was good and I like the new packaging for the to-go order.

Great place to grab lunch. I've tried pretty much everything on the menu at this point and everything is good. If you're hungry or indecisive, I'd go with the homerun curry, which gives you a little bit of everything. Vegetarians also need not fear - there's a tofu katsu and veggie tempura option, but just remember to ask for the vegetarian curry sauce as well (I think their default curry has pork in it). The only issue I run into sometimes is that service can be a bit slow. They seem to be short staffed frequently, often with one guy acting as both cook and cashier, so I've had to wait as long as 20 minutes for take out. Not the end of the world, and the food is ultimately worth it when you get it.

a big ol gorilla size bowl of japanese curry that warms the heart and soul.  on the bottom is a bed of rice.  then you pick your size and your protein.  they have small medium large and xlarge and they measure it by weight.  proteins are chicken or pork katsu, tempura by the piece, shrimp, egg, sausage.  then comes the curry and the cabbage.  they also have some combos where you can try many diff proteins.  the grand slam is a popular one where you can a sample of each.  it can get slow since only one person is working.  its a small place so too many cooks will just be more burdensome than help.  when i crave a quick curry, i come here.  its always consistent and theres multiple locations for wherever you are.

I ordered a small pork katsu for lunch and it was delicious! Small means the serving of rice weighs 4 oz. For me, it was just the right amount with the pork cutlet and free cabbage. The sauce was a bit spicy but nothing a medium spice person can't handle. I did ask for extra cabbage to balance out the carbs and they were happy to accommodate. Service is quick but if you're looking to dine in, then definitely try to beat the lunch crowd or have a friend grab seats while you place orders. Overall, not a bad lunch option for the area.

This spot actually has some great curry with plenty of fried options available. The service is really quick and the portions are super filling. I went for the small curry but there was actually a good amount of rice. I added shrimp, pork katsu, chicken katsu and fish katsu on top. The katsu were all pretty thin pieces of meat. The fish in particular was really thin. I preferred the pork and chicken over the fish, which really isn't worth it. The shrimp was also pretty small but covered in plenty of breading. Everything was nice and crispy and the curry was really good too. It wasn't spicy at all. I wish there was just a bit more curry sauce though. I also added pickled radish which is a bit sweet and sour and gave a nice flavor contrast to all the fried items. The cabbage that is provided is also a nice refreshing touch. Definitely an affordable, filling, tasty meal!

I ordered the small with chicken katsu and extra cabbage. If you like spicy, definitely drizzle some on top of the cutlet and you have an amazing lunch for around $10, which is almost unheard of in FiDi.
